1.content:
Infected anthro Pokemon start out like this. You can decide how the infection started, how it spreads, and how it can be stopped, but you may need to know how ferals act. Symptoms show that their eye color becomes a pale purple, they become ravenous for whole food, and they lose any sense of who they were and can only growl, roar, bark, instead of speech. Some authors may have the infected speak however, depending on the storyline. They can be much stronger in force then when they were normal Pokemon. The more they eat, the more powerful they become...

Anyways, starting off in this dark mysterious world, what type of anthro are you? There is a wide selection of anthromorphic Pokemon to choose from!

This story is still a work-in-progress at the moment though, but feel free to message me about anything, review, or add your own storyline! If you do add a storyline, this means you are committing to complete it! I will not tolerate those who add a few chapters and abandon the story for someone else to finish.

With that mentioned, if you don't want to feel obligated into writing literally a whole interactive story, but still wish to contribute, you can look through the community storylines located in the second choice to this chapter. There are extra rules there explaining everything, so go ahead and venture in there if you need to.

I'd like to mention and persuade readers to message the amazing authors who have added and kept up with their storylines for this interactive, to give your feedback and favorite mentionables towards their stories. It really helps everyone in this interactive prosper, and I'd like to think of it as a fun little community!

Don't be shy, add your own storyline to Viral!

W. Scarf's Story: Lace the Lucario makes a lone effort to abandon his home in search of a reasoning and cure for the infection. Just who all will he meet along the way? And it won't just be the infected he'll have to watch out for...

Viral's Collab Stories: Storylines that anyone may add to and go off the rails with!

Languid Lizard's Story: Jack the Charmander kicks off his adventure with a perilous revelation and an unfortunate circumstance, thrusting him to have to take a role more important than he ever could have imagined.

Shadow Cat's Story: Kale the Sneasel just wanted to be left alone, but reality would deny him of that as he goes from one perilous event to another. Just how long can he manage to survive?

The Vaporeon girl finally responds by pointing to your round belly, “Then…would you care to explain that right there?” Her voice was soft, but sweet, even if she was utterly terrified. Her legs were slightly quivering in the flowing water.

“I had a little surprise encounter with an infected Pinsir on the way here. I’m not here to rob you or hurt you. Trust me.” She finally stood up straight, relaxing and blowing a sigh of relief.

“Well...I guess I believe you. Sorry about that though; you can’t be too careful at times like these, you know?” The water type answers as she walks out of the stream, and stops in front of you. She was only an inch or two below you in height, sparking a smile across her face. The Vaporeon raises a hand, “I’m Charm.” You gladly shook it and respond back.

“I’m Lace, and yes, I know exactly what you mean. If you don’t mind me asking..." Your ear give a quick flick in the air as you replace the paw to your belly, "...I’m definitely positive that I’ve never seen a Vaporeon out here whenever I had visited this place.”

She points a thumb behind her down the stream. “That’s because I live in an underwater cavern that only I know about that's actually far from here. I tend to stay away from most villages and people. Usually they get overrun by the infected. The area I was living around wasn't holding up enough food or resources for me to use, so I thought I'd see if there was anything up stream. And judging from your gut-filled presence, there are plenty of berries as there are ferals in this forest, I presume. Are you part of a village, Lace?” Her head tilts a little to the side with her eyes peering over your shoulder to see the scenery in any hopes to see evidence of civilization somewhere.

“No, I live by myself too. I was just coming here to collect these pieces of fruit specifically.” You point your gaze at the bush, looking at the gleaming berries growing from it.

“Are they particularly your favorite? I know there are different kinds with certain remedies that can cure specific illnesses, but what exactly are these kind…? I have never seen these before.” The Vaporeon questions with an intrigued brow raised. You step over to the bush and pluck off one on the green, fleshy fruits.

“It’s a Lum berry. It cures any status ailments, whether you’re sick, tired, or weak, cold or hot, stiff or strained. They’re going to be very useful to me when I go out on my trip.” You explain. Charm tilts her head to the side again.

“A trip?” She asks. Grabbing all of the Lum berries, you carry them in your cradled arms.

“That’s right. I’m going to travel around, find out what I can about the infection and see if I can stop it. I’m not literally going to sit under a rock and live in isolation my entire life. I’m going to move out of my cave and help solve this epidemic, because it seems to me that no one has tried or succeeded.” The Vaporeon was a little taken back in from the surprising comment. Her face looked a bit worried for a moment, but she picks her spirits back up with her gleaming smile.

“Well, I’m going to wish you luck! I’m glad someone finally decided to break out of solitude. I’m pretty sure you’ll find the answers you’re looking for, and by the looks of it,” She pokes a finger into your belly, feeling the melting body withheld inside your stomach. “...You can take care of yourself from these creatures.”

After saying farewell to Charm and waving goodbye to each other, you walk back into the forest while she dives back into the water, heading in the other direction for a good symbol of parting ways. Tomorrow morning, you would leave everything behind, headed out into the unknown for the sake of the world, or a beast's stomach.
115312.title: Charm the Vaporeon

1153121.content:
Grabbing your handmade leather side bag filled with all of your supplies and blowing out a lit torch on the rock wall, you exit out of an opening inside a mountain side hidden under a cluster of trees, once being your home. The home has suited you very well in keeping out of feral's scent range, and not once has one aimlessly wandered inside. You stare back at it with a small sense of sadness before leaving it behind, likely, forever. You step out onto a ledge with your flat belly that digested the Pinsir, watching the sun glimpse over the horizon to reflect a soft yellow glow in the back of the sky. The digested feral inside of you has provided an overwhelming jolt of strength surging through your muscles, and with great luck, the infected's body appeared to have no effect on you.

Descending off the rocks and traveling across the field, you begin your quest for the cure of the infection. Deciding that it would be best to find a village first, you could hopefully discover someone who was at least up-to-date on the epidemic to gather the most valuable information as possible. Hearing about a local town in a valley from a traveler who had gone past your home once, you head eastward on a dirt path, never looking back.

Making the most of the trip, you ponder about how the infection probably started. Maybe there was a virus in a river, and some unlucky passer-by’s daring sip of the contaminated water initiated it? Or, there was a possibility that a poison type pokemon purposely created the disease, infecting others for his or her own cruel and strange cause? Many scenarios flash in your head, always creating new theories and possibilities for such a sick, twisted world. Sunlight beams down at you with a beautiful glow, exposing the never-ending sky speckled with cloud streaks following the wind. The trees give off a flourishing green, ripe with moisture and splendor that dance with the air skipping past them. The outside air sends a whiff past your black nose, which fills you with joy to experience the wonders of the wilderness. It was a shame that you couldn't freely go outside unless you wanted to be hunted by a feral to crawl down its salivating jaws.

Stopping, you see a figure in the distance...!
1153121.title: Your Journey Begins!

11531211.content:
An outline of huts were far off in a field with a dirt road paving the way to it, as if pointing towards a graceful sanctuary. Walking down the path, you begin to ponder to what you may actually find within this small town. Seeing that wagons or pedestrians were nonexistent within the territory limits to the village, it rouses some skeptical hopes in you that the village citizens may no longer be around or alive. What disturbs you the most, however, is the silence. Not only close to the town had you discovered it, but your realization had occurred from the very beginning of your journey. The soft wind resonating as the only source of noise was probably a terrifying enough experience that was almost equal to the battle with the Pinsir. You pass the town gates with a wooden banner nailed above with an engraved, Jade Gorge across it. A nice name for a small town. Stepping out into the dirt streets, something was obviously clear. No one was walking anywhere and the doors and window openings were all boarded up...

Not a single sound emitted anywhere this time around, even with the wind as soft as it was, blowing the light dust from the graveled routes. It was obviously hit and abandoned from an infected horde. "What a shame..." You mind declares by the sight. You step slowly out into the empty lot, watching the rooftops and alleys as you pass by, knowing that a feral can be near, but hopefully with no pokemon to commerce about in the village, an infected would surely have ventured off somewhere else. You peek into what looked like the town hall at the center of the village. There was a small crack in between two wooden boards that covers a window opening.

Peering inside, the entire place was completely trashed. Bookcases fallen over, drawers opened, paper and debris scattered all around the dark room. It was too dark from the menacing shadows to see anything else, but the hall had clearly been ransacked by robbers. Sighing with a depressed octave, you move away from it and check for a shop in town for any possible remains of what happened. Finding a saloon-looking building close by and still standing, you focus aura energy into one of your hands and punch the door, blowing the boards away in a small blue explosion.

After the smoke clears for the most part, you step inside, only to see a large blast of orange flames shoot out directly in front of you! You quickly jump back, clumsily and accidentally falling on your rump from avoiding the searing fire. Rubbing the soot from your eyes, you glance back in shock as a Typhlosion steps out from the pieces of flaming wood with smoke fuming out from its mouth. You roll back, standing up once more as you toss your bag to the side to avoid the fire and possibly inevitable fight. The fire-type growls an intimidating and heart-pound rousing tone, having a somewhat equal height to you but sports a rim of chub over its belly from most likely having a mixture of work-outs and overfeeding. Muscle is hidden with its curvy, yet straightforward arms to force a difficulty to guess what its strength truly was. With a flat chest, a masculine body, and such a menacing voice, the Typhlosion presents itself as an quite irritated male.

Staring into the face of the fire type, the Typhlosion’s eyes show…
11531211.title: Jade Gorge

115312111.content:
The Typhlosion flares out another puff of fire from his mouth, but this time, a smaller one that was intended to frighten you more than harm you. It practically worked. His green eyes gleam a furious expression as his fangs flash out to show you his jaw's menacing power with the gnashing grinds of his somewhat sharp teeth. “If you wanna keep your life, then I suggest you leave, now!” He yells out, obviously not taking 'no' for an answer.

You relieve yourself with an inhale to build up some courage. Raising your hands up a little to try and explain yourself that you're not a threat to him, you quietly plead, “Listen, I’m not looking for trouble...I’m not here to steal from you or…!” You try warning him, although, he quickly cuts you off.

“Yeah, that’s exactly what the last thief said. This town wasn't ruined because of infected you know. It was wiped out from raiders like you.” He breathes in a mighty puff of air until blowing out it back out as a storm of scorching fire! You roll to the side, seeing the ground where you once were left as a large, black, and smoking smudge spot!

“Wait! I’m just…!” You were cut off yet again as the Typhlosion pounces out, tackling you down and endeavors to bite at your neck for a severe wound. The force of the impact launches both of you rolling into another hut door, crashing through carelessly while grappling with each other in an even match of brawn. He thrashes his claws out your head; occasionally leaving a mark or scratch on your face as you deliver a fair amount of punching jabs into his ribs. You place your legs at his torso, kicking them to hoist the heavy, attacking Typhlosion off of you and into a wooden table, breaking pathetically under his falling weight. Swirling back to stand up, he repositions himself along with you for the two of you to stare at each other in a standoff within the empty damaged hut. You circle around the room in a slow manner, taking your time while waiting for the other dare making an attack or approach. A single drop of blood slipped out from a scratch on your cheek, down to the floor in a wooden loud thap, signalling a cocky grin from the Typhlosion.

Diplomacy would never work for a punk like this. Even if you were to convince him that you're not a threat, you had a real sense he was picking a fight on purpose. Some pokemon just have a real nerve to pick with the world and its inhabitants, especially this Typhlosion. And besides, this idiot would pay for attacking you so ignorantly. Just then, he pounces forward at a dangerous speed, almost to the point where you weren't ready for him. It was now or never to make a decision. You could either risk the time into fighting this fire-type and earn some kind of pride out of it, and it'd probably put this guy right back into his place if you did. Then again, he might be able to overpower you, which may lead into undesired events if he was voracious as much as the ferals were, or even worse...horny enough...But a flaw applies to that as well since you've seen his speed first at hand. Running could lead to the same exact fate...
115312111.title: Fighting the Typhlosion

choices: Slaps the berry from your hand.
1153121111.content:
Lashing your hands out forward, the both of you slam into each other with a violent tremble to shake the entire house of wood and stone, gripping at the shoulders to pverpower their opponent. Heated seconds passed by with wavering struggles. Every time it appeared that you were just about the push the Typhlosion over, he would strike back with a bone compressing force towards you, striking a startling fear in your body to struggle less. The entire charade of a battle was exhausting. You were about even in strength with him which gave you some hope of winning the battle since it was better than fighting off a much larger and much stronger, although, you quickly began to see the flames build up at the back of the Typhlosionâs neck to flare out as he inhaled a large load of air to prepare another flamethrower!

Watching his maw spread wide open and a glow of orange shining out from his slimy gullet, you immediately turn while tossing the heavy being, throwing him of his feet and into his side. The Typhlosion was left unprepared from the move, and accidentally releases the fire from his mouth for it to spurt out in random directions, scattering the burning fireballs around the cabin. Flames engulfed the targets they hit, igniting wooden objects and furniture on fire, including the ceiling! Down on the floor, you kick away the Typhlosion as he spits out the last of his inaccurate attack. Rising up, you press a hand over a table to aid yourself rising back up. the fire-type growls above the crackling sounds of fire and grabs your ankle, digging his claws into it. The pain wasn't too agonizing, however it did in fact cause you to bark out and frantically try to kick away the Typhlosion yet again. You manage to hit your hindpaw against his chin, making him unintentionally bite his own tongue. He roars and releases your ankle to cringe at the comical yet unbearable pain he was suffering through. You return to raise up your body with the table's aid, however, once at a full stance, you look back at the table to discover it thrives with many ingredients and flasks and jars. It was an alchemy or medical experimenting table, and right when you saw the flames eat away at the wood to reach a fallen cup of lamp oil, it was too late. A small sea of fire flourishes madly out towards you, singeing a few hairs and covering your face with soot. The heat has you barking out with surprise and leaves you back-tracing awkwardly with steps to avoid the mass of burning heat.

Smoke floats throughout the entire vicinity, staling the air and engulfs much of your vision. The Typhlosion finally gets back up from the floor, a little dazed but still desperately furious with you. Ignoring the dumb idea that a fight was still at place, you wrap an arm above your eyes and dash to the exit door, however a blast of fire suddenly destroys it! Spinning around, the Typhlosion glares his generic cocky attitude again, calling out to you, âOh ho ho no you donât! Youâre not leaving this place until I know youâre dead!â And it was if karma came to the rescue, burning debris from the ceiling came crumbling down, landing right on top of the fire-type!

Slamming into his head, the Typhlosion fell unconscious under the pile of burning rubble to slowly be crushed and burned by the colossal debris. You let out a single chuckle before turning back around to find another way out, butâ¦there was an odd feeling you had ringing in your heart. You started this journey wanting help others, even if they didn't want help. You hate feeling guilt, especially since that idiot of a pokemon started the fight. You tried to talk him out of it. Twice.

You regretfully turn around yet again, heading back into the smoke-blinding horror as parts of the ceiling fell from above. You squint your eyes in the dark fog, coughing from the disgusting smoky air, which made you think why anyone would ever willingly breathe the stuff daily. Then, two light sandy-colored legs were stuck out from under a pile of rubble, motionless. Finding the scene pathetic and feeling a little merciful, you unleash an aura-filled punch to the small mound of debris, blasting most of the burning material away, revealing a knocked out Typhlosion beneath it all. Grabbing around his back, you lift one of his arms around your neck and press his body at your side upright, helping to drag him through the falling building and seeing a light from the outside as a glorious exit.

You push over a fallen wooden beam as an obstacle and arrive back outside in the wonderful day, welcoming fresh air as you cough out the rest of the contaminated kind. You drop the fire type out on the dirt road carelessly and you stagger on over to your bag. Pulling out a canteen, you unscrew the top and splash cold water on your face to relieve yourself of your endeavors trekking through fiery obstructions, carrying a heavy oaf, and washing away any soot or ashes off your sweating body, until walking back to your unconscious "friend".

Lying down on his back with his mouth miserably open and eyes close, you drip the cool water over his smudge-covered face, waiting until he finally coughed out violently. The Typhlosion groans as he places his hands on his head that marked with a small spot of blood from the falling ceiling's impact.

âAhgghh, my head hurts like hell!â He yells before rolling over to his knees, curling up while continuing to grumble in discontent. You unhappily large burn marks against one of his arms, seeming slick and just very painful to the eye. Feeling that hated sense of compassion towards the newly saved Pokemon, you go through your bag and pull out one of the many Lum berries you collected. You rip off a large piece and hand it over to the Typhlosion. He turns to look at you with surprise, looking back between the berry and you, discovering where he was and what had just possibly happened for him.

He thenâ¦
1153121111.title: Carnage

choices: You decide to leave the town.
11531211111.content:
âWait, how the hell did I end up here?! Youâ¦you pulled me out ofâ¦?â The Typhlosion inquired behind a cough, just now remembering what his situation was. His arms were quivering with his eyes struggling not to lose focus from time to time. He clearly needed help, fast.

âYeah, and you better thank me for it. Now hurry up and eat the berry.â You gesture the green fruit closer to him, already irritated with him.

âWhat does it do exactlyâ¦?â He grabs it slowly into his hand and began to sniff at it.

You sigh, âItâs going to help your burns heal faster, and hopefully relieve some of your pain.â You answer him, wishing that he would just eat it. He carefully licked the fruit once with a single scrape and almost instantly backed his head away in disgust.

âAghk! Aw man, this thing is sourest thing I have ever tasted! Where'd you get this crap?â The Typhlosion pushes it back into away, refusing to eat it.

âQuit being a baby and eat it, or youâll regret it later. Those burn wounds are going to get any better, in fact, much worse unless you grow up, be a man, and eat that tiny thing.â You retort, wondering if you should just take it back and let him suffer. The arrogant fire-type grumbles and restrainly bit into the fruit, mumbling some unhappy sound as he swallows the entire Lum berry. His tongue flops out and a queasy blow of air exhales from his dispirited maw. The Typhlosion tries getting back up with his new found sense of bravery, but he ends up suddenly gasping and falls back down, gripping his arms. You shake you head back and forth calmly with closed eyes from watching the poor scene, âDid you really expect it to work that fast?â

He angrily grunts and sits back up straight, pouting in his time for the Lum berry's effects to quicken in his body. Sighing out loud again, you plop down a seat on your bottom next to him for the both of you watch the building in front of you burn down. The flames flare out a demonic, yet strangely beautiful, coloration out from the dying construction. The two of you were, in a way, hypnotized by the hot picture.

You decide to break the silence. âIâm Lace.â You reach out a paw to him as he turns his head to you, feeling uncomfortably annoyed and surprised at the same time. The Typhlosion unwillingly lends out his hand, grasps yours, and shakes it with just a single, powerful tug.

âJackal.â He hisses. You smirk and continue to watch the flames in front of you glow a bright orange, until he finally spoke again. âSo...I take it that youâre not a robber?â You laugh at the comment and shake your head. Jackal looks back at the fire awkwardly, blushing a little with embarrassment. âUm, so there's like, uh, no hard feelings between us, right?â

âWell, Jack, you tried killing me and I not only spared your life, but I saved it.â You answer back at him. The Typhlosion tilts his head a little down with a wavy frown, obviously feeling a bit guilty from trying to murder you with little suspicion. âBut yeah, there are no hard feelings.â You continued afterwards. He smiles back a little until you give him a swift pat on the back, causing him to yelp.

âOw! I still have burns there.â He yelled, softly rubbing his wounds. "...And my name isn't Jack."
11531211111.title: Jackal the Typhlosion

115312111111.content:
You pull out a spare bandanna from your bag, handing over a forepaw to Jackal. With a grin but a serious tone, you order, âGive me your burned arm.â Jackal curiously raised his left arm up, watching as you wrap the orange cloth around the injury. Tightening the knot, you finished wrapping it to let Jackal peculiarly inspect it.

âWell gee, uh, thanks. Say, if youâre not looking to steal anything in this town, then what are you looking forâ¦?â He asks you. You gesture him to follow you as you rise up to a full stance.

âLetâs go inside somewhere. I prefer breathing pure, clean air when Iâm talking to someone.â You answer back to avoid the traveling smoke clouding around.

After settling inside an abandoned, dark hut, and not fighting in this one this time, you explain to Jackal your reasoning for leaving your home and about the quest for stopping the infection, explaining some of the theories you had and why you were digging through buildings to find traces of what happened. Jackal was slightly taken by insane idea of a death wish to openly travel everywhere for the idea of possibly stopping the infection which could easily land him in the belly of some creature, although, he seemed to see it as more hopeful than crazy thing.

âJackal, what specifically happened to this town? Did you ever live here?â You ask him, impertinent to know because he mentioned that raiders were the main cause of it. Jackal only sighs before sitting further back in his seat, rubbing the back of his head with the eerie silence of the dark hut. He didn't even glance at you for awhile.

âActually, when I came to this town, it was already abandoned. I figured that it had been overrun by infected ferals and everyone was either eaten, infected, or they justâ¦left at first.â He replies. You could only slowly nod in confirmation as Jackal continued. âWhen I traveled here, I knew for the most part raiders were a problem because ferals don't go through your belongings, remove your drawers, and pull out all that you own from your homes. The old market places were of course empty. At first, I found only a couple of infected.â He then flexes his arms and bloats out his stomach. âBut they were no match for these.â

You huff in playful annoyance and grab your bag before heading out towards the exit. Jackal immediately got up from his chair, letting the audible dragging sound out behind you to almost make you stop. âAre you leaving already?â

âWell, unless thereâs a cure for the infection here, this place doesn't have what I need or already have.â You begin to walk out of the building, and by pressing a hand at the door, you say, âI guess it was nice to meet you, even if we did have bad first impressions.â

âWait!â Jackal yells to you, raising an arm hoping to halt you. âI wantâ¦â He trails off in his voice as your raise up your ears to hear his explanation with some intrigue. âEghâ¦how can I say this without it being weird? Listen, I wanna sorta repay you back, for what you did back in the burning buildingâ¦â

You began using a mocking tone. âWhat? Is the infamous Jackal going soft? I thought he could stand for himself with...â You gesture his previous action by flexing your arms as he had done before, âThese.â

âShut up.â He crosses his arms. âI was just thinking that if I helped youâ¦that would make us even, you know?â

You chuckle aloud, âIâm guessing that means youâre going to follow me then. Alright, pack a bag of all the food, blankets, matches, medicine, or anything you need as much as you can. I guarantee that this trip is going to take awhile.â

((Jackal has joined your party!))
115312111111.title: A New Companion

1153121111111.content:
Leaning against the town entrance gate, you had waited outside as Jackal gathered all the supplies he needed to travel the land with. Looking up from the dirt path, you spot the scuttering Typhlosion approach you from the town with a pillar of smoke trailing out of it from you past fight. There wasn't much you could do for the town, and seeing that it may sadly burn down, it could've been an improvement to the hellish sights one could see and ponder about. Jackal was still wearing the orange bandanna on his left arm and carrying a brown satchel bag filled with what you had suggested. You stand off the fence to meet him.

âLooks like youâre ready.â You point out with a smile. He nods, and with that, the two of you continue on your way! You unintentionally gained a traveling companion in what seemed like a battle to the death about an hour, which made you think about the turn of strange events held out for your future on this campaign. The two of you go down the dirt path that led out from the mournful remains of Jade Gorge with your heads held up high. Along the way, Jackal asks you, âSo, where exactly are we headed next?â

âWeâre following this dirt path until we reach another town. It has to lead somewhere, right?â You answer right away. It was true you had no idea where you were going, but you were bound to run into at least some kind of civilization or infection-informed person. Jackal nods to the proposition as the both of you travel along through the valley, passing through forests and across rivers, and luckily not meeting any hungry infected. But speaking of which, you turn to Jackal during your adventure, "Jackal, you wouldn't know how the infection spreads to pokemon, would you?"

He shrugs, "Not really actually. I've never seen someone turn into a feral...I think I remember one guy saying that if a feral scratches you it causes the infection to spread into you."

You tilt your head, "And have you been scratched by a feral?"

He grunts, "Psh, plenty of times, but that...was a long time ago...sooo..." Well that threw that hypothesis away.

After walking and giving small talk for a few hours, the two of you set camp in an opening of trees. Lighting a small fire, you sit down atop a stump and you begin cooking a bowl of berries, letting the delicious scent fill your hungry nostrils. A growl rumbles for a meal since you haven't eaten all day, and with the previous morning dispute you spent wrestling with Jackal, you could use some energy for your system. Jackal was down on his rear upon the grass, tugging at his bandanna tightly wound over his injury.

"If you keep playing with it, you may make the wound worse, you know. You don't want to reopen or irritate it." You suggest to him. He reluctantly releases the cloth with a grumpy scowl.

The Typhlosion sneers, "Well it's certainly irritating me."

"Some lunch can take your mind off of it. You hungry? It'll be ready in a few minutes." You prod the mashed mixture of food with a stick as he it heats up in its bowl above the fire.

âI'm actually more thirsty than hungry. In fact, as long as Iâm still waiting for that to cook, Iâm gonna take a wizz.â Jackal says while turning away, walking behind some trees. As you check the pot, you suddenly heard a rustle in the leaves off the distance, and it certainly wasn't coming from the direction Jackal left in. This noise was behind you. Jumping up and staying alert, you scan the trees around you, searching for the noise. Just then, something appears from the bushes, revealing...
1153121111111.title: The Quest For Two

choices: Growls and goes to rescue you!
Peaks up to see...oh...such pretty eyes...
11531211111111.content:
Purple and gold scales shine beautifully into your view as a long, long body slithers out from the deep foliage. A snake head brushes out from the leaves, followed by two large yellow globes, with dark hazel nipples peaking at each end. The entire naga was mainly covered with glimmering violet scales, save for the golden streak over her chest and breasts, the underbelly of her mainly snake-side portion of her body, and the softly rattling tail tip that lifts above the ground slightly.

The female Ekans slides her extensive naga body towards you with casual ease, staring deeply at you with bright and beautiful golden eyes. Her torso rises up as her tail slides from side to side in a wavy line behind her. You were bewildered by such a lithe body while her hypnotizing voice practically sings out.

âWhat is that absolutely delicious scent I smell?â She slithers closer, but in turn, causes you to back up to keep your distance. Her eyes weren't purple with great luck, and she was clearly capable of speech thankfully which removes the possibility of her even being infected. But something about her seemedâ¦dangerous.

You look her in the eyes to face this sudden stranger and interrogate her for her presence, but suddenly, you start to have a strange feeling stir inside yourself. Almost as if her eyes begin to grow in color, the world around you begins to fade away as if it never existed as her alluring pupils were all that you could focus on. Having the environment disappear, your eyes constantly focus on hers with your mind seemingly to grow fuzzy and careless.

Her voice echoes out into your ears as if it was coming for every direction. âWell what do we have here? A Lucario wandering in the woods alone? How could such a stud like you roam around the woods by yourself without anyone by your side?â She places her scaled hands under your chi with such light, delicate intention, raising her head above yours to leave you staring blankly at her spell-inflicting gaze.

âI-I wasâ¦j-justâ¦â You stammer out but found yourself at a loss of words.

âOh shush shush! Iâm sure you have your reasons, but perhaps you would prefer some company.â The end of her tail slid around your ankles, circling up your legs which forced them to tremble helplessly.

âA-a-ahh-h-hâ¦â You could only let groans of pleasure escape your lips as her long body began to coil around your frozen body, tightening you in its mighty grip. Your arms become pinned to your sides with your head the only part uncoiled. The smooth, scaly wrapping grinds all around, giving off small squeezes to tempt something dark in your mind and your crotch as a snicker shrouds over you. Her forked tongue flickers out, tapping at your face before tasting your fur in all out whiplashes of the muscle licking around your entire head. Oh, how her scales felt wonderful to you, and her tongue, brushing around your lips felt soâ¦intoxicating. A moan of delight escape the Ekansâ lips as her hands rub over your wet cheeks. the naga had left quite the amount of her warm dribble smearing your face to leak onto her coils.

Stretching her mouth open, you stare up into the slimy tunnel dripping saliva onto your face, beckoning for you to willingly jump into it to fill this snake's belly; your new master's belly. Pleasing this Ekans was all that you could wish for.

Suddenly, reality snaps back to you once you hear a certain Typhlosion's voice.

"Lace, is that food done yeâ¦whoaâ¦" Jackal's voice exclaims from behind you. Your world reverts back for you to shake the hypnosis away of the Ekan's eyes. Realizing the danger at hand, you struggle with all of your will to get away from the serpent, however, all of your limbs were tightly pinned together in her coils! Your time for escape was far too late. Her head looks away from you with disappointment to whoever interrupted her little Lucario snack, staring at Jackal in surprise though once she noticed his unaware reaction.

"Oh, so you weren't alone after all. Well if it isn't just my lucky day then! Two cute-looking boys in one meal!" Her voice rang out with glee. Jackal backed up, obviously not trusting her for your trapped state in her twisted body and her strange taunt right from the start.

âLace, wh-whatâs going on here?â His voice quivers, but the naga continued to try and seduce him.

âCome here you spicy anthro. Let me take a better look at you.â She calls over, curling her finger from a raised hand towards herself, begging him to step forward. You try to yell out for him to avoid looking her in the eyes, although the end of her tail wraps around your muzzle, ceasing your cries. Jackal thenâ¦
11531211111111.title: Slithering Surprise

115312111111111.content:
Jackal shrouds his bandanna-wrapped arm over his eyes, shielding them from her glare. The Ekans hisses with deadly rage, tightening the clench around your body which constricts most of the air out of your lungs. You manage to be able to choke out, âJackal, a-attack herâ¦!â

Obeying your demand, Jackal takes a deep breath until flaring out a stream of fire towards the naga, causing her to shrivel back and slither away in another direction with you still trapped in her coils! You twist and turn as her body loses grasp on you, trying to escape the pursuing Typhlosion giving off a chase. Feeling your back dragging against the ground, you manage to slide an arm out from a coil to punch the scaled tube around you with a powerful blast of aura. The Ekans shrieks in pain, automatically and happily dropping the rest of your body for her to attempt panicky slaps on her burn so she could keep off the blue fire.

Falling and rolling over the forest floor, you were able to stand a little after a complete stop, welcoming a wind of air inside your chest from the previous pains of suffocation by the naga's cruel and twisting body. The Ekans, meanwhile, hisses again and expects revenge for her lost meal, freeing her long fangs from the roof of her mouth as her eyes turned more devilish then deceptive. âYou will pay for that you stupid mutt!â

The serpent lunges out to take in your head, until an odd blue and pale tan-colored blur smashes into her side, sending her torso tumbling into a tree. Jackal pounces out to the snake, blowing fire around her fallen body to avoid escape. She twists and turns, looking for a way out of the ring of flames, but the only opening for her escape was blocked by the Typhlosion as usual.

The Ekans backs up into the tree, acting weak and defeated. âWould you really hurt a young lady, and one with such a peaceful faceâ¦?â She gleams her eyes once again, pulling their hypnotizing effect back out towards Jackal. You block your vision, not falling for that trick easily again, however, you hear slow footsteps crumble in the grass. Daring to peek over your elbow, you watch as Jackal slowly walks towards the snake, smiling as she beckons him closer.

âJackal, stop!â You yell, but the Typhlosion seems to ignore your call and continue his gullible-self on towards the snake. She was curling her finger towards herself, getting him closer as she chuckles.

âThatâs right, Iâm not going to hurt you. I just want to give you a little kiss, is all.â She beckons to Jackal. He was standing just inches from her for her body to raise up to meet eye-to-eye level with him. Her tongue flickers out, almost tasting the Typhlosion's lips before she hisses, "Foolish boy. You were never going to be able to avoid my gaze. Your meaty hide sha-" Before the serpent could ever claim he victory, Jackalâs mouth had opened up and chomped her head into it! With dire haste, he quickly locks his hands around her wrists that endeavor to claw out his eyes as he gulps further, taking in her shoulders. Her tail thrashes out in agony while Jackal continues to slurp up and lick over her scaled, long body.

He grumbles a muffled sound in the midst of his lunch. âIt would reawwy hewp if you hell her taiw for me.â (It would really help if you held her tail for me.) You break out from staring and desperately dove onto the ground, wrestling with the rattling and writhing tail. Finally catching the striving tentacle, you happily push it along into the Typhlosion's swallowing maw, helping the consumption of the witchy reptile speed up a little. A bulge forms from his cheeks, leading to his throat, and ends at his large belly which squirms and screams with rage. The tip of the purple and yellow noodle sinks in between Jackalâs lips at last, followed with a loud gulp and a deep sigh of pleasure. The Typhlosion lands on his butt, letting his extremely large belly slam down with him for him to put his hands on so he could feel the coils of the Ekans slide around inside. He loosens his tongue out from his mouth and he blew out more moaning air.

âOooooh, I donât think I want that berry stuff you had cooking anymore. Ergh.â He fusses as he closes his eyes to embrace the feeling.

Letting yourself chuckle, you give a friendly, soft nudge to his gut, causing him to gasp in surprise at the sudden wave of pleasure. You even felt the Ekans twitch from you little poke.

You had to ask, "So, is that the first pokemon you've ever eaten before?"

Jackal blinks a single eye open to look at you, answering, "No actually, it isn't. I've had a couple of ferals before, and my first time was sorta outta desperation. But...I can see why carnivorous pokemon and ferals want to snack on us all the time because of it. I kinda like it a tad bit really." He raises a brow. "...Have you?"

"Only one." You mention your experiences with the Pinsir and how tough it was for you to decide to down such a monster in a way. "However, I do agree with you. It's more satisfactory than it is weird. I could just never bring it upon myself to swallow someone else if they weren't infected, unlike that snake. How'd she taste?"

Jackal blushes from the nosy question, replying in a softer, more embarrassed tone, "Oh, uh, she was uh...kind of good, actually. I think I prefer eating reptiles in fact."

You scowl and lean in, "Only infected reptiles and carnivorous ones, right?"

"Yeah, yeah, whatever." The Typhlosion answers.

After helping Jackal up, you head back to the campsite with the heavy Typhlosion and sit close by the fire while eating your cooked food and chatting with Jackal until the sun begins to set. You watch as Jackal falls asleep, cooking the food he had just eaten ironically. His belly sags out immensely over the ground as he rests on his side. Deciding that it would be best for you to also get some rest too for whatever tomorrow would hold, you put out the fire and collect two blankets from your bag. You toss one over the snoring Typhlosion and lay one on yourself, dozing off by nightfall.
115312111111111.title: Debts Paid

choices: You try to kick him off of you!
You prepare a punch with a surge of aura!
1153121111111111.content:
Flipping your eyelids open, you awaken to a bright, and fully beautiful morning. The sun on the horizon rises, setting a golden glow on the land that almost made you thing the world was perfect and without any evidence of chaos. It makes you ponder what the world would be like if you fail and digest in someone's stomach, and if the ferals soon ruled the world practically. How would life move on? Would the ferals just begin eating each other until the very last one is left? And what then? Stretching and yawning, you bend up and manage to stand up from your rest spot with cool air brushing past you. Your fur prickles and you almost shiver from the wind of the changing season. Summer shall be missed. You look to your left across the black smudge that used to be your campfire to the pile of Jackal's blanket, with the Typhlosion missing.

You flip your head back and forth, searching around for the fire type. The Typhlosion was nowhere to be seen. "Hey Jack, where are you?" You call out for him, feeling a little tension from the possibility of something to have happened to him. In response, a rustle in the leaves of a bush catch your ears' attention. Jackal's head then pops out from the leaves.

"Ugh, it's Jackal. I don't see how difficult it is to grasp that name. What do you want? I'm a little, erk, busy here." He answers in a foul mood. After a long, growling grunt, he blows a sigh of relief with a content smile, walking out of the bushes with a much flatter stomach. "Aaahhhhhh...much better." Well it appears that the Ekans had to come back out of Jackal at some point which added a thin layer of pudge over the Typhlosion's gut, you noted, as he rubs his rump a little before returning the blanket you generously put over him last night back into your bag.

The pair of you grab your things and continue down the road, wondering what may be at the end of it. Jackal mentions, "It better be a fort with plenty of guards stationed in it. I'm not going through some desperate town expecting us to help them with all of their needs."

"Well that seems a little cruel to say, don't you think?" You retort from his lazy and selfish statement.

He shook his head though, "You haven't been in a populated village in a looong time from what I can tell. Small, rural towns aren't exactly the greatest safe havens during these times. If a village like it still stands, it won't last for long. They're practically giant dinner courses for ferals." The news came across you as simply terrible while the Typhlosion continues. "Typically, villagers are always wanting to persuade visitors and citizens to stay, because if a large majority of them abandon the town, what will the remaining Pokemon do when there comes a time for a horde of infected attacking them? It doesn't stop there, really. I've noticed the town help boards with each one I traveled through. They're just butchered with posters and requests of missing Pokemon and sad situations that you wish you could help with, but..." He peeks a glance at you, frowning, "...Why risk it finding someone when they're most likely just a pile of crap left out in the wilderness to decompose, you know?"

Before you could mourn the situation any longer, a shriek pierces the air. Your ears rang up as Jackal looks around frantically through the forest trees. "Wh-where did that come from...?" The Typhlosion asks with shakes hidden in his voice. Pinpointing your ears on memory, you glance past the side of the road and into the depths of the forest.

"The yell came from there. Leave your stuff to somewhere safe and keep your guard up." You advise. He nods and places both bags at a tree basin hidden from the road, following you into the midst of the ominous woods. The scream sounded like it was from a female, and whoever she were, it was clear that she was in danger. The two of you silently creep over the grass, yet keep a fast and steady pace closer to the noise's apparent spot. Lifting a branch up, you instantly spot a short Buneary girl with oddly red-colored puffs instead of tan-colored ones, being pinned against the ground to what looked like a male Marowak.

The skulled pokemon headbutts the screaming rabbit, causing a final yell to strike out from her before she is knocked effortlessly unconscious. "Hey, get away from her!" You yell over to the Marowak with its back turned to you. Disturbingly, his heavy breaths cease and his backside remain facing you. Typically, someone would've spun around in surprise with the inturder's presence. As creepy as it could, it slowly stands up to what seems like your height from leaning over the rabbit girl. It tilts its head quietly, glowing bright purple eyes within the bone helmet's eye sockets as a low growl rumbles in its spit-dripping mouth.

Jackal simply growls back and sprouts out in a mad dash, running to the Marowak on all fours roaring. The Marowak simply raises its bone club, tossing it forward in a spinning chaos to nail one of Jackal's sides. The Typhlosion roars in pain while he's knocked back from his pounce, slamming into a tree as the bone boomerangs back to the Marowak's hand. Even infected, the feral still knew all of his predecessor's skills.

"You alright, Jack?" You call over in concern, but he only puffs out a small cloud of smoke in your direction.

"Shut up, it's Jackal! And don't worry about me, my arm is just stuck in this fucking knot hole. Hurry up and save the girl you stupid mutt!" He furiously yells as his arm was thoroughly stuffed inside a thick tree trunk. The Marowak growls in amusement as it begins to dash towards you, jumping in the air to your surprise! Unprepared for it, the feral collides into your body with a powerful impact that sends the two of you tumbling over the grass as...
1153121111111111.title: Danger Rises Again

choices: The Buneary reveals to you of the village hideout!
11531211111111111.content:
Managing to bend your legs underneath the furious attacking Marowak, you pulse your muscles out with a savage roar and haul the infected anthro off your body. The feral crashes downhill to toppling down from a large grass mound and falls into a ditch. Getting back up finally, you run over to the top of the forested hill to see the Marowak fleeing in the opposite direction, disappearing within the sea of trees.

Jackal, by now, pulls his arm towards to himself and finally pops his hand right out of the tree trunk's knothole. Shaking his arm a bit to circulate the blood in his wrist again, he spins around and flashes his fangs out, exclaiming with confident readiness, "Alright! Let's do thi-"

"He's already gone." You say, cutting him off as you pass right by him. He stares idly ahead, surprised that the battle had ended so fast and miserably. Glancing around, the Typhlosion discovers that your words hold true with the Marowak gone without a trace. around for the infected but has no luck from his point of view. Continuing to look down the hill from a different side just to be safe enough to know the Marowak was truly gone for good, you mention, "Here, if you want to be useful, go check on the Buneary to see if she's still okay."

"Oh...right..." He stammers about. Walking to the faint body of the red and brown rabbit, he pats her face a bit in attempt to wake her up. Only a soft whimper responds. Under the sense of uncomfortable tension, he then takes the girl by the shoulders and wiggles her body, worriedly yet awkwardly begging, "H-Hey kiddo...uhm...Buneary, wake up..." After one final shake, her eyelids break in between, revealing her hazel, uninfected eyes gaze upon the strange Typhlosion face staring down at her. Blinking again and again, she lets her eyes accustom to the light to catch the glimpse of Jackal close to her face.

Weakly, she opens her mouth to say, "Y-You saved...me?"

Jackal only rubs the back of his neck while stating, "Guh?! Well, the thing is...mmphmff!" He's interrupted, but definitely not by you this time. The Buneary had pushed her head forward, kissing Jackal against his own surprised lips. Her eyes were closed, living in a pure blissful moment, but to your view, Jackal was flailing with wide open eyes of dismay. He muffledly yells during the rabbit's smooch as he thrashes his arms out against the Buneary to desperately pry her from him.

Breaking her lip-giving present, Jackal retreats back by stepping back and almost falls over, coughing loudly from the horrific moment. He consistently spits out the taste from his mouth, shouting out, âWh-wh-what the hell?! *Cough* Whatâs wrong with you?!â You couldn't refrain from laughing.

The rabbit only giggles as she stands up for you to get a good look at her. Her small, thin frame only stood up to be about half of Jackalâs actual size, if you didn't include the long ears, suggesting in your own thoughts that she must have been a teenager which would explain her early evolution form. As stated before, the puffy fur on her ear tips and lower half were of a crimson red, instead of the pale tan color which was odd. It was probably a recessive trait or something.

âIt was the least I could do for rescuing me! I mean taking on an infected, powerful Marowak for just a stranger was so reckless, yet so brave!â The Buneary begins to blush as she crosses her arms behind her back while digging a single hindpaw into the ground, looking away from Jackal. Jackalâs eyes open a bit more wider to your amazement from how wide they were before, and he was struggling with either telling her the truth about her rescue or letting himself take all of the credit, because after all, you did do all of the work.

You walk over to Jackal and give a soft punch to his back, sneering with a grin, âYeah Jack, tell her how you scared the feral off with your fearless and god-like courage.â He gives an angry glare at you as he fumbles around in his mind to find the right words, when all of a sudden, the Buneary hops onto the his back! She hugs around his neck, which was thankfully not ignited for the moment, as he yelled in agitation trying to throw the joyfully laughing girl off. He was too busy running and struggling around, fighting the rabbit off to the point where he runs face first into a tree.

The Buneary finally hops off, laughing to herself as Jackal falls to the ground groaning. You decide to stop the Buneary from giving Jackal too much love torture by asking her off topic, âSay, if you wouldn't mind me asking, but how does a young Buneary like yourself go wandering in a dense forest infested with ferals all alone?â

She pauses her chuckling and flips her vision towards you, looking a bit worried. âWell, Iâm not supposed to tell outsiders from my village about our hideout.â She instantly cups her hands over her mouth, frightened. âYou didn't just hear that!â Village? If she knew where a village was, then why would she try to hide it? Were they just protecting something? She tugs down on her large ears to covers her face as her hindpaws alternate stops in her mad fit. "Oh no, oh no, oh no, oh nooooo! I'm gonna be in soooo much trouble now once the Chief hears about this! Oh me and my big, fat mouth. Please sirs, just forget what I said. I didn't mean it! I'm a liar! There's nothing for me to hide!"

You attempt to settle the frantic girl down, âMy savior of a partner here and I are searching for a cause and possible cure of the infection. We've been looking for a village for some help or knowledge about it, and it would help if you could tell us about your town.â You try to persuade her with the truth.

She ponders a bit with an unsure expression, contemplating hard until finally answering, âOkay, but if I show it to you, promise me that you wonât tell anyone there that I was the one who gave its location away, alright?â You nod your head and smile, but the girl presses your loyalty. "You have to swear!"

Grinning, you hold up a forepaw. "I do solemnly swear." The bunny gleams a satisfied smile at you as you give a light and non-painful kick to Jackal, still mumbling on the floor. âHey Jack, weâre leaving.â

He groans bitterly once more before replying, âMy name is Jackal, you stupid pup.â
11531211111111111.title: Rabbit Rescue

115312111111111111.content:
You elbow Jackal as he gets up grumpily. âWhat?" You flick your eyes to the girl with a head-tilt and back to him, urging him to promise to keep the village a secret as well. "Oh, yeah, uh, so do I.â He answers. The Buneary claps her paws together once with cheerful glee.

âThatâs great! Iâll be happy to show you where it is then!â She incites and begins to walk back to the path as the both of you follow behind her after Jackal had courteously retrieved the bags he had set aside. As the three of you journey onward, you think that it would kill some time if you began a conversation with the happy and skipping rabbit.

âWhatâs your name?â You kindly ask her.

âIâm Rose! And you how about guysâ¦?â

âMy name is Lace,â You quickly point to Jackal, âAnd this is my friend Jack.â

âHe means Jackal.â He reacts quickly, clearly expecting for you to say that. Enjoying how much fun you got out of his agitation from the nickname, you will proceed to always call him that from now on, especially if he hated it. But then you remembered how young and innocent Rose was, so why would she leave a safe village?

âRose, why did you leave your village? Was it attacked or did something happen to it?â You ask. She shook her head.

âNo, my village is one of the safest ones around! Well, actually it does get an occasional infected attack, but we've managed to keep a stable society in a hidden location with our really really big system of guards, especially with keep thieves and cruel pokemon out. I left because we recently lost one of our village scouts.â She then began to skip at a lesser pace and her head tilts a bit down. âThe scout that disappeared was my older sister, so I set out to find her myself. I heard the rumor from a couple of guards talking to each other.â She suddenly embraces herself with confidence, looking triumphant. âBut I promised myself to find her! Sheâs too fast to get caught by some fat infected! Sheâs the fastest Lopunny in the region, and I wonât just give up hope on her.â The Buneary begins to daze out into this strange daydream state during her speech.

You smirk a comically across your face as she hums out a military sounding tune with her skips slowly transforming into a march. For a teenager, she truly was a young child at heart. Rose stops when all of you arrive at a large rock wall. Only a few trees and maybe a bush or two were scattered around, and that was a large sum of the area.

âWeâre here!â She exclaims joyfully while heading towards a large rock. Somehow, even with her small frame, she is able to push the colossal boulder to the side with simplest ease, revealing a small, open tunnel. You could almost hear Jackalâs jaw drop.

Rose just giggles, âThe rock is fake, but robbers and ferals can surprisingly find that out quickly. There are a lot of open crags and nooks they find themselves venturing through, and there's even a massive cavern system close-by the village that's crawling with the hungry monsters. But our totally awesome security keep them away, so that's pretty cool, right?â She gestures her hand for you to follow her into the narrow and dark crease.
115312111111111111.title: Rose the Buneary

1153121111111111111.content:
Rose leads you through a large network of corridors in the cavern that thrive with twisting and turning tunnels scattered all about, which made you wonder how the Buneary, or anyone for that matter, remembered the way to the village. The maze of paths and darkness seems never-ending, plus repetitive. However, the three of you arrive at a large wooden gate to your surprise, with torches aligned and lit along the rock cave walls that reveals a strange yellow symbol on a crimson flag. Three upside-down black triangles all centered within a large yellow one. You wonder if it has true meaning and to be honest, the large wall of wooden columns could be mistaken for just a simple blockade which prompts you of the security's concern. Rose taps at an indenture within the wall as Jackal oddly scoots closer to you and bumps you with his elbow with the girl's back to him.

He mentions with a whisper, "Hey, I'm not exactly excited about this whole 'secret village' stuff. I've got your back if things go south down in there."

You grin and answer without facing him, "Hmph. I'm flattered to hear that you care about me so much."

The Typhlosion scowls at you and steps back to his previous position. Suddenly, a Scyther in leather armor-like padding wound to its torso held out a long arm-blade at Rose after opening the 'door' you never saw in the wall. Although, he seemed to have instantly recognized her as he embraces the small rabbit into a hug. (Avoiding cutting her, of course.)

"Rose?! Where on bloody earth have you been? The Chief has been worried sick about you, and the village was expecting you have been gobbled up!" He exclaims to the girl in an odd accent. Glancing back up in his time of bewildered happiness, the green bug gasps to see you and Jackal behind her. His expression reverts back to anger. "And who, might these two be?" Before Rose could speak, you choose to explain yourself while stepping up to the Scyther.

"My friend here and I are traveling to research about the current infection. We so happened to find Rose looking for her sister in a forest patch next to a road close by." You justify. The Scyther's face turns to a blank or worried tone.

"So that's why this mischievous rabbit ran off. Well, a'right then, but now there's been more than one of you to say the same thing. We don't know much about the infection as it is and we're just doing our best to avoid any problems." He sets Rose back onto her feet from his hug and nudges his shoulder in an odd gesture. A guard hidden behind the wall begins turning a crank, lowering the entire midsection of the wall into an open slit below it to the open the gate entirely. "Come along then, I'll show you two tourists to the Village Chief."

Before you could take one more step though, he turns and holds one of his bladed arms out at you, "But mark my words, Lucario, make the tiniest hint of any trouble, and I won't think twice about slicing up you or your bandanna companion over there into a bloody pile of cut meat." You nod to his warning as you grip your bag a bit tighter, following the cautious Scyther. You can hear Jackal behind you tug on the bandanna you gave to him on his arm and mumble out,

"Bandanna companion?"
1153121111111111111.title: Bandanna Companion

choices: "Do you know anyone who might know though?"
"Is it okay if we stay a night here though?"
11531211111111111111.content:
The village, was huge. And that feels like an understatement. The entire residence was underground beneath a large mountain with most of its interior actually carved out, with occasional small crags and slits that streaked across the extremely high ceiling above you. "That must be where the oxygen and light outside come in from" You think to yourself. Four impossibly towering pillars hold up the roof above the village's head, with staircases and and rooms engraved around them to be used as vacancy and watchtowers.

Although a little too dark for your comfort, there was plenty of lighting to see all of the citizens, dirt roads, and signs around. Especially the buildings. The buildings are made of the very rock used from digging inside the mountain, either sculptured out our clayed together in large stones, giving a very sturdy and earthy look to the whole area. You watch as you enter the door a stretched sign reading, Redeemer's Grotto carved into the rock banner, Let those with minds rise above the evils that lurk our world. Torches were lit everywhere and anywhere they could to destroy any sense of pure darkness, which so happen to reveal to you were of local soldiers scouted all around, wearing the same exact symbol on the flags at the entrance upon their leather padding. Villagers roam the streets freely, with the town's guards kindly greeting them and moving on with their lives as if the world wasn't in an apocalypse. You could get used to this.

The Scyther stops you from moving any closer as to what seemed to be a large Charizard wearing the outside skeleton armor of an Aggron, who bears the three horned skull on its head with the shoulder armor pieces on, well, the shoulders. The orange dragon's clawed hands grab the sides of the helmet, lifting it off, to expose the Charizard's face. The armored lizard was male judging from his masculine torso while protruding a yellow cushioned gut, thick legs, packed muscle, and reveals a long scar going from his brow over one of his eyes, streaking across to stop at his jaw. Fat or not, he was intimidating

"Pence, who are our guests?" His deep voice asked the Scyther, Pence. It seemed more of an order, than a question though.

"Chief, I found these two outside of the gate. They want to help with the infection epidemic." The Charizard chief just grunted.

"Isn't everyone? You know that's not a good enough excuse to let newcomers into our city, but what I'm really interested in is if can you explain to me how they found the gate?" He inquires with a smokey huff.

Pence shudders a bit in fear, "...S-Sorry, sir...it was my mistake b-but..." The bug was debating on whether to confess the truth on the matter, or merely lie to keep Rose's skin in the clear. Although, the Buneary appears from behind you, raising a paw in the air.

"It's because of me." She says softly. Her ears were bent downward in sorrow along with her face dreading her actions. The Chief looks down upon her, but instead of a face of anger, he seemed a tad bit...happy? The Charizard crouches down to his struggling endeavors from his thick body and weighing armor to her height, and pats her head.

"Looking for your sister no doubt. Don't worry my fair girl, I'm sure she's out leaving ferals in the dust right now." He pats her one more time before standing up fully to look at you again. His unhappy tone returns, and yet, it sounded a little less sinister, "I'm sorry, but you may as well turn around, for we know little to just as much as you do about the infection. They crave for whole flesh and even the occasional sadistic pleasure with their purple eyes. That's all we know. We've kept as far from it as possible and we would like to keep it that way." He explains to you. You thought so, figuring that they wouldn't know much, especially since they literally live under a rock. You also notice that during his speech, he held Rose, close. Even Pence had an emotion of unwillingness towards the topic.

You ask the Chief...
11531211111111111111.title: Redeemer's Grotto

choices: Meet with the Village Chief. You have an apocalypse to worry about.
Well, maybe you could spare some time with Maple~...
115312111111111111111.content:
"Do you know anyone who might know though?" You inquire before the chubby Charizard could turn to leave. The reptile ponders fro a moment, silently thinking to himself as you notice Pence's glare darts from you to the Village Chief, and back to in a repeating sequence. Anxiously waiting, the Village Chief finally brings his attention back to you, assuredly making up his mind.

"...Hmmm, there may be one pokemon you might wish to look into, but the journey there may be a bit hectic. He's a Toxicroak from what I've heard, and he lives in a swamp just south of here. His eyes are closed with his mouth open wide, procuring a toothy smile that flexed a floppy tongue out. He was clearly enjoying his treatment.

One of his eyes opened up, noticing you, and he instantly closes his mouth from his murring. After ordering his Luna to stop, he never let his smile fade away as he calls out to you while holding his arms out openly, "Lace! My friend! I'm glad to see you alive and well fed!"

You stammer closer to him, stopping while replying, "I'm glad about that too."

He then places a hand over his fat gut, stroking at it. You wish you could take your attention away from it, but the Charizard notices that as well. "Ah, straight to business I see." He places his hands against the sides of the rock mound, pulling himself up with a hint of trouble thanks to his obese stomach. He manages to actually get to his feet and gestures you to follow him. "Come this way. I can give you directions."

1153121111111111111111112122111.content:

He had also explained to you the direction and paths to go into for the fastest trip to the swamp, and to get there, you had to bypass many feral-thriving areas by going through an 'empty' canyon. According to his scouts, they had said that a deserted village resided there, and the Charizard puts much stress into the words of his warnings about the infected that live there. You remember the Chief's words, "The farther north you go, the more ferals you're bound to run into. They may even work together in packs just as they did to attack this, so be warned! They know how mighty they are the more of them that work together to devour you."

You are at the gate after you and Jackal had a moment to rest and digest most of your meals. Pence brought your bags that you had left in your temporary bedrooms as he said his farewells. Rose and the Village Chief were also there to see you off. Rose hugs Jackal again, except without hopping on him or anything this time, and smooshes her face against his mid-section.
