Infected ferals aren't the only Pokemon that would like a squirming Lucario in their bodies. Some Pokemon are carnivorous and crazy, so pay attention to those types!" After a pat on your back, he orders a soldier to open the wooden gate. But before you left, you had to ask.

"Um, how did you ever get that Aggron armor actually?" You question. He laughs out a bit, shaking his newly added flab.

"I wear it as a trophy! An Aggron was the hardest thing that I've ever eaten, including disposed of. An Aggron's skeleton is so strong, most of it survives digestion, thus, how I still have its exoskeleton helm and shoulders." He answers. The Charizard tapped his shoulder pieces to signify its durability and fortification.

Pence walks up, gesturing his blade a bit in a good-bye wave, "It was nice to meet you, Lace and Jackal. It's great knowing someone is finally trying to do something about this epidemic. I have a feeling you'll get far in your quest."

And after that, the both of you walk back through the tunnels, and manage to exit them thanks to the Village Chief's instructions. It was afternoon out in the blue sky, showing no signs of any clouds. Your belly is a bit pudgy, but it definitely digested most of the Politoed by now. Jackal's belly also had the same situation, which meant you had plenty of packed energy to make it through this trek to the swamp. You head northwest, to take a shortcut through this canyon, wondering if you'll meet anyone along the way, except for ferals though. This Toxicroak better be at this swamp, or this long journey risking your life dangerously was for all for nothing.
1153121111111111111111112122111.title: Your Journey Continues!

11531211111111111111111121221111.content:
The orange crusty clay walls stretch in a curved line, swerving and turning throughout the chasm. The canyon walls are truly intimidating in size, and the possibility of having infected hiding in the nooks and crannies of the plateau sides frightens you to no extent. You tighten your grip on your satchel bag and move onward as Jackal followed close behind, browsing and investigating the ominous rock walls. Your steps walk through its center while echoing around the natural eroded hall, making a straight narrow path to be able to pass the canyon's chasm to reach the swamp. Strangely enough, there are carved out sections of the clay and rock walls of buildings with rubble roofs, wooden bridges, and scaffoldings. It truly was once a place where Pokemon lived happily in a village, and you wonder if anyone was still around.

"Hello? Is anyone here?" You dare to call out in hopes of seeing another rational soul instead of a feral. However, only the chilly and moaning wind of the canyon calls back by blowing past you.

Even Jackal was a bit worried. "That's it. This place is just freaking me out. We're outta here." He says as he bumps elbows with you to walk faster.

Suddenly, a dim shadow looms high above you during your walk! It went by too fast for you to be able to see what it truly was. Looking up, you search for the mysterious object, but to no avail, not finding anything in the air of it around. Perhaps then it was just a cloud, although it did seem pretty fast for the shadow to whisk at such a large size like that. Pretending to ignore it, you continue on, watching from the edges of your eyes for it. For about another five minutes, nothing seems to appear.

Coincidentally, almost immediately after you point your vision up from the canyon floor, the large shadow flies past over your again; even Jackal noticed it this time. It was definitely a Pokemon, but which one? Was it infected?

You instantly heard a, "Pssst!" The both of you look over to your right but see nothing but small grasses, an occasional weed, and clusters of rock. "Are ya insane? Get under cover before ya get grabbed away!" A woman's voice from what you guessed, (with a fill of a strange country accent), called out to you. An arm popped out from a small hole, almost covered by a bright brown stone. The arm was a bit thick in stature, but it had golden-hazel scales running almost all the way around it with claw tips at each finger. Under the arms, was a pale tan color of skin. The shadow streaks by again, and this time, you were ready to look up.

Terror filled your eyes as you see a winged beast's width spreading out wide above you. It was a silhouette to your vision as it blackens the sun out in front of your eyes, and it conceals its species by the lighting effect. Its draconic hindpaws strike out, ready to capture prey like a bird. You quickly grab the tight bandanna around Jackal's arm, using it to pull him with you as you run for the waving big arm. You dive, tossing Jackal to his side with you as the both of you slide into the small hole, managing to miss the flying Pokemon's grasp. You heard its feet clench behind you, missing its attempt to collect you for its dinner.

The both of you roll a bit down in the small hole is it formed into a sharp curving slide, as you fall face first into a...
11531211111111111111111121221111.title: The Canyon Chaos

choices: "So I wanted to keep you safe here!"
"But now we can have some for ourselves!"
115312111111111111111111212211111.content:
As you roll down forward, you expect to crash into something hard like a rock wall. However, there was a strange and quite lucky discovery. Your landing turns out to be more soft and plushy than you'd imagine! You feel your face slam into a thick cushion, making the impact much more comfortable to land in. Hitting whatever broke your downhill descent was obscuring your view though, so you place your hands around the plushy material that your head was stuck inside, and pushed against it quite firmly. With your head plopping out of the soft wall, you are shocked to find out what it was, or should you say, who it was.

You had fallen face first straight in between a, quite chubby, female Sandshrew's breasts! You notice that your hands that you had used to grip and push yourself out are grasped firmly groped around her soft boobs, scaring you immediately with your fur prickling. Now you know what Jackal must have felt like when he first met Rose, except you were the awkward pervy one. Your cheeks flourish a bright red, and you release the voluptuous globes to begin grunting out different parts of different words in response, unable to control your voice. You crawl quickly back in embarrassment, looking up at her hazel eyes to see that she was also blushing as well, but seemed to be more flattered then horrified. Jackal remains how he fell, lying on the back of his shoulders with his rump accidentally in the air and his legs hunch over his body, groaning in discomfort.

You stumble back to try and find the right words, "I-I-I'm s-so sorry...! We fell and I had no idea that what I landed into was..." You trail off as the Sandshrew just waves her hand up and down to assure you.

"Oh hun! Don't worry about it! I'm sure it was an accident." You notice that as she gestured her hand, that was the very same thick hand you saw previously, beckoning you to hide in the hole along with the same southern voice. Looking around you, you take the features of the small underground hole you stumbled inside, finding the area to be maybe a few of meters deep within the layer of dirt. It was small, but long for space. Torches light the side walls, pouring smoke out from small hole-vents made specifically to traffic the smoke out. You must have stumbled into her home, or actually...now their home.

A male Golem steps out from behind her, curious at the new visitors in his small tunneled home with disgruntled frown. You scratch the back of your head. "We apologize for the intrusion, we just didn't want to end up as some feral's meal out there. Your friend here helped us escape out there" You try to convince him that you meant no harm, but he should understand, after all, the Sandshrew called you into her home.

"That's perfectly alright, hun! Don't pay no mind to my husband here. We have an infected large Aerodactyl that roams this canyon, eatin' poor travelers as they pass..." She trails off, until saying...
115312111111111111111111212211111.title: Soft Landing

1153121111111111111111112122111111.content:
"Agh. Did you say, Aerodactyl...?!" Asks Jackal as he sits back up on his rear, rubbing the back of his head from his landing. The Sandshrew nods her own head in response. In fact, you take the moment to just examine your two new acquaintances starting with the Sandshrew first. She was a bit of a chubby one, with thick arms, thighs, a short tail, and sports two large globular breasts which reveal the greyish brown nipples without any covering to hide themselves from, but in your world its unnecessary to anyway. Her belly was the most impressive feature to you somehow though. It booms out, hanging out in such prideful plushness and girth. Her underbelly parts appear so soft and comfortable to where they feel even better since you got a hint of a feel for a moment from your accidental entrance. You didn't know why, but you had no fascinations to bellies before this whole epidemic; maybe it was messing with your head enough or maybe there was something to it about the infection. You aren't sure and brush the thought away once the Sandshrew returns her chat.

"Well, we've had that fella around this canyon for what...a few months, Morro?" The desert rodent asks. Morro, being the Golem from what you've gathered, hesitates and finally answers while rubbing his jaw to contemplate, "Yeah, I'd say about four months it's lived here."

The Sandshrew continues, "That infected grey lizard has been using this canyon for its hunting grounds. Everyday it comes by, sweeping one of our kind up and carrying the poor fella's off to its nest! It just doesn't know when to quit! There's barely anyone left in our town anymore, if that's what ya wanna call it still. A tomb sounds more like it. Hmph." Her resistant tone really shown through to you from her frustration with this thing. And you thought it took a horde of infected to ruin a whole town.

Morro steps up to wrap an arm around the Sandshrew, "My wife and I only travel outside for a matter of minutes everyday, because we live in fear of that...giant! It's like it's always out there, patiently waiting for us everyday to join the fate of our neighbors." Yikes, you thought how it must have been hard to search for food in such conditions, especially when living in a canyon, but a monster who's whole purpose is to eat you is right at your front door everyday, something like that seems like it could really screw you over. You're surprised that this couple didn't bother eating you in the first place for food. It was still urgent to get to the Toxicroak in the swamp, but you aren't going to make any form of distance with that Aerodactyl there. You needed to take care of it first before moving on.

The Sandshrew crosses her arms, retorting, "We used to have a wonderful town in this small divide of cliffs. Little did we know that a ginormous dragon would destroy everything and run everyone outta of town with their lives or end up in that...mouth of its...Hun, anyone who hasn't run away from this patch of canyons and has managed not to get caught by that monster live underground or in the rock walls in complete fear. This is no longer living! We're just desperately surviving and herded like livestock for it!" Her voice flares out in anger from her statement. You happily interrupt her rant.

"I'll stop it." You say. The Sandshrew and Golem then look at you with wide eyes, taken back from the sudden suggestion. Even Jackal is very surprised. "If you can show me where this Aerodactyl rests, I'll try to stop it if I can."
1153121111111111111111112122111111.title: Aerial Problems

choices: You and your group venture off to the Aerodactyl's nest!
11531211111111111111111121221111111.content:
The Golem begins to laugh out uncontrollably. "Whaaaaaaaaat?!" Morro madly cackles out. "Stop the Aerodactyl by-by-bahahaaahhh-by yourself?! Heh, I know you want to get rid of the thing just as much as we do, but do you know how huge and fast that thing is? It's probably twice your size! The only thing you could to harm it was to give indigestion as you boil inside its belly!" He bursts out his loud laughter more before the Sandshrew slaps the backside of his head, silencing him.

"Well at least someone is wantin' to do somethin', unlike some of us." She implies to him, putting the emphasis towards Morro. Although, she quickly sighs and sulks as she turns to face you. "But, he is right when it comes to you getting eaten...or worse..." She shivers with disgust as the images of how the Aerodactyl could 'play' with you for its pleasure.

She holds up a hand, raising it to you, "I'm Darcy. It's a pleasure to see a freindly face in these parts again, even if they have a death wish." You shake Darcy's hand, returning the favor.

"I'm Lace, and this is my partner Jack." You point to the Typhlosion, getting an angry huff in response. "We're traveling the land, searching for a way to stop the infection. We were on our way to a swamp to find someone that may be of some help until...well you know the rest." Darcy's eyes didn't seemed shocked to hear about your quest.

"Well that's no surprise to me. You're not the first one to come through here, sayin' the same thing." She says as she shrugs her shoulders in disappointment.

This worriedly bewildered Jackal. "You mean...there were others before us...?" You could hear a loud bellowing gulp of fear travel down his throat.

"Of course!" Darcy answers, "Did you think no one knows about the sickness? Plenty of people are trying to stop it! The only ones that pass through here all mention about hearin' this frog in the swamp that could help, only till they then disappear within a few hours here at this canyon when they go back out."

Jackal starts to quiver nervously, "You mean they get..."

"Eaten." Morro replies with sinister eyes and a devilish smile. Jackal's face whitens up pale, seemingly to look like he wanted to throw up immediately, but you cared less; you were good at improvising, and there was no way of turning around now.

"I've handled large flying infected before, I'm pretty sure I could do it again." You courageously say. Did you have any bit of fear? Absolutely. When you were attacked by the Fearow, you just got lucky as it hit a rock wall. Yet, could you be able to do it again with this feral now...? "Just point me in the direction of its nest, and I'll see what I can do for you two."
11531211111111111111111121221111111.title: Improvision

115312111111111111111111212211111111.content:
You love how the breeze flows within the canyon, streaming the wind so fluently through the eroded walls with a cooling chill that comforts you in the hazing sun. It's a shame that this place is so highly dangerous. You had traveled out of Darcy's home, and through the tunnels inside the canyon walls to avoid going outside. Darcy was kind enough, and brave enough, to accompany you on your way to the Aerodactyl's nest to show you where this monster resided most of the time, but wouldn't do any of the fighting. Morro had stayed behind, cowardly not wanting to risk his life and mentioned, "Well someone has to watch over our home!" Although he was kind of enough to threaten both you and Jackal to bring his wife back safe and sound, or the Aerodactyl would be the least of their problems. Jackal, however, found the confidence to follow and help you, even he tries to act tough along the trip, even with his legs obviously shivering in the process.

You exit the cavern, arriving at the top of a flat and open plateau. There was nothing on the flat surface, except a cluster of rocks, shielding sunlight over a large straw nest. The nest was occupied by a large grey beast.

You all immediately tense up at the site of the dragon, but you luckily hear loud snoring with no purple eyes gleaming out. It was asleep for now, perhaps digesting away whatever prey it recently may have caught. Darcy holds your arm before you take a step forward towards the infected feral. She whispers, "Well, there ain't any turning back now. However you're gonna stop this thing, I suggest you do it fast, and quietly! I'm stayin' here in the tunnel where its safe!"

You nod, and wave your arm forward to gesture Jackal to follow you. You silently creep to the loud breathing Aerodactyl, feeling its exhaling breath to exhaust at you. It was warm, and gust blowing even, sending sand from the ground to wave out in small ripples from the force in your direction. Deciding to hit it at the back of its head, you had hopes that it would knock it unconscious so you could have more time to think of a way to kill it. The creature was massive stature, perhaps three time your height. You could only wonder how many meals this thing has eaten to achieve such a size like this, but seeing all of the empty homes along the canyon, you had a small guess of how many that could be. That fact only terrifies you more, making you question if two Pokemon could truly stop this thing if a whole town couldn't defend itself from it.

Arriving at the shadowed nest itself, you watch as the dragon lays against its chest, slightly curled up in its comfortable snooze to happily enjoy. Its neck bulges out and shrinks back with each heavy breath, occasionally snorting that forces you to almost jump if it had awakened. It even moves a winged arm over to scratch at its large and scaly belly as it gurgles out, making the dragon even drool some with a faint, fanged smile. You could only imagine that it was thinking about food.

Just so very close to have an arm's reach to hit the back of its horned skulled, you need to just a take a step closer for a good shot. You press a hindpaw down, stepping against some of the straw of the nest to break it right under you. SNAP! Your heart implodes within your chest as you glance over to see the Aerodactyl...
115312111111111111111111212211111111.title: No Rest for the Wicked

1153121111111111111111112122111111111.content:
The Aerodactyl snorts, quickly making a fast twitch with its head to roll over that causes you to almost jump out of your fur! Yet the infected dragon continues to fall victim to its slumber, snoozing loudly once again and rolling its head back over again. You release a silent sigh of relief from dodging a bullet there and charge your paw with aura as you watch your steps this time. Focusing your powerful energy, you wish yourself luck and throw your fist down, jabbing the Aerodactyl directly in the back of its head that sends a small blue shockwave of blue flames to scorch out from the impact.

You hear a severe thumping noise from the hit as it's easily deafened out by the blood piercing screams of the Aerodactyl. The large lizard howls in miserable shock and agony, flailing its limbs in its nest aimlessly and unable to comprehend what was happening at the time. A massive, flexible wing collides into you to knock you back out of the den and onto your back outside atop the plateau. Your mind rocks back and forth inside of its skull when the back of your head meets the hot and rough ground to smack down on for your own pulsating pain to mirror the infected dragon's dilemma.

You slowly begin to recover from your dizziness to watch the behemoth of a dragon stumbling out if its cave, holding its hands that were connected to edges of its wings at the backside of its head that left a smolder smudge mark smoking out some along with more than just a headache pulsating for the feral. It groans furiously and heavily steps outward while fumbling and teetering some with its glowing, violet eyes struggling to aim straight to focus. You were unable to knock the infected out, but you clearly managed to stun it for awhile which was much more acceptable had it just awoken and chomped you up. Prepared to fight it with Jackal running over to join at your side, you suddenly witness to your horror of the Aerodactyl...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111.title: A Rude Awakening

choices: You launch the dragon back down!
11531211111111111111111121221111111111.content:
Extensive purple wings flex out with clumsy power, spreading a wide gust of wind to blow across the flat top of the plateau. Loose sand float away in small waves as you watch the Aerodactyl begin to flap its wings with dizzy flails, and the beast was beginning to rise up. The massive dragon still somehow had enough focus to take flight in the air, gaining some distance from the ground a few meters up in hopes it could escape whatever had attacked it. You aren't going to let it get away that easy though.

As the dragon aviates above you to fly off into the canyon, you pay special attention to the tail that it's dragging limply below it. Catching the long tendril in a dive, you are suddenly carried off with the Aerodactyl to soar through the air a you keep a firm grip on its tail. You gulp and regretfully look down to the floor, watching how far below the ground was beneath you now as the infected dragon scutters its wings in wild desperation, making you second-guess if this was the right plan or not. Jackal calls out to you as you see him get smaller and smaller in the distance, disappearing from concealing cliff-sides during your trip on the dragon's wavering tail.

Having to embrace your fear, you climb along the tail slowly as best you can with it swishing back and forth during mid-flight for an uneasy trip to ascend up on. The Aerodactyl, although still stunned, notices your mounting and roars with great anger. It tilts to its side, slamming its backside into a canyon rock wall in an effort to crush you. You are able to dodge it just in time by sliding to the side of the Aerodactyl as its back grinds powerfully against the cliff, sending dirt, rubble, and dust clouds trailing violently behind it before releasing off. You continue your ascent, climbing up the long back and neck of the dragon as it continues to struggle, unable to do much with you out of its reach. It instantly flips upside down, almost making you slip and fall off to your death, but your hands luckily grab the horns on its head to dangle your body above the terrifying height. The Aerodactyl flips again, sending you to rise up in the air from losing your grip on its horns. The Aerodactyl thinks it has won now as you begin to stop rising in the air above the Aerodactyl and start plummeting towards it! Although, you charge your paw with a blazing blue fire, sending a deep aura punch towards its skull before you land back on it!
11531211111111111111111121221111111111.title: An Airborne Trip

choices: Meeting up with Jackal and Darcy afterwards...
115312111111111111111111212211111111111.content:
The small aura explosion erupted at the base of the Aerodactyl's head, sending it to plummet down in a fast paced descent. You do your best to hold onto to a shoulder of the screaming beast as it comes into contact of the flooring of the canyon, exploding dirt in all directions once finally hitting the earth and grind into the dirt floor like a massive cannon shot. You quickly jump off of the dragon, hitting the ground and rolling from the sheer force of the Aerodactyl's falling speed.

It crashes into a steep rock wall in a loud crunching noise, while you stop from rolling and attempt to shake your dizziness away, your blurry vision fades away enough for you to focus back to the large infected creature. It laid face planted in a wall, with cuts and scrapes along its body, growling muffledly in rage. It weakly and bewitchingly raises its head, craning its neck to stare at you, gazing an evil purple stare. You stagger backwards to get ready for a real fight with all of the excitement from putting a beating on the Aerodactyl draining out of your body from that gaze. That menacing violet glow proves to you just how dearly the dragon wanted to kill you. Taking a few more steps back, you trip over a rock and land on your large blue rear, gasping in surprise and making feverish crawling pushes back.

Suddenly, a rumble in the wall groans, as large boulders begin to fall from the Aerodactyl's impact. They tumble out of the rock wall and plunge downward above the dragon, silencing it yells for its last time once the colossal rocks fall onto the Aerodactyl, letting out another crunching noise. You wince again as the dust clears, seeing a grey tail thrash violently from under the boulders until finally dying out in energy and falling to the floor. It remained still after that. It was over. You have actually defeated the giant Aerodactyl single-handedly! (Jackal would've probably done something if the dragon hadn't flew away with you on it. Probably.)

You groan and fall all the way onto your backside, panting out from all of that terrifying work and luck as you stare up into the blue sky. You watch the white clouds surf silently and slowly through the air as the canyon breeze occasionally whisks by. The quiet moment you rewarded yourself was surely worth all of the effort you put in to help making this canyon a bit of a safer place. But you would need to get back to Jackal and Darcy to truly celebrate the day's victory, and besides, as eager as you were to just sit down and rest, you had a mission to complete. Sitting back up and trying to wet your dry mouth, you force yourself to a struggling stand with a groaning exhale. You feel your wounds pulsate repeatedly with part of your head aching, including a small bloodstain sporting on the of fur on it, and as for your leg, you have collected a few bruises on it. Well, at the very least it was nothing seriously vital and you could live to see another day!
115312111111111111111111212211111111111.title: Ground Sweet Ground!

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Your body is crushed by thick golden scaled arms, asphyxiating all of the air from your lungs in a tight wheeze! You had returned to Darcy and Morroâs tunneled home with the chubby Sandshrew woman overwhelmed with complete joy of your surviving return. Jackal is leaned against a torchlit wall, smirking a bit as you fail to pry the grateful Sandshrew off. Morro is sitting on a rock-like stool, feeling slightly grumpy of how much his mate enjoyed your company, but is also content about the death of the Aerodactyl.

Two wet lips invade your mouth, pressing firmly against the tip of your muzzle with a determined, "Mmmmmmwahhhh!" Your body aches just from hit you took with the ground after you jumped off the Aerodactyl, but Darcyâs constricting grip was truly even worse!

Her mouth releases its hold from yours before she cheers with a smile. âYa stupid dog! I can't believe ya actually did it!â She applauds by giving you another painful tight squeeze. Jackal was kind enough to tap the excited Sandshrewâs shoulders, signaling her that she should probably stop killing you. She looks to see you face jammed between her pillowy breasts, blocking off all of you air. âO-Oh, sorry hun, I just couldn't help myself! Heehee!â Her thick arms finally release you from the malevolent grasp, endowing you breath once more.

âKahhkk, ackk...! Th-Thatâs quite alright. I'm glad you're happy.â You manage to wheeze out.

Morro suddenly gives you a swift pat on the back, chuckling some. âI guess this means youâre heading out then! Itâs a shame we can't have you stay any longer! This canyon could'a had a person like you around to keep off any unwanted infected, and you would'a be seen as like an icon.â It was clear he was grateful, but he also wanted you to leave since his mate seemed more interested in you than him.

Morro is actually right though, because you need to get to the swamp still. Every minute of time could've been precious in this case, and it was probably required of you to continue. You are, at the very least, making progress on the infection from your point of view, and this Toxicroak had the potential of helping you even more. Darcy sits down on a stool, patting at her legs happily. "Ain't this excitin' though?! We don't have to live in this dump anymore! Morro honey, we can actually go back outside, to our old home and village, and look for other survivors. Finding food and water is easier than ever!"

Morro sits by his wife, wrapping an arm around at her backside to cup on her shoulder. "I know dear, but don't get too excited. That Aerodactyl wasn't the only feral out there. We still have to deal with any other evil critters out there."

She suddenly pecks a kiss to his cheek, patting his rocky chest. "I ain't worried ya big oaf. I have ya to protect me." The two smile at each other before Morro explains to you, "I can't tell you how much my wife and I appreciate you saving us and this canyon. We promise we won't let you down, or let anything like that dragon dominate this land ever again. We'll try to find the others from our village and re-establish it. Your efforts won't go in vain, Lace."

Jackal suddenly raises a brow, "H-Hey! I helped too...kinda sorta."

Darcy chuckles, "Don't worry, we'll let everyone know about Lace and Jack, the 'dragonslayers', heeheehee."

Jackal scowls, but doesn't bother to correct them this time. He just glances to you to blame for the incorrect name.

----|----


After Darcy kindly gave her crushing goodbye hug to you, both you and Jackal left through the canyon path with your bags in hand, out to reach the swamp. It was a bit of a setback, yet you're glad you got to help out someone in need and make a difference. It was the entire purpose of your mission. The two of you travel with no infected-encounters and exit the canyon walls to approach a cliffside-craggy turf, overlooking the rest of far-off terrain to see that you're much closer to the swamp now. The bog is in sight, but has a certain residing between you and it. It looks like it'd be your next stopping point, so you head out in hopes you can get to your true destination before nightfall.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Onward!

choices: A red beam shoots out from the water!
A large beast arises from the water!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Your rump plops weakly against the shore of a lake. The wound on your leg was pounding out in pain from the ever-ending walk to the swamp, and it urges for rest. Jackal certainly didn't mind stopping after walking for about two hours though. He sat his personal belongings next to him before he lied on his backside, yawning out tiredly with arms crossed behind his head. He murrs out to you, "Take as much time as you need to pooch. I'm in no rush."

"True, but I'm in a bit of a rush. That frog could be fighting for his life in that swamp right now, and we're just idly sitting here worrying about ourselves." You answer back to him as you inspect your leg.

Jackal frowns some, "Yeah, yeah, I know. But you can't go anywhere if your leg gets worse. You are your priority, right? Don't worry. If that fucker is crazy enough to live in a feral-infested swamp, then he can probably take care of himself." Jackal sits up a bit with a worried look, "...H-Hey, how is your leg, by the way? Do you need my help or...?"

"I'll be fine." You reply to him without even turning to look at him. You inspect your leg, and although it wasn't too bad, it might still get infected. Not with becoming a feral, but an actual disease like any other wound could get. "I just need to wash it some. Just go back to relaxing. I'll be up and ready to go soon enough."

Jackal shrugs and closes his eyes, lying back flat down with a hand on his gut. You stare at the cold lake water and prepare yourself for however this might sting. Nudging up to the coast of the lake, you splash a bit of water on your wound, cleaning your black leg fur and cooling it off whilst making it wince in some pain. You grit your teeth and just endure, feeling a bit better after your leg is given a thorough wash, and after you cup some water in your hands to drink. After the washing, you stared out at the pond, enjoying its odd beauty. Something was more odd though. There are strange ripples in the water seeming to ring out in the liquid.

Jackal peeks and eye open and looks up at you, noticing your tension. He lazily sits up, asking out to you, "What is it now?" He was quickly cut off when...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: A Lake Filled Surprise

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
You begin to see a hue of red beginning to glow from under the surface of the water a bit of ways off, with sizzling bubbles beginning to boil over it. Before you could warn Jackal of it, a glowing crimson beam of light flashes out from the water to narrowly miss the Typhlosion and hits the sandy ground next to him. However, the explosion sends the Typhlosion to fly back, hurtling into the ground with a small burst of dirt to fly out. You look inside the murky waters to witness a light blue Golduck hop out from the water, spreading droplets across the pond from his sudden leap while spreading an open sinister smile along his flat beak.

He splashes back into the shallow part of the water enough to stand just a few meters out from where you were standing, bringing him to at least knee deep water. Swinging an arm to point a clawed and webbed finger at his target, the blue duck exclaimed, âWow, I can't actually believe I just missed that!â The duck begins to count on his fingers. "Even with the element of surprise, a powerful and direct attack, the fact that I was hidden, and the fact I had time to charge and aim, I still met the unfortunate end of missing. Damn, I'm embarrassed." He was apparently cursing himself; yet, his cocky smile never left his beak. The red stone engraved in his forehead begins to dim in color, cooling off after it had been recently fired.

You growl out, âWhat was that for? We're not infected! You nearly killed him!â You flash your fangs out as you tense your arms, expecting a fight. The Golduck simply crosses his arms against his chest, huffing out in a gloating manner.

âJeez, rub it in that I missed, why don'tcha? Youâre even grouchier than an infected Granbull, dog. I tell you what, just coming to a lake and not expecting any other ferals or dangers is pretty stupid if ya ask me.â The Golduck chuckled out. His arrogant attitude was about to tip you over your stress level as the smug duck continued, âAw man, are the both of you dudes? Damn, that really blows. I never get any hot chicks to trespass this pond. Not even girls in general. I'm so horny, I'd bang an ugly or feral gal just to get some pussy.â He called out in a disappointed tone, although he shrugs afterwards. âBut still, a mealâs a meal!â

That was the tip over. He ate âtrespassersâ on the lake for his own satisfaction, whether they were infected or not. You were going to take this bird down. Looking over, Jackal was too busy coughing out in agony from the burns he just sustained, and your leg would be a bit of a pesky problem to deal with, but...what other choices were there then besides fighting? There's no way you're going to bargain peace with this malicious runt.

The Golduck suddenly blasts forward in the water, jetting across the aquatic surface in high speeds as vapor splashes violently behind him. You aren't ready to risk your injured leg yet, so dodging was out of the question. You power energy together, combining aura energy into a burning blue globe of vigor. Before the Golduck could reach his clawed grasp around you, you launch the bright sphere andâ¦!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: One Cocky Golduck

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
The Golduck gasps from seeing a large globe of blue fire cannon at him, which he jumps quickly out of its burning path to crash into the shallows of the waters next to you. The blue duck shakes his head of the dizziness as you stand above him, dominantly. His eyes shrink back as he holds his hands up in defense. “Hey, hey, hey now! Let’s not try anything th-GAHCK!!!” You silenced his plea when you stomped a hind paw against his chest.

He coughed out dryly, breathing in difficulty as he continued to beg; “Now I know we started off on the wrong foot, but I-AAACK!” You ironically stomped again. “Stop *cough* doing that and let me explain…! *cough*” He exclaimed out while wheezing. Gulping fearfully, he held up his hands again, “How about I pay you back in the troubles I given you. Whatta’ ya say?” He suggests while whimpering a bit. His smile was the fakest smile you ever saw.

Using your uninjured leg, you powerfully kick the Golduck out of the pond and into a tree. Crashing into the trunk of it with wood breaking behind his back, he manages to squeeze out another yell in his quacking like voice. Jackal gets, irritated as usual and disoriented. “Ugh…what was that laser?” He groggily said until yelping a bit from his injuries.

“Let this Golduck explain it to you.” You answered him in agitation. The Golduck popped out of the wooden debris, raising his fist fiercely into the air as he yelled, “I have a name you know ACK!” You had kicked a small stone on the ground the hit his forehead, cutting his sentence short. “Mangy mutt! You’ll pay for that!” He began to press his fingers around his encrusted red jewel as it began to glow brightly, attempting to shoot a laser from it. It suddenly shoots a spark, only making about a centimeters distance before disappearing.

The Golduck stared out blankly, leaving a strange awkward silence between all of you. “What happened to my jewel!!!” He exclaimed, holding his head as fake tears rolled out of his eyes. “What kind of witchery is this? What have you done? I’ll be a mockery, a joke to all Golducks!” He screamed while overreacting. He thrashed his head while running in small circles. It seems the stone you kicked at him hit the red stone, breaking it by accident. His words began to come out of his mouth rapidly, “Why did it have to be me, of all Golducks to be burdened with the shame of a broken jewel? Oh the embarrassment I’ll have to sustain over the long years of my life with such knowledge! It all started when I was just hungry! But wait. Maybe it’ll grow back! Maybe it’ll grow to an extensive size, larger and grander than any other! My head shall burst the finest lights, beaming down anyone who stands in my way. Grah! I feel invincible! GAAAHHCK!” Your paw slammed down against his skull, ending his rant.

This guy was really annoying, and yet, unrealistic. He just tried killing you and changed his mood all because of a stupid stone. You got to at least get a good look of the Golduck though. He was only shorter than you by a couple of inches, but he did seem to have a good set of years on him. He wasn’t worth standing around and beating up. It was time to leave.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: How Embarrassing!

choices: An infected attacks you on your way!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
“Why should I tell you? ACK! Ow, ow, ow! Quit doing that!” The Golduck quacked out a bit of pain as you jabbed another hind paw into him again. Jackal had earlier tied him up with vines he found around the forest, binding him with his arms pinned to a tree trunk and you had been interrogating the Golduck for some answers. He of course just insulted you and continued to rant.

“Let’s make this a bit easier for all of us. My name is Lace…” You said to the arrogant duck as you pointed to Jackal, wanting him to introduce himself. “Jackal.” He huffed out annoyingly. He was still irritated about getting shot at by the Golduck.

The Golduck growled out a bit. “Gold. It’s a pleasure to meet you.” Jackal raised the brow above his eyes curiously.

“Gold the Golduck? Your parents weren’t very clever were they?” Jackal mockingly asked, getting some appreciation out of it. The Golduck snapped back while flailing madly in his tied position.

“No! I named myself! I’ve never had parents raise me! To Hell with them!” The Golduck barked out. He didn’t seem sad about never having parents around in his childhood, which was quite amazing that he survived on his own in isolation. "I’ve lived in this lake for years, and kept my territory from other trespassing roamers such as the likes of you! You’ll rue this day, Face, or whatever your name was!” He continued his rant, beating the back of his head against the tree.

“Calm down. We just want to know about the swamp up ahead. We’re searching for any clues on how to stop the current infection going around, and we heard there’s a Toxicroak that could help which lives there. Can you verify that?” You tried to kindly ask through your impatience. The Golduck stopped his constant struggles and grumbles.

“Yeah I know a Toxicroak that lives there. He’s someone I met a few months ago; A complete weirdo. He’s a damn homosexual that tried flirting with me while I was minding my own business, doing my business!” Jackal almost laughed out loud but kept his struggling chuckles by placing a hand over his mouth. “I haven’t heard from him since, but I plan on keeping it that way! Has this world gone mad?! Do females not exist anymore?”

“Thanks for the information, Gold. We’ll be off now.” You got up while taking your bag, passing a Lum berry to Jackal for his wounds as you began to walk away. Gold yelped out in shock.

“Hey. Wait! You can’t just leave me tied to this tree!” He begged to you, watching disappear into the tree patch.

“Sure we can.” Jackal yelled over with a smile as the two of walked away.

“You bastards! What if an infected comes by looking for something to eat? What if a woman comes by and I can’t even appeal to her? You’ll regret that you ever crossed Gold the Golduck, Taste! Or whatever your stupid freakin' name was!"
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Gold the Golduck

choices: Your fangs cause the Yanmega to let go in pain!
Not even your sharp teeth can pierce through...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
You felt a sudden chill stab freezing needles to pick at your spinal cord when you saw the entrance of the swamp. It was getting late in the day, and it added an ominous tone to the already dark forested marshland. You could listen to the strange constant noises of the swamp, echoing around the entire biome that just plainly creeped you out. Jackal nudged you with his arm while walking forward, “Let’s not keep that Toxicroak waiting.”

The both of you entered the marshy bog, as you held the strand for your bag tightly as you could hear movements in the swamp. It always felt like you were being watched as you and the Typhlosion treaded through murky waters, walked over muddy lands, and ventured through moss and misty vegetation. Yet, no purple glimmers could be seen.

The Charizard chief from Redeemer’s Grotto had told you that he probably lived in the center of the swamp, which wasn’t much of help, but at least it gave you somewhere to look. Problem was, you didn’t know how large the swamp was! The marshland never seemed to end as you continued to plow through the dense slough. Suddenly, something did give you an alert reaction. You heard a branch break somewhere far off. You stopped, perking your ears up and attempted to locate the source.

Jackal turned around, “Don’t tell me. Your sensitive big ears picked something up.” He dropped his bag while placing both of his hands to his sides. Suddenly, two arms wrapped around his, pinning his arms by his shoulders. He gasped and quickly panicked in whatever was attacking him. “Jackal!” You call to the Typhlosion, ready to help him in his aid. A female Leafeon was right behind him, holding his arms up high as she flickered a tongue, brushing against his face. Her purple lavender eyes pierced through one’s sight like a spear, as her body could do the same with her impressive bust size and tempting waistline. She certainly sported a heavenly hourglass figure.

Beautiful looks or not, she had to be stopped. You pounced out to Jackal, going to free him in her somehow powerful grasp until you felt strange hard limbs surround you. The sturdy shelled limbs held you pressed against something on your back, and you heard loud buzzing from behind. Looking up, you were caught in the clutches of a Yanmega’s legs! You growled with rage, not accepting that you came this far just to be eaten by a bug.

You struggled inside the grasp of the giant dragonfly, as its head above your own begins to drool, dripping long slimy strands against your face. Seeing that the Leafeon pushed Jackal face first to the ground, she lowered her crotch above him, ready to unbirth her prey! In retaliation, you bite down on one of the Yanmega’s legs that pin you to its underside, hoping that it might be able to do something.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: The Swamp

choices: Calm, golden, and ready to battle...
Hungry, violet, and ready to devour...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
With time running out, you curl your upper lip, sinking your fangs into the appendage. A screeching plea of misery blasted out of the Yanmega's voice. Fumbling, the legs eagerly drop you to scatter through air desperately. The massive dragonfly whirled in frantic circles and loops, pivoting to the wound in an upper leg. You collapse to your knees to welcome air back into your weary lungs. The infected Yanmega quickly disappeared into the shadowed depths of the swamp.

Crucial for you to recover, you briskly hop back up to begin running to Jackal who was in definite need of your rescue. His head was jammed between the vaginal lips of the Leafeon, squeezing his shoulders up with his body to clobber around under the grass type for freedom. Your paws beat against the slick marsh floor, splashing in bursts of mud droplets audibly. But there were other footsteps you heard, except softer and much slower than your own. Your vision is tilted to your side to see an anthro purple/orange frog, emerging out of the marshland waters.

Croaks rumbling out from the orange throat sac that hung down from his chin echoed into your canine ears. The eyes of the Toxicroak were...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Released!

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Yellow light reflected at the outside color of the frog's eyes, which was easily compatible to its calm expression. Although, they widened with interest after seeing you and a half way unbirthed Typhlosion out in the open marshes. Looking around the wet floor, it simply picked up a handful of slick dirt, tossed it into the air before catching it again and blasting it forward in an excellent swift pitch.

The sludge bomb collided into the Leafeon's face, knocking her back to stagger at the ground until inevitably tumbling downward. Hitting the mud rump first, Jackal easily took the opportunity to squeeze his head back out her with a loud POP! A clear strand of pre leakage from her sex organ stretched across as the Typhlosion growled with rage. No longer would Jackal be humiliated by the infected Leafeon!

You stopped dead in your tracks because you had to watch his revenge unfold. The girl wiped off all the dirt from her face, only to look up at the open maw of Jackal's mouth. You unrelented interest peaked during the spectacle of the anthro Eevee-morph submerging into the fire type's throat, taking note of the wild thrashing her legs gave off seemed like an awkward dance movement. The shaking brown foot paws vanished in Jackal's jaws, bulging from his neck to the pit of his belly which he so happily rubbed after a satisfied belch.

Hands clapped slowly in the performance out of the background, taking your attention back to the Toxicroak. This time, you could pay more attention to the detail of its stature. Judging from his build, and bandaged crotch area, he was a male Pokemon with a bit of a tall physique. The frog's hind legs balanced his tall body as the sound of his croaking emitted out the orange sac attached to his chin. He could probably stand just a few inches higher than you even compared to your mid-tall height, especially with the crest on his head. Orange claws shined out brightly, showcasing their sharpness with poison tips on the purple hands. The Toxicroak began chuckling while stopping his slow clapping motions.

"My, oh my! I don't often get to have visitors visit this swamp. Heh, they usually end up inside a stomach before meeting me!" The frog croaked out with amusement. Jackal tensed his eyes with a short grunt. He clearly didn't like the Toxicroak already.

"You wouldn't happen to have any knowledge about the infection would you?" You kindly asked the amphibian however, continuing your guard. No one could be trusted in your time, especially those who aren't infected but live secluded in isolation. Those anthros tend to be more vicious and hungry.

The Toxicroak placed his hands together on each hip by his wrists before answering, "Hm. Wasn't expecting that kind of a question. I'm guessing that you're not travelling through this swamp for just simple sight seeing."

Jackal irritatingly flashed his fangs out to intimidate the frog, losing patience from every word the Toxicroak spoke. "No, we clearly aren't, so answer the question." He snarled through his teeth. You glared a quick look at him, signalling him to calm down and avoid a fight. Although, when you looked back at the Toxicroak, he was suddenly standing directly in front of you while staring down at your legs! You wondered how he got close to you so fast and so silently.

The frog bent down, investigating your hind limbs. "Might I ask what happened to your poor leg? It's been scraped at the sides and bruises near the bones." He pressed a thumb against his tongue, wetting it, and rubbed the slick finger over a small wound under your fur as he held your leg in place firmly with his other hand. He slid the thin layer of saliva to wipe of a small stain of dried blood off your coat oddly enough. You felt a bit of awkwardness during the predicament, so you looked to Jackal who raised a brow at the Toxicroak's odd sense of care. He seemed to not want to attack you, therefore he must be friendly.

The Toxicroak stood back up, displaying a cheerful smile, continuing, "Judging from your injury," He looked over to Jackal's struggling belly, "...and your newly acquainted girlfriend, we can talk safely in the comfort of my tent. It's secluded and definitely not too far off from here. I would love and appreciate your company....um...your names?"

"I'm called Lace, and this is my friend, Jackal." You raised a hand to shake, but the Toxicroak suddenly wrapped his arms around your back, embracing a violent loving hug.

"Ah! So you're the Lucario I've heard so much about! Please, please, I must take you to my humble abode!" The Toxicroak encouraged until finally releasing you.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: A Friendly Welcome

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Following the odd Toxicroak, you thought it would be best to travel farther behind him. Who knows what kind of trick this pokemon could’ve been up to? You didn't know him yet he seemed to recognize you as 'the Lucario' from somewhere. Although, he had plenty of opportunities to harm you or even…eat you, but you assumed that it was best to just keep a safe distance.

Both you and Jackal steadily walked behind the Toxicroak as he earlier mentioned that he wanted to talk in his tent about the present infection. Jackal’s belly bounced with each step that he made from the infected Leafeon girl. Dead leaves would crumble under the stuffed fire type with every step that the sound would never endingly stop cackling around in your large canine ears.

The Toxicroak looked back with a sly sarcastic expression. “You can walk faster and closer you know. I don’t bite.” The strange charismatic smile shined brightly, but his eyes seemed devious when he mentioned bite. He chuckled like a child softly to himself after the joke and continued staring forward in the direction all of you were headed in. It wasn't long until you came into a small clearing of the swamp, with a highlighted large tent radiating out an orange glow in its center.

The Toxicroak motioned you to come with his waving hand as he entered his home, disappearing behind the cloth entrance door. Jackal gave you a doubtful agitated glare, as if to say, "You go in first." A sigh withdrew from your lungs and you braced yourself when entering the Toxicroak's home.

"Please, Lace, have a seat. I can't wait to talk to you about your little 'research adventure' I've been hearing about." The frog said calmly. He was sitting down on his crisscrossed legs above a plushy cushion. There were a few more cushions scattered around the tent room with a blazing small campfire in the middle in which the seats had circled around. You took the farthest seat from across the fire, as Jackal finally walked into the tent upon resting a much larger cushion, displaying his gut to hang outward.

The Toxicroak cleared his throat, pressing his hand to his chest. “My name is Hex. I live here with my sister Lilly to survive from the outside infected terrors. You’re probably wondering how I came to know you.” He raised a brow eagerly as he leaned forward, pointing his gaze directly to you. You nodded without saying a word. Hex seemed to be excited to answer.

“A messenger from Redeemer’s Grotto told me that you were coming immediately after you had left. He said that you had begun a ‘search for a cure’ on the infection and that you were travelling across this massive island just to find it. I even heard about the small battle in that village you got mixed into, plus, that you even took down a large Fearow, if I’m correct.” He answered while taking a stick and readjusting the logs in the fire to burn brighter. His focus was finally off of you and back to the campfire.

“How did someone beat us here if they left after us? We never saw anyone from Redeemer’s Grotto on the trip here.” You asked worriedly. Hex chuckled again in reply.

“Grotto runners are meant to be faster than normal pokemon. The village chief appoints the fastest pokemon for the positions, and the one that came here was a Hitmonlee runner. Cute fellow…” Hex took his attention away after a glimmering gaze in the air. He snapped back into reality awkwardly, sighing, “Anyways, back on track, he told me that you were requesting on my take on the infection.”

You were excited to hear some actual news about, and the Toxicroak seemed to look like he knew what he was talking about. “What do you know about it?” You tried your best not to yell it out happily.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Hex the Toxicroak

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Hex relaxed back into his cushion, losing his happy sophisticated charm and gaining a remorseful tone. “Through the research and data gathering I’ve conducted over the past year, I’ve realized very little about the infection.” Jackal sat up quickly, furious.

“What?! You don’t know anything?” The Typhlosion flared the fire at the back of his neck, gritting his sharp teeth together. Hex only lifted a hand to stop him from talking. “It’s very rude to interrupt. I never said that I was finished.” Jackal grumbled as he sat back down on his cushion, angry as usual.

“Infections and diseases usually have symptoms such as specific sicknesses like, coughing, weakness, corrupt blood flow, wounds, rashes, blindness, and even problems with internal body parts, not making them go wild and madly hungry. However, this strange disease around only changes one physical trait in pokemon’s bodies…” He pointed two fingers at his face. “Their eyes…So this little factor really confused me on what I was dealing with, but then I took my theory to the next level I had interesting results. What if the infection doesn’t affect our bodies, but our minds?”

The Toxicroak leaned in closer to you, speaking a bit softer and more serious. “What we’re dealing with here, Lace, is a psychological type of epidemic.” Jackal flashed a curious look from the unusual theory.

“And…by psychological epidemic, you’re saying that this infection is being caused by…” He trailed off, but you immediately finished his sentence.

“A psychic pokemon.” You answered. Hex slowly nodded, revealing the true intentions of the infection. “But why? Why would someone try to control pokemon to kill others in such an…uncommon strange way?”

“I’m not sure about that either, but I can tell you that I have a deep interest in finding out.” The Toxicroak replied. He took the stick to move the burning logs and placed into a pot as he rose up, collecting a bag.

You were unsure on how to take the situation. This entire catastrophe was all based on a single psychic pokemon, or possibly more. You suddenly felt a familiar nudge. Hex had dipped his thumb into his tongue again, and began to rub around the wound on your leg softly once more. You cringed a bit at the quick sting. “Can I ask, er, what you’re doing?”

“Your leg is damaged and you’re not going anywhere until I can at least fix it.” The Toxicroak pleaded smoothly. He opened the bag he had picked up and held out a roll of bandages. He wrapped the end of all across your bruised area, stretching it tightly to your hind limb before biting the other end to cut it off. “I need to go get some berries for your leg, but before I go…” He randomly stood up and opened another cloth door, beckoning for you to come inside.

Standing back up, but feeling a sharp tug at your leg, you walked over into the other room to see a Croagunk girl, who could’ve been about a little more than half your size was laying down on her side, breathing slowly and softly. The room was kept dark, and empty plates surrounded her. She was lying against a bed of pillows, resting under a brown blanket cloth. You felt Hex’s hand press on your shoulder.

“Lilly, we have guests…” He spoke aloud, softly. The Croagunk girl slowly blinked an eye open, yawning soon afterwards and ending it with a wheeze of some sorts.

“Who is it?” She asked a bit weakly. Hex stepped forward, leaning down in front of her.

“Lace, meet my younger sister, Lilly.” He turned back to his sibling. “These are travelers who are creating a cure for the infection.” Hex placed a hand on her head, rubbing it carefully.

“Hi…” She shyly replied before yawning again. She steadily fell back asleep. Her Toxicroak brother sighed before rising back up and returning by your side. He stared at her until breaking the silence. “She’s going to become an infected soon. She had recently been attacked by one.” He sadly whispered. This shocked you a bit, while your eyes stared awe-strucken at the Toxicroak.

“Lace, do you know how people are infected by the ferals?” Hex questioned, already knowing the answer. You shook your head, expecting it to be from bites or something. Hex looked away from you, looking down at his sister, Lilly. His voice was almost without sound that your ears had a difficult time to hear it, but the message was easily clear. He had said:

“They’re raped.”
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: What the Infection Truly Is!

choices: You awake to a strange sound!
You awake to someone walking into the tent!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Hex rubbed the back of his head as all of you returned into the separate tent room. He continued explaining, “Whatever or whoever is controlling these ferals has to have some kind of contact or, connection, to overpower their mind to do so. My inference is that it’s through most of the liquids inside infected. Ingesting or absorbing any of their blood, venom, milk, and even…sperm, can also cause you to turn into them.” He sighed aloud again, looking down at the blanketed flooring. “For example, the seed injected into my sister. Sex can cause infection.”

Jackal felt some heavy in his throat, and he couldn’t seem to swallow the pressure down from hearing the news. You walk back to your seat, accidentally wincing from the small sting in your leg as your rump pressed against the pillow. Hex noticed. “You’re clearly not going anywhere anytime soon, so I suggest that you rest here while I gather herbs in the marshes for your leg.”

Your ears rang up with interest, spotting how the Toxicroak stood back up, stretched his impressively flexible back and waved his hand to Jackal to follow. Hex noted, “You’re coming along just in case I meet a few more monstrosities. According to your stomach, you can handle that.” The Toxicroak placed a hand on Jackal's soft yet large gut, giving it a good squeeze to force the Typhlosion to grunt. He pointed his vision towards Hex, giving him the, "Hands off." glare. Hex chuckled as Jackal looked down at his belly, still digesting a Leafeon within the deep flab of fat. Struggling a bit, the Typhlosion was able to rise back and exit the front cloth door. Hex stopped before leaving. “Your friend seems to have a few anger problems…” The Toxicroak stared back out the opening of the tent, inspecting Jackal who still had his back turned. “However, he seems nice and helpful.” He trailed off again as he cocked his head to the side some. “And he is cute in a way. Well, ta-ta for now!” He was gone in a flash, leaving you to sit quietly to sleep in the small blaze of fire inside the tent.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: More Explaining

choices: She bites down on your head!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
You awoke to a crash! Freezing to a tall sharp position, your ears flipped up with the hairs shivering from surprise. Blurry, your vision slowly faded back into clarity, absorbing your surroundings. You arose from a heap of cushions to find Lilly, collapsed on the floor in front of you! Her face was buried into pillows, but her back would recess and encase air, so at least she was breathing. Getting up fully, you kneel down to her, placing a paw on her shoulder. She felt warm, however, weak.

âLilly? Are you alrightâ¦?â You asked the Croagunk girl. A cough seemed to have been her response. Pushing against the side of the shoulder, you flip her to face right side up again only to have teeth sink into your arm. With a quick howl, you thrash your bitten arm, attempting to throw Hexâs sister back off. Finally, her flat teeth gave away, releasing her jaws from your limb. You grip to the wound fiercely, looking directly at your mad opponent.

Lillyâs eyes were blank and purple. She had become fully infected now! You watch in horror as a small drop of blood sink down from the edges of her teeth, and a long drooling tongue happily laps it off in a clean sweep. You would feel awful to hurt Hexâs sibling, but what else could be done other than to fight? If you ran, you would probably end up as main course for some other infected feral anyways. Lilly pounced again, hopping toward you to achieve another bite!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Lilly's Inner Demon

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Familiar teeth bit down against your legs, pinching down on your bandaged wound! You yelp again, falling on your back against the floor to begin twitching and fidgeting your leg. The Croagunkâ€™s teeth forced themselves harder on the scratch, forcing more barks of pain to howl out. You were finally able to pull her mouth off, freeing your leg of her jaws. A stream of saliva was attached from Lillyâ€™s mouth to your leg which was quickly licked away by her long frog tongue.

Bending your leg towards yourself, you gripped the bandage tightly, hugging out the pain striking your engraved teeth marks. Suddenly, when opening a tightly squinted eye, a wide rump hovers above you. Opening your mouth to protest, it is quickly pressed between her purple cheeks, giving you a mouthful of her crack! She squatted down, sitting on your open maw while rubbing her groin on your jaw. Her anus squeezed against your tongue, letting you taste the stale rim of the dark purple hole. Placing your hands at her sides, you push her away, gagging from the flavor of her rump.

However, she sits back down forcefully, encasing your entire head with her anus this time! Coughing, you flex your shoulders to stop proceeding inward any further, but the Croagunk demanded an anal meal, as she stomps a foot against your hurt leg, causing a loud whimpered howl to escape your lips. Your shoulders loosen from pain, and are quickly sucked inside, followed by your arms and chest. Your legs twitch, fearful of kicking too hard may cause them anymore pain.

The infected Lilly was victorious; able to successfully trap your fate as her whole unwilling meal. Your furry face is squished at the constricting anal walls to seemingly taunt you as you squeeze into a hot demise. Your waist is sucked within the ever stretching butthole, absorbing the tail and eventually, your legs. Your head suddenly feels an opening release in front of you, giving you a hint of where you were now. Your foot paws cringed in fear, as the anus rim shrinks back over them, sealing your inevitable fate.

----|----


Lilly, no longer conscious of herself, tilts her rump upward, letting the foolish Lucario paws to twitch for the last time before entering her lower intestines. She flipped back into a pile of pillows, letting her purple amphibian belly to sag outward, bouncing some from the struggles of her curled up prey. Rubbing it with her hands, she was able to lull its endeavors to finally faint into weakness, achieving her well earned prize. Having a small problem with getting up from her smaller size, the infected Croagunk girl chuckled witchly, walking out of the tent and into the marshes.

Hex returned later with Jackal, to come home to a strange mess in the tent. For some reason, Lace was gone, and, so was Lilly.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: The Croagunk's Interesting Form of Punishment

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Your world quickly turns dark when Lilly had leaped towards you. You felt sudden force to fall back as a strange push pressed at your head. Crashing down, the Croagunk girl descends down with you, eventually to release your head by accident from the sudden fall. Together down, you growl ferociously, sending an arm covered in aura to strike her chest, blasting Lilly out at the tent wall, tearing a hole to the outside during her launch. The frog collapses against a bare marsh tree out of the tent, cracking somewhat from the force.

To the best of your ability, you hop back up onto your legs once more to stare back out through the open hole. Hex’s infected sister sat right up, shaking and holding her head until finally snapping out of the daze. You grit your fangs together, hoping she would just stop attempting to devour you. Regaining her sense, the infected girl hissed through her teeth, quickly scattering away until hopping into a forest of bushes to disappear.

You sigh, falling down onto a cushion now that it was all over. Wiping off the saliva from your head, you ponder on how you would explain to Hex that his sister suddenly turned and ran away. You rub your hands together on your face, agitated and tired, wondering what you should do…

----|----


Hex rubbed his face with his hands in single slow strides. His eyes focused against the empty tent room, with an empty bed resting in its center. His breath was silent and his face was a ghostly pale color, resembling cold stone. Jackal twiddled his fingers a bit, unsure of what to say. You had recently just given the harsh news to the Toxicroak about his sister’s fate in the most reasonable way you saw possible. No one spoke. Only the fast heartbeat of Hex’s chest could be heard, echoing within the desolate tent.

“It was never your fault Lace.” Hex suddenly choked out. Your head propped up from staring at the floor the entire time. The Toxicroak had turned to you, expressing a sense of compassion from his shining gaze. “I knew that it was only a matter of time until she…turned, however it was my fault I let you in charge of her. I’ve should’ve been here when it happened, so, I suppose I’m…”

“Don’t apologize.” You interrupted him, raising a paw up. “No one is at fault here except for whoever started this infected mess. Alright?” Your voice was serious, stern, and sympathetic. Losing a relative in such an awful way must’ve been absolutely tragic, thus, you didn’t know what Hex could possibly be feeling right now. He could mask his thoughts and expressions so easily, so you wondered what response he could have. You soon got your answer.

Hex had smiled. He smirked a smile the spread wide enough to each of his cheeks to stretch. The orange sac under his jaw began to croak once more, symbolizing content comfort. “Yes. Yes of course. How foolish of me to ever think that!” He looked away from you, closing the cloth opening to the room, ignoring it for the time being. He stuck his hands against his sides, standing with pride in front of both you and Jackal. “Complaining and worthless apologies will get us nowhere in the fight against this apocalypse, and it will certainly not help us bring my sister back!”

Hex padded over to a chest, rummaging through it to obviously find something. You were glad he at least got his confidence back. Jackal stood up, raising his brow. “Didn’t you say that you know someone who might know about psychics better than we do?” Your eyes unwillingly looked down at Jackal’s gut area, noticing at how most of the Leafeon he had eaten earlier was digested away, leaving only a bit of chub left.

Hex withdrew a paper rolled up in a scroll-like fashion, holding it up high for the both of you to see. “You have quite the memory. Yes I did mention someone, in fact, two people.” Hex walked to a close by end table, spreading the scroll across its surface to reveal a map of the entire island region you lived. He pointed a single purple finger in a specific spot.

“This splotch of tress here is the swamp of where we are. Now if we’re dealing with a sadistic psychic pokemon, I now just the people who can help us find out who it might be and how he’s doing it.” The Toxicroak’s finger slid along the paper, gliding over to a dense prairie area of the map. “There’s a Drowzee and a Hypno there that know exactly what’s what in psychic abilities that I met earlier, maybe a few weeks ago when I was exploring. Problem is, they tend to be a bit isolated and a little tricky to find, but I’m positive that we’ll stumble upon them soon enough.”

You paid a bit more attention to the spot of where Hex was pointing, and discovered a certain obstacle. “Wait a minute. To get to the prairie, we would have to go back the way we came across the lake.” You mentioned to Jackal. He gave a look that was confused on why that was a problem. “That means we have to go back to Golduck again, and I’m pretty sure he hasn’t forgiven us at our last encounter.” You added to your statement. Jackal grunted angrily in reply.

“We can easily take care of that duck, just like the last time. If he’s smart, he would ignore us as we pass right back.” The Typhlosion sneered back. Hex suddenly clapped his hands together excitingly at your conversation, bringing him to a full upward stance with light happily gleaming from his eyes. “You mean that cute little Golduck by the lake that pitches fits all of the time? I remember him quite well when I first moved to the swamp, and he had a pretty nasty bite with his aggravated words.” The Toxicroak’s voice sang out in joyful tune.

You remembered Gold’s words when giving up information about Hex. He mentioned how weird the frog could be, especially as a homosexual that flirted with Gold. You shivered a bit, wondering if Hex would try to flirt with you. The Toxicroak did in fact enjoy your company and also didn’t seem to mind rubbing your leg when bandaging it, even would occasionally lick his thumb to rub around your fur. But, he was just cleaning your fur from the blood…right? Well, it’s not like you had a problem with being flattered by it, however, you just hoped Hex wouldn’t pull some trick on you into having…eh…intercourse with him…

You violently shook the thought out of your head, finishing off your topic, “Well, since it’s morning, I think it would be better for us to leave now to cover the most ground. Traveling at night is dangerous for non-infected anthros. Jackal nodded his head to agree with you, but Hex simply sat down into a cushion. This out you in a little unease since Hex was the only to know where the Drowzee was. “Is something wrong, Hex?” you asked.

Hex sighed a bit, looking at the tent door to Lilly’s room. “Oh, I think I’ll stay here for a short time and do some things before I go…” His tone of sadness returned. Your ears lowered some, pitying his loss. In reply, you answered, “I understand. Take as long as you need, just remember to catch up with us later, alright?” He looked at you, slowly growing a grin again with his eyes glowing their golden shade again. “I certainly will, Lace.”

Hex returned to a stand, lifting the map to you. “You’re going to need this unless you want to get lost. I’m trusting that you’ll be able to keep it safe since it’s my only one and irreplaceable.” You kindly accepted the gift, placing it into your bag for safe keeping. Before you could look back up, you were forcefully embraced in a strong hug by Hex, feeling his chin placed on top of your forehead since your view was obscured by the range bubble on his neck. “I’m sorry I can’t leave with you now but I’ll be sure to find you once again, so we can find a cure for Lilly together!”

Jackal snickered at your awkward hug as Hex finally released you, until he placed his hands on both of your facial cheeks. “You’re a brave and stupid dog, you know that? I’m sure you can make a difference in this hell-hole of a world we live in; just try your best not to get om-nomed-nomed by those beasties, promise?”

You smiled back, “I promise.”
