He crashed into the ground to both your and Jackalâs surprise, investigating the plant tendrils to stretch down over to a Roserade, and for a bigger surprise, Hex and Gold were standing next to her!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Legendary Ass-Kicking

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
“What the Hell?” Herox growled through his sharp beak, struggling to see his attackers behind him. Again, bolts of lightning scattered out from his feathers, sending the energized matter through the vines to shock the Roserade violently. She cried a short yet harsh shrill from the hurtful voltage, but she managed to sustain her grip around the Zapdos’ legs.

Whoever she was, you were just glad she was willing to help out. Her strength seemed like she could take a few hits and barely wince. With Herox down, Hex rushed in with Gold towards the stable bird simultaneously, releasing their attacks as they passed the Zapdos’ sides. Gold splattered water over most of the avian’s body, dousing the electric feathers to shock themselves instead! The Toxicroak jabbed his poisonous knuckle claws into the bird’s side, raking down a long cut as he ran past Herox while spitting out multiple balls of venom over the Zapdos’ wet form. Herox growled from the counter-attacks, shocking the Roserade one last time to force her vines off.

She howled and retracted back the long tendrils to fall to the ground, twitching harmfully in quick spasms. Herox kicked Gold away, as his wing swatted Hex into the ground. He growled cruelly before threatening, “Hrrrregh…hrrrregh…You’re the other fools following this mutt? Fine, then you can die with this mutt!”

Watching the scene ensue, you pack together an array of aura into your palms, charging up a cannon to unleash at the Zapdos. There others were compliant enough to continue to battle, charging the Zapdos again through his storm of electricity. Gold fell to the ground, unable to control his body from the sheer shock as the Roserade toppled down with him. Jackal managed to release a flamethrower, breathing the flames over Herox to force him back a few steps, before Jackal himself passed out in the electricity. Hex shot out a few poison sting darts, jabbing up Herox’s legs all until a long orange beak came down atop the frog. Hex croaked in horror as he found himself the slimy jaws of the Zapdos. Herox gave out muffled laughs as he licked over the Toxicroak’s body, feeling the frog squirm and writhe in the squelching mouth muscles. The tall avian gave a deep swallow, gulping down Hex!

Just then, a thunder bolt attack came jolting towards Herox, bursting the ball of electricity into the legendary’s abdomen. Herox quickly sputtered from the sudden damage, coughing out Hex’s slicken body to hit the ground as the Herox tried to recuperate from the attack. He stared down at Star, finding the sparks jolting from her hands. Her legs muscles gave out, crumbling the Luxray to tumble down along with everyone else.

“Hreh ha ha ha ha ha! Oh my, I didn’t expect the whole lot of you to pack such a punch, but I’m afraid my title still stands as a god of thunderstorms. It’s going to take more than just electrified water, a little poison, and a few flames to take me down.” He chuckled out. He approached the fallen members, ready to consume his large dinner before he looked up.

There you were, with a glowing pact of obscene amounts of aura, ready to be released. Herox opened his beak, but you cared not for what he had to say. You roar out as an exploding beam of your energy jets towards the Zapdos, striking his chest to drag the colossal bird along the prairie flooring for an extensive stretching crater line. The cannon of aura even was able to shoot Herox straight through a large hill before the beam lost its contained line, exploding to send a gigantic bubble of smoke and blue flames to scatter. You tremble to your knees, watching the tower of smoke fume from behind the demolished hill. After a few loud breathing moments, your waiting finally ends as wings strike out from the burning rubble.

Herox screeched loudly, with patches of his feathers missing and bloody scraped along his chest. He heaved the death-like air, coughing out as he struggled to climb out of the debris. His bloody red glare stared into you again, filled with unimaginable rage as his wings fluttered for support. “…Hreeegh. Hreeegh. Hreeegh…Y-y-you mangy dog. I’ll g-get you for th-th-this…Just you wait…With the aid of m-my master, I will r-raise an entire army against you. Your death will be my entire existence in life, as well as my master’s, so b-be prepared for your last pr-prayers, Lace…”

He glared his deathly gaze over at your party, who seem to be adjusting back up again. The wounded Zapdos took flight, wavering over to you and your team once more. “But not before I steal some of your precious friends to use them against you later!” His talons opened up, ready to capture any of who tread close to them. You dive to the ground, feeling the incredible force of the wind pass by you. You look up to see Herox disappearing over the horizon’s edge, vanishing in the thick white clouds.

The battle was over. You look around to see if Herox actually did capture anyone, but to what you saw, no one seemed to be gone. Hex had Gold clutched in his arms as they lay in the grass, which must have meant he pushed the Golduck to the ground with him to save them both. You were surprised the duck wasn’t struggling to get out of another male’s grip. Jackal had Star underneath him, meaning the same situation likewise. The Roserade kneeled back up, shaking her head from the disorientation.

“Oh, sorry…” Jackal stuttered to say out loud. He suggestively positioned himself over the Luxray girl, pinning her to the ground as she blushed in response. He wobbles off her as she stands up quickly, frantically searching around.

“Where’s Bell?” She asked. Only you and Jackal looked around; the others had no clue who she was talking about. She asked again, except much more scared and loud, “Where’s Bell?!”

Little did she know that the Miltank was in Herox’s clutches, tightly wound in his feet as she struggled with weak force. Herox grinned at his prisoner’s squirms. He would find a good place to infect her, and find the right moment to use her…
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Legendary Ass-Kicking Part II

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
(Warning! The next few chapters are nothing but boring character dialogue!)

          Your teeth sink into the blue flesh, tearing it away from its source to chew the juicy substance in your jaws. The Oran berry's flavor seeps in, filling your tasteful hunger with great satisfaction. The flavor practically rejuvenates you, giving you the needed strength to continue your berry binge. You scarf down the fruit desperately as you rest along a rock, chomping down the Oran berry until someone sits next to you.

Hex plopped his rump to your side, stating, “Oh my, I didn’t know you loved Oran berries that much. If I had known that then I would’ve collected more for my strong little friend. May I sit next to you?”

You nodded and the Toxicroak fully relaxed back, having a berry in his own hand while you replied, “I’m completely drained of energy. That aura cannon burned up all the strength I got from that Pidgeot.”

“Pidgeot?” Hex asked before setting his berry down.

You waved your paw in a gesture, “Just another infected I was forced to eat. Jackal and I met quite the number of them on the way to the village. We were lucky enough to stumble onto Aldanwood where Bell and Star nourished us back onto our feet. How was your trip? You really did gather a resourceful amount of berries.”

“I’ve been meaning to talk to you about that.” You instantly felt the Toxicroak’s arms wrap around you, pulling you in for yet another Hex hug. This time however, he actually planted his lips onto yours! You grunt in surprise as Hex seemed to enjoy the moment a bit too well. He retracts his head, emding his kiss before he smiled brightly, “Sorry, but I’m thrilled to know you’re safe and sound. I’m simply keeping a promise to myself.”

“…No, that’s alright. To be fair, I’m really glad to see that you’re doing okay too.” You answer. You swallow the rest of your ration of food and ask Hex, “So, did Gold give you any trouble?” You knew the two were off at bad terms with each other.

Hex chuckled as he continued to eat, “Oh, actually, he’s been quite the traveling partner. I presume that we have found a common ground, and Gold actually has a…tender side to him.” That really surprised you. You wondered if you would ever get Gold to like you.

Just then, the short Roserade approached you. She raised a bouquet arm to you, welcoming, “You must be Lace. Hex has told me a little about you.”

You raise a forepaw, unsure how the shake would play out until her vines suddenly protrude out from the flowers, softly wrapping around your hand for a brief tug. “Um, has he now?” You ask.

She gives off a slight bow. “My name is Eden. I led Hex and Gold so they could safely leave the forest, although there was a run-in on an infected, but nothing we couldn’t handle.”

“Happy to hear it.” You gratefully respond. However, Eden suddenly leans in closer.

“I meant to ask you, Lace. You wouldn’t mind if I tagged along, would you? I’d prefer stick with a group then try to fend for myself in an infected-filled forest.”

Hex smiled brightly, like a child and this meant he could have a friend come over to his house to play. The Toxicroak urged you, “That would be delightful! Lace, Eden’s abilities would greatly aid our long task, and the more pokemon we get to go onboard with this, the better.” He clasped his hands over yours, tightening over them desperately. You were a little discomforted by the sudden panic, but you had little reason to deny Eden or why you even had to make that decision. It was Eden's choice, yet everyone made it seem like you were in charge.

“Of course she can…” You said. Hex cheered and wrapped an arm around your back with his other over Eden’s, pulling the two of you in for a group squeeze. The Roserade awkwardly smirked and you winked at her, as if to say, this happens a lot so get used to it. Hex undid his arm bind before he sat up from the rock. “Now if you’ll excuse me, I have a Typhlosion to kiss for a safe return and a Luxray to meet.”

Before he could leave, you call out, “Be careful around her Hex. She’s been through a lot.” He nodded and ventured over to the other circle of party members, as they had been gathered around a campfire that Jackal had prepared.

Eden stole Hex’s spot on the rock to look at you, “So, do you really think you’ll be able to stop this infection? I mean, everyone wants to, it’s just that, it seems like it’s impossible, you know?”

You watched the others laugh and converse over the fire, finding comfort that they're living in stability. You smile and answer, “Yeah, I think we can.”
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Reunion Aftermath

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Jackal’s muffled voice screamed in the ambiance of Hex’s mouth, as the Toxicroak continued to envelop his lips over the Typhlosion. Jackal struggled to push the snuggling frog away without hurting him. His mouth finally disconnected with Hex’s, allowing the Typhlosion to cough out any saliva that may have mixed between the two.

“…Erugh…C’mon Hex! What was that for?” Jackal yelled, scooting back some from the frog’s presence. He, Gold, and Star circled around a pile of burning debris Jackal had set up, all until Hex randomly embraced the fire-type. Gold snickered whereas Star said nothing. In fact, she was off in her own world as she sat along the grass, looking away from everyone. Her legs curled up against her chest with her arms crossed over to hold herself in place. She stared off into the sky’s edge as her head leaned against her knees.

Hex gave off his signature smirk as he sat incredibly close to the distraught Typhlosion. He answered in a coy tone, “I’m simply showing my gratitude for your return and for Lace’s protection. I can’t tell you how happy I am to see the two of you in one piece.”

Jackal grumbled, “A simple ‘nice to see you’ would’ve sufficed.” Jackal gasped as an amphibious purple finger probed at his abdomen.

“Jackal, is that a little pudge I feel? Are you going to let yourself go and become one of those adorable chubby types?” Hex began to suggest.

Jackal let his face envelop into a florescent red, arguing back, “Wha…No! It’s just left over from an infected yesterday evening!”

“If that’s the case, then why are you still eating berries? Shouldn’t you be full?” Hex pointed at the Cheri berries Jackal had clasped in his hands. Jackal winced at the comment, looking at the handful of fruit. He grumbled as he poured them back into Hex’s bag.

Hex’s smile quickly degraded into a depressing scowl. He tried to give back the berries, apologizing, “Oh, Jackal, please don’t put them back! I was only kidding. Sigh…I’m sorry. I went too far on that one, but please do take them back. If you’re hungry then you need to eat.” The Toxicroak regretted his statements as Jackal stared into his sincere golden eyes.

He rolled his own in return and grabbed only a few of the berries back. Hex smiled as he got back up. Only after taking a few steps, he plopped down next to Star, who at this point continued her silent isolation. Hex sighed once more and placed his hand on her shoulder. She shrugged it quickly off. It was obvious she still mourned her loss and will never bother to talk, but Hex was positive for her to hear him out.

“You know, I may still be wriggling around in a Zapdos’ belly right now if it weren’t for you. That thunderbolt really packed a punch, and at the right moment.” He mentioned. She barely moved as a response. “I don’t think I’ve introduced myself. My name is Hex, and that brat over there is Gold.” He pointed at the Golduck that replied with a flirtatious grin at Star. “What’s your name?” Hex was kind enough to offer.

She mumbled after a few long moments.

Although, Hex continued to smile, “…I didn’t quite catch that. Did you say Rawr? I mean, I know you’re a cat and everything but I would have guessed that your parents would have been a little more creative than that.” And there it was, what Hex was attempting so hard to achieve. Through the darkness that Star had tucked her head into was a faint smile, endeavoring to hold itself back. The Toxicroak continued his joke, prepared to see her finally come out from her symbolic hole. “I mean, thank goodness I wasn’t named after what natural born noises I make. What child should be cursed into being named Croak? It has a different meaning to the name if you know what I’m talking about. However, Gold I think your name should’ve been Quack though. Its separate meanings fit you perfectly.”

“Hey!” Gold hissed in response. Jackal chuckled in return when all of a sudden; a female voice snickered with them. The three glance over to the Luxray, watching her shoulders tremble as her voice rippled through her legs.

Her faint smile showcased itself to everyone once she lifted her head. She looked at Hex with her eye, repeating, “…I said my name is Star.” Her voice softly carried out in just above a whisper’s octave.

“Well, that’s more like it. You certainly saved my skin with the legendary, and I must simply show my gratitude.” He got down to his knees, staring up at Star before asking, “What’s your favorite kind of berry. Just name it.”

Star focused on the frog, using her soft voice again, “…I like Nanab berries.”

“Nanab berries it is.” The Toxicroak sung. He pillaged his bag and plucked out a few of the orange and yellow fruits, taking the long segments over to the Luxray. After handing them over, she started to nibble them down slowly as Hex placed his hand against her back. She didn’t force it away this time. As the cat munched down her snack, Hex tried to comfort her feelings. “I lost my sister a few days ago when she became infected. I luckily stopped the feral that was…doing things to her, but I was too late when it had started its, orgasm. A single drop of that infernal seed was still able to corrupt her and steal her away from me. And for awhile, I was so infuriated, not at the infected, but with myself for not having been able to come to her rescue sooner. I had trouble in dealing with her loss, not knowing what chaos she would ensue or what her fate would ever be. However, the only way I could distract myself from her was knowing that I could still save her. If we succeed into stopping this psychic soon, then I can finally reunite with my sister. That's what drives me. I'm sure you'll find your drive soon enough for your friend.”

Star swallowed the bit of fruit in her mouth, answering in a fearful sound, “But I don’t know if she was turned into an infected. That damn Zapdos could’ve eaten her already and….then…”

Hex tensed his hand, caressing his fingers along her spinal fur, “Then the only thing you can do is either let yourself fall down into depression as you await the day the infected find you, or hope that your friend is safe and find a cure.”

Star nudged closer to Hex, refusing to eat the remainder of her food. “…It isn’t f-fair…”

The Toxicroak patted her back as he nuzzled with her. “I know.”

In the mean time, Gold scooted closer to Jackal to whisper in an envious tone, “How do gay men always woo the girls better than straight men?”

“Beats me.” He replied before chomping down on some fruit. He looked over to you who was sitting with Eden, talking together about something he couldn’t hear. “Beats me.”
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: More Aftermath

choices: Off to see the mind-raping Drowzee again...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
“Hey Lace!” Jackal’s voice hollered out to you, “C’mon over here for a second!” His order definitely grabs your attention, letting your conversation with Eden end as you hop off the rock to head towards the relaxing Typhlosion. After arriving at the camp set, Jackal pats his hand to his side, beckoning you to sit beside him. You plop down as he leisurely lazes down to prop his torso up by his arms. “I’m a little famished from the Zapdos battle today and I’m having trouble with eating these berries…” He gives a single wink, gesturing of what he was implying.

Forced into doing what he says, you take a Cheri berry into your palm, raising it over his mouth to feed the Typhlosion. His hand suddenly grabs your wrist powerfully, squeezing as he threatens, “Slowly.” You sigh as you lower the red fruit softly into his mouth. His front teeth bite down to chip it off the vine tip and chews the berry with joyful delicacy. Gold raises a brow, including Hex as the two stared at you. What on earth had happened in the plains yesterday for you to randomly do this? That’s your best guess in what they were thinking. Star remained having her head nestled against the Toxicroak’s chest, struggling to stay awake as Hex’s warmth was to calming.

Jackal murred after you plopped another berry into his mouth, letting Hex have his moment, “I would’ve figured Lace being the dominant one in the relationship. What changed between the two of last night? Did you finally sleep together and find out that Jackal actually takes top?”

With your hand inches away from Jackal’s face, you could feel the hot temperatures expelling from it. His face had turned red again, except the brightest that you had ever seen it from the beginning of your trip. His voice growled in an evil sound, “I’m going to be generous enough to not kill for saying that. But mark my words, toad, I have ways of revenge if you make such a snide comment again. I’m not sleeping with Lace, I’m not his boyfriend, and I’m not gay. Got it?”

Hex waved his hand. “Yep, your aggressiveness shows you’re the dominant one.” The Typhlosion’s mane ignited. Out of nowhere, he puffed out a large cloud of smoke, enveloping Hex’s face. He gagged out while releasing Star to fall against the ground. He coughed and struggled for clean air, chuckling out, “Okay, I deserved that too.” Star crossed her arms over her legs again, returning to her sulking state.

“Jackal, watch yourself.” You warned him. Jackal grunted and laid back down, doing his best to hold back his temper. “Now before we kill ourselves, we need to know our next tactic. Star asked if we could show her to Redeemer’s Grotto in return for helping me and Jackal.” You looked over to the mourning cat. “…Do you still want that?” She paused until nodding. “Well, once we drop off Star, we can inform the Village Chief all that we know about the infection. I’ll request a few soldiers to help us once we scale up the mountains from there to reach the psychic. We approach the psychic, interrogate it for whatever it may know and probably kill it for its actions. It’s not exactly a great plan, but its all I got to face something that we don’t know about.”

Everyone seems to nod as Hex raises a hand. He states, “I say a good checkpoint to reach is Draxius’ tent. We can settle there before it gets dark and head directly back to Redeemer’s Grotto. I have recently discovered an issue revolving around the infection.”

Your ears perk up. “What is it?”

“I’ll tell you once we reach the tent.” Hex assures you.

“Then we should clear up camp as soon as possible. I have no doubt Herox will send out his reinforcements to come searching for us.” You say. Everyone agrees and begins to pack.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Oh That Aftermath

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
The trip to Draxiusâ tent wasnât as near as bad you had actually anticipated. The campfire was put out quickly and everyone had collected their gear together a little too eagerly. Figuring that they could all stay in the humble abode and cozy setting of Draxiusâ security, many were ready within mere minutes. The venture through the rest of plains wasnât very life threatening or time consuming either. Yes, there were a few encounters with infected such as a Salamance, a Ninjask afterwards, and later a Staraptor, however, seeing that the feral had to face six opponents at the same time, they were sent fleeing the scene quickly. You were quickly making progress through the patchy forest when yet another feral had attacked.

----|----


The Ninetales growled in animosity as her bundle of tails thrash in a mad spree. Jackal had pinned the purple-eyed kitsune down, licking his lips as he eyed her like a feral would. Star and Eden looked away in disgust, waiting for the Typhlosion to get over with it as Gold locked his hungry gaze in jealousy. Hex managed to comfort the girls as they locked in closer with him, while Jackal had ordered you to hold her legs and tails down, (which was not an easy task.)

His mouth rolled over her muzzle, taking in her head as her feminine body began to slide into his throat. The Typhlosion murred at his easily caught mealâs flavor, licking over her bright fur as her meaty figure relentlessly slid down his gullet. You scoffed at Jackalâs pleasure, unwillingly noticing Gold fingering over his sheath as the naked female was quickly gulped down. Releasing your pinning section, only a few tails managed to remain wriggling out from the fire-typeâs bloated maw all until they too were slurped into his stomach. He blurted out a good belch before his hands slapped around the sides of his belly, wobbling it happily as his prey struggled inside.

âThatâll teach herâ¦!â Jackal gloated out as he massaged his bouncing stomach. Star and Eden release Hex, and continue to follow the frog as the three pass the newly fat Typhlosion, ignoring him in return. âAw câmon! You make it look like Iâm the bad guy! Sheâs was infected and she couldâve snatched someone up or called for more of her beasty friends to show up. I say I did more good than harm!â

Gold walked by him, having trouble with a boner. âYa couldâve waited awhile so we could give her a nice welcoming party, if ya catch my drift.â The Golduck snickered. Just then, vines whipped around and slapped the backside of Goldâs head painfully hard. He quacked out loud as he looked at Eden who glared at him for his evil comment. ââ¦I hate that stupid woman.â That mumbling comment was rewarded with a second whipping.

Hex brushed away a branch, opening his hand to point to a field. âThere it is my friends, Draxiusâ camp.â The two females blew a sigh in relief in knowing the walking trip was over. They day had already reached sunset from your abrupt sleep, traveling, Herox, and battles for the trip back to the Drowzeeâs home. The tent was still incredibly large with smaller tents connected to the four corners. Tall torches lined the entrance that was concealed with a wooden pallet, where your team would soon arrive.

Hex knocks against the door as the familiar slot opens along the door. âWe would like to see Master Draxius concerning the infection.â Hex informed Gyro. The Hypnoâs signature blank expression nodded as the slit closed. You wondered if you had to go through the entire process again. All of a sudden, you heard the Drowzeeâs voice carry out through the carpet walls.

âGyro! Show some respect! You should know that these guests have the right to enter or leave as they please! Honestly, itâs like you lack any form of character or empathy.â The slot opened up again, revealing Draxiusâ lowered calm eyes. He must have been standing tippy-toe style to even reach his line of sight through the door sliver. âAh! Quite the revelation! It is my favorite band of traveling adventurers. Please, do come in!â

The door unlocks, and everyone slowly pours in. The rooms are all walled by curtains hooked into the clothed ceiling, with lanterns to scatter the place for a luminescent tranquility vibe that lit the tent. Gyro, as always, stood without any form of clothing, which was perfectly normal in your world. Whereas for Draxius, the Drowzee displayed a navy-blue hooded robe with Unknown symbols long it, patterning down for an elegant formal appearance. The psychic dipped his head, âWelcome Hex and Lace. What brings you back into my happy residence?â

âIf you wouldnât mind, I would like for us to converse at the main room over the table.â The Toxicroak asked as he nodded his head back.

âAh, indeed.â The Drowzee ordered Gyro to show them your group the way, as you were led to a flat square table within the largest center room of the tent. There, to your surprise, was a female anthro Abra, who was quite tall for her stage form. She was just as tall as you. She sat along the edge of the wooden desk, lightly swishing her tail side to side. Her body was mostly covered in crimson sashes with the same Unknown shapes Draxius wore. The dress-like fabric lowered down to the straw sandles tied around her feet. âEveryone, this is Yuli. Sheâs a fellow pokemon that I have recently been discussing what you have learned about the contamination so far. Sheâs a powerful and diligent psychic who I deem worthy to help us in our rebellion against the infected. Now, I make it that you have recently discovered something, Hex?â

âYes Draxius.â The Toxicroak answered, kneeling at the table. âIt has come to my attention that weâre already infected.â

Your ears stab upward as Jackal abruptly yells, âWhat?!â

Hex resumed, âBefore the infection, oral vore was as natural as blinking for carnivorous pokemon. It is only until now that vore has evolved. Whether itâs oral, anal, vaginal, or urethral, non-infected have a sudden instinct for it and use it will. Honestly, how many of us typically ate living things whole before the infection had presumably began?â No one answered, however, Draxius raised his hand in response with a creepy smile. You shuddered from what that meant. âDo you see now? The psychic has already sent impulses to our brains that suggest vore and sexual seduction are simply reasonable things. It makes it easier for the ferals to collect their prize, be it a nice stuffed belly or a new infected to trail with it. Whoever weâre dealing with had plenty of time to come up with this, and their dastardly plans have destroyed many of our villages and families in such a cruel fashion. Weâre infected, but the only way the psychic can actually control our minds, is by a physical connection. And what is the easiest part of the body that can easily disperse into another? Their fluids, and thatâs where they kick in. Once theyâre in you, the psychic is technically a part of you, which makes you exceptionally susceptible to its whims. It has also come to our attention that Herox the Zapdos is working for the one who plagues our land.â

âI couldâve told you that.â Yuli the Abra stated. âHe was the first legendary to fall under the disease creator. His first order was to dispose of the other legendary birds, Embis the Moltres, and Terra the Articuno. They were devoured by Herox, and the Ho-oh and Lugia remain as infected ferals that patrol the northern mountains, guarding Heroxâs master along with other non-infected followers that send out the psychic signals. I do not yet understand why this creator has sent this disease for such an indescribably reason, but Iâm certain weâll find out if your team continue their pursuit.â

Hex nodded, âWe defeated Herox once, and weâll be sure to finish him next time.â

Draxius slowly clapped his hands together. He answered in a sly grin, âYou never cease to bewilder me, Hex. You seem to have flipped this infection over in a matter of a week. I congratulate you and wish you the best of luck!â He suddenly rose his pudgy form up, proclaiming, âWell, I see that all of you are quite tired from your long travel. I have a few rooms open for you to unpack your things. Stay as long as you wish! I cannot have my proud fighters weak or worried!â
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Final Aftermath

choices: Choose a room on the right side. (Female Options)
Choose a room on the left side. (Male Options)
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Everyone disbanded as you and Jackal led yourselves to an open small room. Only a large futon was placed as piece of furniture. Anything else was just a candle lying in a plate. Jackal groaned as his heavy mass tumbled onto the cushion, convulsing its plushy form around his fat belly. He began to rub it again as he asked, âHey, drop the bag and help me with this Ninetales, sheâs giving me a hard time.â You grumble as you set your satchel down. You get to your knees and place your padded paws at the surface of his fuzzy gut. You can feel the foxâs body squirm slightly inside, curled up and writhing in the Typhlosionâs digestive juices. You grin and relax back in your seat, just staring at the tall Abra with amusement, "Is that how we're doing this? Just pretending that it never happened?" You chuckled out.

Yuli took a moment to just sit silently looking at her book, even though you knew she wasn't really reading it, and sighed. "...I simply just want things to be 'settled' between us. No, that's not the correct word." She struggles to figure out that right way to make it sound like a professional, mature excuse to talk to you. "...Things should remain 'mellow' between us. Is that the way to use it?"

A small range of snickers force out of your mouth as you can't bear to look at her. You rub over your face as you reply, "Yes Yuli, that's a decent word for it."

The Abra blushes and places her book down, crossing her smooth legs to the point where you can hear her skin slide loudly against each other, and pouts somewhat. "Just because we will not be 'together' in a relationship does not mean I cannot simply enjoy myself for some friendly idle conversation with you."

You finally are able to contain your giddiness as you take the time to smile at her. "That's fine by me. What would you like to talk about?"

Yuli flashes you a look, "What is your course of plan on this expedition?"

"We're heading back towards Redeemer's Grotto if you've heard of it, to take a small bit of refuge there to drop the Luxray, Star, off. And hopefully we can persuade the Village Chief there to lend us soldiers to aid us when we head to the mountains together to stop whoever or whatever is causing this."

Yuli raises a brow, "So, you're just going to gather several foolish citizens who have been living under a rock all of this time to go out and battle against a supreme force that has caused a wide array of destruction and horror around this entire island with your nose stuck up high to beat it with your mere fists?" The honesty was a bit brutal, to the point where you almost shrank into your chair. "I'm not saying that you should not help save everyone and 'cure' this epidemic, but you will not go far if you think you can just walk to that psychic's front door and just punch them into submission. Anyone who has ever dared to go to those mountains have either died or become just another slobbery monster."

You scoot in closer, "Then what else is there that we can do?"

The Abra sighs, crossing her arms now and reclining back. After a moment of silence, she whispers, "I don't know."

The two of you just return staring at the table without another sound, contemplating on what was to come. Suddenly, you hear the sound of one of Yuli's sandals slipping off to feel the side of her footpaw slide up along your ankle. You flash her a look this time, smiling some as she blushes and glances away to avoid eye-contact. You sneer, "Whatever happened with our mellow relationship?" You begin to rub your own forepaw against hers, feeling her two front digits occasionally pinch at you affectionately underneath the table for no one to see.

"I merely...accidentally bumped your leg and I'm looking for my sandal again." Yuli lies and nudges your legs a few times as she fidgets pleasurably in her seat before sliding the sandal back on.

"In fact, I meant to ask you, but why do you wear clothes? I know some Pokemon need them for cold weather or think it's stylish but...in these times? Clothes like that are useless."

Yuli looks at her teacup, troubled with thoughts, "I wear them only in Draxius' tent. It's just a tradition we have to wear these robes around each other. I also respect him since he's a far superior psychic that I am, so I cover my body for less of a distraction." The Abra suddenly gives you a wink. "That, and they're very comfy and sleek. I noticed how much you enjoyed them."

You reflect a smile, "They are very silky."

The Abra sighs again, sips up the last of her tea and takes her book with her, giving you a bow. For a moment there, it was as if she truly wanted to tell you something. "Good luck on your quest Lace. I'm certain our paths will cross again." Before you could even say goodbye, Yuli heads off into her room without looking back.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Breakfast with Yuli

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
With your bag in hand and a mighty inhale of fresh morning air, you and the rest of your group stand outside of Draxius' tent both eager and unwilling to leave. Spending you time within the psychic's home made you reflect on how peaceful and wonderful life had been before this crisis, back when you could look forward to the next day instead of worrying if you would make it to that point. You stretch your legs out some in preparation for the long walk ahead, along with any battles that may come your way on the travel there.

Draxius, Gyro, and even Yuli stand outside at the entrance of the home, saying their goodbye and 'good lucks' to you and everyone else. You would have offered for the psychic's to tag along, but their abilities may have been useless against this master villain hiding out there in the darkened heights of the mountains. You had already talked it out with the woman you actually slept with last night before departing with the rest of the group, confirming that you should just keep it to yourself and focus on the task at hand right now, but you knew you would be together with her soon enough hopefully. As you finally depart, your team heads out into the directions of the mountains in the distance, but not to fight the psychic just yet. You still needed to swing by Redeemer's Grotto to tell them the revelations you discovered about the infection, along with the hopes of gaining some of the city's troops so you wouldn't be outmatched by the psychic. You glance over to Star remembering that the original plan was to drop her safely off there as well, but you hoped she would change her mind about it. The Luxray had already proven to be a valuable asset, plus you've grown to enjoy her company along the trip. Perhaps through time she could feel better and bond with the others.

----|----


         You remain ahead most of the group, silently looking forward the whole way through passing the dense forest and following a dirt path that supposedly lead to a village according to Draxius. However, he didn't know if it was abandoned or safe there anymore. Either way, you still planned on setting that as a good checkpoint to head to. But as you were calmly walking, a familiar heat approached you from behind as Jackal walks a bit faster to catch up to your side.

The fire type didn't say anything at first, or even glance at you for that matter. His eyes keep a firm aim around at the forested environment looking out for ferals, but mainly just to pass the time trying to find the right words.

You speak first, "Hey." The last time you saw the Typhlosion was when he kicked you out of the room in a mad dispute over nothing. You wonder if it affected anything about your friendship with him, but seeing as he wanted to obviously talk with you, it was a good sign.

"Hey." He responds, but avoids his eyes away still. You glance down at his gut to see that it had worked nicely on the Ninetales feral he had devoured yesterday, the same stomach he became so enraged over last night of when he forced you out mid-rub. Jackal awkwardly paused for a moment before continuing, "...I'm sorry, uh, about you know. Last night, and...stuff..."

He then rubs at the back of his head, scratching it some as you reply with a smile, "Don't worry about it."

Jackal's face burned a bit red as his voice got quieter. "Thanks...so like, we're still buds, right?"

"Of course." You keep your answers short and simple, waiting for the real questions the Typhlosion wanted to ask you.

He in fact did so, mustering the courage to say, "Soooo...how'd you enjoy your night? I kind of heard some stuff in the other room with, well, you-know-who. I wasn't really expecting you to, you know, bang her."

You grin and flash a look at him, "One thing led to another, but yeah, it was really wonderful. Why do you ask?"

"Oh! U-Uh. Well well well...uh...it's just. Fuck, what do I say? It's cool." He stutters and frantically panics of what to say.

"It's...cool?" You mockingly retort.

Your friend's cheeks flare even more red as his struggles for words become humorously more difficult. "W-Well, uh, it's just that I didn't know you liked her, that's all. You sort of just met her, but to each his own, I-I guess." The poor Typhlosion's voice was shaking and you almost thought he was beginning to sweat for a moment.

You pat a hand against his back, rubbing it some before returning it to your side, "Don't worry about it. I'm still the same guy you met at Jade Gorge." Jackal calms down some he keeps a tight grip around the satchel of his bag. Peering back at the others behind you to see if they were listening in, you spot Eden and Gold loudly arguing with each other about something to do with the clouds. You swear they could rant against each other about anything.

"What would some flat-chested plant know about the weather, huh? It isn't going to rain anytime soon." The Golduck quacks out with confidence and anger.

The Roserade quickly gives Gold's cheek a firm smack with one of her vine whips, huffing back, "Excuse me? I can tell by the moisture in the air! Plants thrive based on what's in nature, and how dare you think some 'chest size' has anything to do with it! How would a useless piece of scum like you understand anything about rainclouds?"

The Golduck rubs the red mark left on his face with a shut eye, growling back, "I'm a water-type if I need to remind you, you pesky little weed!"

Farther back was Star and Hex quietly walking with each other as the frog explains past times before he lived in the swamp and how he came to learn different natural ingredients could cure different illnesses. The Luxray calmly listened with her tail even wagging some behind, keeping her eyes glued to the Toxicroak while he dramatically used body language and fancy descriptions for it.

You turn your head away and change the subject before anything became too awkward with Jackal by saying, "So how'd you sleep? Did the feral give you any trouble?"

Jackal scoffs, "Please, that bitch gave up its fight as soon as is was guzzled down and trapped. Heh, I'm pretty sure I'm getting stronger with every feral I beat."

"And tubbier." You joke.

The Typhlosion looks down at his soft belly, pinching at the slight pudge there, "You think so?" You didn't know if he was insulted or complemented by the comment.

"Perhaps, but it's cute in a way. You seem to really like belly rubs, and so does Star. You should ask her for some." You chuckle.

Jackal's face ignites again, along with the flames on his mane just a bit. He peeks over at the Luxray, having his voice almost stutter, "Really?"

"I figured from how I woke up in the nursery that one time and I found her hands on me like that."

Jackal grunts, "H-Hey, now wait a minute, don't lie to me about stuff like that!"

Your smile stretches out long on your muzzle, "Oh I wouldn't dream of it Jackal. In no way do I think she'll find you attractive!"

The Typhlosion sighs out, "Oh, whew, that's a relie- Hey, what do you mean by that!"

You snicker and continue walking along the path, avoiding in giving a straight answer to Jackal. Maybe you were serious. Maybe you were kidding. Who really knows.

For the most part, the trek was beginning to look nice and easy for your group. The only time you met confrontations with ferals was just one at a time, and with a whole group of companions to fend them off, ferals seem to pose little of a threat. They either ran away from being outnumbered, or were quickly beaten unconscious from the group. Although, as much as Jackal or Gold wanted to eat their defeated prey, it would only slow the group down so they merely left the knocked out ferals on the road.

You were proud to make it through most of the forest with plenty of the day left, arriving at...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: To the Mountains (Female Preference)

choices: You head over there with Jackal!
You send Hex over there with Jackal!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Your entire group stops to survey the area lying before all of you. You had noticed from before the sudden transitioning of the types of trees changing, with many of them dying or leafless at this point along with the scattered puddles and patches of fungus and moss out around the path. At last though, your group had arrived at the coast of a large, flat lake of murky mud and black sludge.

The tar pits occasionally bubble and releases fumes of steam and toxicity that you can even vapor out from the surface of the gunk. Poorly built wooden walkways were built in several angling paths over the sea of sludge to maneuver people and carts over easily, but with the recent infection, you truly doubt anyone has been around long enough to do any of the repairs for the wooden bridges. You spot several holes along the walkways, with wooden beams rotting and decaying away, along with some damage that looks like fights were held atop these bridges, most likely from pokemon using these to get over the tar pits to escape ferals but were forced to fight there. This bog was in worse of a shape than the swamp Hex lived in.

Jackal places his hands on his hips, shaking his head, "There's no way in Hell am I walking over these things." You check back on everyone else in fact, and their reactions are all typically the same with unsure expressions.

Hex then points out, "With our numbers like this, we'd have to only cross one to two at a time on the pathways, and even then we would have to step carefully on the planks. I suggest we may want to find a way around this or at least a safer alternative."

You can only sigh with a groan, answering, "I suppose you're right...let's g-" You are then cut off by a loud shout carrying off in the distance.

Star's ears flip up and she worriedly asks, "Wh-what was that?" Squinting your eyes to try and pinpoint where the yell had come from, you then spot a group of three anthros close to the other side of the bog. One was of a Typhlosion from what you curiously question, that is until you noticed that its a shiny Pokemon with a crimson backside of fur instead of the traditional dark blue. Judging from its physique, it appeared to be a woman. Next to her was chubby Grotle which you could easily tell was a male as well the third anthro; a well built Rhydon. Although, you quickly notice that all three of them are distressed about something when you then notice that the Rhydon and had fallen through some of the boards of a walkway and landed in the tar! He angrily roars and struggles in the thick sludge that only made him sink in deeper with his two companions doing their best to try and reach him and pull him out.

You step forward and place your hands around your mouth for an audible call, "Hey are you three okay over there? Do you need any help?"

On the other side of the tar pits, the Typhlosion and Grotle glance up to see you and a whole pack of others behind you which in fact startles them. The Grotle worriedly asks his companion next to him, "Who...wh-who are those guys? Do you think they're those bandits from earlier?"

She retorts, "I dunno...They're not the same kind of Pokemon, but they could still be in that clan for all I know. Listen Clubs, you keep trying to get Jab out and just leave everything to me." The red Typhlosion then gets up from her knees and calls back, "Hey buddy, we're taking care of ourselves here, so ya might as well turn around and leave! We don't want any trouble with ya!"

"I would hope not, but it seems trouble has already found you. Do you think you can pull him out on your own?" You reply.

The fire-type crosses her arms and grumbles, "Of course we can, now like I said, ya need to-"

"Please! Could you help us? I can barely even reach him, let alone pull him out! He'll drown in there if you don't!" The Grotle interrupts with a distraught and desperate plea with tears almost in his eyes. The Typhlosion glares at him for awhile and looks back down at their Rhydon friend who was already halfway in the tar dragging him slowly down.

The large reptile barks out at his traveling partners as he trashes within the gunk, "Would you two stop bickering and get me out of here! If they're offering to help, then just take it already you bastards! I don't have all day!"

The Typhlosion just shakes her head, "Fine fine, but if these guys prove to be an issue and we're all raped and eaten, it's all on you two." She then returns to yelling back to you, "Alright, if you really want to help us, then hurry your asses over here!"

You nod as Hex steps up next to you with a hand on your shoulder, "I think you should send at most two people. If the boards broke under him alone, you can't be too careful if you're rushing over there with the weight of two people." You agree with the Toxicroak until all of you notice something. Several howls and growls emit out from deep within the wilderness and darkening trees as several violet dots appear that only seem to grow larger and closer with each passing moment. The sudden ground softly resulting footsteps to rumble throughout the floor signifying several ferals all attracted to the commotion happening at the tar pits, that maybe yelling for communication wasn't the best idea.

You tense up with your group as you look over to the trio on the other side, mirroring very similar reactions to the horde that was soon to come. The Rhydon stuck in the tar stares with fearful eyes as he sees the glowing purple dots through the wave of dead tress glowing brighter and making their way towards them only has his lips shuddering to speak. Without even looking at his friends and focusing his gaze at the faint moving figures far away that snarl and stomp their way to, he whines out, "P-Pull me out...pull me out, pull me out, pull meee ooouuut. Right. Now!" The Typhlosion and Grotle get back on their knees, outstretching their arms down over the walkway edge to try and grab their friend's own reaching arms.

With time running out, you're prepared to head over there yourself before Eden's voice shudders out, "G-Guys...behind us!" Peering back, the same situation was at hand. Several ferals were dashing out of trees and from the forest path behind you to all attack in unison, making your numbers completely meaningless now from this ambush. Are ferals truly this smart? You didn't put too much thought into it as you would need to suggest who to stay and fight the ferals from the rear, and who would go out onto the tar pit walkways to help the other group. You automatically nominate Jackal to go since he's most likely the one with the most strength at the time, and you ponder of who should go with him. You could risk your own life and go across with him, but would the others be okay without you? Perhaps Hex could go with Jackal since he was the leanest and tallest. He would definitely be able to reach the Rhydon in no time.

With those facts in mind, you decide that...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: The Tar Pits

choices: Charge at it and kick it off!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"Jackal, you're with me. We're sticking to the plan and heading over to the other group." You explain to the Typhlosion as you glance back at the others. "Your job is to stay here and hold those ferals off until we pull him out of the tar." Hex, Eden, Gold, and Star look uneasy about the situation, but eventually feel confident enough in your plan and agree to it.

You feel Jackal tugging at your arm, grunting, "Well let's not waste any time then." He starts to head over to the staircase to the walkways as you trail behind him quickly.

As you ascend the stairs, you glance back to see Hex wave to you both and calls out, "Be careful now! Don't end up in any tar or stomachs, you hear me?"

Gold jabbed an elbow into the Toxicroak's side and quacks angrily, "They'll be fine, but we won't be unless ya turn around help us fight these sicko's off, ya hear me?!" The frog glances one last worried look at the two of you making it across the tar pits before turning around and fending off all of the ferals trying to bypass them.

Meanwhile, you and Jackal cross the walkways together in a cautious sprint, tensing every time the wooden boards creak under your pounding steps. Several close calls occur as soft snaps and wobbly sections seem to almost give away under you, but less times than what Jackal had to go through. Being probably the heaviest of your group members, he had taken it to himself to be the lead point just in case the boards couldn't support the weight. If Jackal could make it across, then more than likely you could, and you would be there right behind the Typhlosion just in case it happened.

Those thoughts come at the worst time though when you suddenly halt in your dash to the other group once Jackal brakes to a complete stop abruptly. You try glancing over his shoulder and ask, "What's wrong Jackal?"

The Typhlosion clears his throat some, looking around from where he was standing to reply, "Well...uh, heh, uhm I think this wooden board is going to give away right under me, I could hear splitting wood and feel a crack in this thing under my foot."

You look down to see the wooden plank was indeed a bit split in the middle, and anymore sudden weight difference can have it completely break. You sigh and look over at the trio in trouble, with the female Typhlosion and male Grotle too busy fighting ferals to pull their friend out from the murky tar. Seeing no other way and no time, you explain, "Then I guess you better take your hindpaw carefully off as slow as possible, but we don't have a lot of time left. But don't worry, I'll catch you if you fall, okay?"

A bead of sweat drops from his forehead as he makes a single nervous laugh, "Oh, heh, yeah sure. It's not like I'm super fucking worried or anything." He shuts his eyes close and grits his teeth tightly together, taking the paw off the board to hear the wood ache and groan underneath until he immediately takes an entire step back to let the plank snap and fall down into the gunk below. The Typhlosion releases a heavy sigh of relief, rubbing the sweat from his forehead as he flashes a smile back to you over his shoulder in reassurance. Giving a small step over the empty panel of the walkway, several boards then crumple beneath him to send the fat Typhlosion falling down! The wood snaps loudly and Jackal's body falls heavily down, yet he manages to grab the edge of the hole in a desperate lunge, growling out with a worried look, "Gahh...shit!" He does his best to try and hold on while his legs kick and thrash wildly in the air just inches from the bubbling tar down below. The struggling fire-type glances down to see the broken wooden boards sinking actually quickly in the blackish gunk, sending chills up his usually warm body.

You bark out once you see this and circle around the hole, doing your best not to have anymore boards break from your weight to not end up like Jackal. "Don't worry buddy, I got you! Just, uh, hang on!"

Jackal grumbles as he endeavors to claw his way back up, "I wasn't planning on just letting go if that's what you were thinking!" You squat down and grab Jackal's outstretched arms, tugging his pudgy body up the best you can as his legs still struggle to kick off of anything for extra support. But thankfully, you manage to heave Jackal back onto his knees on the walkway for the Typhlosion to hold his chest to calm his heart down from the close call. Looking up at you, he pants, "Whew...Remind me to make it up to you after all of this."

You roll your eyes and help Jackal back upright. Close to the trio you were sent to aid, the both of you continue onward until your stop in your tracks with two purple-eyed figures blocking your path. An infected Breloom stands on the walkway with a drooling mouth and wobbling cock that oozes out pre onto the wooden boards, paired up with a female Pidgeotto that glides past the mushroom creature to aim towards Jackal.

The Typhlosion's mane ignites as he prepares to fight the bird closing in on him from the air with the Breloom being your opponent to deal with for now. No one had time for this, and you needed to take care of this quickly and efficiently.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Volunteering

choices: Hop on the Rhydon and hit the Muk directly with aura!
Grab a wooden plank and strike the Muk in the face with it.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Aura swirls around between your two palms as you collect them together at your side. Squatting some as you charge your power, blue fire forms in a ball at your pressing hands as orange flames flare at the back of Jackal's mane just right behind you. You two would have to do your best to not burn away the walkways underneath you, as well as for the rest of the whole way so that the others in your group could make it across. The hungry Breloom roars out and charges forward without any hesitation. Its tongue hangs out from its mouth while showing off some of its fangs to you in preparation in eating you, but you had other plans then to die today.

The Breloom's leg actually stomp on one of the wooden boards to suddenly smash through it, halting the feral's charge for it to look down and notice that it was stuck. Trying to desperately pull out, you used the opportunity to launch the Aura Sphere directly into the mushroom creature to send it howling and spiraling away in a trail of smoke. The feral flies off of the walkway and directly into the bubbling tar to never be seen again. You feel a bit guilty for killing it, because after all, you wanted to find a cure and save anyone who's become infected. But there wasn't much more that could've been done for the Breloom. You just hoped that whoever used to be that Breloom wasn't in there anymore once the infection took over his body.

You suddenly feel a large weight woosh right over your head from behind you after a soot-covered Pidgeotto is flung right into the tar as well. It's swirling purple eyes and groaning beak is the last thing you see of it before it sinks into the squelching muck. Checking back on Jackal, you spot him merely swatting his palms together to rub of his own soot off before he looks to you with a disgruntled look, "What? You didn't think I could handle some dumb bird?" And takes the lead on the walkways again as he elbows your side while jogging a bit forward, "C'mon, you were in such a rush before. Move it, mutt."

And yet again, the two of you were making progress towards the three other anthros. With no other interruptions, you at last arrive close in front of them to see the Typhlosion and Grotle both knock a Tyranitar close to the edge of the walkway as it teeters over some and struggles not to fall back. The female fire-type smashes her body weight against the large beast to have the Tyranitar roaring as it fell off of the edge. The Rhydon sitting in the tar below sees a shadow looming over him, making him fearfully gasp as he sees the towering body of the large reptile timbering over the edge headed towards him. He wriggles and whimpers to get out off the way, or at least to squirm over to the side some to avoid being pummeled down and eternally sent into the muck. Thankfully, the Tyranitar smacks into the tar right next to the Rhydon to sink down into the stuff, but just as soon as the Rhydon gives a sigh of relief, he feels the Tyranitar's hand grab his leg within the tar to try and pull him down! The struggle is back on as the reptiles kick and claw it out underneath the black putty, with only the Rhydon's head barely sticking out of the slime.

You immediately dive against the wooden boards with your upper body hanging off of the edge with your arms extended. "Grab on!" You order as Jackal gets down and does the same with hands outstretched. The Rhydon notices the two strangers but wasn't going to question them. His arms emerge out of the gunk from fighting off the Tyranitar to trying and struggling to reach your own. The shiny Typhlosion and Grotle don't hesitate on your true motives either, and get down to help to. All four of you grab him, two for each arm, and heave back to try and pull the thick dino out. The gluing black tar stuck and tugged back viciously, to where with even four people it was difficult to just not have him sink in any further.

The female Typhlosion growls, "Grhhhhhh...! Th-Thanks for stopping by you two, because there's no way Clubs or I would be able to get this fatso out! The name's Cherry...and this heavy fool is Jabber. Damn, Jabber! How much do you fucking weigh?!"

Jabber, the Rhydon, whines out as he does his best to pull up. "Sh-Shut up! You're all just weak!"

Clubs the Grotle worriedly asks, "Ch-Cherry, why isn't this working? There's no way this tar can be this thick and strong!" You would have to agree with the shy guy. This tar was practically sentient, and driven to do anything in its power to suck this guy down. Just what was going on?

Jabber shudders, "I-It's moving all around me! I-I-I think it's grabbing me!"

Cherry growls back, "It's just goo, you big oaf! It isn't alive, and it isn't trying to...oh no..." Her crimson eyes widen as the four of you stare at the Rhydon's body to discover the explanation.

He looks at all of your eyes, confused, "Wh-What? Why are you guys staring at me like that?" Jabber looks down at his body to see some of the slime emerge around his body out from the black tar, being closer to a greyish tint. Two purple eyes even glimmer out from the thick gunk as a purplish slime-like tongue rubs over Jabber's belly and chest. He tenses up to see that an infected Muk was in the tar, and eating him! "Ah-Ahhhh! Ah crap! P-Pull me out! Get it off me! D-Do something!"

You all fight in a tug-of-war match against the slime monster as its own hands shift out of the tar and glue themselves against the wriggling Rhydon. Glancing around, you notice that not just the Muk was awakened within the tar, because several more infected Muk and Grimer began to shift through the tar or slide along the walkways towards both the group you were with at the moment, as well as towards the coast of the tar pits where the rest of your group was battling.

Jackal looks to you for help, "This isn't good. We either have to give up on this guy and make sure we can just make it out of here alive, or find a way to outmatch this guy. My fire would only singe the fatso with the Muk if I attack."

"We're not giving up on anyone, Jackal." You assure him as you try to come up with a plan. The Muk was massive in size, and it was probably even larger underneath the submerging tar. Apparently the toxic gunk added to its size and strength, and with being a feral and all, its power outmatched other simpler Muk and Grimer. This thing would need to take a big hit to be able to stun it or force it back.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Slimy Issues

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"Gimme a sec." You mention over to Jackal next to you before you release Jabber's arm and stand up. The Typhlosion flashes you a look as the Rhydon panics with less people help pulling. You suddenly hop down over the boardwalk edge to force a gasp out of Jackal as he sees you actually land on top of Jabber, making it far harder to pull him up with the extra weight.

Jabber growls worriedly as he writhes his head under your hindpaws, "H-Hey! Get off! What are you doing?!" You don't answer him as you crouch down whilst standing on the Rhydon's shoulders to power up a fistful of aura. Punching down, you strike the Muk square in its face to make it howl and shrink back into the tar a bit. You immediately hop off Jabber and back onto the boardwalk to grab his arm once more.

"Pull him, now!" You order as you and the other three yank with all of your might at his raised arms. The plan works since the Rhydon begins to slip out of the Muk's whining mouth to lift back up towards the walkway. He desperately claws onto the edge, scrambling his limbs around like a scared spider when trying to pry himself completely out of the tar. The Muk growls and reaches its maw at him once again, but with Jabber out now, Jackal and Cherry work together to spit flames down at the feral. The Typhlosion duo scorch the Muk's slimy girth dry to have it yelp and submerge back deep into the tar.

Jabber waddles on all fours and kisses the floor repeatedly, "Oh I'm alive! I'm alive alive alive alive aliiiive!" Clubs eagerly kneels down and slaps at the Rhydon's backside while weeping happily, "Oh Jabber! You scared me half to death! Watch where you step next time! I don't know what I'd do without you!"

The two large dino's get up together and hug it out as all of you get a chance to take a short breather. Just then, several gloppy howls sound out around you. Your head looks around as you perform a full circle turn-around to see many Grimer ferals slowly sliding towards all of you; each of them smacking their lips and ready to charge all at once. Jabber grips Clubs closer into a hug and whines, "We're dead! Ohh we're so dead dead deeead!"

You get ready to fight off the ferals in front of you as Jackal and Cherry ready themselves at the rear to take on the others across the way. Glancing over to the terrified reptiles squishing each other in between all of the fighters, you growl out, "Don't just stand there, we need everybody to fight!" A Grimer lunges towards you that you drive away by a strong kick to send it into the tar.

Clubs just flashes a mortified face and shudders, "W-We're just farmers! I don't know h-how to f-fight!"

The excuse makes you groan as you spot nearly five more Grimer quickening their pace in a rush towards you. You gulp and hope for your best until a massive stream of water crashes into their sides and sends them all washing away back over the edges of the boardwalk. Looking ahead, you see Gold dashing along the boards in a very quick sprint, giving you a bit of relief for help, even if it was Gold. You wave to him and happily call at him, "Thanks for the help Gold! We could re-"

You're interrupted as the Golduck simply dashes right past you while exclaiming in a fast tone, "Yeah you're welcome! Bye!" He passes by Jackal and Cherry as well, erupting more water from his beak to just casually wash the other Grimer away so he could continue down the boardwalk. You peer over to see Hex, Star, and Eden running along the walkways as well with scared expressions. A wave of ferals were in pursuit, running along the wooden boards behind them with drooling maws. The pressure from all of the frantic chasing and weight of bodies was causing the boardwalk structures to crumble one after the other, causing unfortunate ferals to plummet to their dooms in the heavy tar. You start to walk backwards before turning around completely into a run as well, tapping Jackal and Cherry's shoulder and mentioning, "Time to go...!" They look over and begin to do the same as you immediately with the same feeling of rushed concern while Jabber and Clubs try to keep up.

Going along the entire walkway as it zigs and zags over the tar pits, you hope nothing would break underneath you or the others, for that meant life was over for the poor fallen sap. Thankfully though you make it across to fresh land after descending a small wooden staircase with the others trailing behind you. After everyone crosses, Cherry is wise enough to turn around and erupts several blast of fire at the boardwalk. The old dry wood burns easily to have it crumble away and splat into the tar, so you and Jackal both join her to use your flames to burn out any support beams or walkways that connect to the exit staircase.

The ferals along the walkways roar as they come to a stopping point, with their way to their intended meals stand across a good space away with tar and littered burning debris inside the murky sludge. You and the group see that it's safe to move ahead in a bit of hurry so you can make some distance with the ferals...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Saving Jabber

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Your hands plants themselves onto your knees with your body hunched over, relieved to take some fresh breaths of air after all the running you did. The group had made quite a bit of distance from the tar pits together, and after slowing a bit down along a thicket of forest trees, it was unanimous to take a break to catch some breaths. You rest your backside against a tree trunk to survey the others in front of you, noting that no one was left behind and everyone appeared to be perfectly fine if you looked past their constant heaving of air. Jackal slumps against the same tree you're on and slides down onto his rump to sit as he looks over to you, "Hahh...wheeeww...gotta hand it to ya, Lace. You managed to get that tubster out and everyone's safe and sound. You got some crazy last minute plans, but they certainly work in the long run."

You scoff, "Look who's calling who a tubster." Jackal hardly seems phased, and in fact, he grins in a bit of tired chuckle from it.

"Well fuck you too, ingrate. That's the last time I ever give you credit for anything." He says through his snickering teeth.

You check on over to the trio you helped to see Clubs and Jabber clinging onto one another with Cherry apparently harassing them about something. Getting off from the tree in a short lean, you make your way over to the scared dino's while listening in mid-way through the shiny Typhlosion's little fit. "...of you two know what 'watch your step' means?! I didn't just say that because I like the way it rings off my tongue. I was saying it for the sole purpose of the chance of what happened! And oh whaddya know. Guess what? It happened. You blindly just step firmly into a hole and topple over like a swan diver right into the tar. Geez...if those other people didn't show up, you two would've been as good as dead. Heck, maybe even me. It's not my responsibility to take care of two strangers I hardly know. Gah, this job sucks." She groans and pinches her scrunched together brow in anger with tight shut eyes.

Jabber remains silent while biting his lip, but Clubs spoke up, "H-Hey! It was an accident! You don't have to be angry at us. It's not our fault those ferals came after us..."

You decide to butt-in and interrupt, "Uhm, hey there? Can I talk to you three for a sec?" You ask with a bit of a wave of your hand.

The Grotle stands up and actually squeezes you in a tight hug. "Oh of course! I meant to say this earlier, but we kind of had infected on our tails. Thank you sooooooo much for pulling Jabber out! You're a saint; a savior!" You gasp out loud as a powerful and crushing hug compacts around you from the large Grotle's arms. He swings you back and forth in a loving embrace that has your lungs burning with pain and your eyes bulging from their sockets. You can only wince out of your closed throat. "Gh-Ghff....ff...!" Clubs even resorts to pecking several kisses to you right on your cheeks, muzzle, and forehead, showing you his appreciation in all the ways he could fathom.

At last, he releases you so you could cough out and stagger a bit. "Ghakkk! U-Uh, no problem. I-I kkhhuuaaachhkk! I wanted to ask you some questions..." After catching your breath again, you look over to the crimson Typhlosion and point to her bandana. "You're part of Redeemer's Grotto, right?"

Cherry raises a brow a picks a hand at her maroon bandana with the Redeemer's logo right on it. "Huh? Yeah, I'm a relay runner for them. I deliver messages and packages for certain outsiders. What about it?"

"I need you to deliver a message for the chief. Just tell him it's from Lace, and he should listen." You tell her, but before you can explain your message, she interrupts.

"H-Holy crap...you're Lace the Dragon Slayer!" Your pupils give a look of sheer confusion as they peer at Jabber and Clubs who just shrug their shoulders. Cherry continues, "Are you saying you're the Lace who took down the Aerodactyl at the neighboring canyon? I heard you took that thing down single-handedly!"

You clear your throat with your ears folding back some, "Uh, yeah, I suppose I did. I mean it wasn't li-"

"Damn, dog. That means you're probably the Lucario I heard about that liberated that hive too!" The Typhlosion begins to grow immensely excited. "There was a mass hive that Redeemer's Grotto always got word on that was kidnapping people. We tried to send some troops there, but never got word of them, so we just assumed the worse. But apparently a Lucario that was taken there who broke out and caused a mass riot before burning a large majority of that place down!"

Your cheeks become rosy while you rub your arm, "W-Well, that wasn't just m-"

"Oh! And! There's a story that you fought a legendary! Someone sighted one of the flying ancient birds limply soaring through the air from afar, but had clear burns from aura fire. Did you seriously take one of those on? Was it...infected?!" Cherry asks.

You stop her right then and there. "Whoa whoa whoa, alright. I think it's time for me to explain some things to you, and it has to deal with how the infection spreads and who's responsible for it."

Cherry gives you a very concerned look, "Someone...made the infection?"

Plopping a seat on the floor, you gesture for the Typhlosion to sit down with you. "Take a seat. It's a long story."
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Moment to Breathe

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
You wait for Cherry's reaction as she simply has her face in her palm, scratching at her cheek. You and the entire group were sitting around in a large circle to explain the events thus far, and hopefully Cherry would receive it all, believe it, and deliver it for you. She finally speaks and ask, "Okay okay okay. So, like, let me get this straight. This whole thing really isn't an infection, and it's more of a brainwashing mind spell this...god-psychic is doing from the top of a mountain? And he's controlling all of these victims to rape people so he can control them when their mind's weak and the fluids from the victims get to another, so that makes them easy to locate? Like...I just...I don't get it. Who the Hell is that freaky and convoluted to think of something like that? Let alone pull it off..."

Hex adds, "Well, it's just a theory. But we have good enough reason that that's just the case."

"Oh. Oh great. It's good enough." She responds with a bit of a sassy tone with her arm slapping her thigh. "Well let's just take the whole Redeemer's army up this mountain so we can take on this psychic chillin' up a mountain that for some reason wouldn't be able to just control our minds to clusterfuck one another right then and there just because, it's good enough. I don't see that absurd or stupid in any fashion."

Star gives her own unimpressed feedback to the Typhlosion, "Your sarcasm is very touching."

Cherry huffs back with crossed arms, "Listen, maybe you've had enough time to process this stuff all for awhile, but I just got dumped with all of it in one go, so saaaw-reee if I'm a bit skeptical about it."

"I don't care if you doubt any of it." You explain to Cherry. "I just need you to tell it to your chief. It's extremely important that you do. We're on our way there, but something tells me you're not a fan with sticking to groups."

The Typhlosion rises back up and wipes the dirt off her knees, "Well you're definitely right about that. Those two boneheads taught me otherwise." She gives Clubs and Jabber a look to make them feel a sense of guilt before she turns and sighs, "...Ughh...fine. I'll tell him all the crazy shit you told me. But don't be surprised if he doesn't believe you."

She begins to jog through the forest away from all of you as she calls back, "Good luck with beating this 'psychic' though. If you killed a dragon, why not a god too?"

It was a cue for everyone to slowly rise seeing as they should probably move too. Gold grumbles through his beak, "Geez, a little bitchy much? We risk our lives to go through that and she doesn't show an ounce of gratitude or concern for us."

Eden retorts, "Well she probably just looks out for herself Gold. Besides, I don't recall you having to go through all of the things Lace has. Isn't that right, leader?"

"Please don't call me that." You sigh as Jackal yells, "Hey! What about me? I've been doin' it since day one with him!"

Hex chuckles as he nudges an elbow at Jackal's side, "Oh Jacky, we already know about how you and Lace have been doing each other~" The Typhlosion's teeth nearly crack like chalk from the fierce and grinding clench he was seething through his mouth as his cheeks flare red. The Toxicroak can't help but croak happily and pet his back.

Looking over to Clubs and Jabber, the two are consoling one another before you ask them, "You said you two were farmers, correct? Do you live in a village near here?"

"Y-Yeah, we do." Jabber answers as he points down in a direction, "There's a town not too far from here that we live in. Clubs and I had gone out to go gather some more seeds from outside since we're running low...but, we didn't think there'd be ferals as far as the tar pits."

"It seems weird for farmers like yourselves to run out of seeds. Did you just not get enough out of your harvests?" You inquire.

The Grotle and Rhydon simply just give each other uneasy looks until Clubs explains, "Well...it's just that...w-we do, but they're just stolen."

Hex lifts a brow, "Stolen? Who steals them?"

"L-Listen..." Jabber says, "Can we just explain this when we're back at our home? I r-really don't want to be out here in the wild with more of those things outside now that I know they want to rape me to become one of them." You simply agree to that offer with everyone feeling just about the same. It'll be nice to be back into a fortified town with people again, and you got lucky to come across a runner to go deliver the news even if she was rude. So you weren't in too much of a hurry to get to Redeemer's Grotto.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Special Delivery

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
A wide wooden and stone gate stands before you with a tall wall isolating the area. The bricking appeared to be in a rushed job with very uneven bricks and slabs all cemented together for a quick fortification. Plenty of places looked like this when the infection first began, when towns heard of the tales and threats of ferals and their encroaching spread, they began immediate work to fortify their towns or homes as quickly as possible. Clubs the Grotle looks back over his shoulder since you and your group were following him, "This is Hedgen, our hometown. It might not uh, look like much once we're inside, but it's definitely a nice place to stay in and we don't have too many problems when it comes to ferals."

You note the fact that the town as literally at the bottom rim of a mountain, and from where you stood, you can spot several rolling hills along the mountainside with railroad tracks and mineshafts. "It's a mining town?" You ask.

Jabber replies, "For the most part. But it was also a very economic town in general. We used to have great agriculture for plants and food, and even a mass lumberyard. Guess it all didn't matter though with what's happened now though."

"Hey, you know that isn't true." Clubs expresses back with sincerity. "People need supplies, food, and resources more than ever now. We just need a safe route and delivery team to help get towns back up and running."

Star asks behind them, "I thought you said you didn't have problems with ferals...?"

"Oh, well we don't but...you'll see why." It got a little unnerving that the Grotle nor Rhydon would reveal anything about their situation, but you had to trust them if you wanted to get inside the town. Besides, they didn't seem hostile, especially since you saved their lives. There was little reason they would turn on you. But Star remains unconvinced by that answer by flashing you a quiet look about the two.

Arriving at the gate, Clubs and Jabber get the cue to come inside but your group is stopped by the entrance by a lone Slowbro guard. The pink chubster gives the Grotle a look and asks, "H-Hey, who are these guys? You know what'll happen if we take outsiders in...!"

Clubs puts a hand on the Slowbro's shoulder and gestures at you, "Yeah, but these guys could help us with our problem. They already saved Jabber and I at the tar pits."
