The Slowbro didn't appear to be convinced as all he was armed with was a measly club. "...The tar pits? Why did you go all the way that far?! I dunno if Bronze is gonna like this-" He's cut off by a different and much deeper voice once a large bone covers his mouth, "Don't worry Horris. I'm fine with it." A lone Marowak stands before you at the gate as he sets his large bone back down, using it as a cane to balance his weight on. Even though he was hunched over a bit and appeared weak, he certainly wasn't that old to be needing one. He certainly wasn't young and he did have a bit of a potbelly on him, his body seemed in good enough condition to keep itself up plenty, after all that large femur bone must've been heavy. His hazel gaze fixates on you and your group before he shows off the gate to his town, tiredly saying, "Please, come inside. We welcome you to Hedgen." He turns to enter the gates with the three hometown citizens following in suit with worried faces.

Before you take a step inside, Jackal grabs your arm, "Okay, we seriously need to discuss this first."

Star agrees as her hands cup at her hips. Her eye portraying that something about this felt off, "Jackal's right. These guys are hiding something and we might be walking into a trap."

You turn while wiping off Jackal's arm. "Well what do you suppose we do, just stand here or go around this town and attempt to scale this mountain on our own? We need to get over it if we want to get back to Redeemer's Grotto, unless we want to walk around the whole entire range which could take days. Maybe even weeks."

Hex yawns out, "Hrrroooaaagghhh. I concur. I think this town is hiding something, but they can only discuss it once they're inside. There may be an outside force here that's causing some sort of issue, and the best thing to do is at least figure out what it is. Besides, we helped their farmers. What malicious thoughts could they possibly have towards us?"

The Golduck at his side pouts and sits down on his rump with crossed arms. "Ughh, another one of these group discussions. You people can't fully agree on anything."

Eden snaps back, "Oh, like you're one to talk. What ingenious plan do you have?"

"Head inside. Relax a little. Enjoy a night's rest in an actual bed, or a sauna if they got that. Maybe meet a nice prostitute while I'm at it. If the locals are hostile once we're in, then I beat em' up and still stick to my earlier plan." Gold quacks back with a smug grin on his beak. Eden merely whips his cheek with a vine to make him yelp in surprise and fall over onto his side. She huffs, "You're unbelievable..."

Star does make the point though, "That's just it. What if the villagers do actually pull something? Do we take on a whole village? We don't know how many people are in there or what we're dealing with."

You try to convince the Luxray with, "Listen, as they said, they're a town meant for resources. They have miners, lumbers, and farmers it seems. Does that sound like a militarized force to you? And they have mines throughout the cave. That means we could possibly just have to walk through the mountain. It would cut down a lot of time and walking, and we could navigate it if we had one of their miners lead us through or give us directions once inside."

Star sighs and simply admits defeat. "Alright Lace, you're the boss. I trust you enough."

"Whoa whoa whoa, I never agreed to be a leader in all of this." You retort back. You had no clue that she thought of you that way, but the others begin to increase that popular opinion.

Hex croaks. "I would have assumed you were the leader of this little pack anyway. Your consent doesn't seem to be the case here, Lace."

You look to Jackal in hopes he'd disagree with them, but he just shrugs, "Hey man, I think my first words when joinin' ya was that I'd follow you. People follow leaders man."

You reach a forepaw to rub down your face, "Listen, I never asked to be some kind of...leader in this. There is no leader in this group. We all work together, and that's the general consensus."

Hex giggles and lifts his hand up, "Well then. Everyone in favor of inducting Lace as the group leader, say 'aye'." A resounding motion of raised arms and a chorus of 'aye' came from everyone. Heck, even Gold from the ground did so.

A hint of embarrassment was shown on your face as you figure out there was no escaping this. "E-Err, let's just change the subject. Rather, let's do a vote on what we do next. Those in favor for going into town to use the mines as a shortcut?" You lift your hand, as does Jackal and Hex. But Gold, Eden, and Star don't.

Star offers, "Well if we're doing a vote, who's in favor of not just blindly going into town to get gangbanged but whatever's happening in there?" Star and Eden raise their arms, but the Golduck remains unsided. "Gold, you didn't even vote." The Luxray huffs.

The duck whines as he tiredly stretches on the ground, as if he was going to take a nap right on the grass path. "Hrrrrrgghh, ugh, both of your plans just involve more walking and little-to-no prostitutes. I vote for my own plan."

Eden whips his ankles together and raises him up high, causing the Golduck to writhe and quack wildly in the air, "Overruled. You have to be the tie we need if we want to win the vote. I'll let you go if you vote for us~"

Jackal grunts, "H-Hey! That's no fair! Well if you're bribing the vote, then Lace should count for two votes since he's the leader."

You exhale with a whine and your ears flatten some, "...Please stop bringing that up."

Gold sways back and forth in a frantic manner, swiping his clawed hands about and missing Eden's ensnaring vines, "Grrrrr! Fine! Jeez! I vote for whatever gets me in a bed faster to at least relax! Arceus knows I need a private break from all of you people."

Hex brightens up, "Then that would be for Lace's plan! Sorry ladies~" He chuckles happily as Eden drops Gold flat on the ground, crossing her bouquet arms.

The Roserade huffs, "Why am I not surprised. Gold can never satisfy women in what they want."

Jackal cups a hand over his mouth to keep a chuckle in. Apparently the burn was even a little too hot for the Typhlosion. But Gold didn't partake in the stifled laughter whatsoever, and raises a clawed fist from the ground, "Ohhhohhhhoh. You're on, bitch. What does a fuckin' plant know anything about-"

"Vote's over." You interrupt before grabbing Gold's vengeful hand, hauling him back up to a stand for him to jerk his wrist out of your grasp and grumble to himself before you continue, "We're going into Hedgen, and we'll try to convince them to go through their mine if it'll cut us some time and distance."

The Luxray sighs, running a hand on her forehead, "...Alright, fine. Just please make sure you know what you're doing when you do."

"I wouldn't endanger all of us if I wasn't sure. Look, we can just go in, keep our eyes peeled, and stick together. We can leave if things get too close for comfort. Okay?" You suggest. The Luxray and Roserade simply nod their heads.

Out from the doorway of Hedgen, Bronze the Marowak keeps the door open, "Are any of you coming? Or are you leaving? I assume you have questions, and I'll be eager to answer. Do not worry, it is safe within these walls. But the trees have...ears. We cannot dilly-dally out in the open like this."

"We'll be right there." You answer. Looking to your companions, they all put their faith in you, and you all step through the gates.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Welcome to Hedgen

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Scared people. Several villagers are scattered around the nice-looking quiet town, but many of their expressions showcase their concern, with some type of fear of you. Bronze is leading you towards a quint little cottage as he mentions, "There is my home, we can talk there." Your group remains silent as well from all of the eyes observing them like other-worldly creatures.

Star can't help but whisper into your ear, "Laaaaaaaaaaace...?"

You grab her hand behind you to squeeze, "Just keep walking. We'll be fine if we're all together in the house." You release her hand when all of you make to his door. Just then, a voice from the villagers calls out, "Monsters!" A sudden stone is thrown from in the midst of the crowd to fly right towards you. Gasping and preparing to take the hit, the rock clacks away to the floor after Bronze deflects it with his large bone.

"Enough!" He calls out. "These people are not Damien's. They have brought Clubs and Jabber back to our town safe and sound. They don't mean any harm." Jackal looks over to you to mouth the word, 'Damien?' at you, but you merely shrug in confusion as to who that was. The village people seem to become more calm and murmur to each other while dispersing, going about their day once more. The Marowak turns to you and gestures his head, "My apologies for that. Please, come in. You must be tired if you dealt with ferals at the tar pits."

He opens the door for all of you to funnel inside. The place was certainly cozy with a wooden structure and fine stone slabs along a fireplace that was roasting. A young Piplup maid bows to the Marowak, "Welcome back Mr. Bronze. Shall I fix the guests anything?"

The Marowak bows to her and turns to all of you, "Thirsty? Famished, anyone?" All of you shake your head in the uneasiness of the situation. "Bah, well please fetch me some tea, dear." The penguin bows again and heads off through double doors into a kitchen. Bronze walks to a velvet chair and slumps into it with both hands on his bone staff, resting it up in front of him. "Well then. Make yourselves at home. I have plenty of seats in here."

All six of you cautiously take your spots for whatever chairs or stools there were in the living room area. You begin the conversation right off the bat. "What's going on in this town? Who's Damien?"

Bronze sighs as he grips his cane, "A fool is the best way to describe him. But he is a fool with power." He points to a painting on a wall right above the fireplace. It is a framed portrait of a Houndoom. "The person you see there is Aldan. He was the original owner of this manor and the sole reason this town, and another, exists."

Star sits a bit up from the sound of the dog's name, "Wait, you mean...Aldanwood? I-I'm from there."

Bronze continues, "Indeed I do. It was named after him after he founded it several years ago. He was a part of a lumber service that helped this small mining town grow economically, as well as supplying homes for refugees in return for their workload. He was a great man, greater than anyone I have ever known. He began a small lumberyard here long ago that was able to help support our mines from collapsing and aiding our excavation. His business grew, as well as his popularity. He had gone onto craft new towns outside of this one in an effort to benefit not just his own citizens, like Aldanwood for instance. I never liked the name of the place, and neither did he. It was too on the nose, you know?"

You simply just ask, "What...does this have to do with Damien?"

The Marowak clears his throat before explaining, "Damien is Aldan's son. His only son." The Piplup girl returns with a tea set on a tray. She lays it out on a table for the Marowak as he thanks her, "Just leave it there. I can pour it myself. You can return to your duties upstairs." After bowing and leaving, Bronze pours his tea and sips it to continue, "Aldan was out during the construction of another town when...it happened. The infection was spreading across other towns when we caught word of it, especially since outsiders of other towns fled to this one. After days of dealing with the first wave of ferals, the village agreed to begin construction of the outer wall you saw outside to keep the infected at bay as we did our best to defend it. But it was a difficult time. Without Aldan, the villagers didn't know who to turn to for leadership. But Damien still remained in the town and he took the role of his father and the lumberyard."

"What was wrong with Damien?" You ask him.

"He was young. Stupid. Reckless. And most of all, merciless." The Marowak says with a very serious and angered tone. "His priorities did not lie in the protection of Hedgen. But saw it as his own personal empire. He rationed the food poorly. Only those who went out on hunts with him were allowed the large enough rations to stay strong and full. Anyone else was just given a pathetic excuse for a meal. His excuse was if you're nothing but food to the ferals, than why do you deserve to have food?"

Eden grows more curious. "What do you mean by, hunts?"

"He goes out and -finds- ferals. He and his hunting pack rape them, torture them, kill them, or even eat them themselves. The monsters had become victims to their own perversion. Damien has become no better than they have. He doesn't do it to rid the area of ferals. Rather, it's to show his dominance. That lousy mutt feels the need to physically show that his youth and name does not make him strong. It's his own will." The Marowak answers as he pours himself some more tea to idly swirl in his cup.

You try to take the news as best you can, "What happened to Aldan?"

"We do not know." Bronze sighs in displeasure. "We waited for his return, but with communication difficult from how dangerous the world has become, we never did get any word on his where-abouts."

Star curls her tail around in her lap, tugging at it in her own hands, "That's...terrible. Why didn't you fight back?"

Bronze shifts a glare at the one-eyed Luxray, "We did. After too much abuse to the villagers from Damien and his corrupted followers, the rest of the town rebelled and chased him out of town. But that hasn't stopped him...now he wants our town back. In his head, it is still his."

"Where is he?" You ask.

"His father's lumberyard outside of town. He's made the place into a well-fortified fortress now since he still has followers. Their numbers have grown since then, and he's convinced many people to join his gang of ruffians. Every now and then, we are raided by them. They steal our resources, pillage some of our buildings, kidnap some of our people, and even take our precious and limited farm food. It's why you found Clubs and Jabber out looking for more seeds. We lacked enough to plant to keep everyone well-fed. If you hadn't shown up, we would've been heartbroken over Clubs and Jabber's loss, but also potentially doomed without their farmwork and the seeds they collected. We are in your gracious debt." The Marowak sips more of his tea before setting the empty cup down.

"Why haven't you defended your town then? Did you even try to take down that lumber place?" Jackal questions.

Bronze snaps back, "The last time we did that, I became a cripple." Now that you thought about it, he was indeed too young to look as withered as he did. From the glow of the fire, you could see the faint scars all around his body. "You saw those people outside. Do we look like soldiers? We could hardly protect ourselves when it was just Damien and a few when he lived in this town. How are we supposed to take him on now that he outmatches us?"

"We can help." You reply. Jackal slowly turn his head with widening eyes and a bit of a tilt, Clearly he didn't enjoy your sudden volunteering.

Gold sits up a bit yelling, "Hey hey hey! Whaaat?! Uhm. I thought we did things by a vote. Wasn't that a thing? I say it should be a thing. I vote that this whole political dog shit ain't our problem."

Jackal agrees, "Yeah, I'd prefer it if we put a bit more thought into it before we-"

"All of you don't have to do anything." You cut the Typhlosion off before looking back over to the Marowak and continuing while you take a stand, "I'm going to try and stop him. It's my intention to save this world one monster at a time, infected or not. I told you before Jackal. No one gets left behind."

Bronze smiles weakly to try and hide some overwhelmed feelings. "Y-You...don't have to do that. But this town would be forever in your debt..."

The Golduck raises a brow then, "Oh so can I like, sit this one out then? I mean if you want to go alone and get yourself killed, go for it buddy."

Star scowls at Gold before warning you, "Lace, you're being far too hasty. You need to think about what you're going to do before you-"

"I do have a plan." You say to cease her concern. "And I'm going over to their hideout, today."
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: The Town History

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"You're crazy. I'm not even going to try and reason with you. Cause there's no point in reasoning with someone who doesn't seem to understand the concept of reason." Your Typhlosion partner explains to you as you sit crouched against some bushes. You don't answer him as you stare ahead at the apparent fortress Bronze had mentioned to you. After your meeting with Bronze inside the manor in Hedgen, you had gone out with the agreement for the Marowak to lead you to the lumber camp Damien and his gang reside in. Your group decided to hang back at the village under your recommendation, but Jackal was too stubborn to let that happen. He tagged along with you, complaining along the whole trip. He nudges at your side, "But at least give me a sign that you're at least listening."

"Please be quiet. I don't anyone to hear you." You answer.

Jackal grumbles some but huffs in a whisper to himself, "Fair enough."

From behind you, Bronze creeps low and whispers, "Alright...are you sure you want to go through with this? This is the only time I've managed to get this close to the place without being seen or caught. I can't make any promises I can do it again."

"I'll be fine. They don't know anything about me, and from what you told me, they're welcoming anyone that wishes to join their cause and kill ferals."

The Typhlosion gulps and glances over to you. "Yeah but...you don't actually enjoy killing ferals, right?"

You give Jackal a small wink and a toothy grin which drains his face to become pale until you assure him, "Of course not. But what's done is done. There wasn't nothing else I could do for the ones I've had to take care of." Reflecting back on all of the infected you've harmed or killed, it did become worrisome that you were enjoying it when you devoured them. A sudden insatiable hunger just grows inside you, and it seems logical to just eat them. However powerful this psychic was, its influence was surely great, but avoidable with the right morality and willpower.

Jackal huffs, "So what's your plan then? You go up to them saying, 'Hi, I'm a bloodthirsty monster just like you guys. Can I join your creep-club?' and expecting them to welcome you with open arms?"

"Something along those lines." You mention back to him before standing up and walking forward to the lumber camp. Jackal hurriedly gets up to try and match your pace with a nervous frown on his face.

Bronze whispers as he slowly steps back, "I'm headed back to the village now...good luck you two...you're more than our town deserves."

You look to see the lumber yard is just ahead with the sun actually beginning to set over the shaded horizon of pine trees. Hopefully you could meet back up with your team during nightfall. Perhaps late at night would be the best time to tear this place down. Looking over to Jackal, you explain to him, "It might be best if I do all of the talking when we meet these people. Who knows what they're like, and I don't want us giving two different stories that makes us look suspicious. If they take joy in eating ferals, they probably do so to spies as well."

The Typhlosion shudders at the thought and just grunts, "O-Okay."

Getting closer to the gate of it, you see a massive fenced structure of tree logs raised high and tall, maybe two or three stories high with the tops of the logs sharped in spikes. A patrolling Bibarel walking along a balcony behind the fence glances over and spots two silhouettes approaching the encampment, making him yell out, "Hey! Halt right there!"

You and Jackal stop in place as you hint quietly to him, "Don't try to seem cowardly. Just act casual, and act confident."

A loud bell rings and several more guards arrive at the top of the fence structure to peer over, with a couple more stepping out through the opening gates, all equipped with spears. A Jolteon guard close to you ignites his fur to static with electricity, bringing some light to the scene to highlight both you and Jackal for the others to see. The beaver atop the gates yells out, "Who are you two? Why have you come here?"

"A couple of neighbors wanting to know who blew up their way home." You explain to him to get an odd look, even from Jackal.

"....What?" He asks.

"My friend and I live past the tar pits closeby. He and I were hunting together, only to come back to the tar pits to get across just to see most of the walkways destroyed. I want to know if any of your men had something to do with that, because now we're having a tough time getting back home. The routes around the pits are too crowded with ferals to get by." You explain to him; the other guards giving weary looks to one another.

The Bibarel huffs, "Too bad for you. None of my men would do a thing like that since we use those walkways too. Now beat it, before we-"

"Now now Bigby, don't be so harsh." A roaming voice from behind the beaver states that has the Bibarel, Bigby, freeze in place. A black hand cups over his shoulder with a young Houndour approaching at his side, smiling down at you and your friend. "We heard a commotion from the tar pits and investigated the area. Someone or some people really stirred some of the local ferals up in that area. Sorry to hear about your home though. Perhaps we could discuss it inside over some ale? It's awfully chilly out here."

"Much appreciated." You state with a grin. You motion for Jackal to follow you with who you assume is Damien to announce, "Let them inside. Have them meet me in the saloon~"

The beaver just defeatedly growls, "...Y-Yes sir..." With much disgust, the other guards allow you to pass and enter inside the camp with Jackal. Many unconvinced eyes stare at you with each step you take, but you only seem to have to get Damien's opinion over theirs. Hopefully that won't be too difficult...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Deathwish

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Laughter, booze, merry chanting, and wrestling fills the room as you're lead into a large circular parlor up inside the wooden fortress. Many tough looking Pokemon reside inside the saloon area at a large bar with kegs of ale and liquor, scattered about at tables that are either drinking, boasting, or arm wrestling. Sometimes all three. There's even a section in the middle of the room that's a short pit in a hexagonal shape with a dome of fenced wood over it, with thin logs and sticks woven together to make for a caged small arena of sorts with a sandy dirt floor and two large gates at each side. You preferred not to know what goes on down there, and the openings of the roof of it was probably for the guards to watch whatever sport took place in there.

Bigby the Bibarel is the one to lead you up a short staircase the ends with a lounge area balcony that looks over the entire saloon with several bits of cushioned furniture and tables there, along with Damien the Houndour. The fat beaver in front of you steps aside with his arm gesturing you to enter, but a firm scowl is locked on his face when you and Jackal pass. Damien is relaxed on a plush couch with his arms spread and holding the back of it; his legs kicked up and crossed atop a close table.

He wags his tail and with a toothy grin, welcomes you, "May I introduce you to my humble home and family. Please, sit my guests! I have much I want to talk to you about."

You take your seat with an adjacent couch with Jackal nervously and quietly sitting right next to you. "Thanks." You answer with Damien leaning forward some.

"How do you like furniture? It's stuffed from the coats of a local Mareep girl we keep around in the basement. A feisty lass she is, and grows plenty of fluffy wool. At first we did it to her just to keep her busty body naked, but then I had the genius idea to make some actual use of it all and her! Pretty neat, right?"

You do your best not to deck the bastard then and there and simply chuckle to try and blanket a growl, "...Remind me to thank her for the nice ass treatment. Makes me wish I had this stuff back at home."

"Oh riiiiight! Your home. Sorry to hear about the tar pit walkways going down and all. I have my men searching for the fuckers who tore it down at the moment. Just give them a bit of time, and they'll find them~" Damien answers and snickers.

Just then, a Lopunny woman makes her way up to the steps of the balcony with a tray of drinks, quietly stepping towards the Houndour who eagerly stares at her with a cruel grin. She sets a thick mug of ale at the table by Damien and quietly mentions, "There you go, Damien. Filled to overflow the top just like you want."

The young canine smiles with his fangs and suddenly cups an arm around the bunny to tug her in close to him, almost falling onto the couch with him. "Oh Daisy...you're so good to me. What did I ever do to deserve such a wonderful slut like you?"

The girl can't even look Damien in the eyes, just stuttering weakly, "J-Just treating me well, D-Damien. Anything else I can get you?"

You spot his hand snaking down to her brown rump, squeezing an ass cheek to get an unwilling squeak from the Lopunny with him sneering, "How thoughtful of you my beautiful bitch! Just get my two new guests here something to quench their thirst~"

She tries to fight off his hand to turn away with a fake smile to head down the stairs, but he suddenly pops her rear with a swift spank that leaves a glowing mark there on her cheeks. "...And head to my quarters later tonight, won't you? I need to show you how much I appreciate your work~"

The Lopunny doesn't look back at him, but you can see the expression of dread on her face as she just silently nods and heads back down in a bit of a hurried pace. You feels something oddly familiar about the Lopunny, but you're brought back to the issue at hand once Damien's attention is back on you. He takes a large swig of his drink and loses the smile on his face, "So. Care to explain to me that in all my years that I've been in this area, I've never seen or heard a trace of you two 'neighbors' in my land."

You reply with the straightest face you can manage, "We're a bit of travelers of sorts. We simply nest out in a spot until its dry of some resources or too over-crowded with ferals for our tastes. The tar pits made a good way to fence off intruders and other ferals. We manage on our own as hunters during the days. It's how we've managed to live so long."

"Ahh, hunters for survival or for sport?" Damien asks with a bit of intrigue and swirling his drink in his cup.

"A bit of both." You say with a smile.

The Houndour sets the drink down, but something tells you that he probably wouldn't even be legal to drink liquor at all. He looks and feels like he could just be an older teen. But his expression is less hostile at this point, "Mmmhhmmm. Well, perhaps I should actually introduce myself. The name's Damien, and this is my lovely family." He turns to look over his shoulder, past the balcony fence that overlooks the entire large room of other guards and punks. "From the bedrock to the summit!" He calls out loudly

The entire crowd littered about immediately stop what they were doing, slamming their fists to a surface near them in unison to cry out, "From the bedrock to the summit!"

Damien gives a small wave for the men to resume their actions with him glancing back at you, "A strong crowd that does whatever it wants, when it wants. I keep them in-line. And who might you two be?" His eyes particularly peer over to Jackal who hasn't said a word, and more importantly, didn't look confident.

"I'm Lance, and this is my partner, Zack." You explain. Jackal opens his mouth to speak, but immediately interrupt with, "He doesn't talk much!" The Typhlosion simply shuts his mouth and just plays along, looking rather disgruntled off to the side.

Damien nods his head, "Hmmm, alright Lance. Mind if I ask you why you suspected of my men tearing the walkways down?"

"I tried going to some town nearby for some questions, but the cowards wouldn't let me in or talk to me. They mentioned your group, so I figured I'd check."

"Ah, you're talking Hedgen." Damien huffs before tilting his cup over his head, ramping down an entire mugs' worth of ale down his mouth to slam the cup back down, exhaling greatly. "Hmph. That village is a place for good-for-nothing townsfolk who can't help themselves or anyone without discipline. I used to run that place, you know, but they couldn't see my vision eye-to-eye. Bastards tried casting me out, but luckily I've gotten several people to understand my campaign." He stands up and rubs over his flat stomach, showing a bit of his abs. "With a bit of time, I got this place up and running as a base of operations. My men and I built this mill as we wanted to, all without the townsfolk's help who left us to die in the outside wilderness with the infected. But I'm not like them. I know where I fit on the scale of society and nature. From the bedrock I rose to the summit, I became the top of the food chain. Not the ferals. The infected are scared of this land. We go out and hunt them to take the fight back. Unlike the worthless souls of Hedgen, including this fucked-up planet. This world has gone out of order as of late, but I'm going to set it back how it should be."

He looks over his men and continues, "These men know where they stand in the natural order, and they'll follow me to the top where I belong. We'll plow anyone who stands in our way of what we deserve underneath us, because if you can't take what you want, you don't deserve to even try or live. I will never be a castaway again. I will be better than anyone who looks down on me. As will these men."

Damien glances back to you and grins. "From the bedrock to the summit is our code. Our creed if you will. We're gonna become a fierce army that takes back that town and use it for what it's meant for. Restart the mines. Control the entire mountain there from top to bottom. Clean the entire area of ferals with hunting parties. And that should be fun with the amount of people we have. We'll make sure we rape the Hell outta those freaks to never think about a cock or pussy again. Any weakling who can't adapt to our standards will be forced to mine or eaten. If they won't benefit us, eating them certainly will. That way they're not such a waste."

Jackal gives you an uneasy look and you struggle to remain seated in your chair. Everything about this young brat made you want to shove him off the balcony right off the spot, but that was simply a suicide attempt with how many people you and Jack would have to fight.

Damien stares at you to get your reaction, adding, "So Lance and Zack. You want to join us in our trek uphill, plunder what you want, fuck any girl you have your eyes on, eat any shithead who messes with you, or would you prefer being on the opposite of that spectrum. We fuck you up to our hearts' content and throw you out like garbage when we're done or digested you with the others who decided that they were, 'above our cause'?"

You stand up, ready to choke the runt out on the spot until you're interrupted when the Lopunny slave girl comes back. She quietly sets two drinks on the table and gives a bow. She heads back down and you're left looking down at the drink with Damien and Jackal's eyes on you. Taking the mug of golden booze, you think about splashing the spoiled Houndour with it, only to just raise it up some to him.

"From the bedrock to the summit." You say before chugging a thick swig of your beverage.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Damien's Camp

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
The stale drink made you almost want to spit it right back onto the Houndour's grinning face, but your restrained yourself and forced it down. Oddly enough, a mere sip of the liquor was harder to get down than the first feral you ate. Your eyes unfocus some and blink a bit, unsure of how to handle such a strong drink, yet you manage your stance and composure enough to convince Damien otherwise. The Houndour claps his hands in congratulations, "Atta' boy~!" He looks over to 'Zack' who looks a little dumbfounded and later took a cup up quickly to chug it down. Maybe Jackal was a more common drinker or simply had more of a tough drive than you, because he swallowed the pint with ease down into his belly. He smacks the cup down on the table leaving nothing in it but suds. He wipes his mouth with an arm before patting his gut to leave Damien chuckling, and later, laughing. "Hahahahaaa. I like you two boys! Oh but I shouldn't say that now should I? You're men! Men apart of my lovely, caring family that can enjoy life like the rest of us civilized people."

He takes his own heavy swing of his cup and set it down. He sighs with an open maw and floppy dog tongue with a face of complete satisfaction on his face like he just accomplished something great. "I don't know what it is, but I think I can really enjoy you two. Oh, and speaking of enjoying two...~" The Houndour grins when looking ahead that you look over your shoulder to see what it was. The same Lopunny girl comes back with more drinks and two other companions; both of them Persians. Damien murrs out with extended arms, "Ah, my precious bitches. C'mere you lovelies~" Both of the cats saunter past you and give mischievous looks to you before settling on the couch with Damien, one in each of his arms at his sides. Cuddling up to him, you discover that they look practically identical. Their heights and age look the same with the only difference being that one was female with a blue gemstone on its head with the other being male with a red gemstone. They purr with curling tails and rest their hands against Damien's chest and sides, stroking at his masculine and lithe figure while flashing you naughty glances. The Houndour continues, "These two are the most prized possessions a lucky dog like me could ever have. Meet the twins! This lovely goddess laying next to my right is Sapphire..."

The blue gemstoned Persian murrls out, "Hi there cuties~" She says to you and Jackal, followed with a wink and a stuck-out tongue.

"...And the seductive devil here to my left is Ruby." Damien adds when nudging up along the red gemstoned Persian.

"A pleasure to meet you two. Are these the latest toys for the group? I love fresh takes, especially when they're nice young men~" Ruby says while tracing his fingers over Damien's abs.

Jackal gulps silently to himself before Damien interrupts with bellowing laughter, "Hahaha! Oh you wish Roobz. I'm the only nice young man you need~" The Houndour leans his mouth over to expose his teeth, grazing them over the male Persian's neck to force Ruby to release a much needed 'mrrrowl' of pleasure from his mouth. Damien then glances back to the both of you and explains, "No, actually, they're not. But you were right about them being new. They've just joined a moment ago after just a simple conversation! And I plan on getting to know them a bit better. The mysterious but dashing Lucario is Lance, and that tubby Typhlosion is Zack. Apparently doesn't talk too much though, so maybe you could coax him to socialize a bit more~?"

Sapphire smiles and slowly slides off of Damien to crawl on her hands and knees low on the table between the two parties. Her face expresses a hungry look as she's prowling with sauntering hips like an actual cat. Her breasts drag over the flat surface of the table underneath her as he blue eyes lock to Jackal. Licking her lips, she purrs aloud, "Oooooh, I bet I could make him sing. I like it when I can make big men moan higher than a girl can~"

She slowly rises up from her knees to show off her naked breasts adorning her chest and glides her hands up along her curvy sides to cup over the round mounds. Jackal's face flares red with his jaw craned open slightly, truly unable to say anything either way as the Persian bites her bottom lip. "Heehee. Are you sure I can't keep him as my cat toy~? He looks so cute when I can make him flush hot like that by just teasing him. Mmhhh. Do you think he'd jizz if I just touched him? He looks so desperate for a woman. Let me see where his weak spot is~" She slides off of the counter and begins to shift over onto Jackal's lap, getting his mane of fire to erupt a blazing heat behind him with nose lightly bleeding a bit from having the attractive feline welcome herself over onto him. His hands weakly go over to cup against the side of her thighs while her own plant against his wide tummy to smush into the taut pudge a bit. "Ohh, he's definitely a big fella. Certainly hasn't missed out on a meal or brawl. But let's see just how big you really are~!" Her rear end begins to swirl around on top of his lap to get Jackal to look over to you with worry and reddened cheeks. A small bit of blood even leak over the end of his snout.

You try to stop her by suggesting, "U-Uh, er, heh actually, I wouldn't bother. He's pretty small when it comes to length."

Jackal's mane gives an obvious flare of its flames and he grits his teeth in a scowl. He didn't seem to enjoy wanting rescue that way. Damien laughs. "Hohohooooooo...oh Lance. Way to demoralize your poor friend there, cause damn. Does that mean you two have fun with one another~? Maybe you should have Ruby then if men are what you want. I guarantee he'll milk you dry to where you could just die in joy~"

The male Persian stands up at the sound of this, showing his obvious twinky build with a taut and cute rump on him, little to no muscle on him. His grin is wide to one side of his face, and each step he takes towards you is in front of the other paw. Dancing his tail behind him, he murrs, "Kitties need their milk. But I like feeding from my meat straws in private. Maybe I can get to know you more, Lance, uncover some naughty secrets about you~" His hands rest on his hips while leaning to one side. His own tongue runs over his mouth as you're left with your own problem. Jackal is too busy struggling to fight off the other Persian's advances, grunting and murring with glee as her soft, thin-furred form courses over him in a chest to chest slow lap dance.

Damien shows off his teeth from a smirk to say, "Oh well, I was going to invite Lance upstairs to the balcony and show him the game. You should get a real kick out of it, Lancey boy. But if you want to play with either of my precious cats, go right ahead. You can see me afterwards to discuss your living arrangements and have some fun! Just remember. If my bitches are unhappy, I'm unhappy. Don't make me unhappy. Give em' a real treat and they'll treat you just fine~"

You're given a tough choice now as you look between all three of your options here. You see the playful female cat straddled on Jackal and getting him to lose his focus and composure. But her just teasing him would just all be in good fun, right? Clearly Jackal would want it. Probably a bit more. But you wouldn't want him saying something stupid either to get you both caught so you could simply take Sapphire away somewhere private. You could have some fun yourself that way if you wanted to. Then there's Ruby who has a brow raised at you and that same grin on his face. It seemed insincere however, and it was obvious he didn't trust you just yet. It might be good to head with him somewhere and get yourself on his good side, but who knows what he was planning. Then there was Damien himself. It would be wise to go along with him, but that leaves Jackal all alone with both of the Persians, and with Sapphire's work on him and Ruby's caution about you both, maybe that wouldn't be such a good idea either. Then again, Jackal would flip if a man tried to advance him in any way, so maybe he would be okay then actually? All he had to do was keep his trap shut. You didn't know what was best...

[Author's Note: There will be a third choice to go with Ruby when I get a Membership with Writing.com again. Basic Memberships allow you to make a third interactive option with a chapter. I don't know when I will cause I'd rather put money towards things like, you know, food, to live and stuff. But I wanted a trio of choices open for people, to those who want to continue the story, or have a nice bad end with either preference you have, male or female. Sorry about that!]
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: From the Bedrock

choices: You don't have to play the game, right...?
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Damien was the most important choice to go with. Jackal's sexual tension could be sacrificed when it came to the goal of stopping this Houndour. You needed to learn all that you could about him and his fortress before you and the others could take it all down, with the exact same happening for him as well. You sit up from your seat with hands on your hips, retorting back, "Maybe I'll show your cats how a Lucario really does it another time. I'm interested in what this game is actually. Is it something you guys do for fun?"

The Houndour's expression changes to an intrigued one as he begins to head off and away from the couch, "Hehheh...something like that!" He cups an arm around Ruby to secure a quick kiss to the male Persian, murring quietly afterwards to the cat's ear, "I'll leave you two to the poor chubby bastard over there. But keep him around, alright~? That goes for the Lucario too. I'd actually like to keep a new set of recruits for once. Got it?"

The feline passes a glance to the canine, brushing the arm away with a hand as he struts off to join his sister. You can't help but notice his eyes glaring at you for a moment when he continues by you, all before reaching Jackal. Damien pats his own side and begins to head for some stairs. "C'mon! Allow me to show you one of my favorite parts about my family and my home." His tail swaggers about behind him as you follow him without much delay.

From behind, your ears catch the sounds of Ruby's voice murring, "Well well now, big boy, looks like I need to-" He's suddenly cut off by Jackal angrily retorting, "Oh HELL no!" with a lot of thrashing in his seat. Seems like he didn't enjoy the male's company all that much. You can only pray that it was the right choice.

You ascend the stairs, walking past other aggressive looking men with a major lack of women around. Perhaps it's because women probably wouldn't be around to just freely roam or drink...they'd be handled differently by the 'fellow' brethren. It only convinces you it was a good idea to leave behind the other members of the group like Star and Eden, and it encourages you all the more to slam Damien's skull against your fist. Damien quietly continues to head up level by level, gifting you enough time to see just how many people he's claimed in his cause, which was nothing more than a cult. It worries you just how many men there are that seem just as vile as Damien, gambling, drinking, patrolling the halls with unfamiliar looks on their faces when they notice you with their leader. The constant glances slow you down some, only to feel something big and furry shove against your back to force you forward a few steps. You twist around to see the brown gut of the Houndour leader's guard, Bigby. The Bibarel doesn't smile or anything, and merely tips his head to get you moving. "Don't stop now. You heard the boss." You scowl back at him some, knowing that he was probably going to be a problem later on. But no use in starting a fight. Turning back around, you head off to where Damien went up to find yourself out on a balcony with him now. You were several floors high in the wooden lumber mill, seeing a good bit of the pine forest around. But something was directly below the fenced patio that looked to be an assortment of bushes. A coach is laid close to the guard railing of the balcony with Damien already lounging along it, keeping a leg crossed over the other and an arm lazed over the back of it with a large bronze gong next to it.

The younger dog smile at you and tosses his head to get you over. You stand in front of the coach but have yet to sit in it. You curiously look over the fence to see what exactly was there to see, only to have the Houndour explain, "So...sadly not everyone in my family gets along...and sometimes they even go as far to think of themselves and only for themselves. That doesn't fly with me. So we've created a little punishment for those who wish to sink themselves back down to the bedrock. It's the game~"

It was a maze. Tall brick walls covered in overgrown ivy make a circular labyrinth to navigate through, and some areas were completely concealed with brick ceilings and what looked like dens. Many grunts and growls echoed from the walls, with some of the ivy along the walls shifting with movement in the rounding alleyways and paths that you aren't quick enough to fully see. But you had a good idea what was in that maze. You turn to look at the fang-grinning Houndour with Bigby behind him, arms crossed, standing behind his boss with a rather smug look to rile a reaction. You clear your throat, "So...poor bastards get thrown in there, huh?"

Damien is quick to snap by leaning forward with a single finger jetting out to banter at you, "No, useless bastards get thrown in there! Cowards. Traitors. And especially thieves."

"So just taking something equates to execution, huh?" You retort, but Damien doesn't budge his expression.

He's even eager to answer, "Abso-fucking-lutely. Because when you're a thief, you're no better than a killer. Perhaps even worse. Because when you steal something vital from someone like our food or supplies? That's essentially just making life harder on us, y'know? You're a parasite slowly picking us off. It's a slow death. Those who steal get the same treatment as they do with their victims..." He glances back a Bigby, nodding to him to get the large and chubby beaver to ring a bell. You hear shuffling above them as Damien walks over to the fence, leaning against it with you. "...a slow demise. Stewing in some animal's gut down there."

A Staraptor bandit suddenly flies off the roof from the canopy above you, carrying another person with him. It was a Manectric, strapped in a black rubber harness, muzzle, and overall suit to cease any powerful electrical attacks he could use against his captor. He's struggling madly, trying to fight off the hold of the avian with his mouth barking, "G-Ggrrrmphh!! Fuck...gnnh, you Damien!"

The Houndour merely smiles and waves to the bound dog before calmly talking to your way, eyes locked on his prisoner, "That's Saul. I liked Saul some, until one of my fellow men caught him sneaking out a cart of fruit and vegetables that weren't really his to take. After asking him nicely where he was going to take a good amount of our food to, he decided not to answer and challenged me directly instead. Call it self-defense~. So now here we are. Teaching this parasite a thing or two of what food really is. You ready Saul~?" He calls out with the last sentence. The Manectric merely curses at him again before being dropped into the labyrinth below. He yelps and rolls along the dirt before staggering up awkwardly. His arms were belted behind his back that he was having obvious trouble with to get off. Damien points a finger to Bigby to get the beaver to click a small clock to start it ticking.

The Manectric down below growls out with a furious bark, "I'm gonna kill you, you stupid brat! You're lucking none of the other men have done it!"

"Then why didn't you kill me when we had that little tussle? Oh right. It's because I handed you your own ass after I beat the shit out of it. Tell ya what! If you get out of the maze, you can get another chance to kill me! If you prove that you're above being feral chow, I'd love to dine on you myself~" The hellhound says with a cocky grin, swatting his tail about in a happy dance. "Bigby! It's dinner time!"

The Bibarel happily takes a mallet from the table with the clock and bashes the large gong, sending a tremoring noise that alerts all of the infected Pokemon in the maze. They roar in unison with their meal's heart dropping. He panicks and picks a direction to go in. The walls are too high for him to get over, and his electricity fizzles to weak amounts with the black rubber straps belting along most of his body. You and Damien both watch him when he's close enough to balcony to see over the walls, finding dead end after dead end with your own eyes as you attempt to solve the maze yourself with a higher view. But then it hits you. Looking along the whole maze, you don't see any exits points. There are some openings along the outer edges, but the first couple of ones you reverse-track also lead to just dead ends. There aren't any paths leading to those. This wasn't a maze. It was a permanent trap. You turn to look at the Houndour's face when it wasn't focusing on you, and it was this twisted sense of beauty in his eyes. The sudden yelp of the Manectric brings you back to look down and out to the maze to try and find him, and you can see the tip of his head looking at something before turning and running; and something eagerly gave chase.

It was hard to tell, but you discover it was an infected Granbull, a male one by what you saw, cornering Saul into a wall with no way around the drooling best. "H-Haghh f-fuck! Get the fuck away fr-MMmmGHK!!!" He was pounced instantly, pinned to the ground out of your view, but with the whines, dirt being kicked up, and the muffled tone of the Manectric, it was far too evident what was happening. You were rather glad you didn't have to see.

"Stop the time Bigby." Damien says, sighing with his head cupped into his hand. "...Dare I ask, what's the time?"

"A minute, forty-one seconds." The beaver huffs with a baffled look.

Damien shakes his head, "Arceus, what a fucking pathetic run. Sorry if that bored you, Lance. Usually people do better than that. Ohh well. Carve it in."

You glance over to see the infected Granbull pawing at its wobbling round belly, gurgling out ambiently along the maze walls to trot over somewhere to relax in wherever its den was in the place before you hear a wood panel turn over behind you. Bigby draws out a knife and carves Saul's name and time into it, under where the other 'players' were. You scan the panel. Dozens of names line the huge board. All with times. All of them labeled, 'The Losers'.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: The Game

choices: Have a chat and keep walking
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
You head down the stairs with Damien and Bigby directly behind you after all was said and done from the game; you remain quiet about most of it until Damien nudges your shoulder. You turn to look at his grinning face when you make it to the bottom of the staircase with his hands on his hips, "So! I don't have to worry ever tossing you in the maze, right?" You glare back at him with the Bibarel guard of his standing right there, glaring ahead at you for your answer from over Damien.

You swallow your pride and grin back, shaking your head, "Mmhhh...probably not!"

"Great! I can have Bigby show you the ropes here, probably take you to your quarters to get a room set up with your 'phlosion buddy and-" Damien begins to explain before you cut him off.

"Whoa-whoa uh, you know, uh, I can't stay here..." From what you said, Damien tilts his head with his head cocked some. There was a sick moment of silence from him as you have to continue, "...at least, not for tonight! Cause Zack and I have to get our stuff from our own hideout home! We have some important things, not a lot that we can just carry over here before we you know, settle in here. I should go find him to get our things and we'll be back tomorrow."

"You can come back tonight." A sultry male voice purrs out. You attention is brought forth to Ruby, the Persian that saunters his way over to the trio of you. His tail curls happily with his face as sly and his tone. "...You said you just lived past those tar pits right? That's hardly far away~" He lifts a brow himself with his one-sided smile and locked eyes. Just perfect. Last thing you needed was being constrained by this cat.

Damien adds on to the idea, "Yeah the sun's still out! No need for you to be out so long, right?"

You do your best not to defy the bandit leader. "Yeah, uh, sure! I guess we can get back tonight if hurry. I better go look for that big oaf before it gets dark-"

Ruby chimes in, "Oh, he's probably off having some fun with my sis. No need to waste time dragging him along. I can just come with you and help you take what you need. I overheard it wasn't much to carry~? So it shouldn't be a problem then. Call it cat-curiousity, but it'd be nice to know where you two have been hiding under our nose all this time. But we're all friends here, right~?" Even more perfect. There didn't seem to be any way out of this, and surely the Houndour would choose his favorite slut over some stranger he met moments ago.

The Bibarel even opens his dumb mouth, "Yeah, you're friend's in good hands. Ruby'll keep you good company too~"

You retain a sigh and nod, "...Alright, I guess that could work. But just remember to keep up." You head down some more steps that go down to the main atrium of the bandit mill with Ruby tagging along. The slutty cat waves his master 'ta-ta' and murrs close to the back of your ear, "Right behind you~"

As you go through the main room, you can't help but catch a few images of things. Like the several men getting served at the bar by that Lopunny girl, a large pit in the center closed off by wooden bars domed over ahead to act as a caged fighting ring. Two men are going at it each other with their fists with the crowd outside placing their bets on one or the other. You even get a glimpse of Jackal relaxing in the back of the room where Ruby's female counterpart was with him down on her knees, hands cupped to her breasts, rolling them around his twitching shaft and lapping at its head. His head is rolled back with closed eyes and an open mouth, clearly enjoying it like the time of his life. He was unable to see you, and Ruby placed his hand to your back to keep you moving forward to where the main gate outside would be. Looks like you wouldn't get the chance to talk to him. You just hope that he'd be alright by himself.

Back outside during the sunset, the forest is dark and orange, lit up by the fire of the horizon. You probably wouldn't get the chance to have a full plan with your team back at Hedgen if you want to make it back tonight. But then again, you set yourself up for this. You'd just have to find a way to take care of the untrusting cat following you and meet up with the others. Whatever you'd come up with. The assault on the lumber mill would have to be soon at night, or else something might happen to Jackal should 'Lance' and Ruby never return. The wooden gate closes behind you, and you were alone with Ruby, standing there in the wilderness.

The cat states without coyness in his voice this time, "Show me this home of yours, or you're going to regret wasting Damien's time." It was clear he planned on ridding your facade and of course deal with you were you to be an imposter. You're already walking through the pine forest away from the lumber mill with cat refusing to walk anywhere else other than behind you to see if you pull anything, and you have yet to answer him. Saying anything might just rouse more suspicion, but you certainly had to deal with him soon. The farther you'd lead him away from Hedgen, the less of time you'd have to meet up with the others and figure out a way to get Jackal back and deal with Damien.

"Jeez. Do you usually attempt to scare the hell out of newbies? Relax cat." You retort back, as if it would actually cease Ruby's caution.

You could try to gain his trust during the walk towards the tarpits, or you could just attempt to take him on right now. Might even sneak a hit or two to get the advantage...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Catwalk

choices: Take a breather. This isn't the time or place.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Attacking him right now probably wouldn't work in your favor if the cautious cat was behind you, out of sight, and with a clear intention on making sure you obey every order he demands. Getting him to settle down first and earn more of your trust along the way would be the best course of action first. And what better way than having a talk with him? It'd only make things worse if you're just awkwardly dead silent the whole trip. As you walk through the forest in a general direction you think the tar pits are in far off, you turn your head over your shoulder some to ask, "...So what's your story with Damien?"

"Hm?" The Persian asks a few paces away. You can hear the grass crunch underneath each step of his hindpaws, knowing he was well too far from you for a good punch or kick. "I'm his favorite bitch. What's there for you to not get~?"

"No, no. That's not what I meant. How did you meet him?" You ask with clear indication this time. The Persian remains silent for a good bit before speaking aloud.

"...I've known him since we were kids. We grew up in Hedgen, a town close to here. We were a trio of delinquents, you could say, with my twin sis."

You turn your head to continue walking forward with a sudden brush of air going by. It was getting colder and darker outside. The sunset wouldn't last too much longer with how dim of an orange the sky burned. "He seems pretty young to be leadin' a band of men out here in the wilderness with the infected."

"I wouldn't let his age and size fool you, mutt. He can do more than just kick and rape your big blue ass~" The cat grunts with a smile as his arms cross over his chest. His red eyes gaze at your rump during your steps as you would love more than anything than to sneer that insult down, but Ruby continues, "There's a reason why things are they way they are, you know. Damien didn't just claimed leadership. He earned it. Back when we were just kits and puppies, he was the leader of our little trio of thieves."

"No one's ever fought him for the alpha spot?" You inquire, only to be shot down immediately.

The cat laughs, "He's had more fights like that than he has for sparring. Plenty of the men have challenged him or got overconfident with his ruling. And each one lost and joined those flat abs of his~" It bothers you that he's never been beaten apparently, even when thinking about the clearly large and powerful Pokemon in his family of bandits and crooks. But you've overcome impossible odds. Surely you could take him, right? Even Ruby was thinking on the subject, snickering, "You can challenge him too if you think you're up for it. Damien would probably take you and your Typhy friend on simultaneously and still make meals out of the both of you. Hehehe!"

"I think you'd miss me if that was the case." You try to deflect the subject of your demise, humoring the cat instead of protesting against him.

Ruby takes the bait and scoffs with a grin, "Oh, would I?"

You turn around, but you remain to walk backwards as you face the cat directly with a cocked brow, "Would you~?"

This gets the Persian to cock a smile of his own some. With half-lidded eyes and a smirk scrunched over to one side of his face, he murrs, "...Mmmh, I guess I would...~"

You grin back at him before pivoting around once more to continue your travel. It wasn't like you had a clue where you were going, but the Persian's mind was now on something other than wondering where your nonexistent den was. You even play with the idea of swaying your tail back and forth since the perverted cat already mentioned your ass. It was a treat the cat would definitely take notice to and enjoy.

-----|-----


         Your chest meets Ruby's own as the cat's back hits a tree. No words are exchanged between the two of your once your muzzle locks to his mouth, twining you together into a deep kiss that certainly riles the Persian up. The two of you had been walking and talking still, but it was clear you won him over with enough advances. He truly was a bitch when it came to pleasuring another male, but maybe it helped that you were a strong and capable canine like his lovable Damien. His hands are immediately wrapped around you, clinging to you as if it was for dear life that digs his claws into you some. However, you brace the pain by hungrily working your tongue in his mouth to elicit a muffled mewl of pleasure vibrating the wet walls around your probing muscle. Ruby was actually getting along with you a hell of a lot more as you continued to chat with him from your walk, but you may have gone overboard with your teases and likability, resulting in him nearly pouncing you down to fuck your brains out.

You weren't one to just turn down the offer however. Banging him was probably the best way to get him on your side of things for once. His sandpapery tongue wallows out to take control of your own tongue, but you eagerly wrestle it back. Your tongue was thicker and stronger than his own which makes it easy to pin against his cheek walls and obscure most of the room in his mouth. "M-Mmmphhrrrhpphh...!!!" He moans loud in the kiss as he begins to grind his lithe, curvy figure against you. His claws seize at your body with those thighs of his wiggling happily. A firm erection was even sporting out, and yours wasn't too far off from a full boner either.

"Hhrrhhh...~" You happily exhale out as your hands roam at his lovely sides to get handfuls of his body. It wasn't like you were going to complain about things were going.

...But perhaps you should think twice about it? Because as nice as it sounded to rail this cat, it was nighttime at this point, deep in a dark forest that already proved to have infected roaming around. You don't want to be caught by some feral when you're balls deep in this cat, but your libido implored the idea. A twisted pleasure in the threat of getting caught as you were doing it, but you attempt to shake the idea away. Why on earth would you like that...? The remembrance that the psychic villain at large behind this infection was using their influence on all Pokemon to get them into their more animalistic desires comes to mind.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Ruby Revelation

choices: Retreat to Ruby. Take it on together.
Blast if off the tree. Ruby clearly won't cooperate.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Your hands latch onto that cat's rear end to mold into your palms, feeling the taut orbs filling them while spreading that exposed pucker. The situation was beginning to win your lust over, yet you fight it, knowing fully well you didn't have any time to waste here if you want to warn your group and get Jackal back. Plus, you swore you heard a noise distantly out from behind you.

Ruby however is panting heavily with his hands exploring around at your head, running his clawtips along your noggin, muzzle, and neck with his chest rumbling from his pleasant purrs. "PrrRRrrrrRRrrr...you're keeping me waiting, you bastard..." He moans into your ear before biting it softly.

As much as you'd like to return the favor, you begin to push away from him, unpinning the Persian from the tree that he had his back to shake your head. "N-No...hold up."

"What?" He groans with a clear distaste, keeping his hands on you with an angry look of disappointment on his face. "I don't think you realize that when I want something, I get i-"

You silence him with your own hand by cupping his mouth with it, retorting in a lower voice, "No no, shhh!" He glares ahead at you with pinched brows, wriggling his short snout that tickles your palms in his whiskers, but he does indeed remain quiet as the two of you listen out for a brief moment. Nothing but the rustling of trees sounds out in the cold wind, yet there was a sudden shift farther off on the ground. Ruby slaps your hand away, only then to twist you around and slam his back to your own. "Agh! Wha-"

"If there's an infected out there, it can't sneak up on both of us, right? Goodness...I so looking forward to tonight too." He grumbles as he stares ahead, surveying the area in the darkness. You try to do the same, acting as eyes for one another's backs.

You reply with readied fists and a flick of your previously nibbled ear, "You sure we'll be able to see this thing? It's complete blackness out there." Even with some moonlight, the trees obscure the sky to where the infected could be in front of you and you wouldn't even notice.

"I can see clearly in the dark with my feline eyes. Can't say the same for you, pooch. Just look for a pair of purple dots. Their eyes fucking glow no matter what." Ruby answers as his claws are fully unsheathed out. His long tail idly brushes on one of your legs as he adds, "And after we gut this thing, I'm straddling on top of you and going to town, whether we have another infected audience or not."

You huff at that before igniting your fists with your flaming aura, illuminating some of the forest area before you in a flickering blue light. Nothing moving or purple eyed catches your attention, yet you continue to hear something shifting in the environment, like brushing smooth flesh. It was becoming louder, ever-so-faintly that really confuses your ears. It was only until you hear a branch that you fling your head upwards to surely enough catch a pair of glowing violet orbs glaring down at you. "Above us!" You say before ramming yourself against Ruby, tackling the cat down to the ground away from the large predator landing right where you once stood. It was massive in size, landing in a collected thud, yet its upper body remains upright.

Rising up to your hindpaws, the growling Persian below you grabs your hand and helps himself up to a full stance as well to face off with your now common enemy. The burning aura around your palms brightens to reveal a large unraveled snake body before you, rising up to a naga torso to an infected Serperior. The grass snake was rather large in both width, length, and muscle. Its drooling jaws spread apart with long white fangs dripping with its hot saliva unlatching from the roof of its mouth.

"HhhHHHHSSSSSSSSS...!!!" The hiss was violently loud that gets Ruby to retort, "Awh shut your trap. Let's slit this thing's throat and be done with this."

You're rather unsure about just charging at this naga head on given its sheer size. Its coiling length was thicker than plenty of other nagas around, probably just showing evidence of how many meals its had to pack its hide. Even its upper body was intimidating though, with buff arms that hadn't been underutilized with an obviously flat male chest in broad pecs. But with the help of Ruby, you were certain that you could take it down. Even with a lithe figure, the cat was most likely capable of speed, and has been in more than just a single tussle in his life if he was one of Damien's men.

Acting as though you were a part of your group, you begin to plan out, "Alright. We need to stay on opposite sides of it. So I need you to-"

"Rip its guts out? Way ahead of you puppy~!" The Persian growls before darting on ahead, clearly not following your sudden act of leadership. The infected Serperior lunges its upper body towards the cat, but Ruby was fairly quick enough to leap over it and rake his claws along its back in the process. It hisses in pain before swinging its mighty tail to smash into the cat, flinging the Persian over to a tree. Ruby yowls out, only to land his hindpaws on the tree to rebound back with another jump and get an extra rake across the Serperior's cheek. Landing with a roll, the snake goes for another reach of its tail in an attempt to nab Ruby's leg, only to receive a deafening uppercut of your aura-burning fist to its jaw. The snake slumps back in a daze as you ready an Aura Sphere between your palms, ready to blast the snake away with it.

The Serperior growls with a hand cupping its jaw, glaring ahead at you with a clear disdain of punishing you for that hit. Before it can lunge, you blast your projectile towards with a close enough range that would most likely hit it. However, Ruby tackles the snake's upper body to swing it over to the side, causing your attack to completely miss and blast a tree behind the naga. You silently curse the cat as he drapes his legs around the snake's upper sides to crush between his thighs as he goes to claw away at its face and chest. The infected hisses as its hands go to try and pry the riled Persian off, struggling to not have those claws puncture anything vital.

You groan as you're forced to go help, only to hear the violent snap of wood begin to rip and tear. You turn to the tree trunk you erupted an Aura Sphere against, seeing the tall thing of nature beginning to teeter over towards you. Diving off to the side, you hit the dirt with the timbering tree slamming down just inches from your tail and legs that wince upwards from the impact. Your heart skips a beat before you rise back up to a stand with a large tree trunk in your way of Ruby and the infected serpent fighting on the ground at the other side. Hopping up onto the fallen trunk, you're ready to help, only to have the cat's slung body slam into you after being tossed off the infected. Your back meets the ground once again as Ruby is hurled away in a roll farther off from you.

Your spinal cord clearly didn't enjoy the fall, nor did your ribs appreciate the new ache from the cat's impact either, but all of that had to be ignored with the large Serperior now slithering over the fallen tree with its purple eyes glaring down at you purposely. You begin to stagger up, needing to think of how you want to approach it next...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Good Call

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
From the large snake easily towering over you with clenched fists and coils spilling over the fallen tree to get to you slowly, it was obvious that you needed all the help you could get to take this thing down; even if that meant forcing Ruby to cooperate. You roll back up onto your hindpaws to retreat back to the fallen Persian. Ruby was on the ground groaning aloud with snarled fangs, and you reach a hand to pull him back up, "C'mon, get up!" You exclaim for him to hurry.

He slaps your hand away and begins to stagger up on his own, "I'm working on that you bitch. Now don't get in my wa-"

You didn't have time for this. With your hands yanking on his sides, you force the Persian up onto his own hindpaws and growl, "You wanna take this thing down fast? Then work with me, dammit!" You exclaim as you glance at it. "I'm gonna get the thing to focus and lunge at me. I need you behind it to attack its exposed back when it does. Think you can do that, or do you need your boyfriend Damien's help?"

"Hmph." Ruby scoffs to finally see some control from you. "Easy. Try not to get chomped, pup. I'm not helping you if you get snagged~" The Serperior angrily hisses and approaches the two of you, signalling Ruby to scatter off to the side. The naga is ready to go after the runner, but a small Aura Blast from your palms grazes its arms to make it howl out and grab the burn.

You stand before it with aura-flaming fists, ready for it to make a move. "That's right. I'm the one you want. C'mere..." You glance some to see if Ruby was around, but the Persian was long gone out of your view. You could only hope that the Persian was following through with the plan...instead of actually bailing on you to leave you to fight alone with the serpent. The Serperior glares at you with its violet gaze as its rumbles a deep and unpleasant hiss. Clearly you pissed it off, and it wouldn't take you lightly anymore. It was closing the distance from between you and itself, slithering far strongly and quicker then your legs were stepping backwards. The closer it gets, the harder it would be to dodge out of its way, and the naga knew this. You begin to feel with worry about the sudden plan you made, because even if Ruby followed through with it, you still might have the long white fangs you can see outstretching from its maw in you.

"....HhhhhhhhhhhhhHHHHSSS!!!" It hisses before making its move the moment you take a final step, lunging quickly with spread jaws. Just then, Ruby leaps off from a branch with a mewling hiss of his own, raking the Serperior's back on his way down with his clawed fingers. You luckily had thrown a punch to connect with the thing's snout to luckily have its jaws miss and snap closed right next to your face. Its upper body suddenly arcs upwards from the stinging lines on its back, fully exposing its abdomen out for you to charge another aura-building punch. Your blue flaming fist drills into the naga's abdomen, with the muscles taking a lot of the blow, but muscles or not, the force sends the snake backwards. Ruby leaps out of its teetering way for it to slam onto the earth by its own heavy weight. And together, both of you run of up to its growling head to deliver a firm and simultaneous kick to both sides of its skull for an immediate knock out of its senses. Its lengthy body and arms flop in place, but the naga is pounded out of reality and lies there limply. Its fingers and tailtip twitch, yet that's about as much of a response you and Ruby get out of it as you stand there waiting for it to get up.

You exhales more and put your hands to your knees, huffing, "I think...I think we got it... Good job, Ruby." You stare at the snake's closed eyes and partly open mouth to see if it would wake, but you don't get an immediate response from the Persian. "Ruby?" You ask when looking up, only to see the male feline stepping over the snake and sauntering his way to you with those swaying hips. The slutty cat suddenly drapes his arms around you, pressing himself right to your chest and opens his smiling mouth. There, it locks with your own muzzle to zip a sudden kiss with you. The cat purrs, lapping his rough tongue to your thick canine one while brushing flat stomachs together in his swaying dance.

"Mmmhhhrr~" The happy Persian purrs, lightly digging his claws at your back before plucking his mouth off from yours to stare his red eyes at you. "This doesn't make us friends, but take that as a compliment for doing a good enough job to be alive and well still~" His fingers trace at your spinal crease with those half-lidded eyes showing their slight admiration before he lets you go.

"It was a team effort." You retort, wiping your mouth.

"Pfft. It was, but you're lucky that I was even willing to do what you say. Damien's the only one that gets to bark orders at me, pup, and you'd be so dead right now if I didn't follow your stupid idea. You should be thanking me, Lance~" The Persian purrs, lightly walking back over to the snake.

You hold your arm to feel the stress it went through with those punches, but you reply to the confident and selfish cat with, "Right, but so should you. I don't act as bait for just anyone, and I'd hate to see something awfully terrible happen to you." That was a lie of course, but you had to get on his good side.

Ruby flicks his tail at you. "Hmhmhm...trying to flatter me, pup? Many men have tried, but only once succeeded. But I'll keep the thought in mind~" He smiles at you from over his shoulder before taking his attention to the defeated Serperior. "Poor Thrashie."

"Thrashie...?" You say as you approach Ruby's side.

The cat explains, "This is Thrash. Or at least, I'm pretty sure it is. The snake bastard was a part of the family. Only a naga like him was so focused on his looks and body. Muscle-flexing numbskull. He went out alone one night to prove a point that he could bring back any infected alive to Damien, and now look at the dumb cocky bastard. He just ended up like one of them."

"Oh...I'm...sorry." You mutter when looking down at the snake, thinking back on every feral you've met was once just a person. Ruby suddenly laughs some though to take you out of the moment.

"Sorry? Don't sweat it, pup. I never really liked the guy. In fact, it's pretty ironic, ain't it~? We all made bets that he either got eaten or fucked by a stupid feral. Guess I have some winnings to collect. I had a hunch the big worm was always a whiny sub hungry for dick in his mouth~" The Persian chuckles to himself at the misery of his fallen comrade before heading to his tail. Picking it up, he orders, "C'mon and help me drag this back to the camp."

"What?" You ask, lightly shocked. Not only did Ruby seem to not care about Thrash's infection, but he went out of his way to say the snake was nothing more than just meat to carry.

Ruby huffs, "It isn't every day we catch a feral alive. It'd be great proof for me to claim my bet winnings, plus we can toss it in the games or just cook up some Serperior stew. The big guy's big. Let's not have his dumb exercise habits go to waste, right~?" The cat looks out to where the lumber camp's direction would be in, adding, "Fuck your stuff. We can go out when there's daylight tomorrow. What we have is even better, e-"

Your hand suddenly clenches the cat's head to cut his sentence off as you force his skull to smash into a nearby tree with a thrusting lunge of your arm. His head breaks through the bark of the tree with a wooden crunch, dazing his senses to drop the snake's tail before his body completely crumples right next to it. You didn't want to hear another word he had to say. Ruby was knocked out instantaneously as you stand there before your two quiet enemies. You didn't know which one was worst. One being just a hungry animal bent on devouring or infecting others against its will, or the other being a manipulative, uncaring asshole bent on the benefit for himself and his cruel leader. Either way, you accomplished surviving the battle with the snake and successfully taking care of your evil escort.

"Sorry, but we're not going to either place just yet." You exhale angrily before scooping your arms around the unconscious cat, slinging him over your shoulder to carry. "Gotta get back to Hedgen and warn the others. We're getting Jackal out of there, and we're stopping that leader of yours." You grunt to your quiet prisoner. With a glance to the Serperior, feeling as though you should say something in a way to pity Thrash, but you remember that he was just one of Damien's men. Someone like that probably wasn't a good person, but you justify saving him from being chopped up like livestock as decent enough sympathy for what happened to him.

You tell yourself just to reassure your own goal thus far, "I'm gonna put an end to the ferals, and the world's going to go back to order. No matter what..."

Walking forward, you try to head towards the direction to the path that leads to Hedgen with the Persian bobbing over on your shoulder...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: The Cat's in the Bag

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"You want to break into that place tonight...?!" Gold exclaims with an alarmed quack, sitting up in his seat. The wooden chair underneath creaks and stomps its front legs from being tilted back from the duck's lounging back.
