You nod and explain, "Yeah, I don't like Jackal being there, and if I show back up there in the morning without their leader's most prized lover, well..." Your voice trails off, knowing that things have now become dire. Some time has skipped since your encounter with the Serperior naga. After knocking Ruby out, you carried him all the way to Hedgen to see your team and Bronze, that town's Marowak mayor. Together, all of you reside in the old sheriff's office of the town which had a jail cell to toss Ruby into whenever he would come to.

Star sighs as she runs a hand over his forehead, sitting on top of a bar, "Lace, this is crazy. I was against you heading there at all, especially alone."

"Sorry...I was going to do so regardless." You answer back which doesn't seem to help the Luxray's qualms at all.

Eden speaks up, "How about next time you wanna go out and be the hero, everybody comes with you." The Roserade was glancing over her shoulder at you before going back to reading through one of the old books left at the office of prisoner check-ins and check-outs. "No real point in this being a team effort if there's no team."

"That's why I'm here with you all." You explain. "It's not like we all could've just walked right into that place. You should've seen how many of those bandits there were and what they...do to others... I had to infiltrate alone or else they would've just attacked us, and now, I know just what we're dealing with and what the camp is like."

Bronze clears his throat while tapping at his bone staff on the floor impatiently, "And...ahem...how do you plan on just magically taking out Damien's men all in one night?" The Marowak clearly doubted your incursion and worried for the safety of his village. Should you fail, Damien might see it as an attack from Hedgen, and respond with a raid of his own to the town. "The people of this village are under grave threat should you choose to act against Damien. It's obvious that we took you in, and we don't need another reason for that damn Houndour to want us dead."

Now you had to convince the mayor himself, "Most of the lumber mill is made out of the wood it's produced. The thing is just a big fire trap, so if we start a large fire from multiple points at the mill, both outside and inside, we can topple the whole thing down. That would take away the bandits' fortress there."

Bronze shakes his head, "Of course we've thought about burning that place down, but there's too many men that could easily stop us. A fire at the mill isn't going to create a big enough confusion to panic men like them and make them disperse."

"No, but infected will." You answer back, leaning more forward on the table you had your hands against. "They keep living infected in there for games that they have. If we sneak in there, the bandits will have a fire tearing down their building, infected running around, and us to fight with. They fear Damien the most, right? Well I'm going after him. We'll take out their base, their ranks, and their leader. Whoever's left could be manageable for your town, right? The main threats to you would be gone?"

"Errr...well..." The mayor mumbles, scratching at the back of his head that this was actually going to be executed. "...Lace, I need to know for sure that...you promise that you'll defeat Damien?"

You stare dead in the eyes to assure him the deed will be done. "I promise. He won't be a problem to your town by the morning, whether that means he's tossed into your jail or if I have to take matters into my own hands to make sure he won't hurt another person again..."

"I-I...thank you..." Bronze says, still struck how this was actually happening at last.

Hex's coy voice picks up from the fray, "Buuuuut that's only if we do it tonight. Although I'd prefer this whole ordeal to have been dealt with differently and our hand is...being forced here considering the circumstances, I'm with you on this, Lace. I want our Typhlosion back, and I want that evil pup gone."

Star picks up with arms crossed on her chest and her single eye giving you a personal look, "Lace, wherever you go, I go. Being alone is the last thing I want, and the first thing I want is for the entire gang to be together again. Let's get Jackal, beat this guy, and we can all move on from this place."

Eden adds, "I, personally, want to pound this asshole into oblivion. Count me the hell in~" The Roserade even whips her vines from her flowers slightly with a clear grin of getting to hit Damien and his men.

Your group turns to Gold who was back to lounging in his chair; his legs were on a table with his chair tilted back and only standing on two. An arm was slung behind his chair along with his head rolled back at the top. But the Golduck was aware he needed to speak up and grumbles, "....Yyyyyeeeeaaahhh, I guess you guys could use my help. I think if we just left now, I'd start to miss that hot-headed chubster. Plus those bandit dudes don't seem to know how to treat a woman so, aight, count me in. You can all thank me later."

Some members are ready to scoff at the duck's arrogance, but Bronze also seems to add, "I would like to help you as well. Your friend does not need to be trapped there, and you're doing all that you can to help a town of strangers. The least we could do in return is offer what we can to make sure this is seen through to the end, once and for all."

"Are you sure, Bronze?" You ask the Marowak, "You don't need to push yourself to the point where you'll just endanger yourself."

The mayor chuckles at this and stomps his bone club down at the floorboards to reassure, "I may need some help keeping myself balanced, but I promise you that when I hit, I hit incredibly hard. I'll be teaching Damien and his men some manners~" You're more than happy to take his help, but Bronze also mentions, "I have a suggestion for you as well to help destroy and burn the mill. Causing a fire and making sure it spreads without any of the bandits discovering it or snuffing it all out might be troublesome. As you know, Hedgen grew from being a lumber and mining town, and despite both of them being abandoned since the infection, our town is situated at the rim of the mountain. Our mineshafts are still right here, with plenty of the equipment and resources for it scattered about in storage areas. I'm certain that we still have kegs of blastpowder used for excavating the mountain and mines left. We can roll the barrels of this blastpowder to the mill and ignite them to make for immediate chaos and burning the wood."

"That sounds like a great idea actually...!" You exclaim. Having the kegs scattered around at the base would make for a great diversion and confusion against the bandits. The problem was, the kegs would only be able to blow up just the outer walls. "...Bronze, would there be a way for us to get the kegs inside the mill? We'd have to bail of course to not be caught in the explosions, but do you think Damien would buy that Hedgen were offering them a gift of barrels of ale to have to appease them from destroying the town? You and some villagers take the barrels to the gates and t-"

The Marowak shakes his head to deny the idea. "Even a blind person would know what were in those kegs. The blastpowder is easy to catch its scent, and it's quite unique. Damien would catch on, and he certainly wouldn't even think to have the kegs to just be immediately allowed in through the gates without having someone look inside."

"Damn..." You mutter, wondering if there was just some kind of way to sneak the kegs all about in the mill without any bandits seeing them.

Just then however, a small Piplup maid that worked under Bronze in his home stepped out from the hall with the jail cells, bowing before all of you. "U-Uhm, Sir Bronze? The...Persian prisoner...is awake now."

The Marowak smiles and nods, "Thank you dearie, for watching him. You may return home and turn in early tonight. We can handle this from here."

"Yes, Sir Bronze. Have a good night." She bows again and begins to walk away shyly, all without flashing you a look before disappearing the entrance door.

You begin to head into the hall where Ruby was being held with Bronze following close behind, knowing that you wanted to have a 'talk' with the cat. The Marowak asks you, "What exactly do you hope to get out of him, mind I ask?"

"Whatever I need to get out of him."
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Back at Hedgen

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
You stand there with metal bars between both you and the Persian slumped against a wall, fiddling with his chained restraints. You growl out, "Comfortable?" The Persian flashes you a look with those red eyes that could send daggers into your spine and heart. He was sitting on the floor, riding his back close to the far wall away from you inside the cell, yanking on the chains that bound his wrists behind him.

But Ruby suddenly purrs with a confident smile and half-lidded eyes, "I've been in tighter situations, don't you worry, pup. But do you know what I would find comfortable...?" The feline suddenly rises up to a stand, walking towards you with locked eyes to approach the bars, "I have this strange idea that I find soooo relaxing! It's me, back at the mill, on my lovely Damien's bed. It's warm, soft, by a fireplace and it has my favorite Houndour there with my lovely sister. The three of us are enjoying a delightful morning together as we pleasure our one true master~"

"Is that right?" You ask with a grin before he snaps back with wider eyes.

"Yes, that is right. And the best part? We all get to wake up to your fucking head mounted on that goddamn fireplace mantle! You'd have a fucking retarded expression of crossed eyes and a flopped tongue, with the golden engraving of Dumb Bitchfuck right under it, and we'd make each one of your friends and villagers line the fuck up to bow before it and kiss Damien's paws, pleading with their stupid lives to him not to FUCKING JOIN YOU ON THAT WALL!!!" Ruby screams, panting in breath almost with a rapid heartbeat, glaring at you with thoughts of going at your throat with his claws right there and then had he get his wrists free.

He presses against the bars, facing off against you with his blood boiling. "Hhhh...hhhh...you fucked up. You fucked up so big, Lucario, you're too stupid to even understand. You should've just gone back to whatever hole you and that fat fuck of a Typhlosion randomly crawled out of, because now, hohohooohh... now you get to face whatever lovely punishment Damien gets to give you and everyone you love when he finds out that you dared to even harm me in any way. You're so fucking dead, oh you are SO fucking DEAD~!!! Ahahahahhaaahh-"

You drill a punch in between the bars of the cell to sink your fist into the cat's stomach, making him gag on his own words and crumple down onto his knees. "You leave Damien to me, don't you worry. He'll be joining you in this prison, if he cooperates enough. Otherwise, I might feed him into his own game." You threaten back, leaving Ruby choking and coughing some before bearing his teeth together.

Bronze from behind you speaks up, "Lace...may I make a request?"

"Name it." You reply while looking down at the pathetic feline.

"If we can...I'd like for us to be able to save some prisoners the bandits have themselves. I know that they keep some people alive to...do things to them..." The Marowak says with disgust and sadness, but Ruby starts chuckling.

The cat is back to looking up at you, and his glance fixates on Bronze afterwards, "You want to take our toys, eh? Finders keepers, old man. You were using them, and it's all they're good for now anyways."

"Th-They are people. Innocent people that you force into-" Bronze growls back with a stomp of his staff again, but the Persian talks over him.

"They're not people anymore, geezer, not after what we did to 'em hehheh. Now they're just dick-hungry husks with enough drugs and sex to keep their minds broken and their holes numb to fuck. And after my Damien comes and saves me, you can join their ranks. I always wanted a piece of your pathetic big brown ass. I'd probably be the most action you've ever had in centuries you fucking skeleton. It would be merciful to make you our sex slave than what's probably going to happen to this Lucario you befriended." The cat laughs to himself again, keeping away from the bars this time so you can't punch him. His attention goes back to you, "...You hear that, Lance? You're fucking screwed no matter what, all of you are. Oh I can't wait to eat your stupid 'phlosion boyfriend fuck right in front of you and make you lick my stomach, crying that I don't have you join it. I want you skinned alive. I want your pelt as my fucking blanket every night to sleep with. I want your bones as the fucking room decorations. I want this entire town burned down with all of its people. I WANT YOU ALL FUCKING DEAD!!!"

Your arms slip past the bars, but Ruby easily steps back another time to have himself be out of your reach, making him laugh maniacally all the more. However, you send a simple pulse of your aura to blast the Persian completely off his paws. The feline anthro's back smashes against the wall behind him, making him yelp and slump onto the ground as he was before. "Sit down and be quiet. My name isn't Lance." You retort unhappily but unimpressed with Ruby's threats. There was no good into letting his maddening fantasies get in the way of what you needed tonight. "You're going to tell me exactly where your people keep any prisoners or slaves."

"Ghhkkk...p-psshh...why would I tell you shit...?! I don't need to tell you where it is...cause you're gonna be locked down there, with all the other sluts in a pitch black room, fucked daily until you're dead!" Ruby growls out more dryly, now just furious than insanely joyous on the future.

Bronze places a hand on your shoulder, "We're getting nowhere with this...and beating him will do none of us any good." He glances back at Ruby and mutters, "Well, maybe some of us..."

You sigh, knowing that the Marowak was probably right, but there was suddenly a knock down the hall. You glance over to see Hex standing there, leaned against a wall with his knuckles rolling against it. The coy frog mentions, "Sorry, but I couldn't help but watch. Do you think I can take the cat out for a spin~?"

The Marowak huffs with confusion, "What do you hope to do?"

The Toxicroak passes by with his sauntering walk, tapping his orange knuckle clawtip at his bone skull chin with a croaking murrs, "I have my ways, good sir. You two can go back with the others. I won't be long with the Persian, so let me into his cell. I can get you the location of the prisoners." The frog licks around the poison tipped claw as he just thinks about what he'll get to do.

"You sure about this Hex?" You ask him, having the key ready to let the Toxicroak in.

The confident amphibian gives you a look to assure you of his confidence. "I won't get too ugly. After I'm done with him, you'll have all that you need to know, and he's going to do it with a dumb smile on his face...~"

Sighing, you put your faith into Hex, wondering what he'd exactly do to Ruby, but frankly, you can rest easy without ever finding out what it was. Opening the cell door while making sure Ruby stayed in his battered place against the wall, you allow Hex to stride inside with the gate closing behind him. "Give us a holler when you're done, or if anything bad happens, okay?"

The frog suddenly smooches your cheek on his way out, "Don't forget to lock the door behind me, he might try to run. If you hear any growling or moaning, don't worry about that either. I'm the least of your worries right now~" The Toxicroak stands before Ruby with the dazed cat looking up at him as you close and lock the cell door, keeping the key with you.

"Don't be too rough now." You say with Bronze being unsure about this, but you guide him back into the other room where the others were, closing the wooden door to the cell hall.

But before you do, you can hear Ruby growl, "...And who the fuck are you?"

Hex's charming voice rings with glee, "Your new best friend! And we're gonna share each other's secrets...~"
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Prisoner Interrogation

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
You sit on a table, waiting on Hex to finish up with how he was questioning Ruby on where the bandits specifically kept any of their slaves, and all you could hear were muffled whines and moans. A dark thought you have is that what if Ruby somehow got the better of Hex? What if the cat was straddled on the frog, sitting on his member and riding the Toxicroak's rod? What if he got out of his restraints? What if he was doing something awful to Hex? You tap your leg impatiently before you pick up on Star's voice somewhere in the room.

Looking up, you see the eye-patched Luxray talking with Bronze at a set of chairs, "This is the sheriff's office...right? So what happened to the sheriff? Or any of the people that worked here to keep the peace?"

Bronze sighs, clenching both hands at the peak of his bone staff. "...The sheriff is with Damien. Bigby was a promising man that enjoyed order, but something about Damien corrupted his way of thinking. I think the amount of power and influence he had seduced our sheriff into joining his ranks when Damien began Hedgen's mutiny after the beginning of the infection. Any officer under Bigby that didn't join him as well...well..."

"You don't have to finish that statement, I'm sorry." The Luxray mentions, putting a hand on top of his own to ease his worry.

"Do not fret. I am just glad our prayers have been answered. I don't know what we would've done if your group hadn't shown up. What you're all going to do tonight, please...believe me when I say that we all owe you our lives. We could never repay you, should we succeed in destroying the bandits tonight." Bronze assures, thanking Star and your group for what you'd do.

It worries you that the old sheriff of the town is now Damien's right hand man, and seems to be in charge of the other bandit guards. Just another reason for you to have a distaste for the large beaver. Just then, Hex's voice rings out from the hall, "Oooohhh, yoohooooo!" You can hear tapping of metal bars, getting you to slide off the table, arrive in the hall with the cell keys ready. "Ah, Lace, I'm all done! And I have some interesting news~" The frog says with a delighted smile and a shake of his hips while holding onto the metal bars to be as close to you as he can.

"R-Really...? That's great, give me a sec." You stutter before fiddling with the keys. You glance past Hex just to see Ruby on the floor. Strangely, the Persian had fully dilated eyes, full with black pupils and vivid red irises. The Persian groans and moans, drooling out of his smiling mouth with a tongue flopped out. His knees are bending inward to rub against one another as he just wallows his head about like he was tired, but crazy. "Is...he...?"

Hex answers with his mischievous grin, "Tripping balls? Yes~" The frog idly croaks with his orange throat sac bulging out repeatedly with his happy tune. "I doused him with a bit of my poison that I've been naturally churning up just for him. Instead of numbing his body, I've numbed his willpower. With some alluring words, and maybe one too many injections, he was happy to start boasting to his new best friend about all the prisoners they specifically keep downstairs under the mill!"

Unlocking the door to let the frog on in, you ask him as he steps out, "Downstairs? Wait, there's an underground section to the mill?"

"Exactly! There's a few cellar doors out in the forest that lead into the underground bit of the mill, and we can find these easily because they usually just have a guard or two randomly standing on top of them, covered in foliage." The frog pats your cheek and kicks the cell door closed behind him. "Soooo, we just surprise attack those guards we find that are separated from outside of the wall of the mill. Get some of us down into the tunnels to lead the prisoners out..."

You start to add, "...And we can roll the powder kegs down there as well, spreading them around..."

"And then we blow the mill sky high right from underneath them~!" Hex cheers, croaking with closed eyes with hands on his hips.

You cup the Toxicroak's smiling cheeks with both hands and show your gratitude, "Hex, do you know that you're the greatest...?"

You get a toss of his hand and a turn of his head, "Hmhmhm...maybe just a little bit. I'd hate to toot my own horn, Lace~" The tall Toxicroak drapes you in a hug that lifts you off your hindpaws before he sets you back down. "Let's tell the others, and get that hot-head of ours back with those prisoners."

-----|-----


"So we all know the plan?" You ask around to the people in the room. You were at a table with your team and some of Bronze's villagers circled around at a map of the mill layout you had drawn. You had discussed who was going where to make sure all was set for tonight.

Hex raises a hand, "You and I will sneak into the mill together to find Jackal and to release the infected they have in their pins."

Star raises a hand, "I'm heading down with some of the volunteers here to help people lay the powder kegs around in the underground tunnels. I'll ignite 'em when I get your signal."

Eden adds, "Gold and I will go to the prisoners' quarters, where we'll lead them about before the blasts go off." Gold flicks a thumbs up at you from across the room as he's casually leaned against a wall. He appeared to be annoyed, but at least he was sticking around and doing his part.

Bronze taps his bone staff at the ground and mentions, "And I shall be outside with the other villagers scattered around the mill, lying in wait for the blasts to go off before we go on our assault and burn the mill down effectively. Any bandits that attempt to escape the fire will be met with a wall of people bent on their surrender or capture. I and some others will personally remain at the walls to take out any scouts and keep a look out for you."

Clear with everyone, you nod and rise up from the table you were leaning on. "Then we're all good. Get your things, say what you need to with one another, and stick together. Tonight, Damien and his crew are going to get what's coming to them..." The villagers nod, chanting their confirmation with Bronze.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: The Assault Plan

choices: "Mind if I have an extra word with you, Hex?" [Hex Romance]
"Mind if I have an extra word with you, Star?" [Star Romance]
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
This was it. This was the battle to finish off Damien's camp, all in one go. It felt odd how you only just discovered the camp's existence since arriving at Hedgen, but considering just the mere day you've had of experience with it, you can certainly understand why it needed to be dealt with sooner rather than later. It was a curious thought of wondering just about how long everyone else was affected by Damien's gang, and how they ever got by. Regardless, it all came down to tonight. The sky was a pitch dark, with clouds obscuring most of the starlight above. Not even the moon was visible, with all but a faint glow cascading from the dark clouds.

You stand there in the dark forest with other villagers slowly circling with what would be the lumber mill of Damien's camp far off, remaining out of view from the guards posted around. Several of the volunteers cart and roll all the powder kegs they had found in the mineshaft supply from the mountain, and ready themselves to take it to any spots they're told that would lead into the underground tunnels underneath the mill. Bronze steps right up next to you, tapping his bone staff at the grass below. "Whhhhh...." He sighs out before glancing to you, "...Are you nervous?"

"Doesn't matter if I am or not." You explain. You were getting the job done either way.

"Hmph. The blind confidence of the young." The Marowak mayor retorts with both hands clenching the top of his club.

You take a good look at him, and nothing seemed wrinkled or worn down. He was slightly hunched over and could have a bit trouble with balance, but otherwise he didn't seem to old. His flesh was taut and healthy despite his handicap. "You don't mind if I ask...how old you are, right?"

"Hah...! Let's just say if I made a bad decision if I was young, you could probably be the age of my grandchild." Bronze retorts, smiling some. "Don't let looks fool you. Sure I'm old, but I'm not that old. I'm finely aged is all. But the same principle applies to Damien. He may be young and lean, but he's more of an animal than the infected are. Watch yourself should you ever meet him in there."

"Oh I plan on meeting him. I haven't made it this far to be taken down by some brat." You retort. Your mind lingers, and you can't help but feel a sudden hungry drive to devour him, sending him to your stomach to wallow and whine as you sit there rubbing your taut yellow gut, witnessing every minute of his passing to join your body. You almost grin in a drunken, evil daze at the thought, but you shake it away. It's strange, but you feel the sense of enjoying vore more than you have since the beginning of your journey. You pass this off as just the psychic mastermind trying harder to influence you, or perhaps you truly were hungry. Either way, you ignore the feeling and remain headstrong on what the real goal is.

Bronze however exhales with a hand brushing over his skulled smooth head. "I certainly hope that isn't true. I've lived both a good and rough life. This infection was rather...unneeded for how I get to experience life, but I've done well with what I can. However, I don't want it all to just end up with me being captured by these people..."

"I don't think anyone wants to get eaten by these guys, so-" You were adding, but Bronze shakes his head.

"That would be a mercy. I believe the last words I ever heard Damien tell me directly before he was banished from the town was, 'I'm going to fuck your bent-over ass until you're torn in half.' or something along those lines." His golden eyes glance to you with a stern voice, heeding, "And you heard that Persian in his cell. They're more interested in violating me with their...sexual deviances than their hunger. They've become lost like so many others by indulging in their dark pleasures."

You set a hand on his shoulder and assure him, "No one's forcing you to do this with us. You can stay back at your manor, or take refuge on the mountain should things go sour here..."

He brushes your hand away and laughs to himself, "Be less worried about me and more about your own hide. You're the one who hurt his favorite pet and lied about who you are, after all."

"Right..." You mutter. An ear of yours twitches anxiously thinking that you'd probably get the worst of any punishment to anyone.

Bronze smiles to himself, "Sorry, didn't mean to worry you about anything. I'm confident there's a chance we can accomplish this. Something about you just seems as though...you can achieve anything."

"I certainly hope that's the case." You reply back to the mayor. "We'll get your people out, and no one's gonna have to worry about Damien eating or enslaving anyone. Not even you."

"That's good. I enjoy being a mayor, and the thought of having some sense of control and community again sounds nice." The Marowak says with a rather calm look to him. It didn't seem like he had any real nerves against the situation, and this helps to calm you some as well.

Just then, Star's voice picks up from afar to call your name, "Hey, Lace!" The Luxray lightly jogs over to you from where she was to explain, "...Some of the villagers found a couple of lone guards. Turns out that they were standing on a hidden doorway just like that Persian mentioned; they lead right down into some tunnels. They even cowarded out and fessed up about two other cellar door entrances that we have people moving in on now."

"Wow, that's...great actually! Did Hex get to those guards that fast?" You ask her with Bronze perking up at the news.

The cat whips her starred tail and grins, leaning one hip out with a single finger swirling the air. "Hey, I have my own questioning methods to get things out of people." She purrs some, causing crackling static from her hand. "But to be honest, they saw just how many people they were going up against, I think they nearly pissed themselves. They told us without much resistance."

Bronze grunts, "Just shows you how much honor these awful people have." He taps his staff at the ground again in his angry retort.

A stirring croak signals you that Hex finally caught up with you, padding up with hands on his hips and a delighted glare on his face. "Ah, there you are Lace. Ready to snoop right on in~?"

"Just about." You say, giving his side a firm pat and flashing a quick smile to show you're good for the mission. You turn to Star and explain, "As soon as you get confirmation that the prisoners are out, don't hold back in igniting any of the kegs. Hex and I will be expecting it, and this needs to be done as fast as possible. The sooner and more clustered they are together with all of the confusion, the better. If they find out we're here already, Damien can start ordering his men on what to do. We don't need guards searching downstairs or outside, so better to take the chance to blow the mill up than the plan being discovered and stopped."

The Luxray crosses her arms, giving a concerned look before closing her eyes and sighing, "...Alright Lace. I'll put my trust in you. Just, come back in one piece, okay? I don't need you missing anything should we blow the place up and you're dickin' around on the floor level."

You flash her a thumbs up, "Deal. I'm putting my trust in you as well that you'll make the best call no matter what happens. Got all that, too, Bronze?" The Marowak nods his head, ready to go.

Hex suddenly pulls you into his arm, squeezing sides together as he pats your chest with the other free hand, reassuring Star, "Don't worry dearie, he'll be under my care when we're in that mill. I didn't survive in an infected-filled swamp for a long time for nothing. I can be quite stealthy when I need to be, like I wasn't even ever there~" The Toxicroak winks with his smile, getting Star to roll her eye.

"Yeah, yeah. But the same goes for you, Hex. One piece." The cat says with another flick of her tail. She makes sure to point to Hex directly when repeating her 'one piece' bit and back to you.

The amphibian huffs, cupping a hand to his own puffed chest, "I can't have my good looks ruined, now can I? Hmhm, I'm good to go whenever you are, Lucario. Unless you want to bail and I can handle these fools alone?"

"Not a chance." You state back before slipping out of Hex's arm, only to then say...

[There are bonus options available depending on who you had Lace sleep with back in Draxius' tent, if it was Hex or Star. Choosing 'Neutral' continues the story as normal, implying that Lace didn't sleep with either of them that night.]
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Assault on Damien's Camp

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"Let's do this. No need for Damien to have another second of relaxing up in his fort." You finish off with the others. Star and Bronze give out their farewells as you exchange good will and luck to both of them before Hex arrives at your side.

"Try not to fall behind, poochie." The frog murrs before walking ahead to the lumber mill's location, swaying his hips. You huff at the mention, but you remain close to him, taking the lead even knowing what the outer walls of the lumber mill looked like. You hoped that everyone could do their part to make this work, for it wouldn't feel like a victory otherwise should someone be lost because of this...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Enough Talk

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Your eyes travel up that rather tall and thick logs making up as the walls for the lumber mill base. Both you and Hex were hidden behind the backs of trees, keeping a close glance at how the patrols work. There was a balcony along the interior rim of the walls, just at their peaks that had single guards traverse by repeatedly in a rotation. Not only that, but some bandits even walk around on the outside perimeter of the wall at the ground level. There were only a few gates through the wall. A large one at the front, two at the sides, and of course the large maze at the back.

Hex points to the side gate that you can see in your view and mentions, "You're seeing the pattern as well, correct? At times there's parts where the guards at different levels lap one another, leaving a few moments of no one being able to look out. I think if we time things correctly and move quickly, I can scale up one of the walls, take out anyone that I need to, and open the gate for you to let you in."

"You're positive you can do that?" You ask of the Toxicroak.

Hex simply raises his knuckle claws with poisoned tips and quietly croaks, "Just watch me. Those fools already seem like they're half asleep already since it's so late at night. Give me just a moment, dearie, and run right in when you can~"

You couldn't even stop the frog, because once he had his window after two guards pass around the wall, he immediately began sprinting towards the wall in long steps to cover as much ground as he could. Up against the wall now, he was out of view of two other guards standing above the gate, giving him the opportunity to dig his two knuckle claws into the wood to climb up the logs. He quietly works one hand up to hoist himself up as he lightly kicks up against the wall in order to scale. A Rhyhorn and a Gurdurr stand there at the top, completely unaware with the Rhyhorn emitting a large yawn. "Hhhhooouuugghhh..."

The Gurdurr grumbles, "Don't you damn yawn at me, you know that I might....too....hhhrraaaghhh...goddammit." After yawning himself, he flashes a look to his fellow guard. "I'm gonna pass the fuck out if you keep that up."

"Sorry man, I didn't catch much sleep last night. I got too busy with Daisy and some drinks to catch up on my Z's." The fat behemoth mumbles back before recounting his previous venture. "Heh...she's got a rockin' body. It was about damn time I had a turn with her."

The Gurdurr scoffs at this. "Psh. Daisy's the favorite. I've hardly had time with her. But I guess I know what I'm doin' after tonight, heh heh, ya know what I mean~?" The only answer he'd get however is the Rhyhorn suddenly slumping onto his back on the wooden balcony above the gate, shaking from his large weight. "Eh?!" The fighter would mention before seeing the big dino just snooze with an open mouth and closed eyes. He growls, "Are you kidding me? Did you just fall asleep?"

A croak murrs behind him before Hex's hand cups around the Gurdurr's mouth to pull him in close and muffle his speech. "And you will be too~" The stealthy Toxicroak had slipped venom into the Rhyhorn during their discussion, and now the remaining guard would feel the sudden sting of Hex's knuckle claw pinching at his back before a numbing poison injects there as well.

"G-Grrmmphk! Mmph...?!" The Gurdurr growls out with wide eyes and tensing muscles. Hex would've had a problem on his hands if he hadn't injected sooner, and those fighting eyes would roll up with drooped eyelids over time, leaving Hex to lay the Gurdurr down. Successful in taking the two guards out, Hex immediately hops down from the balcony onto a ladder and descends to where the lever of the gate was. It opens up, leaving you the brief moment to dash from behind the tree you were hiding over to the wall in hopes to make there in time. You don't think you were spotted as you make it past the door, but muffled chatter between two other guards making their perimeter walk around the outside of the wall could be heard.

Quickly, both you and Hex try to close the doors shut with the guards passing by. You can hear their steps stopping outside, and you lay an ear up against the doors to listen.

There were two voices, both male.

"Hey, did someone just leave or come in...?" One asks, leaving you to stare at Hex who didn't know what to say considering the only people who should've answered are passed out up on the balcony above you.

You clear your throat and grunt in whatever voice you can, "Yeah, just came right back in. Needed a piss break..." You quietly just wait there in worry and add, "...Why, got a problem with that?"

You hear a grumbled huff from the outside, and the two guards continue on their way, resuming their conversation. It gives you the relief to sigh and close your eyes before feeling Hex pat your side. "Atta' boy~" The frog sings silently before the two of you can finally progress now that you're behind the wall. Inside, there was the large fort building where the lumber-work used to take place, now retroactively turned into the main hub of the bandits. Several small tents and cabins are scattered around outside the main building however, most likely being their living quarters. You can even see some campfires with some of the men circled around them, having boasting chats and drinking from kegs of ale.

You're ready to crouch down and sneak through the tents, but Hex merely grabs your shoulder to stand you back up straight. "We're gonna get caught if we look like that, stalking and crawling around everywhere." The Toxicroak huffs.

"You think we should just walk right on inside?" You retort, but only to receive a nod from the frog.

"Indeed! Look at how many of these guys there are. You think they really know everyone in the group? They don't keep track of every single person that joins, and you're new, right? Some people saw you with Damien, and we're pretty far away for them to really notice us. If we casually just walk to the building, I really doubt that anyone would stop you. And I doubt they have anything against Toxicroaks being amongst them either." Hex explains with hands on his hips. You wanted to argue the logic, but it was a short distance to the building, and around the doorway to it was open. People would see you regardless if you were crouched suspiciously or casually walking there.

You sigh and mutter in agreement, getting the frog to grin. Together, you head towards one of the smaller entrances at the side of the building to go through, avoiding the main entrance for sure, as well as avoiding any eye contact. It was a straight path to the door you needed to get to, yet you couldn't help but feel the pressure that maybe there were some eyes on you two. And yet miraculously, you make it to the side doors without a problem. You'd be ready to celebrate with a smile towards Hex, but you suddenly meet chest to stomach with a large furry fellow.

A big Ursaring bumped into you from how quickly you had made it into the door with the Toxicroak, leaving you to hit your back against the closed door and the bear to stumble back with a mug dropping from his hand. It smashes against the floor with a puddle of beer with the large male growling, "Ey! Watch it!" He snarls down with clenched fangs and angry eyes.

So much for a clean and quiet entrance. You were ready to apologize until he growls, "...Wait, who the fuck are you?"

"Lance...?" You mutter as an answer before tensing yourself some more. "And who the fuck are you?"

The bear huffs from his nostrils, "Oh yeah, you're the puny pooch I saw with Damien earlier tonight, with that 'phlosion."

"That's right, I am. Really nice to meet'cha." You say to appear aggressive. "Sorry about the drink. I'm sure my Typh friend will get you another one if I could find him. You wouldn't know where the chubby bastard is, would ya?"

The bear scratches at his chest some, "Yeesh, aren't you the grumpy fellow. I think I saw him upstairs in the back with some other guys, bein' weird. But I'm less concerned about you..." He mutters with his eyes glancing to the frog beside you. He brushes a hand to your chest and forces you away from Hex as he gets up close and personal with the amphibian. "...and more about you. I don't remember seeing any damn Toxicroak in these parts. And you weren't with him earlier this evening. Who the hell are you? We're not taking in guests."

"Oh, you're not...?" The frog, cupping a hand to his cheek. "I could've sworn it would've been alright."

You can see the bear ready to grab the frog, but you intervene, leaping up and crossing your arms from behind around at the Ursaring's neck. "Ghakk!!" He exclaims as you choke his neck and make his spine bend back, leaving his front easily exposed for Hex to inject him with both of his claws. "Hnk! Wh-What the f-ffuuuuuhhuuoohhckk..." The bear's eyelids droop with the poison going into his system fast from Hex stressfully pumping it into him with both claws.

The chubby bear slumps, incredibly hard for you to carry. "H-Hfff..." You wheeze out, staggering some to keep the big guy's upper back and shoulders from hitting the ground too.

"Well that could've gone better. Sorry." The Toxicroak mentions before glancing over at the door, hearing more bandits approach it. The frog flashes his eyes to you, worried, but you just toss your head to gesture him off.

"Just get outta here. You heard the guy, start looking upstairs in the back for Jackal. I'll catch up with you after I deal with this." You mention to him, thinking of how you could explain this. Hex begins to take a few steps back, unsure to leave, but the sound of the door opening makes him slip away through another door in the hall, having to abandon you and go it alone...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Over the Wall

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"What the hell...?" A male Pyroar exclaims after opening the door. He stands there to see you trying to hold one of his fellow bandits up that was left groaning an unresponsive. Before he could make any clear accusation however, you pipe with some kind of reasoning.

"I, uh, think the big tough guy had one too many pints..." You say, struggling to hold the groaning Ursaring up. The Pyroar bandit glances over to see the smashed drink of beer on the floor, and it was apparently all that was needed to convince him.

"Ugh. I told Graves I'd fucking kick his teeth in if he got this drunk. C'mere, I'll help him up." The lion states, sighing and taking one of the Ursaring's arms, apparently who was named Graves. "I am not taking this guy to his tent. His tentmate already told me the dick's impossible to sleep with when he's drunk."

You fake a smirk and help the lion get the bear up some with an arm of his draped around your back. "Where do ya wanna dump him?"

"Ah, just this way where he's not gonna be a bother to anyone." Both you and Pyroar head down the hall and go through a series of doors. The lion apparently didn't bother asking who you were which you completely are fine with, and any other bandit that saw you was more focused on the groaning Ursaring passed off as wasted. The bear occasionally bobbed his head tried to fight off your arm, perhaps still conscious of the situation, but the poison kept his mind subdued to not have your cover blown.

Finally, you arrive into a tool room that was used to house axes, hammers, and other things to use for working with wood. "Just lay him up on one of these tables." The Pyroar mutters, hauling the big bear onto his back on the table surface. "There, he'll be out of the way from pestering anybody else. Thanks for tryin' to deal with him." He turns to you in fact, with the buff feline having to look down at you from being taller. "In fact, I don't think we met? James." The lion extends his hand of all things, wanting to shake on it.

Collecting the big hand, you gesture back with a shake and mutter, "Uh, Lance. I'm one of the new guys."

"Ooohhh, yeah, I heard a couple of the guys mention you. Welcome to the family. I heard you got to be on good terms from Damien just by comin' in. He's not usually in the mood to do that sort of stuff. Whadja say to get on his good side?" The lion says with a grin.

"Well, er, I can't say for sure actually. Maybe he was just buzzed...?" You tried to excuse. The lion laughs at this though with closed eyes. Apparently you were getting on James' good side as well. "Gotta get used to saying the 'family' thing though."

The lion finishes his sensible chuckle. "Heh, yeah it was weird for me at the beginning. Ever since I left Hedgen, I figured that I'd hate it here. But it's not entirely bad. You just gotta know who not to piss off."

That one statement takes your interest and you ask, "You're originally from Hedgen?"

"Yep! You know the place? Well, I found and stayed there before that place got really divisive, I should say. There was a lot of tension between a lot of the residents, where the mayor wanted one thing, Damien wanted the other. When Damien left, some of us just went with him." He explains casually.

"Mind if I ask why?" You ask.

Thinking on it, the Pyroar answers, "Uh, I mean, I didn't go with him at first. But there was still a lot of hostility left in the villagers with one another. Mayor Bronze had to figure out how to ration what food we could, and the number of infected attacking were becoming a staggering rate. When I heard of how Damien was handling himself with the others though at this mill, I couldn't believe. Yeah, things can be rough, but it's a better life here than it was in Hedgen."

You never really had the chance to talk things out with Bronze about how everything went down prior to Damien's exile. But then again, you only got his side of the story. There may have been things he left out or lied over just to vilify Damien to you. You were unsure, but after thinking about your encounter with the Houndour, you doubt that Bronze would need to lie to you about how evil he was. "Oh, damn... Sorry to hear about that."

"Heh, it ain't a problem. Not everyone agrees with Damien, but to be honest, we're kind of scared shitless of him. Anyone that's ever challenged him on anything get it pretty bad..." The lion admits, nervously scratching at his cheek. "Not that you heard this from me! But you're new and all, and it's better to know this stuff early. Don't piss Damien off. Yeah, he's young, but the guy's more of an animal than the infected are. He'll kill you in whatever way he wants if you challenge him about anything. He's taken men out that have all simultaneously took him on. So a lot of guys just does as he says. If they're being a dick about anything and acting tough, it's usually just for appearances. Although, we do have our fair share of complete pricks. I don't like the idea of sleeping in a tent with a guy that rapes infected, but I'd rather have that than being in some faulty town that can't even protect itself from its own people or the infected."

"I actually appreciate this a lot, James. You've...certainly opened my eyes to something." You mention before thinking hard about this. Not all of the bandits here are cruel people, but just people acting out of fear from the greater evil they're forced to stay with. Despite you disagreeing with their choice of following Damien, in an apocalyptical world like this where the slightest mistake can have you devoured or having your mind erased to that of a savage beast, it was a pretty easy choice to want to stay with the vast numbers of people in the heavily fortified settlement for safety, no matter how you had to act to be able to do so. Still, there were sex slaves and probably worse things in this place. They still needed to be set free, and Damien needed to go down, along with any other severe potential bad person here.

"Don't mention it...! Just glad I can help the new guy learn the ropes." The Pyroar said before glancing up and smiling more. "Oh hey Bigby, what's up?"

Your fur spikes up with your ears straightening. You turn to see Damien's right-hand man, Bigby, standing there by the doorway. The Bibarel was leaned against it with crossed arms and a rather unhappy look to him as he was staring right at you. "Apparently more than we initially thought..." He mutters, perhaps a jab at his suspicions against you.

"Oh, have you met the new guy, Lance?" The Pyroar mentions, giving a pat your shoulder, unaware of the tension between you and the beaver.

"I'm pretty sure I did James." He says with a scowl.

The lion tenses his brows and mumbles, "Oh...well, Graves got drunk so we just set him d-"

"Say, James." The large beaver asks, interrupting the Pyroar. "How about you go gather some of the men to the arena. A fight's gonna start soon."

"...Oh? Who's...in it?" The lion mutters with a hint of fear in his voice.

"I think you'll be surprised. Now go on." The Bibarel orders the large feline to get a move on. The Pyroar notices the gravity of the beaver's mood and simply just quietly leaves. You're ready to just leave with him, but Bigby closes the door behind James and glares at your with his scowl. "...What are you doing back here...?"

You can see that you're not getting out of this situation without coming up with something, so you retort, "I was supposed to come back, remember? I didn't have much to get, and we didn't have to go out too far."

"Mind telling me where Ruby is?" The beaver grunts, stepping forward.

"He's...somewhere I guess? I don't keep track of him. He led me in through the gate and went to go find his darling Damien or so-"

"Bullshit." He growls, far more angry. You can see his arm extend out, taking one of the sledgehammers from the wall of tools at the side, approaching you with it. "I've been at the main gate all night, and you two never showed up. I come by just to tell Damien there's nothing to report, and yet, strangely, here you are..."

You can sense that it didn't matter what you say anymore, Bigby's not going to believe you. "I don't want to fight you." You say, raising your fists up and taking steps back.

"Oh, but I do." He huffs before opening his mouth suddenly shooting a ray of water out. The Water Gun splashes against your face to make you stagger back, and it gave the beaver enough time to take a mighty swing of that hammer to collide into your wet head.

"Hhungk...!!" You yelp aloud with a shaking jaw and staggering steps, sent keeling over onto your side onto the floor with your ears ringing and your vision blurry. "U-Ughnh...." Groaning on the ground, your skull pounds repeatedly from the impact it had on your head, with your world going dizzy and out of focus. You look up to see the silhouette of the beaver tower over you before he lifts up a thick leg to stomp down on your head. The world goes black and quiet, and your senses are completely knocked out...

-----|-----


Bigby growls with his buckteeth gnashing together in his frown when staring down at the motionless Lucario traitor before him. "Bitch dog. I never trusted you from the start, and I was right about you. I don't know what you did with Ruby, but I know exactly with what I'm gonna do with you..." Grabbing your ankle after tossing the hammer, he begins to walk out of the tool room while dragging you along the ground by your leg to deal with you.

He doesn't even take proper care of his prisoner, walking up stairs and letting the back of your head bang against each one as if the hammer swing wasn't enough for your skull. Whatever Bigby had planned for you, it might just be the end of you...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: And into the Fire

choices: Drop right down on top of him.
Drop down and go for a Poison Jab.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Hex's hands tighten on the wooden beam, hoisting himself up to finally be up on the rafters of the largest room in the mill. He squats down with spread thighs, resting his elbows on his knees. Having been separated from his Lucario companion, the Toxicroak is left on his own in this vast area as he surveys below. It seemed to be where most of the chopped trees would be placed on a conveyor to be sliced and diced, hand-operated by the past workers. However, production seems to have been at a standstill considering the current situation of bandits now running the place. Apparently they didn't need anything built anymore with the lifestyle they have. Hex can even spot many barrels and kegs of their alcohol that they have, making him wonder what they'll do when they run out. It seemed like only temporary good living. A living that was literally going to crash and burn soon.

"Lace oh Lace, where could you be...?" Hex idly murmurs to himself while glancing around the place below. Concealed in the shadows of the rafters high above, he was confident no one would look to see him there. After the dilemma he had escaped from earlier, he went back to see if his Lucario partner was still around, however, unable to see Lace at all. "Although I suppose he'd be more concerned about me more than himself. Well, guess I just have to find that flaming oaf first before I have to go out find the 'cario too."

Just then, he spots a Zebstrika cross a walkway the frog was above, watching the horse travel with hooved steps clopping against the wooden panels. The frog doesn't see anyone nearby or on the walkway the male horse was going along, and decides he could get some answers from the lone bandit. He just had to choose how to handle the horse.

The Toxicroak could only produce so much of his venom, and he used most of its potency into taking down the previous guards so quickly. He'd have to restrain himself after this, or just start now and use other tactics to take care of the horse...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Hex Stealth

choices: Hex asks to see more toys.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
No need to get close and personal with him. The Toxicroak waits until the Zebstrika completely passes underneath on the walkway to shoot out a Poison Sting attack, sending a thin pin needle into the back of the stallion's neck. "Ahh!" He exclaims, twisting around and darting his eyes about. "Who did that? Who's there...?" The Zebstrika never thinks to look up, and instead, feels his hand around at the back of his neck, eventually plucking out the needle which gets him to cringe in place. "Agh...a needle...?" The horse grunts when inspecting the the thing.

Hex glares his eyes. Apparently the big guy needed more juice to take him down more. Despite the Toxicroak seeing the Zebstrika blinking funny from the venom, the frog decides its safer to just shoot him again with another. This one hitting him directly in the chest. "Hhkk!" He exclaims, falling onto his back. He pulls the pin out from this pecs, growling, "Wh-Who's there! Come and face....f-face....m-mmeeeeeeyyyeee...?" The world for him began to blur and become more vivid, the poison finally kicking in. His body felt heavy, warm even. He could essentially take a nap right here...

The Toxicroak however stops this from happening after hopping down onto the walkway and approaching his victim. "Sorry about that, fella. I was lookin' for a friend of mine and I figured you could help. You were the first one I found alone anyway, so you're better than nothing."

"Wh-Who you callin' nothin'...?!" The drugged horse groans, blinking awkwardly and rolling his head about. "I don't...know you...how'd you get in here..."

"Shhhh..." The frog states, putting a finger to the Zebstrika's lips. "I'm looking for a Typhlosion. Have ya seen him?"

"U-Uhhn...a Typhlosion...?" He groans, trying to get up but Hex plants a hand flat to his chest, sending him back down every time. "...ghhahh...I-I think...I saw one...down this walkway, in the hall...door on the...right or left?"

Hex rolls his eyes, croaking idly and just glancing down at the wasted horse below him with half-lidded eyes. "Well which is it? Right or left?"

"I...I dunno..." The horse exhales out, drooling out of his mouth now. "Wh-Who are you...again?"

"I'm a friend! Now I need you to remember, which door-" The Toxicroak however stops once he sees the Zebstrika flop his head back with a tongue out, completely unconscious. The poison was really kicking in now at his neck, completely numbing his mind. "...A bit too late for that." The frog sighs, stepping over the Zebstrika and just continuing forward as the horse mentioned. Opening a door and leaving the large room he was in, he was now in a smaller room, acting as an access point to get to several other rooms.

"Now which one should I..." Hex trails off to see that there's three doors on both sides of the room, left and right. He scowls, wishing the Zebstrika was awake so he can feel his neck being wrung in the frog's hands. "Well for the love of quite literally anything ever, he wasn't a help at all. Now I just have to guess..." The frog remained rather ticked he would just have to try door after door, unsure of who or what was behind them. But, he got himself tied up into this mess. "The things I do for that flaming oaf. I'm getting a blowjob from that closeted hothead after all this is said and done, hmph."

The frog saunters his way to the far left door, deciding to randomly go through that one first. Slowly clicking the knob, the Toxicroak manages to crack it open to peer inside. He can see a desk with tools on it, with some kind of object there being crafted. Unsure of what it all is, the door suddenly opens all of the way with Hex's view completely obscured by a cyan middle. A heavy, slurred voice bellows out, "No peeking!!!"

Hex glances up to an even taller frog than himself. And a quite wider one at that. Standing before him was an incredibly broad, gutted Seismitoad. The thick black lumps of his brows smack together angrily, buzzing with his red eyes glaring down at Hex, all before becoming suddenly more confused an innocent. "Oh...? Another froggy...like Bingo?"

The Toxicroak was left standing there before clearing his throat, "Why, yes, that is what I am after all. It's nice to see another amphibious...friend?" Even Hex was confused, only to see a large and dim-witted smile spread on the Seismitoad's face.

"Heh. Heh. Hehhhh. Bingo has not seen another froggy around here before. Heh." The Seismitoad's eyelids lower with his wide smile creeping out more and he nervously pokes two fingers together. Hex catches on that this big fellow isn't exactly...like other people in the head, to which the Toxicroak would describe to be rather 'simplistic'. But perhaps he can play off Bingo's traits to get out of the situation.

"Thaaat's....because I'm new! I actually just started staying here in this place after meeting Damien. I'm just a little lost. Apologies for interrupting you on whatever you were doing! I'll just be going-" The Seismitoad suddenly forces the Toxicroak to stumble inside the room Hex was in by grabbing him by the shoulders' the toad was massive in stature, and he certainly didn't lack in power. His strength could easily lift up Hex with one hand.

"Nono! Let Bingo show froggy his toys!" The Seismitoad demands, shutting the door behind Hex and dragging the smaller frog with him.

The Toxicroak imagined that Bingo must've had children's toys when taking his mindset into consideration, making him attempt to reason, "I-I am sure they're nice and fun to play with but I really need to-" Hex's voice drops when he's suddenly presented to what Bingo was talking about. The Seismitoad gestured a big open hand to a wall, showcasing his...toys. Dildos. Gagballs. Restraints of all kinds. Collars. Leashes. Whips. It took Hex by surprise, and he simply just quietly nods with slow and exaggerated nods of his head. "O-Oh....those.... Gee, wow...I...really, really don't know what to say. Really. Just, wooow Bingo... Mmhmm..."

The Seismitoad's face reddens a bit, clearly enjoying the lewdness of the items as he takes one of the dildoes off of the rack. The thing was quite a large size in itself, perhaps more than twelve inches and thick. It was black and rubbery in fact, with Bingo murring, "Heh. Heh. This is Blacky. Blacky is Bingo's favorite toy he made."

"O-Oh, you actually made that, huh?" The frog stutters, queitly taking a step back to see if he could slip away from the large toad, but Bingo's thick blue arms hooks around him and smushes him at the Seismitoad's side.

"Yep! Yep! Bingo makes all kinds of toys for the family!" The Seismitoad licks over his lips pervertedly, giggling to himself some with his red and aroused face staring at the level of detail in 'Blacky'. "Bingo used tar from tar pits to make Blacky. Bingo used to make pottery and statues, but sometimes Bingo likes making nice things like this that make Bingo...heeheeeee...excited~! Damien knows Bingo makes toys. Damien tells Bingo to make toys for the family here."

Hex nervously chuckles, shuddering a bit against the large toad's chubby side as he tries to coax that Seismitoad. "And I am sure Damien likes everything Bingo makes. Hrkk!" The Toxicroak is squished into the side powerfully with Bingo squeezing harder.

"Yes. But no, too. Sometimes Bingo just wants to make different things than toys. But Damien is scary. Damien breaks what he does not like Bingo secretly make." The Seismitoad says with dissatisfaction.

Hex idly pets the big toad's side, trying to squeeze out of Bingo's side. "I'm s-sorry to hear that Bingo. I think you should make what you want, whenever you want."

Just as soon as Hex was about to slip from the big burly arm, he's suddenly squeezed again drastically by the Seismitoad. "Really? Bingo like froggy~"

"H-Hrrrffff...B-Bingo...e-ease up..." The Toxicroak tries to wheeze out, but the big toad wouldn't let him have it that way, and simply drapes both arms around Hex after setting 'Blacky' down to bear hug the fellow amphibian against his chubby cyan front. Hex squishes into the amphibious pudge, grunting tightly by the amount of pressure crushing at his back and the pillow of girth smothering his face. He'd have to do something to get Bingo to let him go. He could try to play into Bingo's interests to get on his good side, or if he had enough venom left in his system, the Toxicroak could just make it nap time for the big fellow...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Bingo

choices: Hex offers Bingo an art project idea.
Hex inspects the stock to find 'the secret'.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"Th-Think I could see more of what you made? C-Can't see it if you're squishing me like this..." The Toxicroak grunts out, hoping it would ease the Seismitoad. Hex didn't want to hurt Bingo, cause he seemed like a nice enough guy, but the toad was certainly a forceful one.

The Seismitoad blinks before smacking his head lumps together excitedly. "Oh! Yes! Yes! Bingo has other things for froggy to see~!" Those thick arms finally set the Toxicroak down for Hex to stand and stagger for his balance. The big fat toad heads off somewhere, leaving the Toxicroak to adjust himself before hearing Bingo murr out, "Bingo likes these a lot."

"And might those be?" Hex mutters before yelping in place, having a collar suddenly click around his neck just under his jaw and above his throat sac. His eyes widen, tugging at the black material. "O-Ohh...thank you, ah-ahem, Bingo, but really I'm not really the type to..." The Toxicroak was too busy tugging at it, only to have a metal link at the front suddenly click as well after Bingo attaches a leash to it!

"Heeheehee..." The Seismitoad's face is a deep red with his lumps vibrating in joy; certainly nice but rather perverted. "Froggy looks nice in collar."

Hex can feel his face redden, but more-so with just embarrassment than arousal. "Th-That's....k-kind of you to say, Bingo. But I don't need to wea-" The leash is suddenly tugged, forcing Hex to stumble forward and smack right up against Bingo's belly again. The Seismitoad hugs his arms around the Toxicroak to squish into his gut, molding Hex into the amphibious chub. "H-Hnghk...!" Hex wheezes out, but his arms simply drape the best they can around the big Seismitoad to pat at his sides. "The collar's a bit tight, Bingo. Could you take it off for me?" The Toxicroak gets out, leaving the Seismitoad to hum.

"Too tight? Well...okay." The Seismitoad releases Hex from the fat hug to fiddle at the back of the collar, finally unbinding it to free the Toxicroak. It was a perfect fit, but Hex would never admit that to the aroused toy-maker. "Froggy better?"

Hex runs a hand at his bare neck, huffing, "Ahem...yes, froggy's much better now, thank you."

"Heehee. Bingo not thanked too much by others." The toad admits, poking fingers together again.

"Well, you certainly should be. You are an excellent artist, and I wish you could be making what you want somewhere else." The Toxicroak mutters. He'd have to figure out some way to get Bingo out of here without just outright telling him the place would most likely burn down soon.

"Bingo needs to finish what Damien wants though." The Seismitoad huffs, grabbing Hex's hand and forcing the frog to follow the large toad over to where his workbench was. Right next to the crafting table was a wooden stock, one for keeping a prisoner, in most likely public humiliation. It was two lockable wooden boards, one lifted up at the side that could clamp down on the other thick boards, leaving three open circles of space to lock someone's head and hands into. "Damien wants this to put people in silly moment. But also...heh...a nice moment." The toad blushes again, most likely enjoying the compromising position it could put someone in, unaware it was really for making use of prisoners.

"A-Ah...it looks well made so far..." Hex attempts to compliment before the toad suddenly grins far more widely, beaming with red.

"...Hheh...heh...froggy should go take a closer look. Bingo bet froggy can't find the secret..." The Seismitoad thrums with vibrations, pushing the Toxicroak forward to inspect it. The frog huffs, really wanting to get out of this room, but he certainly just needs to satisfy the Seismitoad's needs for his attention. He couldn't waste much time looking at yet another thing Bingo had.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Toad Toys

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"Bingo. I'm not that stupid." Hex huffs with crossed arms, tapping a heel at the floor. "There is no 'secret' on that thing. You just want to lock me in it." It was rather obvious the Seismitoad wanted to trick him into the prisoner stock, but Hex wouldn't have any of it, not even from a pervy sweetheart like Bingo.

The big Seismitoad continues to nervously prod fingertips together. "Bingo...sorry. Froggy would look cute in it though." He gives a sheepish smile, still red-faced, but looking far more apologetic.

"Hmph. I look fine enough without it, don't I?" The Toxicroak retorts, hands on his hips and his throat croaking in a way to change the subject.

It gets the big toad to murrs, nervously rubbing at his cheek. "Froggy does look nice~"

"Then how about you go make something like me? You said you like to make statues and figures. How about you make something for your froggy?" Hex said, posing with a leg out and a turned posture. It certainly pleases the flustered Seismitoad, but the big guy worriedly questions it.

"Bingo would love to make a small froggy figure! Nice looking figure. Bingo would have to go outside to get mud and clay to make froggy figure, but Damien no like Bingo going out." He says with a depressed sigh.

"Forget what that Damien wants." Hex rebukes. "Some...friends and I are here to erhm...give him a stern talk, so that he doesn't hurt or yell at anyone again. We're not scared of him; in fact, by the end of tonight, he'll be scared of us~" The Toxicroak doesn't like that he has to admit some of the plan to the big toad, but it wasn't like he was giving off any dire information, and it wasn't like the big toad was going to give the Toxicroak away. "That way, you can make whatever you want, Bingo. Your frog friend here will even be happy to pose for you however and whenever you want, and we can make Damien watch~"

Bingo smiles at this, nodding his head, "Really? Froggy and Bingo are...friends?"

"Of course! Truly." The Toxicroak answers, only to be instantly in another hug by the frog. Hex is smothered in the Seismitoad's belly, voice muffled in the chubby, round exterior rippling from his protesting words and squirms.

But Bingo didn't mind them at all, clenching the frog tight in those big arms. "Heh. Heh. Bingo so happy!"

Hex quietly pats his arms around the girthy toad before mumbling to be released, and he eventually gets his wish and is dropped down once more. Wiping himself, the Toxicroak clears his throat, "Yes, well, good. Ahem..." Hex extends his hand out for a gentle handshake to properly greet himself. "I don't believe I ever introduced myself either. My name is Hex. You can call me that." The frog's hand is grappled by both of the Seismitoad's, shaken vigorously up and down to nearly swing the frog about, struggling to even keep his balance on one leg.

"Hex! Okay!" The toad ribbits, vibrating joyfully.

The Toxicroak finally manages to slip his hand out from the powerful grip and just pats the Seismitoad's front to assure the big fellow, "I need to go and find some of my friends though, Bingo, in order to stop Damien from bullying others. Have you seen a Typhlosion anywhere near here? He wears an orange cloth on his arm." The Toxicroak points a finger at his arm to gesture which one it was.

Bingo glances up and scratches at his head, attempting to think about it before stumbling over to the door leading out of his workshop, pointing to one of the many other doors Hex could've chosen from. "Bingo think he saw him go in there with other guys."

Hex sidles right up next to the Seismitoad to see the exact door he was pointing, delighting the Toxicroak. Cupping Bingo's cheek, the frog reaches his head up the best he can to smooch Bingo on the nose to murr, "Bingo, you're the best!" He pats the cheek and explains, "Now go out there and get some clay. I hear they have plenty of it back at Hedgen. You know where that is?"

Bingo rubs at his nose, blushing vividly and murring, "Bingo knows~"

"You might want to take Blacky or whatever you think is important here. Cause uhm...you might spend the rest of the night at Hedgen! When you get there, just tell them Hex sent you there and why. They can trust you then." The Toxicroak mentions, getting confirmation from the Seismitoad.

"Okay! Bye bye Fro-, erh...Bye bye Hex~!" The big toad ribbits, indeed getting his favorite toy creation and heading off to some other door, exchanging farewells with Hex.

The Toxicroak cups both of his hands to his own cheeks, smiling, "Well don't I just feel good now." He murrs with the pride in saving at least one innocent person working for Damien. "I wonder if this is how Lace feels all the time when he helps others...oh I do hope he's alright." Pivoting around and facing the door the Seismitoad pointed to, Hex exhales and prepares to enter. "Hhhh. A promise to Lace is a promise. Jackal is my priority despite my better judgement. Lace, wherever you are, please don't be in trouble."

The Toxicroak presses his head up against the door to listen in on what was happening behind it all. He does in fact hear voices from the other side, one being which being close to Jackal's but perhaps not fully. Confused, the frog creaks the door ever so slightly...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: A New Friend

choices: Jackal takes matters into his own hands.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"Why you guys always got 'dem stupid looks on yer fayshes?!" Jackal's angry yet slurred voice booms for the Toxicroak to hear, listening to him from the cracked doorway. The Typhlosion was surrounded by three other males, backed up against a table with something odd about him. His eyes were awkwardly drooping, his cheeks particularly rosy, and his movements were sluggish. His voice even sounded weird, with everything being a half-tired growl. "You guyz aren't any fun... I'm gonna GO OUT and go back to that nice fella behind the bahr...!"

The Typhlosion would stagger forward, only to clumsily stagger back with one of the bandits pushing him back by his chest. "Not a chance, partner." A deep and gruff voice speaks, being the pusher. It was a large Aggron, muscular, tall, and with an armored belly sticking out. By his sides were a Braviary and Simisear, both with similar cocky expressions as the Aggron.

The avian sneers, "Psh, you are so drunk off your ass right now...!"

Jackal growls, pointing at him with a hand that clearly had a pint with a bit of ale in it. "Ey! How can an ass even get drunk...?! You people are weirdoez."

The primate murrs, "How many pints of the stuff did you even chug?"

The Typhlosion blinks repeated, clearing his throat constantly and swaying back and forth. "Uhhh....Uhhhh...how many's in a, hrk, barrel?" Jackal looks down at his hands to begin counting on his fingers as if that was going to help him, only to get distracted by his own wiggling fingers that he forgets what he was even moving them around for. He just dumbly chuckles to watch them curl and point out. Hex, even from afar and struggling to see past the big Aggron, can notice the big beer belly on the Typhlosion. He must've indulged himself far too much, now drunk, heavy, and in some kind of trouble with the three of these bandits. The Toxicroak however spots three men having half-erect rods and mischievous looks to them all. It was obvious they dragged Jackal here just to take advantage of him.

The Aggron bellows out with laughter, "I'm surprised you can even stand! I think you'd be more comfortable bent over though..." He murrs, reaching out to grab Jackal's shoulder. The Typhlosion jerks back, almost falling over yet again, but bumps against the table blocking him from escape, yet he remains unaware of the bandits intentions.

"H-hhrk. Ey, lay offa me! I don't need yer halp, or anybod'z. I can make it own my own! Hhup..." He hiccups slightly, by the three bandits were closing in on him now. Hex had to do something, or else witness Jackal gangbanged on a table. Opening the door quietly, he slips his way into the room and begins to creep forward, doing his best not to alert the attention of the three bandits having their backs to him. Jackal, however, can see the Toxicroak from under the Aggron's arm. Hex puts a finger to his lips to gesture the Typhlosion to remain quiet, only to see and hear the fire-type growl out with a pointed finger, "Oooy! Whaddar YOU doin' 'ere...?"

Hex freezes in place, standing there with widened eyes, a still heart, and choked breath once the three bandits curiously glance over to see the Toxicroak there at the other end of the room at the door. The Toxicroak had no idea what to do or say. The only thought of action right now was to quite literally murder Jackal. There was just no other option. Jackal had to die now. He had to die. Lace would understand.

The drunk Typhlosion stumps forward, brushing away the Aggron in front of him to stagger to Hex. "YyyooOOoouu...shouldn't be here! You should, hic, be back at duh, uhhh, whatever dug place wuz... Lace sed so..."

The Aggron grunts, "Who the hell's the frog? I've never seen him before, yet you know him?"

The Braviary grunts, "What place is he talking about? Does that mean he's some outsider?"

The Simisear grunts, "Who the heck is Lace? Does he mean the Lance fellow he came with?"

The Toxicroak was about to go into a panic attack from literally everything everyone worked for up to this point, Jackal blew in a single drunken stammer. "I...I...I..." Hex utters, still shocked, frozen in place, unable to speak any kind of defense.

The Typhlosion suddenly turns around and angrily growls, "That aaaain't any o' yer BIZNIZZ...! Pipe down! I'm talkin' to sumwon..." Jackal twists back around, his belly sloshing with his stomach full of alcohol with a hand resting on Hex's shoulder with the other poking repeated jabs to the frog's chest. "I think they're on to yaaa..." He attempts to whisper, but his voice merely hisses the words out. The other bandits can hear his words quite vividly still. "You gots to go. Lace and I have everythin' unduh control. Yer gonna blow mah cuvuh..."

"J-Jackal..." The frog quietly grunts from between his gnashed teeth, curling his hands into fists with extreme worry about the three cautious bandits slowly approaching them.

Jackal awkwardly smushes his finger to Hex's lips, poking one up against the frog's gums some. "SssSSHHssshhhh...! Mah name'zzz Zack! I-I dunno why...Lace said so...so be very, very, very, very, HIC, very quiet..."

The Aggron stomps forward, growling, "Wait, then just who are you two?! If you're outsiders, I'm taking you to Damie-"

Jackal spins around again to huff, " Shaddap! Wait chur turn! I am toduhlee one o' you guyz. I luv the whole, uh, rape slavez thang. And uh, hic, uh, hunt infeckdid. And uhhh...drinks...~ Hhehhh..." The Typhlosions spreads his warm, red cheeks with a fake toothy grin to try and pass off. The three bandits just stand there baffled at the stupidity and weirdness of it all, Hex had to do something while he could, because Jackal surely wouldn't.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Drunk Jackal

choices: The two manage to do well thus far!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Hex plants a hand on Jackal's chest, scooting the Typhlosion behind him before he readies his hands out before the three bandits. "Jackal, the gig's up. But I am more than happy to take you three monsters of men out." The Toxicroak grins in his usual coy way to hide his fear from the predicament and frustration with Jackal. Hex didn't like the odds, cornered by three rather tough looking bandits. However, his fingers flex out and his tongue rims around his lips. "Sorry boys, but I'm taking the Typhlosion back home. He's not yours to play around with. That's my job~"

"Nonsenze...!" The Typhlosion grunts, dropping his drink onto the floor and ready his wobbly fists up, fisticuffs style in a rotating motion. "Jis you watch! I'mma beat these bazturds through every floor of this stu-, hic! This stupid place...!" He blinks repeatedly, with his back pores hardly being able to keep up a flame.

The three bandits grin, liking these odds. Three against two, or at least, three against one and maybe a half considering the useless drunkard. The Aggron beats a fist into an open palm, the Braviary flexes out the wings on his back with readied claws, and the Simisear huffs out embers from his toothy smile. The metal beast boasts first, "Heh...is that right? We were just gonna put that big cushiony ass of yours to use, Typh, but the frog's more than welcome to join ya. We each can have a hole to fuck...~"

Hex silently swallows, not liking the idea at all with the half-erect men standing before him. But there wasn't much of a choice. Jackal retorts, "Eh? Ya wanna fuck me? Is that all 'chu can do to get yer rocks off, big guy, eh? Y'zee, this guy right here..." The Typhlosion suddenly hooks an arm around the Toxicroak, bringing the frog to smush sides to Hex's surprise. "This guy, tooootally just likes men. And dat's okay... A lotta people are bi theze dayz. But he actually only likez dudez, like me, aaand you...and you...aaaand I guess you too..." He mentions, point separately to each of the confused bandits.
