"Now, that's pretty weird, but I mean, I've gone about with this guy for like, HIC, for like a good while, and not once did he try to fffuck me... So yer all just dumb and stoopid and fucked up, and this cool guy here, he, hrk, he getz alllllllllll my rezpectomundo... Heez really really nice, and kinda cute I gez. And I can say dat! I ain't ashamed...! So fffffffffuck you and your dumb dick things! I'mma uppercut 'em...jist you watch-hic!" Jackal huffs, swinging his arms about, disconjointed from what he was actually saying.

The Simisear looks to the Braviary, who looks to the Aggron, who looks down to the two heroes overshadowed by him. With a strong inhale, the Aggron growls, "...I'm beating the drunk down first." He stomps forward and swings his horned head at the two. Hex shoves the clumsy, bellied Typhlosion away with the frog diving the opposite way, barely missing them.

Hex rolls back to a stand with poisoned claws ready. Jackal meanwhile stumbles in his steps against a wall before slowly rebounding off of it, staggering forward, swinging a punch to the Aggron's chest. "Aghh!" He yelps, holding his knuckles from hitting a wall of armor essentially. The Toxicroak groans, knowing that this was going to be a tough battle to deal with. The Braviary and Simisear dash at him, ready to claim their prisoner...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Bandit Battle

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
The Toxicroak slides on the ground to completely dodge the gusting winds blasting from the Braviary's flapping backwings. With a slash of both arms, Hex completely slips in between the avian's legs with his knuckles claws raking the ankles along the way, leaving the eagle to fall to his hands and knees with a yowl. "Craaahh!!"

Rolling back up to a stand, the Toxicroak lightly bounces in place with hands ready to deal with anymore resistance from the bird. The Braviary growls, when staggering up to a stand, but feeling the effects of Hex's venom in his ankles proved to be troublesome. "Damn frog. You're gonna pay for that!"

"Hmph." Hex croaks with a light smile. "Don't blame me, fellow. I'm simply here to collect a pal; you're the one who wants a piece of me. And if you want some of me that bad, you're going to need to try harder than that." The Toxicroak winks to rile the eagle up more before the Simisear steps up.

The monkey growls with tightened fists when standing by the Braviary, "Oh, I'm gonna have more than just a piece of you. I'd like to see how quickly you'd burn up in my stomach!" His cheeks puff out before spewing flames from his mouth to torch Hex, however, the frog manages to leap high with his strong legs and latch his hands onto one of the upper rafters. His legs lift so the fire barely misses underneath, heating up his rump and thighs even.

"Oof! Sorry, I'm afraid I don't prefer being charcoal or primate food." The Toxicroak retorts while happily swinging under the rafter.

The Simisear scowls, but the Braviary flaps his wings forward to blast himself towards the frog in a twirling spin, sticking out his beak for a Drill Peck. "Then how about being bird food?" He madly exclaims.

During Hex's swing, the Toxicroak flings himself forward at the avian to the Braviary's surprise, only to miss the frog once again by just a hair as Hex goes over him. However, the frog brings his legs together to clasp his thighs to the sides of the avian's head, flipping over to completely jolt the eagle from his dive and to slam into the ground with the Toxicroak. The avian hits the floorboards first, busting through them actually with Hex leaping off from him. Hex makes his clean landing and stands up straight with his back to the hole, widening his arms out to the Simisear as if he was waiting for some congratulatory cheers from his enemy by the impressive moves. The avian can be heard slamming into the ground below to groan before the loosen broken boards above him snap apart and fall into him.

The Simisear huffs embers through his teeth, "I'm going to give you a slow death, and it still wouldn't be enough for what you deserve right now."

"I'm going to give you a quick knock-out, which would be far less what you would deserve as well." Hex muses with half-lidded eyes. The frog bounds forward for a Poison Jab at the Simisear, yet the primate was able to side-step out of the with his own fist packing right against Toxicroak's stomach. Hex coughs out only before the monkey chomps his flat teeth to his arm. "Auuhh!"

Hex can feel the teeth bite down roughly, forcing the frog to fall over onto his side. The Simisear takes the moment to free Hex's shaking arm, just to then chomp down onto one of Hex's thighs. With the teeth biting his leg, the frog cries out in the sudden panic to kick the limb and swing his knuckle claws away at the primate. The monkey however jabs the amphibian right in the throat sac, forcing Hex to spit out some with widened eyes. His knuckle claw manages to scrape the Simisear, but only on the cheek. The monkey growls when releasing the leg from his mouth, leaving a firm bite mark on the thigh with a bit of saliva glistening with red. "Not so confident when I'm getting samples of food, eh?"

The Toxicroak was too busy trying to breathe properly than to make a snide comeback. It took most of his attention to do so, leaving the monkey to kick his other side and stomp down on his back. "Crrrhkkk!!!" Hex yelps aloud with a shuddering voice, tensing up all of his limbs.

The Simisear's open maw glows a bright orange light to toast the amphibian, however, a sudden chubby figure tackles him down onto the floor from behind. Jackal growls when pinning the other fire-type to the ground, "Ey! You lay the fuck offa him!" Before the Simisear can mutter a word, Jackal's fist pounds him across the poisoned cheek, making it sting extra harder for the bandit before his other cheek is punched across with Jackal's other fist. "Who the fuck goes aroun' bitin' other people?! What are ya, infected?! Peez o' SHIT!" Jackal was swinging powerful and deafening punch to the Simisear's head with his heavy beer-gutted weight keeping the monkey down and breathless. The legs of the bandit squirm and his voice gags out to speak, but Jackal was beating him so frequently, only the Typhlosion was doing the talking. In fact, every few words he spoke, they were followed with a punch.

"Fuck you! He's! A nice! Guy! Unlike you! A fucko! I hate you! I hate your friends! I hate this place! I hate bandits! I hate your face! I hate your leader! I hate Lace for! Makin' me come here! But fuck it! He's nicer than you! He's better than you! That's why! I'm bashin'! Yer! Fuckin'! Stoopid! Ass! Face!!!" Jackal exclaims, having swung faster and faster the farther he went into his drunken furious rage. Hex was already up and standing, shoving the Typhlosion off the Simisear. Jackal kicks and squirms, snarling madly when trying to fight off the Toxicroak to get the primate. "No! I aaain't done with that chompy chomp bazturd!"

Hex glances over to see the Simisear was easily unconscious with a puffy bruised face oozing with blood from his mouth and nose. The monkey was left drooling stupidly with several teeth knocked out. "Jackal. You must calm down! We need to-" The Toxicroak wasn't allowed to finish, now that he was the one next to be surprised tackled. The Aggron Jackal was dealing with shoulder-charged and bashed his stomping force against Hex to leave the frog smashing through a wooden wall and into another room. The Toxicroak gags at the sudden hit before the Aggron's thick arms grapple around him and slam him heavily to the floor.

The air in Hex's lungs are viciously forced out with his eyes rolled up, spine aching. He can feel the full weight of the Aggron's leg stomp right to his stomach, nearly forcing the frog to spit out all the poison he left in his body. "Splchgaghtk!! H-H-Hh....H-Hughh..." Hex wheezes and gags, unable to come to his senses with the large down glaring down at him.

"Ggrrhh...I don't like it when people hurt my best buds." The dino says, lifting up a leg for another stomp above Hex's head to finish the groaning frog off.

"Neither do I, fucker!" Jackal exclaims from behind the Aggron. The metal beast turns his head to see the Typhlosion...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: A Frog's Friend

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Jackal's very eyes emitted a burning rage to them as his open maw glows a vivid glow of orange. His mane suddenly fumes out a wide fan of fire as his jaws unleash a chaotic stream of the stuff out at the Aggron. Whether it was just his mad anger or the alcohol in his system fueling the fires, the metal dino gasps before being blasted destructively away from Hex. The heavy beast bashes onto the ground by the sheer force with the armor on his body glowing red from burning heat. "G-Ggyyaahhh!!!" He exclaims, feeling the searing sensation at his body some. He was thankful he was the kind of metal-coated creature that he was, otherwise he'd be nothing but charcoal. However, this just leads him to being open to the charing Typhlosion. The fire-type was even pouncing on all fours before smashing into the Aggron with flames still erupting from his body and mouth.

Jackal growls with blind rage, "Let's see how ya like it when the person you tried to fack FACKS you over!" The Aggron is forced back after the maddened drunk managed to actually beat him over with his fists alone. Hex coughs and manages to pull himself over onto his side just in time to see his companion screaming and repeatedly bashing the Aggron's middle. His fist nearly had a fiery blast with each deafening impact, echoing the metal bashing into the room with the Aggron gagging to each one. The bandit's back slams to the floor boards, cracking and scorching up to the intense heat glowing bright from his body with Jackal yelling. The more Jackal screams, the more vivid and violent the flames become.

"G-GhHyyahahhHHHH!!! AHhhHHhH!!! Get OFF!!!" The Aggron growls with pinched eyes, whipping his thick tail about and rolling his head about in the panic of such ferocity. His fist collides into Jackal's belly to halt his flaming breath for a bare moment as the Typhlosion gags to the motion, but it was enough time for the Aggron bandit to grab Jackal by his neck with both hands. The clawed hands clench tight to seize up the fire-type's throat to cease his flame spewing while attempting to choke Jackal out. The Typhlosion's eyes tighten and his hands grab and tug at the burly arms. The Aggron glares angrily in his own pained rage, crushing away at Jackal's throat while growling, "I thought it'd be nice to let you live and just keep you like a fucked-up slave, but if you wanna die, you're more than welcome to. I'm gonna watch the life in those stupid drunk eyes of yours die out!"

Jackal tightly gags and wheezes, clawing at the hot metal at the Aggron's arms despite them doing nothing. Hex watches in horror, attempting to drag himself over to the two with his legs seizing up from the strain. He was able to get a wobbly stance going, but he would nearly fall over at any endeavor to walk. He was rushing himself too much, but Jackal was dying, and would die quickly if he didn't do something.

Unable to think of anything else, the Toxicroak grunts, "Jack-...yeah, Jack. Are you gonna let that bastard just choke you like that? Lace was right about you, being weak. He even told me your real name was Jack, and Jackal was just a cover because you thought it sounded cooler..."

Jackal's brows pinch with his teeth bearing together. The angrier he was, the stronger he was, and Hex knew this. The thought of Lace bad-mouthing him and still on about that stupid name drilled something into the Typh's mind to where he manages to choke out a growl, "...H-Hk...my...fucking...name...is..." His jaws part again with his teeth now glowing orange and crackling with fire. His mane even bursts fuming flames that torch the metal claws of the Aggron's hands cupped around Jackal's neck. The beast yelps from that along with the Fire Fang attack gnashing down around one of his wrists, forced to let go of the Typhlosion. The fire-type roars, "JACKAAAAAAAAAL!!!" with a Fire Blast slamming into the Aggron that sends the large beast crunching through the floorboards before bashing through a wooden wall, off of a balcony, and into a completely other room! The sound of a rumbling crash shakes the walls and floorboards of the room Hex and Jackal were both currently in, scaring the frog even with how violent and powerful the Typhlosion's temper was.

Jackal huffs out smoke with every heavy exhale, giving the air a dark mist to it as he just stares at the scorched wooden trail of embers and soot through the cracks and holes he made to send the Aggron off with. His growls subside and his arms slump before swinging lazily over as he turns to Hex, "Hhhaaagghh....hhrrrrrgghhh...hhhhffffggh...fuck...hhhgh...that guy..."

The Toxicroak clears his throat and straightens himself more, able to take the time to actually stand correctly and check his walking. Making enough ground, he was confident that he'd be able to make it out of this place, especially now that he was with Jackal and the Typhlosion was...capable of defending himself should things get sour. Coughing, Hex mutters when looking at the damage with a bit of awe, "Yes...hff...fuck that guy."

"Gluuhh..." The Typhlosion groans, timbering over. Hex was quick enough though, and manages to catch Jackal into his arms. Apparently exerting himself in such a way exhausting Jackal. "Ughnnn...I wanna...go home." The fire-type groans. "Shit, wait, I don't even haffa home anymore, but I wanna go to a place that feelz like one."

Hex tugs on the Typhlosion to get Jackal to stand properly, keeping an arm slung behind his shoulders. "Don't worry, we're leaving this place at once and going back to Hedgen. We're meeting up with the others there after all is said and done in this place."

The two begin to walk together, needing to leave for all of the commotion they likely have caused, more than what Hex would've liked. Still, he was happy he found his friend. Jackal growls, "Gggrrhhh...did Lace say all dat shit about me?" The drunk Typhlosion tightens a fist with half-lidded eyes.

"No, sorry, I am afraid I lied about that. I figured you needed an extra push to send you into your rather...uhm...primal-self." The Toxicroak admits.

Jackal then grunts, "Damn. Oh well, I showed dat stoopid dino. Sorry for getting all, hic, worked up about it. Glrrhh...I need...some belly rubs..."

"If we get out of this place alive, I'll give you all the stomach rubs you need." Hex states when his attention was more focused on walking Jackal stealthily through the rooms and halls of the mill, attempting to avoid any that had bandits in them.

"H-Hehhh...didja know I had Lace promise me sometin' like dat? It was after a tuff thing we went through together, and he kinda kept it up for a bit but then...shit, I dunno, it started making me angry. I dunno, not at him. I guess I realized it hurt my pride or some shit. Fuck, am I like a child?" Jackal confesses aloud as he's slumped against Hex, needing to be babied around with his alcohol-addled mind after his temper-tantrum. Hex wouldn't admit that to Jackal though.

The frog mentions to dismiss the claim when glancing around, more worried for guards, "Not at all. Now please, keep your voice down."

And yet, Jackal continues, "...I should...apologize to dat guy. He's been lookin' after me since we met, and I tried to eat 'em when we did. L-Lace is such a, hic, such a great dude. I dunno why I get so frustrated with him though. Itz like he's drilled into my head or some shit that I have to deny. I care about him, y'know? And I've treated him like dirt for it. I'mma...I'mma talk to him when I see that Lucario bastard. He ain't gonna get the better of my temper or frien- hic! Friendship! He and I, hic, are gonna fuckin' save the world together!"

"Yes, yes, that's nice, I'm glad you've consoled yourself with this but, please, will you be qui-" Hex states before shutting himself up after hearing a door open. Quickly, he slams himself and Jackal against a wall around a doorway, out of sight from the people that just walked into the hall they were in.

Jackal grumbles, "Naw, we can take 'em, jis like dat Aggron bitch! Lemme' at 'em...hic!" The Typhlosion was actually sliding himself off of Hex, ready to go out there to the approaching steps storming their way in.

The Toxicroak immediately yanks him again, pinning his back to the wall while also pushing a hand to Jackal's mouth to muffle his voice. Clearly, he was panicking and getting frustrated with his friend from the close-call they had in the last encounter. "Sh-Shh! Jackal, for Arceus' sake...! Neither of us are in a state to-"

Jackal slaps the hand out of the way though. "Get yer hand offa me! I gotta go find Lace, n' no bandit it gonna stahp me fr-" The Typhlosion would continue, but Hex was forced to take matters into his own hands. His head tilts and leans in, snuffing out Jackal's voice once the frog kisses the Typh. Mouth to mouth, Hex guides his tongue into Jackal's jaws to welcome the fire-type's own in a bit of distracting play despite the smoky taste. The drunk's eyelids would lift up (as best they could) in surprise before awkwardly drooping. Jackal grunted in confusion, but soon his drunk-addled mind caved in. He simply let Hex do his thing as the gay Toxicroak worked his magic. The bandits in the hall would pass by the two hidden away, exiting through a different door in search for the commotion earlier.

Hex's lips smear and tighten, repeatedly locking to the Typhlosion's own as his hands cup to the chubster's belly. Applying the previously requested rubs, the frog neatly thumbs over the beergut in coaxing strokes and easy palming. The fire-type's cheeks redden over time, lazily just standing there to let it all happen until Hex's lips wetly pucker off from him. The frog stares into Jackal's eyes for a brief moment until he states, "...We're leaving this place. Follow me. Stay close. Be quiet."

Jackal is left dumbfounded. "O..Okay..." Hex takes him by the wrist and leads him out. And along the way, Jackal mutters, "...Could we do that...again?"
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Hot-Headed Savior

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Your world slowly comes back to you, but only steadily over time. A constant and ambient pounding thrums at your skull. Your heavy eyelids attempt to open, and you think you manage to do so, yet the world was still dark; at least, it was so blurry, darkness was barely waning. Parting your jaws, you wheeze in a brief amount of dry air. While you do hear yourself doing this, your ringing ears hardly pick this up as a natural sound. A constant motion of noise fills into them even, but they're so frantic and muffled, you are unable to depict what they all are. "U-...Ughnh..." You groan aloud, regaining your senses at an incredibly slow pace.

A muffled voice boasts, "Wakey, wakey, bitch." You groan out again, blinking again and again to battle off your grogginess. You can feel yourself moving, despite none of your muscles really responding to what you want them to do. Your wrists and legs most of all feel something brushing against them; no, dragging against something. You were being pulled along the ground against someone's hip carelessly before being dropped completely. You cough, blinking still with twitching ears until you glance up to see black set of hindpaws before you. Your eyes glance up to see the vague figure of a Houndour with a female Persian laid out along his lap, lightly combing at his chin with her clawed fingertips.

Damien's familiar voice picks up, "Lance, Lance, Lance. What on earth are you doing here back so soon~? Did you forget something...?" His voice sounded coy, but there was a clear underbelly of anger in there.

You cough and manage to get to your hands and knees. Your sight and hearing were getting better, but a sudden kick to your stomach sends you back onto the ground. "He asked you a question, bitch." It was the person that carried you here, the same person that must've knocked you out from your last memory being with him in the toolroom. The Bibarel righthand man to Damien growls, "Answer him."

"Now, now, Bigby. Give him a moment. He can't talk if you keeping knocking the air out of his lungs. You can bash it all out after he's done talking with me." Damien retorts, now becoming less sincere with his voice. "I last recall sending you away with Ruby a good long while ago, yet I was never informed of your return and I have yet to have seen my precious cat. Why did you sneak back in here? Where's Ruby?"

Collecting your breath, you hoist yourself up to your knees while clutching your stomach, getting a good view of Damien's unpleased face. "H-Hhhk...came back...for a drink. Your precious Ruby's just waiting for me outside." You retort as a sarcastic response.

Bigby is ready to hit you, but Damien lifts a hand to stop him from doing so. He pats Sapphire's hip to get the just-as-angry Persian to slide up off from him to relax onto the couch more as he stands himself up. "...Frankly, I need you alive, but only for so long to where I can know about Ruby's fate. But I can be very careful to hurt someone just enough so they can endure the very edge of death, at the cusp of it, and yet out of reach." The Houndour suddenly kicks the low-table in between the two of you out of the way and off the balcony he was at. Bandits in the main recreation room scatter when seeing the table fall down a level, barely avoiding it smashing to the ground below. The young Houndour then bashes your chin with a swift kick to send you onto your back. On the floor, he immediately stomps his paw onto your neck to make you choke out and gets your heart to skip a beat.

"H-HAGCHHK!!" You gag out with widened rolled up eyes, clutching in a panic at Damien's leg in your weakened state. He grinds and twists the paw down, straning the spinal column and closing your air tunnel, forcing your body to convulse and kick at the floor, gagging louder, "Gg-gggrrhhaackkkghkk...!"

"You sound fucking pathetic. But if you want to sound like anything at all other than a cold dead corpse, then I suggest..." He suddenly stomps down at you again, harder this time, "Where!" He stomps again, forcing spittle from your jaws, "Is!" He stomps yet again, cracking the floorboards under your head, "Ruby?!" His eyes burn with rage, teeth snarling and gritting, tail whipping out in distress. He might just end up killing you with his form of interrogating, but it wasn't like Bigby or Sapphire were going to stop him. They were enjoying this in fact...

You had to decide what to say with the little amount you had to speak...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Captured Lace

choices: Use Bone Rush to finish the infected!
Charge an Aura Sphere to buy some time!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"Behind bars, which is better than what he actually deserves." You retort to the Houndour pinning you down to the ground. Clearly his face was that of confused anger, and you continue to explain, "I didn't like him all that much after a chat. I saved him from an infected Serperior, apparently which was one of your own, Thrash. But frankly, he wanted feast on him like food, so I dragged that cat bastard to the Hedgen jail because at least I still have some decency other than you people. I plan on getting my friend outta here, an-ghkk!!" You choke again once the hindpaw weighs down on your neck making your legs kick at the floor.

Damien snorts out fire with clenched fists tightening up. "You...you barred him in that fucking town? You're with those fucking peasants? You think you can just barge in here after taking Ruby and getting your fat dumb fuck of a boyfriend scott-free?" His paw really grinds down at your clenched throat, closing your channel of air to have you silently gag on the ground. Your lungs burn and your neck aches from the pressure which drives some adrenaline in your body. With an instantly charged aura-burning fist, your collide it to Damien's leg to knock it off with Damien slamming back onto the couch he was lounging in earlier. Wind returns to your mouth to finally breathe, but Bigby is right there to knock it right out with a firm kick to your side, right in the ribs.

You roll over onto your hands and knees, not wasting a moment to slam yourself up against the big Bibarel to drill another punch in. It connects to his stomach to make him hunch over, but Sapphire the Persian rakes your back with her claws as she hisses a vile sound for hurting her precious Houndour. You yelp from the sting until Damien's hand grabs the back of your head after getting up to smash it against the wooden railing of the balcony you all were on. The three on one situation really worked against you, and you collapse onto the ground once more, completely dazed, drooling from your open mouth even. "H-Hghh..." Bigby grabs you by the ears and hoists you up off the ground, leaving you to just dangle there with Damien and Sapphire scowling at you; the Persian already hugged into the Houndour's side and running a hand to the scorch mark on his thigh you left.

"Send him to the Pit." Damien orders the beaver with your eyelids throbbing to regain an open vision.

"G-Gnnh...not the game?" You remark before Damien slams a kick to your stomach to shut you up.

The bandit leader was smiling a bit some, rather nefariously as he explains, "Oh that's right, we never showed you. For some special fighters like you, we have a different kind of event for everyone to watch, not just for me to see down in a maze." He glances over to Sapphire to give an affectionate lick to her cheek, patting her ass to murr, "Gather the men, would you~?" She smiles and heads down as Damien gestures his head at the railing of the balcony to Bigby. "Give him the short way down there."

You feel the Bibarel grip you tight before flinging you up and over the bars of the balcony, sending you to fall towards the large recreation room and bar the bandits had that were listening in the whole time. You bark out with your body slams onto a wooden table, breaking it apart on impact to nearly knock you out all over again. "Gy-gh...nh..." You couldn't even muster words as your world grows dark and blurry with bandit men crowding around you, glaring down at your body amidst the smashed wood...

-----|-----


It was hard for you to tell how much time passed, or if any actually did. Your world was a dark and blurry mess with everything pulsating numbly. Voices mutter around you, almost like a cheer that increases the more you get close to it. You sense yourself being dragged somewhere since you obviously weren't up and walking. Soon enough, a bandit splashes your face with a mug of beer to jostle your senses, having you sputter at the fluid and open your eyes more. Bigby had a hold of your head while sliding you along the ground to somewhere behind you. Several bandits are eager to watch with Damien even walking next to you. His fiery eyes spot you waking up again to have them lock right to your own pair. "Dump him in." He orders, not to you of course, but to the burly beaver opening a wooden gate to fling you in.

Your body falls before hitting a dirt floor this time, no hard wooden surface this time. Your muzzle grunts and wheezes as you remain in your new problematic situation when struggling to stand. Your eyes blink with a roar of applause up above you, getting you to glare up and see that you were indeed in a large circular pit. It was a dug-in hole with columns of logs rounding out the tall walls with a cage of branches making for the ceiling where the crowd of bandits watching down could be your audience. Damien rises from the crowd and bestows you like a show, "Gentlemen, here we have a pretty stupid traitor that has sided with the fuckers back in Hedgen. But here is, wanting to come back for his dear old friend. Let's say we give him some new friends to play with, hm~?"

A heavy sound snaps your attention to face forward in the dirt pit you were stucking. A large gate slowly lifts up via chains to reveal to purple glowing dots peering at you through the darkness. You stagger back, only to growl in pain from how much your body's sustained thus far. The infected stammers forward, revealing itself to be a fat Lickitung with a swinging tongue that's far-too-eager to taste you right now. It drools with a hungry look with a collar tucked on its neck, being pushed forward by a bandit with a long pole to keep it out of reach from himself. He unhooks the pole from the collar to skid back to the gate entrance into the pit where it can slam closed before you or the infected could mosey on through it. The Pit was just a make-shift arena for people to fight it out with captured infected, and you were the newest victim. Apparently they didn't just eat all of the infected, but used them for sport like in the Game and this duel as well.

The bandits cheer and holler for your demise as the Lickitung slaps its belly and stumbles forward with ravenous eyes at your already battered figure to make for an easy meal. Gritting your teeth, you prepare your fists with an awkwardly hurt posture to face off with this chubby being. Damien exclaims as he has Bigby ring a gong, "Dinner time~!" It was almost too convenient that the feral charged at you once the ringing sound bellows out in the room. You skid away the best you can only to have your back hit the wall. There wasn't a lot of room to face off against this thing.

The fat being jostles as it encroaches with a mighty swing of its tongue that you're able to duck under. However, it swings right back to wetly smack your side and send you to the floor. You yelp as your body resounds with aches from the hit that would've normally just agitated you. All that abuse from earlier was on purpose, and Damien wanted to see you fall to a mere hungry feral in front of his 'family'.

Quickly getting up to a wobbly motion, you dash forward to meet the Lickitung with your own attack, only to meet its open arms that grapple around your back to trap you in a hug. Your body is crushed against the infected's gluttonous fat belly, mushing into the pudge that so many others have fallen into with the entrance to you gaping wide before you. "N-No!" You growl as you attempt to worm your binded arms out from its hold. The open gummy mouth before you drools with the fat tongue smacking to the back of your head, wrapping around it even to try and yank it on inside the warm and slick cavern. "N-Nhmmpk! Grrhh!" Your body tenses up. It was like several senses of pain were working against you. Your back aches from the stress of the Lickitung's thick arms apply to your spine, the bare pink and yellow flesh of its gut molds to your battered figure to weaken your muscles despite the cushiony chub, and its fat tongue darkens your vision from flexing around your entire head. The wet meat squishes to your muzzle and cranium before working your head towards its mouth. You do what you can in the dangerous situation, emitting your entire body with whatever aura you could muster in the short amount of time. Miraculously, you get the infected Lickitung to release you before you can even blast your aura off from you to hurt it. Apparently the dumb thing was smarter than you thought. The tongue unravels from your head as you stagger away to have your back hit the wall again, making you wince in place with drool matting your fur now as you pant for fresh air.

Your arms hang down heavily with your posture slumped over some, obviously weighed by the damage. The Lickitung smacks its jaws, wetting its tongue to collect some of the taste it was able to snag off of you from its grapple. Its gut rumbles deeply for food, and you really just encouraged its hunger. The crowd berates you, and you'd have to take care of this thing quickly before the audience got to see what they wanted. Or you could try to hold out as long as you could to save time for your companions who should be storming this place any moment. A distraction like that could lead to your escape...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: The Pit

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
With curled fists that you clasp sides together, you focus your aura within their grip, spreading your hands out to form tightly bound aura into a staff the long your arms extend. Crafting a weapon from your own energy, you nearly stagger over to feel as though your muscles were going to give from just the mere motion. You close your eyes to zero-in on making the glowing bone as physical as possible, surely with enough to make every swing feel like an aura-burning punch. It was rather distracting with all of the bandits cheering for your demise, along with the heavy panting of the beast in front of you. Regardless, your weapon is crafted and you hunch down some to face off against the fat Lickitung slapping its own gut as a gesture for you to bring it on.

In a quick dash, you attempt to close the distance with your staff readied behind you, swinging with all your might in the momentum to slam it right against the Lickitung's middle. The purple eyes of the fatty widen out as the staff completely buries against the hefty chub, leaving it staggering back with a heavy step here and there. You follow it up with another swing towards its head for real damage, although it yanks its face back just in time for you to completely miss which has you pivoting over too far. Left exposed, you feel its large tongue loop around at your hip before lifting you up just to slam you down to the ground on your back. You cough, feeling the stress of everything simultaneously ache. Blinking, you see its leg lifted up for a stomp, and thankfully you dodge this one by rolling over. You can hear the clay-like dirt smash heavily which could've been your skull a second ago. Rolling more back up onto all fours, you crawl some until you can rise back up awkwardly towards your infected opponent who already charged in for another attack. It manages to get another wet-slap of its tongue to smack against your face to make you step back, but you fight it off with bashing your bone staff to the long muscle's side.

The Lickitung yelp and wobbles its tongue about before glaring at you, swinging a wide uppercut with it in retaliation. You quickly use your aura weapon to block the move by holding it horizontally, which catches the fat tongue and his it loop around it instead. The Lickitung growls at this and keeps its hold on the staff, pulling at it to yank you a step towards it. Stomping your hindpaws down, you're now at a tug-of-war match with the beast by keeping a hold of the staff's edges in both hands while its curled tongue tugs harder at its middle. "Ggghhhhhhgggghhhrrrr!!" You growl out in frustration, feeling ever muscle in your body tense up, attempting to fight off the weight and strength of the fat pink monster. Its arms swing wide open in preparation to trap you in another bear hug once it pulls you in close enough, but you wouldn't allow it another chance to do so.

With an aura glint of your eyes, you dispel the staff away, leaving it to vanish in embers of aura midair. You had let go before it did so, but the infected Lickitung had not. The full force of its fat tongue smacks it right against face, forcing it steps back now this time. Panting, you crank up some of the aura you can muster around a single fist and bolt towards the Lickitung after it pries its own tongue off from its face, which now gives it a good view of the roaring Lucario leaping towards it. With the help of some speed, gravity to add some weight to you, and perhaps some miraculous adrenaline, you pound a mighty fist directly to the Lickitung's shocked expression to send the fatass spiraling away in drunken stumbles. Its back slams to the wall with a burning punch mark left right on its smashed nose, leaving it groaning from the rattling shock. ITs heavy weight forces it down onto its knees before inevitably falling over onto its belly, unconscious. The Lickitung's tongue flops out over onto the ground, drooling idly which leaves you the winner.

You had hit the dirt after falling from the down-diving punch, which has you simply on your knees and elbows, heaving for oxygen into those tired lungs before you weakly rise up to the dismay of the bandits above. Your eyes meet with Damien's as you point a finger, "...hhh...hhh...I win."

Damien doesn't seem to be too discouraged by this however. "For round one, yes. But let's see how you deal with round two~?" His tail whips by excitedly as the gate within the pit arena suddenly opens up again.

"Round t-two...?" You mutter before looking over and seeing another purple pair of eyes glaring at you from the darkness, and not only that, but crackling orange flames. Out from the gate, the next infected opponent looms closer to the weak-looking meal it sees before itself and neighs hungrily. A female Rapidash locks eyes with you with a vicious look to her expression. Her flat teeth gnash together with drool seeping through between them amidst her angered growls. And with a glance, her figure was intimidating all on its own. Her body was well muscled with an obvious impressive set of abs on her stomach, built arms, and the rather dangerous-looking legs that could probably break your back with just a squeeze between her thighs. From her slit, pre oozes lightly from it from being horny with nostrils flaring, quite literally since embers and smoke fumed from her. The fire of the unicorn's mane crackles some the more excited she got when thinking about how nicely you'd do for either food or as some fun.

Damien spreads his arms out, "Round two~! Be careful now, she's a real feisty bitch. She used to be one of the slavegirls here, but managed to escape us. I was going to have search parties be sent out to hunt her down and bring her back, but we found her lumbering back towards this place outside, cause she apparently got herself raped out there by some infected! Droolin' and moanin' with purple eyes. Irony I tell ya~"

You lacked the means to shut the Houndour up right there and then sadly.

The Rapidash roars from her mouth before charging at you. Now it was fight or flight. You packed a lot of strength in all that you had to deal with thus far, but you certainly had limits. You'd have to come up with some way to beat her or escape this pit.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Overweight to Heavyweight

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
A mighty collision smashes in the middle of the arena as both you and the Rapidash meet together at the center in a sudden grapple. You tense your body as close as you could to being steel, no pun intended for your type, and clash hands with the large horse. The taller Rapidash roars as your palms mash together in an attempt to work the other down. However, from your perspective, she was working her weight and strength down upon you, and you were endeavoring just to keep her from toppling over you. The infected snarls with its animalistic purple eyes before prying its maw wide, fuming an orange glow within her throat.

Amidst the grapple, you swing your head to the side as she fires off a flaming fan to narrowly miss your face, but the skin and fur certainly feel the intense heat scorch by. It gets you to growl right back before you spew out a bit of your flaming aura yourself, blasting a short burst to pelt the horse's own face with blue fire. The Rapidash snarls in response by swinging its smoking head around, and while the fire-type wasn't too harmed by the move, it weakened her hold briefly enough for you to throw off her hands, only to drill a powerful swing into her stomach. The horse curls over in the motion to gag out before you follow up with an arcing uppercut to clock her long jaw. The Rapidash slings backwards in a few steps before shaking its head again, whisking away the dizziness.

Stomping her hooves down firmly and flexing her figure, she snorts from her nostrils before spewing out a long flamethrower from her maw, forcing you to hit the dirt flat. The stream of crackling heat strikes the wall behind you and burns at the wooden pillars making up the surrounding pit. Just as you think it'd cause a fire for an escape, a sudden splash of water dowses the scorch-spot. Your eyes peer up as you stagger to a slow stand to see Bigby, Damien's right-hand Bibarel, grinning down at you with crossed arms and a wet mouth; rather, damp with water and not saliva despite his urges into eating you. Apparently they thought ahead of time in case you ever thought about using the fire against the wooden structure. No wonder why the Houndour leader liked having the beaver around.

Still, a different idea hatches in your mind as the Rapidash prepares for another charge. Waiting for the unicorn to use another fire-attack, you pivot around and dash to try and outrun the infected beast. It chases you towards a well to nearly trap you, but you leap and kick off from the wall to effectively soar over the stomping Rapidash. It skids to a quick halt and twists around to face you, but by that time you had already landed behind her and swung your leg. A roundhouse kick smashes against the side of her head to send her staggering over wildly, almost falling over into the dirt.

Her flaming mane crackles out much more wildly as she gives you what you want, spewing out another flamethrower to scorch up another wooden wall spot to engulf it in fire. Luckily you were able to slide down along the ground and through her legs, coming up right behind her. Just as she pivots around with a swipe, you get clocked across the cheek, but a firm stomp with a leg keeps you from tumbling over. Your eye catches Bigby's cheeks bloating from up above the pit to extinguish the fire, eliciting into you suddenly charging at the Rapidash. Your body leaps with your legs tucking in close before you dropkick the horse directly in her abdomen.

The Rapidash is sent tumbling backwards before slamming into the burning wall she just scorched up, and all the while, the Bibarel up above already blasted out another stream of water to dowse it. The beaver's eyes widen to see the waterfall smash down onto the flaming horse, erupting a wild amount of steam that clouds up the entire pit. The bandit audience all mutter confusion and thoughts of disappointment from the lack of Lucario whines or beatdowns.

Blanketed in the steam, you limp forward to see the Rapidash is on her hands and knees, panting out with a nearly extinguished mane. Mere embers flicker from her back and neck with drool oozing out of her tired mouth. Without the fire burning at her body, the infected Pokemon was heavily weakened. Adrenaline was still running throughout your body on the other hand. Your heart pounds at your ribcage, your blood boils wildly, and the steamy air fumes about at your throat and lungs. You could feel the tinge of fatigue tempting your body to give out, which only encouraged you to finish this quickly.

Looking down at the Rapidash, you internally apologize as to whoever it was that suffered such a fate before your paws all ignite with aura. Swinging away, your punches slam down at the unicorn's head, battering at her face to rock her skull about. Saliva slings about from the infected's maw as you beat down upon it, all before you roar out with a final stomp. Your hindpaw closes her jaw to the ground in a booming thud, effectively knocking the Rapidash out and leaving your entire muscle structure shivering.

You stumble backwards with light-headedness and land on your rear end, panting out wildly as the steam begins to clear. The bandits are then given a view of the mighty unicorn fighter out cold in the dirt, along with you, alive and huffing. Your eyes glare up to where Damien was as you pant out, "Another...round...done..."

The Houndour smiles from his cushioned seat with an elbow sitting atop an armrest with his head leaning against his fist; a leg casually crossed over the other to bob about. "Cheating, are we~?"

Bigby scowls down at you and mutters to Damien, "Let me get down there in with him. I can finish him off."

"Tempting..." Damien murrs out but then demands, "But let's make it more interesting. Final round. One more feral for you to fight. How's that, Lance?" You didn't anticipate for Damien to keep his word, and simply glared at him while you had a moment to breathe. "Very well, send out our newest yellow friend!" He called upon the guards at the feral gate below to get, to which they both nervously look at one another before heading into the darkness of where they keep the excess of ferals in pins.

You wobble to a stand again as the gate begins to open once more. Readying your fists, you're prepare yourself to face whatever kind of Pokemon they have to throw at you. However, nothing could prepare you for the figure stumbling out. Light flashes off of the beast occasionally, with two purple dots glaring at you from the dark. You catch glimpses of its yellow and white fur that glint with an occasional electrical spark, yet the electrical discharges seem to be held back by something. The gate closes, and the infected is showcased in its glory. Large fangs gleam your reflection of surprise off as a legendary stands before you.

An infected Raikou breathes heavily in hunger and rage, as the power it withheld could be felt simply emanating with the sound of its voice. According to Herox, he ate all of the legendaries, but considering his intentions, that was easily a lie even before this revelation. Still though, the Raikou was more than just intimidating. Sparks constantly flicker off from its male and strong physique, even from the purple mane flowing about behind it. A black rubber mask was strapped to his head, along with other rubber garments like gloves, belted leggings, etc. The black rubber was able to keep most of the electrical power from exploding off from the legendary lightning beast, but it certainly wasn't enough to snuff it all out entirely.

Damien muses, "Ever seen the elusive Raikou before? I forget what his actual name was, but he ended up hearing the plea of the town and was bent on taking me down, along with my establishment here, just like you in fact! However, it seems legendaries are just a fat disappointment. We tossed his battered ass down into this pit with several ferals, and the poor tiger just couldn't fend them all off despite his mighty reputation. Joining their ranks, he's made for a very interesting opponent for others. Luckily for you, you won't have to fight him at full strength thanks to our local toy-making retard's outfit that he crafted just for this loser."

The Houndour claps his hands and announces, "Let round three commence!"

The infected Raikou roars with a bellow that shook the entire arena, nearly muting your ears as sparks and bolts wildly crack about. Judging from how much his open mouth was drooling with saliva, and the intimidating size of his cock drooling with pre, there wasn't a good fate to suffer if you lost to this wild beast. The Raikou's erection throbs in a manner that you couldn't tell if it wanted to infect you, or make you into a batch to infect someone else later. You swallow down your nerves and ready yourself the best you can.

You prayed help would arrive soon if the others were carrying out the plan effectively...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Fiery Bout

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
...Elsewhere in the underground section of the lumber mill, a lone Charmeleon stumbles forward in the dark halls with only that of his tail end keeping a light source, having the individually light the torches along the walls. He grumbles to himself as he walks along the dirt path with a mocking tone of someone, "Oh Credel, why don't you head downstairs and check the tunnels. I haven't checked since it's dark down there. Make yourself useful and go light 'em for me. Damien's all aaaansty." The reptile seethes through his mouth with the task given to him, clearly annoyed.

As he lifts his tail up, all that there was ahead was pitch darkness, with only orange glimmers here and there in the empty dirt path behind him with wooden archways supporting the tunnel like that of a mineshaft. The Charmeleon bandit continues, "Like that's a damn excuse. He can just take a working torch with him and do this bullshit himself. I don't care if Damien's antsy. You'd have to be a moron to use the tunnels at this hour. Ferals can get in here, making it a death trap if you don't know where to go. Credel do this. Credel do that. Since when was I willing to stick my neck out for that asshole? I'm gonna give him a piece of my mind when I get b-"

The bandit stops in place upon bumping into something in front of him. He was so distracted in his complaint, he hadn't noticed it, having skipped a few torch spots to ignite. The Charmeleon cranes his tail closer to see it was a giant barrel simply sitting in the middle of the tunnel hall. "...The fuck is this?" He asks, taking a whiff to see if it was ale, only to jerk back from a smokey sting. "Eghk, this is...blastpowder?!" The Charmeleon glances over to spot a trail of the pewter powder trickled along the ground, leading to another powder keg.

His eyes widen in disbelief, but before he could so much as move a muscle or blink, a Luxray rises up from behind the barrel and leaps right over it with a swift kick to the Charmeleon's jaw. The fire lizard is forced backwards as Star lands on the ground in front of him in an agile stance, crackling electricity at her hands. "Sorry. I can't have you ruining the surprise for your leader though." She states aloud before dashing in at her foe. The bandit hardly has time to react as her quick nature allowed her several jabs bashing into his midsection to get the Charmeleon to keel over some, only for her hands to then clap together at his head and release an intense static shock. The voltage surges through his figure to make his eyes roll up pure white and his body to wildly quake in the electricity.

"Gg-gGghGgg-hggahhhk!" The Charmeleon shudders with a cringing voice before the hands pry off his head, leaving his body steaming and soot stains of his scales. The bandit groans unconsciously before teetering backwards, landing in a knocked out flop.

Star proudly put her hands to her hips in a smiling moment of victory before the Charmeleon, all before sighing out with a shaky tone that she actually managed to do that. "Hhh, I don't know how Lace can do all this lone-wolf hero business." She mutters to herself before turning to the dark end of the tunnel, "It's alright. He's taken care of now."

Out from the dark, several villagers from Hedgen appear. Their worried glances eye over the steaming Charmeleon as his arms twitch and wince. Star looks to him and adds, "It's just reflex of the shock. He's out for a good while." She even nudges a hindpaw at his head to have it uselessly flump on its side as proof.

A Sceptile villager responds, "Thank you for your help. I'm sorry that none of us are much for fighting, but I feel like I might make matters worse if I tried to help out there."

Star smiles to him and offers a thumbs-up in reassurance. "You're doing great actually. Y'all have managed to give these bandits the slip and there's no way I could roll all of these kegs by myself. It takes some serious bravery to even come down here and do this."

"Heh, uh, it's appreciated." The grass type scratches at the back of his head. "To be honest, I'm used to dealing with explosives if tunnels."

Star quirks a brow. "That's rather specific."

"Oh, I used to work as a miner in the mountains by Hedgen before the infection happened. I'm pretty sure that's why Bronze nominated me to take the lead in this task." The Sceptile explains. "Not that I wouldn't help otherwise or anything. It's just nice of him to remember who I was before everything went downhill. He remembers who we all were."

The Luxray pats a hand to his shoulder. "Taking out this mill and that Houndour's reign will be the first step to getting things back uphill. After that, the pack of people I'm with are gonna stop the infection from spreading, perhaps even ending it altogether."

"You think you all can really do that...?" He asks with skepticism.

Star thinks on it. "I...don't think I could. But they've made it rather far and seem to have a good enough idea on what's causing all of this. I'm just tagging along until they get to some place called Redeemer's Grotto to drop me off. It's supposed to be safer there from where I was found."

"Ah. Hmh. I could've sworn you were all companions together. I figure you would want to stay and help them." The grass lizard ponders aloud. Star was taken back by it. She certainly yearned for that, especially as a means to get her loved one back, but she didn't feel like she had the strength to do it. It all came back to feeling insecure as the day she set out for herself to catch lightning.

Her ears lower some, "I mean, I'd want to, but..." She shakes her head to fight off the feelings, "I'm not going to get in their way or slow them down. I'm just paying the favor here for someone that saved my life once."

The Sceptile seemed unconvinced, yet there was still a brief smile on his face. "What was your name again?"

"Oh, it's Star." The cat answers, only to feel the reptile to cup a hand of hers in a shaking greeting.

"It's nice to meet you Star." The Sceptile states. "The name's Bayne~"

The Luxray shakes his hand in return, easing away from the topic. "It's nice to meet you too, Bayne."

"Can I ask also...you had a Toxicroak with you, yes? What was his name?" Bayne inquires as their hands part ways.

"Oh, that's Hex. He was a part of the group before I was." The Luxray replies, only to see the Sceptile's face ignite with some kind of internal revelation. Bayne glances away some, getting Star to ask in return, "...Do you know him?"

Bayne chuckles and shakes his head, "...Of all the bloody coincidences." Looking to Star, he readjusts the conversation, "None to worry about that. Let's just focus on the task at hand. The less we're down here, the better. Shall we roll out the rest of the kegs? I believe we only have two more to go."

"Go ahead and let the other villagers know they can go back and escape the tunnel. I'm gonna patrol ahead just to make sure it's safe, and together we'll roll out those last couple of barrels before heading back out as well." Star relays the plan in agreement with Bayne.

"Sounds good to me. Thank you for considering my people's safety." The Sceptile states upon turning around, however, he glances over his shoulder in the meantime to state, "...Please do be careful Miss Star."

The Luxray scoffs in a smirk, "I'll be the one to kick you out of this tunnel if you call me like that again. Scram, Bayne."

The Sceptile shares her expression and proceeds back the way he came, conversing with the other fellow villagers to make their retreat, along with any others still down farther the tunnel. Meanwhile, Star makes her way forward to the now torchlit areas of the tunnel, lacking any cover or means of surprise attacks now that she lacked darkness to aid her. Her biggest worry however was knowing when to ignite the barrels. Lace kept it vague from her of when they should do so, because had he been caught, she wouldn't know when it would be best to erupt the mill. Knowing him however, he'd be sure to stay away from the ground level.

It's what Star prayed on. She hated feeling incompetent or fearful. Something in that Lucario and the others was growing the adventurous child in her before everything went wrong in her life. "I'll make you proud of me. I promise." She assures herself to Lace, wherever he was. "For Bell."

Star the Luxray strode forward with a confident demeanor, glaring ahead with a single eye and static crackling at her mane.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Star's Task

choices: Shock him directly in the head!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
As the Luxray strides forward with all kinds of thoughts and concerns running through her mind, she immediately halts upon hearing the sudden stomps echoing through the tunnel. It wouldn't be long until the oncomer reveals himself through the torchlit walls. A Tyranitar, easily dwarfing Star's height and width, was mozying on through with his eyes locking to the eyepatched cat. A sharp grin stretches on his face as he doesn't slow down or show any concerns of who she was; and all the while, his belly wobbles before him as a sign that he never skips out on meals. Star was certain he didn't just eat a lot of fruit.

His deep voice carries out to inquire, "You ain't Credel. What'd ya do with the Charmeleon I sent down here, lass?"

Star readies electricity in her hands in a cold glare, "I'd love to show you. I can give you the same treatment in fact."

The large dinosaur laughs as he rests a hand to his front, nearly trembling the dirt and pebbles inside the tunnel to make Star worried about his sheer size. The Luxray didn't like the type disadvantage here, nor did she like the Tyranitar's thick armor plating figure. The only 'soft' part about him was the blue pudgy midsection that proudly bobbed in place from his bellowing laughter. He eases down some and leers to the girl, "I can't trust that damn lizard to do anything. Heh heh, sorry lass. But a hottie like you is too good to pass up. I'm not sure what you're doin' down here, but I think you'd make for a nice addition to our collection of girls."

The Tyranitar proceeds forward with his size coming into plain detail that Star was going to have a rough go of this one. It took every fiber of her being not to take a step back. "Sorry fatass. But I'm not anyone's to have. I'll be sure each of the women you've enslaved gets a good turn in kicking you down when we all leave here."

"Hah! So you're here to rescue them? All by your lonesome self? Get real, bitch. Just sit right there and let me walk you to where we can collar you up." The Tyranitar boasts.

Star's eye leers thinly and a bolt of electricity erupts from her arm, blasting into the dinosaur. The sparked burst actually has the Tyranitar skidding back slightly with his sturdy legs retaining his stand. He actually laughs again and beats a hand at his plated chest. "I'll take that as a no then. You think your tingles are gonna stop me, bitch? Hahah! I'm gonna show you why they call me Tank!"

With a tunnel shaking roar, he charges ahead with arms out, stomping about in a rather faster dash than Star anticipated his size capable of. The cat uses her best ability of speed to ready herself in place until dashing forward, keeping a keen eye on the charging reptile's range before leaping up over his shoulder, sending another surge of bolts into his shoulder. Star lands on the ground on all fours behind the Tyranitar as he skids to a halt by burying a fist into the ground, shoveling a bulky line through the dirt before charging right back towards her again, laughing. The Luxray huffs and leaps to the side to avoid Tank, only to feel his swinging tail catch her off-guard and bashes her into a wall.

The feline cries out from her back striking the earth to hit the ground shortly after. "G-Ghah!" She groans by the impact, only to witness the Tyranitar's leg swinging in for a powerful strike. Star's eyes widen to feel her abdomen cave in by the intense weight, forcing her back against the wall again. Saliva coughs out from her mouth as the Tyranitar then grapples his hand on her neck for a vice squeeze. "H-----Hhhk!" The Luxray grapples her hands at the male's thick-armored arm as he lavishes a murring growl to her face.

Tank boasts aloud, "I told you to stay down kitty cat. Now I gotta play rough." He readies a punch to clock her square in the face, however, the Luxray's fur bristles up with a sudden crackle. Her entire figure discharges with built up electricity, shocking through the Tyranitar's arm and surging along his body. He grits his teeth, bearing through the pain until he inevitably releases Star from his grip. The Luxray staggers to wheeze in some oxygen, but she would have to act fast knowing the dino wasn't going to be stunned for long...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Tyranitar Blockade

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
That soft middle seemed like the best and only spot to do any real damage to the Tyranitar. His endurance was something else to simply wave off Star's electricity, coupled with the thick plating of his figure. The Luxray surges power into her hands as Tank stumbles back after her sudden discharge, gifting her the time to completely concentrate the voltage into her fingertips. The Tyranitar spots her readying an attack and pivots his entire body around for a spin in hopes to strike her with his tail. The heavy length swings by, yet Star is quick enough to avoid it in a swift kneeling slide, skidding right to the dinosaur's front to lunge her hand tongue and mash her fingers into his blue midsection.

The soft scaled tum winces in at first, until Tank laughs, "Hah! You call that punch-Ggh-Ggh-Chrrkgh-GaaAhahaaaaGghk!!!" The focused voltage erupts directly into his middle and scorches throughout his interior, leaving him wildly throbbing in place as his expression matches the Charmeleon from before, whitening at the eyes from how much they roll up and his jaws hanging open. He attempts to stomp about in place, yet his legs remain ground for the electrical current to go through them into the earth.

Tank is left smoking hot and twitching in place, all before Star lunges a firm knee into his gut to send him crashing onto his back with a tunnel-rattling thud. His body spasms, but Star knew he wasn't getting up any time soon.

The Luxray steps onto his chest to lean over him, retorting down, "I call that kicking your ass." She spits onto his unconscious face before kicking her leg off from him, striking his head along the way. With her head held high and her tail dancing somewhat, the cat couldn't help but feel a bit prideful in taking down such a large foe. A part of wish someone was with her just to see her pull it off...

Catching her breath and endeavoring to shake off the aches from the Tyranitar's aggressive hits earlier, the feline leaves him behind and proceeds down the hall, hoping not to catch anyone else lurking for their pals.


-----|-----


Following the torchlights, the Luxray eventually arrives at staircase leading up to an open cellar door, the first floor of the lumber mill presumably. This was the end of the line, and no more guards were present in venturing the tunnels. Star enjoys the relief of that, being able to tell Bayne they can roll out the last of the barrels then and get out. However, her ears catch a voice muttering aloud from the doorway, convincing her to actually snoop in closer. She'd want to make sure the coast is clear after all, and ensure no one else comes down the tunnel.

Silently creeping up the stairs, she carefully peeks her head out from the cellar opening in the floorboards to see a small room used mostly for crates and storage. But there was a door leading outside that a lone bandit was sitting by at, with a table of empty stools besides the one he sat at, mumbling. Playing cards were spilt out all over the table, along with empty mugs of what was once ale. Leering more, Star could tell it was a Girafarig, male like all the other bandits, looking rather bored with his head rolled up, drumming his fingers at the table.

He speaks aloud to voice out frustrations. "Goddamn. I could be elsewhere right now. I get why Credel always complains out loud now about Tank. The guy always makes ya sit or walk by yourself for some dumb job he can just do himself. Hhh, I could be watching the new Pit fighter right now." Star ponders what he meant by that until he adds, "I've never seen a Lucario before. I wonder if it's true if they use blue flames. Are they even fire-types though...?"

Star's eye widens in shock as she nearly bounds out of the cellar opening right there and then. Her mind fumes with worry, "Lucario pit fighter? Was Lace captured? Oh no, they're making him fight... I have to hurry!" The Luxray was prepared to crawl back down, but something in her heart stops her. She leers back at the Girafarig as he was still unaware of her presence. As much as the cat wanted to stick to the plan, the giraffe clearly knew something was up, and she wants answers. Perhaps she could save Lace...

Rising up from the floor-door, the feline quietly steps one hindpaw in front of the other, rolling her fingers in preparation to catch and interrogate the equine. With his back still facing her, she was a mere few meters away, ready to strike. But all of a sudden, Star is met with another pair of eyes and a mouth. The Girafarig's tail lifts up, revealing a round head with a face staring right back at her, having been tucked under the stool and snoozing. Star freezes in place, completely forgetting about Girafarig's tails being somewhat sentient and stares right back at it. She preyed it couldn't speak, and she'd be right about that. However, it begins snapping its teeth to alert the giraffe to glance over his shoulder. "Huh? What are you hungry back there? I just- Whoa, what in the fuck?!"

The giraffe rises up and twists around to face the Luxray intruder, noting that she definitely wasn't any of the pleasure girls at the mill. He reiterates, "Who the fuck are you?!"

Star retaliates immediately without a word, sending out a thunderbolt at the Girafarig. However, the giraffe was impressively quick to summon out a panicked Light Screen, forming a glass-like panel before him that splits the electrical attack into several shocking lines that strike random parts of the room. The Luxray huffs in return and retorts, "I'm the woman you need to give some answers to, that's who. What was that about a Lucario?" She demands out of him, crackling her mane and arms in a readied pose.

The giraffe pinches his brows in confusion. "You're with him?" The psychic Pokemon then readies himself as well. He adds, "Then you're too late cyclops, he's probably getting his ass drilled right now or stewing in some infected gut."

Star's fur bristles wildly as she surges another blast of volts right at him. The shocks pound at his magical barrier until it shatters apart and he's electrocuted where he stands. She snarls as she keeps up the pressure with her hands out, "Where's this arena? Where are you keeping him?!" The Girafarig grits his flat teeth together with fists tightening to resist the shocks before having his eyes glow. In a kinetic blast, all of the stools, table, and crates near him fly back as he unleashes a psychic blast from his mind, forcing Star backwards as well. "Hnhk!" She snarls when landing on all fours.

He pants aloud to twitch his muscles and endure his shocked muscles, mostly using his mind in his advantage for the battle. "You're not gonna find out. Unless I decide to toss you in there myself. You came from the tunnels, didn't you? How about you answer this then, freakshow. What happened to Credel and Tank?"

"Your two lizard pals?" Star rhetorically asks when rising up, "Fried 'em." She then charges forward to attack the giraffe.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: From Brawns to Brains

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Star motions her legs in place to prepare herself before jogging forward, soon turning that into a full-on sprint. The Girafarig sneers to see the Luxray making a mad dash straight towards him. "You serious? Big mistake pussy cat. You're not gonna land a single hit on me." The giraffe states as he uses his psychic abilities to launch the debris levitated around him at her.

Star keeps her focus ahead at the psychic, refusing to falter or change direction. Around her body, electricity builds in loud crackles, all until her fur erupts with voltage in a single line of glimmering light. The volts surround her body as she rockets towards the Girafarig like an electric meteorite. Wooden stools and boxes sling towards her, yet Star's body erupts with lightning to strike any projectile that gets near her, bursting it apart. The giraffe grunts in surprise. No matter what he threw at her, it all just exploded into burning woodchips before they could even collide.

"What the fuck?!" He growls in distress, and with Star's speed, was right in front of him. Quickly, he summons another Light Screen in hopes to deflect her lightning, but with her physical body tackling against it, the psychic barrier smashes apart like glass, leaving one brightly lit Luxray smashing against the giraffe. "Grhaghk!"

The Girafarig is carried with her as she keeps charging forward, electrocuted along the way with his body pinned against her. "Gggggghkhh-kakaka-gkghkrr-kakhk!" He shakes wildly against her as Star actually barrels him back into the open cellar doorway, crashing into the staircase back into the tunnel she had been in. Her body begins to dissipate its voltage, but not before erupting one final strong blast that sends her onto the ground, but the giraffe spiraling away in a smokey trail. He slams the dirt and rolls repeatedly along the floor until he comes to a shuddering halt, left on his back to cringe and spasm.

Star heaves to catch her breath before staggering up to a stand. Gripping her fists, she angrily trudges towards the Girafarig on the ground to tower over his stunned figure; his face of complete shock. With the amount of voltage in his system, the psychic could no longer focus his mind to use his powers which left him completely vulnerable to the rather pissed off cat casting her shadow on him. Sparks tingle off her mane as she glares down at him. "Where is Lace?" She snarls with pauses between each word to truly stress her question.

The bandits sputters to answer as his whole figure shakes, including his jaw and lips, "Wh-Wh-Wha...who?"

Star stomps a hindpaw onto his chest and sends a bolt right through his chest, shocking his heart and lungs. "The Lucario!"

The Girafarig shrinks at the eyes and convulses at his back, roaring in pain before shuddering back into a pitiful state, "H-Hhgahh, i-in the Pit. The m-middle of the mill. D-Damien has prisoners thrown in there and fight to the death with the infected we've caught, y-your friend's probably gone by now."

Star twists the paw and growls, "Lace isn't foolish or weak enough to lose to some random pet feral you have."

The giraffe grunts amidst the zaps, "M-Maybe not one, but Damien just keeps making them fight one after the other. He doesn't let anyone leave alive. Even if it means k-killing them himself." Star's eye narrows in rage, nearly taking it out all on the giraffe before she roars aloud. With an electric paw, she stomps down on the giraffe's head and electrocutes him directly into his mind, sending his limbs wobbling wildly. "GggGggYyHHAaaAkk--kkhH!" The Girafarig spasms in place until she kicks off from him to huff, getting it out of her system before looking back at her actions. The psychic Pokemon was left steaming from his body, left wheezing and dazed like the two other bandits before him.

The Luxray scoffs at his survival, but chooses to let it be that way. She glances at the wrecked stairs to climb with the idea to go save Lace herself, but she remembers his words clearly.

"Don't be afraid to set off the kegs. Hex and I will be expecting it, so the sooner they go off, the better."

Star sighs and endures the desire to go hunt for her friend. "You better be right about this you stubborn pooch." She mutters aloud to herself before turning around and gripping the Girafarig by the leg, dragging him along the ground as she moves through the tunnel with him. She would meet up with Bayne at the end of it to roll out the last of the kegs to keep the plan in motion. She just prayed Lace was keeping up with his end and surviving the Pit...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Overcharged

choices: Focus on his tongue's movements, and catch him mid-attack!
Snuff out the torches on the wall, blind him in the tunnel!
You have teeth, use 'em for a Thunder Fang!
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Star huffs as she rolls the heavy barrel forward as its dark powder leaks along the dirt in a trail, forcing the large explosive through the tunnel until it was right near the end. Luckily she wasn't the only one hauling it. Right beside her was the Sceptile, Bayne, doing the same and laddering his hands over it to keep the keg going. Upon reaching the end, the two stress the barrel over to slump onto one of its lidded ends, leaving it to set still. Star catches her breath and tries to wipe the blastpowder off her hands, but her fur certainly had patches of the stuff coated on her, with visible soot stains on Bayne.

Bayne happily claps across his hands for a job well done and states, "There, that's the last one." He smiles over to the Luxray and even bows his head at her some, "Thank you for the work you've done. It was wise of you to clear the guards out before this. It gave my people a chance to get out."

Star wipes the sweat of her forehead off and replies, "No problem. Let's just get out of here ourselves before any more of them show up. How are the ones I stunned?"

"I'm surprised you gave them that mercy all things considered. I certainly didn't expect you dragging one of them with you when you fetched for me." The Sceptile mentions before assuring her. "The villagers outside have tied all three of them up, so they shouldn't be a problem. They looked like a rough bunch, I must say. That Tyranitar looked like no joke."

"He was stupid and an asshole. He was going to down either way." The Luxray mutters.

"It was a compliment to you~" Bayne then muses. "You're a very strong individual Star, I'm quite envious of your strength."

The Luxray admittedly adored hearing that, visible by her sudden tail wag, but she was terrible at showing her appreciation for it. "Uh...thanks. It's nothing though, I just got lucky."

"Doubtful." Bayne comments in an entertained smile before turning around, deciding not to push the Luxray on the topic. "Let us depart then. We have a mill to blow up and people to save." Star nods and goes to actually follow the Sceptile out, only to be interrupted by a sudden voice.

It was that of another male, but far more sly in tone however. "So that is what you are up to...? Tsk tsk." The two infiltrators twist around to look down the tunnel, but come to see no one in sight. However, Star's head glances upward to see a figure actually attached to the rocky ceiling just in front of them. Its claws were buried into the earth until it releases and drops down, landing on top of the final powder keg they had just rolled out.

It was a Heatmor. The anteater Pokemon eyes over Star as his golden claws flick of the soil on them, while his lengthy mouth idly purses about.

The Luxray keeps a readied stance as she warns, "Another one of you? You boy just keep coming. Do yourself a favor, but I've taken out plenty of you already. If you were smart, you'd be running for the hills far away from this place."

"Why? Because you managed to konk heads with three idiots and think you're brave enough to set off the kegs? I heard enough from your conversation earlier." The Heatmor states as he hops off the keg, landing to the ground to stand a bit a ways from the Luxray. "Do not compare me to the likes of those morons. They were tunnel guards for a reason."

Star huffs, "Tunnel guard or not, I'll shock you like the rest." The Luxray's mane begins to spark, yet the Heatmor only muttered a chuckle.

He extends a hand, wagging a golden finger-claw in disappointment while shaking his head. "Tsk tsk. Are you as simple-minded as them? I would not advise using your prized power." The Heatmor states as Star then realizes her surroundings. "One little spark is enough to ignite the blastpowder. Assuming you even survive the explosion, you will be buried alive with no one to save you."

Star grunts in agitation knowing he was completely right. The black powder was coated on the ground in a trail between each barrel inside the tunnel. Igniting one patch would ignite all of the others in a domino effect. "Gnrh, that may be true, but you can't use your fire either." She seethes out.

The Heatmor chuckles again. "I do not plan on relying on it. You and I will fight fairly with only our bodies and wills to succeed."

"How 'noble' of you." She scoffs in preparation to fight.

Bayne however steps next to her and worriedly touches her shoulder, "I...don't like the looks of this. I can help."

The anteater laughs, "I have no interest in fighting you, lizard. This should be between the girl and I. She was confident to take down the other bandits before, she should learn not to be so over-zealous in her triumphs. I am quite curious to see if she can outdo me." His claws rake together in excitement.

Star looks back at Bayne, "The guy's a creep for sure, but if it's a fair fight he wants, he'll get it. I don't want you getting harmed in the fight, cause I'm pretty sure he's right about one thing. He definitely seems more cunning than those last few thugs." She flings her head to gesture him away. "Get outta here. I'll catch up when I'm done here."

"Are you certain...?" Bayne asks with worry.

She gives him another thumbs up. "Positive. Now scram~" The Sceptile merely glances to the Heatmor before sighing and turning around, headed back out of the tunnel.

Once the Sceptile was finally out of sight, the anteater gleams a small smile, "Nice of you to spare him from the sight of when I ravage your body, miss...?" The Heatmor trails off to get her title.

"We trading names now? It's Star, you weirdo." She retorts.

"Star..." He repeats to remember it. "I am Ketch, and I will eagerly enjoy our bout."

"You might regret saying that when every bone in your body's broken if you even so much as fantasize about 'ravaging' me." The Luxray suddenly dashes in to get the first strike with her own claws at the ready, taking a swipe at the Heatmor.

However, the anteater was fast. He suddenly flips over at the side and lands against the wall of the tunnel, digging his claws in to brace himself there off the ground. Ketch laughs as a long and wiry tongue slides out from his long snout. The tendril wrings about in the air to drip with saliva. "Starting already? You're rather eager, much more fun than any of the other trespassers I have had to deal with~" He suddenly kicks off the wall and charges in at her.

Star skips back as he takes several Fury Swipes to goad her into retreating, clawing the very air and splitting it with his sharp ends. "Ngh! After tonight, I'll be the last one." She swings her leg to kick him away, only to feel his tongue wrap around it for a coiled grip. The cat yelps as the tendril burns hot into her fur and muscle, all before it whips her away in the tunnel.

Upon crashing into the ground, the Luxray flicks her head up to see Ketch chuckling to himself, wagging his finger and head again. "Tsk tsk. Too slow. Too predictable. You'll surely be my meal if you keep making mistakes like that."

It angered the cat in her heart as she rises up. She'd have to come up with something creative to deal with him.
