1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Ketch's Challenge

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
Star knew that with his advantage of that flaming tongue, he could still do a number against her easily while she'd have to be restrained to basic physical attacks. Not only that, but his claws could prove dangerous if he allowed her to get too close. The Luxray ponders if there was a way to get the anteater to her in a moment of surprise or stunned state. If she could plant a hand flat against his head or chest, she could safely discharge a lot of voltage into him without the worry of igniting the blastpowder that could kill them both.

It eventually dawned on her of what to do, but she regretfully knew it was going to hurt. "Then don't hold back. Maybe you'll learn something from me after I beat you." The Luxray retorts to the anteater, getting him to scoff and dance his claws again.

Ketch the Heatmor muses, "Is that so~? Such confidence. Perhaps I will learn something of you, like how your figure tastes when I make you cum." The anteater suddenly slings out his long tongue as proof, igniting the tendril to a hot orange glow of flames to the feline. Star narrows her eye and doesn't go to dodge the attack, and instead, reaches her hand out to grasp the tongue before it can strike her. The Heatmor cocks a brow in surprise, but eventually mutters out to her, "Foolish idiot." It was because the hot flames of the tongue burn into her hand as she squeezes it tight to try and die the flames down, yiping in pain and nearly letting it go.

However, Star fights through the heat as a tear rolls down her cheek with her teeth gritting together, smiling eventually. "Yes, you are." The cat states right back before enacting her plan. With the tongue acting as a leash, she violently pulls at it to completely yank the Heatmor off where he stood, slinging his body up to Star! The anteater grunts in surprise with widened eyes, watching Star rear her other fist back before it rockets in a surge of electricity to smash into his face. His long snout caves in on itself for a loud impact, all before a current of lightning blasts through his figure.

"GGh-hHaA-HhgHhHHK!!" Ketch roars in pain as he's flipped backwards while still flying straight forwards behind Star. His body hits the ground to wildly jitter in place before Star pivots around with a leg lifted straight up high, charging her voltage directly into the pads of her paw. In an axe-kick, the Luxray stomps down on the Heatmor's head to surge her electricity directly into his brain. Ketch's body wildly flops and throbs about on the ground, sparking with burning heat and shaking. "RrRrhgghahahk-khhaggh-aooughk....!" Foam begins to bubbles out from his mouth with his eyes rolling up completely white, baffled that he let such an easy mistake prove the Luxray right.

Star grinds her hind down until prying off, leaving the Heatmor to flop uselessly on the dirt floor. She was glad to directly electrify him away from the trail of blast powder, gifting her the advantage in the moment whereas the heat of his tongue dies down as its left sprawled on the ground out from his open lips. Steaming, the Heatmor was defeated, and Star calms down from her triumphant high. "How's that for a lesson...?" She mentions down at his foaming mouth before dropping herself onto her rear.

The Luxray catches her breath now to glance back down the hall, seeing the stairs far away that led into the bandit camp. Her mind reflects on Lace being in danger, but his words continue to berate her into remembering their original plan. Star squeezes her fists as she begrudgingly tells herself to put faith in him. "Stay strong Lace. And don't die. I didn't want to go through with this for this village, and maybe that's selfish of me. But I'm doing this for you."

Rising up to a staggering stand, Star grips the Heatmor's limp tongue again and drags his body behind her like a pull-rope, going back down the tunnel to ensure everyone was safe from harm and ignite the kegs soon. "I don't even know why I'm sparing you considering you nearly got us blown up down here. But you can't learn your lesson that I beat you if you're dead. The lesson being not to underestimate me." Star huffs as her excuse to the unconscious Heatmor, still silently shocked herself that she managed to defeat the bandits that she did, while also disappearing into the darkness of the tunnel...
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Ketch's Defeat

choices: Gold wants to show off, Eden wants to end things fast.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"G-Grraghk...Huhhk..." A pained wheeze releases out before an immediate thump hits the ground. A Machoke's back flattens on the ground, with his body soaked with water, lashed with bruises, and a purple hue glowing from his face as his open mouth foams. Venom courses through his body as vine tendrils unravel from his muscled body to leave him in his poison-induced coma. The tentacles retract back inside the Roserade's bouquets as she simply walks past the downed fighter.

"I think the mayor lied to us." Eden mutters aloud as Gold was simply waiting by a doorway, letting the Roserade handle most of the fight beforehand.

"Eh? With what?" Gold grunts. He didn't want to bother guessing.

The flower woman crosses her arms and glances at the gargling Machoke on the ground. "About the bandits. Don't you see how many of them there are?"

The Golduck scratched at the back of his head. "Uhhh. I don't remember the old guy givin' us any specific numbers."

"Exactly, he didn't." Eden begins to explain, "He left out just how many people this Damien guy had under his ranks. This is more than just any handful of villagers that skipped town. This guy's been recruiting anyone to everyone he can get that comes nearby. Save for whatever the gross slobs just see as entertainment..." The Roserade shudders to think of the captured women here have to go through.

"Whatever. I'm just here to bust some girls out so you and Lace will get off my back." The Golduck dismisses the Roserade and continues the mission again. Eden and Gold were specifically tasked to go to the servant quarters to help free the individuals the bandits had captured. Used as dancers or waitresses, or worse, the duo had to make sure they were freed before blowing the lumber building to the sky. Despite their obvious conflicting personalities, the two were working well in tandem together, aiding in their type differences despite Eden's strength prevailing over Gold's own, without a doubt in her own mind. Gold, however, was rushing through things and refused to take the mission with any subtle stealth; head-on, he would take on the bandits, with Eden having to act as clean-up to ensure they wouldn't trigger any kind of alert amongst the majority of guards in the building. Gold then adds to his scoff, "Wonder if they'll reward me after tonight...~"

A sudden slap of Eden's vine strikes the backside of his head, making him stumble. He yelps and immediately pivots around with clenched fists. The Roserade scowls firmly at the Golduck and retorts, "Even when you're trying to do something good for others, it's just for disgusting self-gain. Why do you even bother following Lace and the others? I don't know why they put up with you."

Gold rubs a finger across the front of his bill in a sneering grin. "Why I'm around? Nothin' you need to worry about. And maybe they're fine with me taggin' along cause they'd be infected chow without me."

"Your misplaced confidence leaves much to be desired." The woman retorts before continuing on Gold now, taking the lead.

The Golduck snickers as he scratches where she struck. "And yet here we are, together. You're the one that asked to tag along with me in this part of the job, missie, so don't gripe. I'm here cause of you." The water-type reminds the Roserade with hands on his hips now, leaning forward as he walks confidently close beside her. "Why are you tagging along, hm? You show up in a forest, see me 'n the pixie frog having a fight, and now you're a tag-along hero, out to save some backwater town. You got nothin' to gain from this with your life on the line for people ya never met."

"My reasons are my own." Eden answers back, almost immediately as she refuses to look at Gold as the pair traverse a wooden corridor in the depths of the lumber building. "...Besides. It's the right thing to do."

Gold's brows furl in a way of dissatisfaction. "Nuh-uh, you don't get to just say that. Lace is the big dick hero everyone adores cause he wants to find a cure. Jackal's an ass-kisser that'll do anything for his oblivious boyfriend thing and follow him to the depths of Hell if it meant getting some. I can say the same for the frog, but at least he seems to know what he's talking about." The Golduck began to list each of the travelers for the group, getting around to his point, "The Luxray lost her mom or whatever and she's taggin' along to go somewhere safer then her fucked up town. You on the other hand just waltzed on in, made face with the pixie, and no we're buddies? No way sister. You don't get to criticize me and my reasons to be in the group. I've been here longer, and I got my reasons personally with Lace. You're the outsider here."

Eden retorts, "Are you quite done?" She even stops in place, now giving Gold the attention and look he wanted.

"No, but do you need a break, hun? I know I can be a bit much." Gold also stops, eagerly facing the rose woman to egg her on.

"Don't test me, duck. I can and will leave you in a worse state than any bandit I've ruined here tonight." The Roserade warns with her vines trickling out from her flowers again.

"Kinky~" Gold muses right back before the vines strike his face once again. He stumbles a step before the tendrils easily grapple around his limbs and neck, pulling him right back over. The tendrils seize up multiple coils as they restrain his arms and legs to bend backwards, straining his back while also clogging up any airflow he once had with how tightly his throat clenches up. The vines seize his neck vicely to completely gag him, forcing him to choke on his own muscles. "G-Gghkl!"

Eden simply glares at him with an annoyed look, "We have a job to do. Pipe down, do what I say, and we can take this outside like adults once we're done. Got it?" The Golduck is unable to even answer as she chokes him harder, pulling at his muscles and forcing his gullet to garble tightly. His eyes widen while his claws flex repeatedly at nothing. "This task requires stealth, and people's jobs are on the line. We can't get caught because-"

As if it was destiny working its irony, Eden glances over to see a newly opened door to the hall her and Gold were in, revealing a wide and taller figure. Large eyes stare down at her as a toothy grin was spread wide across a face. A sudden sense of cold ran through the hallway to get Eden to wince with a sharp tingle down her back. A snowy beast stood before her with incredibly large blue hands, a broad snowy figure...not to mention an absurdly fat afro of snow on its head resting atop its head. It was a Darmanitan, specifically one from a region up north in the snowy mountains to be something entirely different from its natural race. The yeti-like being simply helped confirm to Eden that Damien certainly recruited from more than just Hedgen, but it also confirmed she was in great trouble now.

The yeti rumbles in a rather amused tone, "What's all this then? A stealth mission? Well you better keep it down, or else ya might get caught, little flower~"

Eden winces at the comment as the Darmanitan completely dwarves her in size. She quickly slings Gold away to get him out of the picture while also to prepare a defense to an inevitable attack. The yeti was too close and too fast however, leading to a giant fist slamming directly into her middle to send her flying back. The Roserade strikes the wall behind her, cracking the wood some and whining out in pain. "H-Hhyyk!"

Meanwhile, Gold crashes onto the ground farther away. He gags and struggles onto his hands and knees to catch his breath, probably deserving that for his words, but it was definitely inconvenient in his mind. The duck glares to the yeti stomping his way towards Rose before coughing out, "Ey...chhk, this is between me 'n her, snowman. Swing on over, hmfhk, and I'll...take you on." Gold grunts to catch his breath.

The Darmanitan grins with fat snowy lips when grabbing Eden by the head and lifts her entire body off as she kicks in response. The Roserade's face was buried into the large palm, gasping for air all the same as Gold was before the yeti slings her away into the duck for the two to crash together and flop on the ground. The ice-type mocks with a fist pounding its snowy chest. "Hah! You're in my house, punks. I don't know who y'all are, but I think I'll be takin' your girlfriend."

Gold huffs and spits to the side to clear his mouth, steadily getting up. "I called dibs on her. Back off."

Eden struggles up to a stand to catch her own breath, gritting her teeth as she debates on who to strike first. "Gold. I'm going to eviscerate you. But this afro guy goes down first."

"Deal." The Golduck answers in response before the two ready themselves for a fight.

The snowy Darmanitan laughs as he punches at the ground, "Y'all want to go down together? Fine by me. One's a meal and the other's a cock sleeve. Works out for me nicely...~"
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: A Duck and Flower

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
A highly pressured beam of water blasts out to the Darmanitan, but the yeti merely tilts his head down for it to strike the built-up snowball on his head. "Hah! That tickles, duck!" Viktor taunts aloud before readying up his large hands. The Golduck grunts as he was still left in a duel with the snowy yeti, with Eden by him cautiously keeping her distance from their foe. The dreadful chill of his presence and attacks could easily make her wither, dooming both her and Gold since she doubted the duck could fight him one-on-one.

The Darmanitan claps his hands together in a booming sound, freezing the ceiling in a frigid gust of air. The duck cockily retorts, "Hah! At least I can hit straight; we're down here, asshole!" Eden was weary of the attack however, watching large icicles suddenly form above Gold. Amassing a great weight, the basins begin to crack. The Roserade's eyes widen before she quickly dashes from the spot, whipping out a vine to wrap around his ankle. The Golduck is immediately forced to hit his back on the floor before getting dragged with the running Roserade. "Wah--?!" He quacks in confusion just before the large icicles drop and smash down just behind him.

Eden skids to a halt and whips Gold back up to a stand. "It's called Icicle Crash, and you should be more careful." She advises him before peering tot he Darmanitan who was patting his snowy gut and laughing. Eden leers before muttering over to Gold, "I need to get that snow off his front if I'm to poison or stun him. My spores or venom have to make it through his skin for them to work. Think you can at least blast him with water square in his stupid gut?"

Golduck grumbles with a hand to his aching back for the beginning of the moment before huffing, "Just shoot him once? Psh, I can do that, easy!" Gold readies up a torrent of water in his throat again.

The Roserade interjects, "Wait, don't just blindly attack him, he'll shield himself again. How about you try distracting him to look up first, and then go for his middle?"

Gold groans to all of the commands, but he does inevitably blast out some water. However, it was in the form of a Bubble Beam, sending the array of soapy orbs to flutter above the Darminatan. The yeti mocks Gold, "Hah, are these supposed to be as strong as my icicles? Tiny duck head means tiny duck brain~" The Darmanitan even reaches up to jab a bubble with a finger to make it pop.

The Golduck holds back his initial desire to retort and obliges Eden with her plan. The Roserade goes on ahead to rush towards the yeti as Gold ruptures a fast beam of water again from his open beak. The high pressure strikes the Darminitan right at his gut, blasting him to stumble backward some. "Rrgh?!" Viktor grunts as the blue of his flesh is revealed at his gut. Eden readies several vines, latching her stun spores on their outer edges while toxic venom builds at their tips. In a panic, Viktor shoots an ice beam out from his lips, but it was in a sloppy direction during his stumble. Eden kicks off the ground to rebound off the hallway wall to dodge the ray of frost, whipping out her vines to strike the yeti's middle.

Viktor roars out from the smack to his gut when Eden lands, with the Roserade following up with several more lashes, striking Viktor, again and again, to rake her poison and spores to his stomach. The yeti's eyes go wide as the stinging enters through his veins and his breaths become harder to muster with his front going numb. "Gghr...d-damn weed, Viktor will have his victory!" The Darmanitan growls when stumbling forward to conceal most of the hallway width. Eden winces and attempts to jump over his arms, but his large hands catch her by a leg to slam her back right onto the ground. She coughs after the hit, realizing she's towered over by the hefty yeti as he bears his fists together above himself. "Die flower!"

The Roserade can't react quickly enough to move away from the descending swing. Expecting a brutal impact, she does at least hear it, but all she feels is the splash of water. Gold blasts against the Darmanitan's face with a headbutt as an aqua jet of water blasts behind him. The powerful launch smashes the yeti rolling away before crashing through a wooden wall with Gold landing in front of Eden. He huffs and puffs as water drips off of his body, ensuring the Darmanitan was staying down. Viktor's body was completely flopped out with his eyes white and his mouth hanging open. Gold takes that as a win and flexes the lean muscle of his arms, puffing his flat chest, "That's right, get some! Victory schmictory, you overgrown snowman, this 'tiny-brained' duck just kicked your cold ass...!"

Eden watches the duck from the floor with elbows propping her back up. She catches her breath as well before huffing, "...Only after you did what I told you to do."

Gold pivots around, rubbing a finger at the front of his beak with a hand on his hip, "Psh, I could'a thought of all that, sister. I just wanted to make you feel like you contributed~"

"You're a terrible liar." The Roserade huffs as she gets herself up. "And don't call me that. In no way would I ever want to be related to you."

He muses with a smug grin and a look of intrigue to Eden's figure now that it was glistening wet. And yet, he holds back from commenting on it, and shrugs his arms up, "Fair enough~"

Eden glares at him before proceeding by past him, "You're impossible to deal with." The flower woman ensures no one was in the hallway with them, and warns, "Still, we need to get going and find those girls fast. I'm sure someone at least heard all of that commotion."

"How about we split and check each of these rooms?" The duck asks, counting each of the doors.

"Are you certain you won't need my help if you get into trouble?" Eden asks.

Gold flashes a sneering look, "You sure you won't need mine~?" The Roserade huffs at his response and gives him her answer by turning away and walking down the rest of the length of the hall. The Golduck watches her go and turns to a few doors that line a separate wall. Everything looked unmarked so it was hard to tell how the guards knew where to go without just memory. There had to be something of a signifier to tell where the enslaved captives were.

Gold traces his hand along the wall, unsure of which door to open which could lead right into an enemy, and he'd rather not pick a fight again if it was going to be more than just one guard. Soon enough however, he sees a carved pair of circles on the front side of one door, deciding it was something unique for a room. He takes a hand on a handle before turning it. Upon opening it, Gold reveals...

choices: ...Just five minutes of fun couldn't hurt.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
In other circumstances, Gold's primal urges would feel right at heaven where he was. Upon opening the door, the duck is greeted to the view of multiple naked women. However, there was a twisted nature from how they were stationed. Lined up in different stables, the females were collared and connected by leashes to waist-high bars within each wooden pin they were fenced around in; only patches of hay are laid out on the ground for their knees or bodies to be left slumped on. The Golduck swallows a weight in his throat as he looks around in the room, finding multiple pairs of eyes taking notice of him. None of the women make any comprehensible words. In fact, they just sluggishly moan or whine.

Gold motions into the stable room with his head darting around, seeing multiple pens keeping the girls in place. Their expressions show that they're drugged, kept complacent and mind-numbed. Along the walls, there were a few kegs of a rich aroma filling the air, a type of concoction never whiffed up before. Pitchers of the wine itself were stationed at a few tables, along with bowls of the stuff in the girls' pens for them to drink up from the floor. The atmosphere was...menacing to Gold. Had he never eased his selfish desires when meeting Lace or Hex, a place like this would be a dream come true. The women were flushed in the face and drooling from between their legs, clearly aroused and insatiably so.

Swallowing a weight down his throat, he begins to back up and check back out into the hall. He had to let Eden know that he found who they were looking for. However, his head darts back and forth, and the Roserade wasn't in sight. He grunts out, "Oi, Eden?" No answer. His bill opens up to yell her name, but he realizes that might not be a bright idea. It could easily alert some other bandit in the area of where they were. Grumbling, he just closes the door and keeps himself in the room with the drugged women. He might as well check on them and free them from their pens before a guard comes in to check on them anyway. "Alright ladies, your one true hero has arrived to save you!" He boasts aloud, to which he doesn't really get a response from any of them. It certainly demotivated the duck to drop his heroic act and just rub the back of his head.

Approaching the first stable pen was a Flareon woman. Having a bit of meat to her, the Golduck did his best not to stare at her figure as he opens the fence gate and approaches her. "Hey there...uh..." Gold mutters as the fire-type flicks her fluffy tail about slowly, all before crawling her naked figure towards him on all fours. The Golduck mutters, "Dunno if you can really hear me, but I'm gonna get that leash off of ya. I got a bunch of lackies with me and we're here to rescue y-" The duck halts his explanation to feel the woman kiss at his stomach. His thighs wobble once and his arms flex up some. "E-Ehh?"

The drug-induced Flareon moans as her mouth pecks affectionately to Gold's belly, working her way down in between his legs. His thighs clamp up together and his hands squeeze onto her head. "Ah! Ah, ah, ah, nope! Stop! None of that right now!" The duck has to huff with a blush, confusing the sleepy-looking Flareon. He nudges her face away from his groin before he gets too excited. "Jeez lady, what'd they do to you to make you so thirsty? I just said I'm here to let you out, not to get sucked off...!"

Gold however mutters under his breath that he'd enjoy that. Still, he had a task at hand and he unclips the Flareon from the bar she was leashed inside to within the stable pen. Gold retreats slowly and goes to another pen to do the same, finding a Leavanny woman in the same predicament.

As he motions past the moaning bug, he yammers on to himself, "How am I gonna get any of these girls out of here? Any dude in the mill's just gonna see me with like ten leashed women stumbling behind me if I get them to follow me to the exit. And hell if I'm gonna walk them like pets... Eden wouldn't let me hear the end of it. Guh, I can hear her cranky tone in my head already. She needs to hurry her sweet green ass in here. Why am I the one pitching in the most effort on this dumb mission? I should give Lace a taste of my mind. None of this shit has anything to do with stopping the cocksucker that started this infection."

Undoing the clip and freeing the Leavanny, she just remains on her knees, confusedly looking at the Golduck she thought was going to walk her up to the rec area. The duck just keeps going to another pen. "Hell if anything, that Lucario owes me! It's his fault he busted my precious gemstone, and I could'a swallowed his stupid wide-hipped ass down my gullet when he had the audacity to come back to my lake. What a punk, wrapping me up in this mess. I'm surrounded by horny women that want to get me off, and yet I have to be some kind of celibate babysitter for 'em. I'm gonna kick that dog's ass after this mess." Gold finishes unclipping an Ekans naga from her own leash and begins to walk out of the open fence of her pen.

However, he's stopped by the Flareon and Leavanny standing in his way. The women stare down at his shorter body, huffing idly with drooling slits. "Wh-Wha...?" The duck mutters as their bare breasts are at his eye-level, and their lack of personal space nearly bump into him as they step closer to him. The Flareon's hands reach out and touch at his body, stroking her nimble fingers around at his blue skin. It gets the Golduck to twitch his cheek in an awkward open smile as his eyes worried dart between the two women. "Ehhh, heh heh, maybe I wasn't clear enough the first time ladies, I ain't here to fool around, I..." The Leavanny eases herself onto her knees with her arms wrapping around to Gold's side, pulling herself into him in a cuddling embrace and murring right by his head. "I...uhh..." He trails off in an aroused stammer now that the Flareon lowers herself into Gold, squishing her warm furry breasts against his chest. The immense heat baking off from the eeveelution was overwhelming that made Gold's genitals thrum.

A purple and gold tail even wraps around at his legs some, with the Ekans naga murring with delight as her tail gently squeezes at the duck. Her front rides up his back to sandwich Gold's head between her breasts, leaving him completely surrounded by aroused females thinking they needed to pleasure him. After being trapped and drugged for so long within the lumber mill's walls, any man down here clearly only needed a good time before the next one. Gold's beak stutters in place as nervous beads of sweat run down his intensely blushing face. It was impossibly painful for him to resist his urges right now. "G-Girls, girls, please..."

The Ekans' fingers trace around at his belly from behind as the Flareon kisses at the end of his beak bill, and the Leavanny licks along his neck, delivering soft lovebites in between the gliding strokes of her tongue. Gold feels like melted butter now. It got his heart thumping hard and his knees shaking. "A-Aaouh, you girls must not have had such a sweet guy like me in a good while. I ain't rough like these other punks here, I know how to treat you lasses right...~"

He shakes his head however as he fights his internal plight. Should he resist them and focus on freeing the others? Or...perhaps he could have just a quick session with these three and get right back to it? No guards to stop him, no Eden to whip and yell at him. It was such a tempting opportunity. Gold's dream of having an orgy with nothing but cock-hungry women demanding his pleasure.

He had to make a call now or never.
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Gold Strikes Gold

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"Keh?" A male voice grunts out the moment Gold bonks directly into a purple wall of short fur. Stumbling back in place, the duck shakes his head to the view of a much taller Noivern completely overlooking him. The bat stood in the doorframe that blocked Gold from ever entering, leaving the duck to gnash his bill into a scowl with a fist.

"Ey, watch it!" The Golduck snipes at the bat with his usual touted anger. He stomps his short leg and faces up at the guard despite the height difference. It didn't even occur to him that he had to remain inconspicuous.

The Noivern glares down at him and huffs aloud, "I should watch it? You're the asshole that swung in here." The bat then perks a brow up with a twitch of a large ear. "Eh...? Who the hell are you? You're not a Fetcher."

Gold growls right back, "Oi, the hell you standin' behind a door for? You think everyone just knocks in here? I don't know what a fetcher is, but I ain't no dog, and I go where I please."

The anthro Noivern's brows pinch in together some as he crosses his arms to his chest, fanning out the wings of his back. "Fetchers wring out the girls, and this is clearly where we keep 'em. You're either drunk and lost, or you ain't one of us, and I sure as hell have never seen the likes of you before."

"Mind if I have an extra word with you, Hex?" You ask him specifically in hopes to have a moment to talk before going out on the dangerous task at hand. "Star, Bronze, good luck." You add. The Luxray nods, takes a few steps back, all before finally turning around and heading out to follow the villagers she was tasked with staying close to. The Marowak gives an immediate and single pat against your back as he heads off to follow her, leaving just you and the frog there.

The Toxicroak cocks a brow with a curled finger at his chin, "Hm? Something on your mind? Don't tell me you're getting cold paws now."

"That's not it." You explain before trying to find the words. "I just...felt as though we should talk to one another, in case we don't really get a chance to again."

Hex stares slightly down at you with a light case of being taken back some, before his expression settles into his typical playful smile. His throat sac bloats and croaks more happily. "Well isn't that just adorable~"

"I'm being serious." You retort.

His hands suddenly cup your cheeks though, and the gay frog murrs, "I know you are, Mr. Hero. But this won't be the last time we'll talk. It's a promise. I still have far too many clever jokes that you still need to hear. But those can wait after we deal with the pesky pup inside that mill." You smile back some, but you can't help but fixate your eyes to the frog that just stared back at you, like not a single worry was running though his mind. Hex seemed like he would prance around in Damien's mill if he could, despite him not have seeing all that you had. Realizing you're just standing there quietly, your own hands find their way taking Hex's cheeks to leave the frog curious. "...Lace~?"

You lean in with closed eyes, unable to hold back a kiss to his mouth. Your muzzle meets his lips, locking together in a zip that Hex didn't waste too much time in putting effort himself. He thumbs at your furry cheeks, feeling the warm of your natural light blush appearing as he croaks far more quickly with his delight. "Crrrrr...crrrrr...crrrrr~"

With a pluck of your lips, you break the moment after a minute or two before you really lost control with it. "...Sorry."

"You're apologizing for kissing me~?" The frog taunts, keeping his chest and stomach pressed up against you, cradling your head in his palms and looking directly down at you. One of his long legs was even bent with a heel craned off the ground, tucking a knee more in between your own legs as he kept his balance.

"More-so that it might be an inappropriate time." You huff back, feeling his smiling lips press at your nosetip. He lightly nibbles the black canine nose, resorting into you wiggling it some. "...Yeah that was pretty dumb of me to say. I just felt compelled to, I guess..."

"Shut up, and stop being cute...~" Hex adds, really running his fingers at your cheeks before kissing your nose. "I'm not offended at all. You're welcome to kiss me whenever you feel like it actually! I'll take free kisses from anyone..."

Thinking about that last wording, you ask, "Sorry but-"

"There's that pesky apology word again." He huffs, wanting you to stop.

You prepare to apologize just for that, but you realize you just need to get on with your point. "-But I was also wanting to tell you something else. In the morning, when you told me you wanted to keep yourself in an open relationship, I don't mind. I wanted to make that really clear."

"Oh...?" The frog mutters in revelation while retracting. "...Didn't you already mention that?"

You take his hands into your own, applying light squeezes. "Yeah, but I felt like it needed to be reinstated, in case you didn't fully take me serious." You keep yours eyes locked to him, having your furry front smear with his smooth and fleshy exterior. "I like you Hex, I like you a lot. If it weren't for you, I might not be around right now so just... I don't know what's going to happen with us fighting Damien or the mastermind, but, with whatever time we have left, I'm glad you're spending it with me."

Hex gives a soft blink and grin, sliding a hand to brush the top of your head between your ears, "I think it's rather understandable you'd feel the need to appease me since I have maybe saved your life once or twice. It's only natural, but I'm glad to be spending time with you as well. These past few days have certainly been remarkable ones that I wouldn't trade for the world. You're doing me a service to go out and cure my sister."

You shake your head however, "No, no that isn't just it. Stop being humble." Your arms slowly begin to wrap around the frog's sides and back to keep yourself locked to him as you nose at his mouth again, "...Your charm hooked me the moment we first spoke to each other. You care about people so much, even if they wrong you or push you away like Gold. You always have that dumb smile plastered on your face, and I can't ever feel down whenever I see it. And last night back in the tent...it was the best night I've ever had before, and I want to be able to experience something like that every night..."

Now you were getting the Toxicroak to blush back himself, getting a rosy coloration and rubbing his taut thighs together. "O-Oh dear...~" His own arms bring themselves around you, but cup at your shoulders to hold onto as a brace. "...I...don't think I could have sex with you every night if that's what you're imply-"

"You know that's not what I'm implying, but I think you just want to hear me say it aloud." You retort, being more assertive in your words, "I liked being in a bed with you. Being at your side, quietly talking, getting to feel you. Yes, of course I liked the sex, but my favorite thing was just to be able to be sleeping against you and waking up to see you in the morning. You were just casually drinking your tea, smiling at me like nothing was wrong in the world. You don't let the bad get to you." You lean in, kissing Hex again to force him into another tuck of each other's lips. You slightly give a bite to Hex's bottom lip before letting it go, smiling yourself.

The frog's hands tighten on your shoulders with his body having a light shiver to you. "...Stop being this sweet. You need to be the big tough guy with a plan like you always are."

"This is me with a plan. And I plan on doing anything I can for you, together." You add.

Hex stares at you some with hot red cheeks and a sheepish smile where you can see his flat teeth. Closing his eyes however, you discover his hands taking yours and he slides them down his back to reach for his taut rear end. His cheeks fill your hands, coercing a sudden grope to them to fatten in your fingers and grip. The frog croaks with his orange sac and murrs aloud, "...After this bandit business is over and done with, you're getting a turn to fuck me~"

You arousal thrums at that idea, instigating another squeeze to Hex's ass with your tail now wagging, "Oh, we're taking turns now?"

You smile the best you can with sealed wide jaws, giving a spank to the ass that has Hex retract away from you. "A-Ahem...yes...well..." He mutters with a wide grin, looking away from you, "...I think it's best if we, ahem, didn't get too riled up right before what we need to do."

"Sure thing, frog-o. Just don't forget everything I told you." You mention, but not before you give another popping slap to his ass to jiggle his cheeks and make him jump in place.

"Ah~" He yelps lightly before wiggling his hips to be free of your hands at last as they return to your sides. He however takes one into his own to croak, "...I don't think it's ever possible that I could. I just don't need to have a boner when I'm trying to sneak around the bandit base, you know~? But you can hold my hand on the way there, at the very least." He gives you a wink.

You grin, thumbing over the top of the hand before lightly pulling at it to guide him with you, "Let's make this a quick job then. I want to get back to us doing this~" He simply scoffs, walking with you at your side to hold your hand the entire way before you'd reach Damien's camp. It would seem unprofessional if you took down the bandit leader while holding another man's hand after all...

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Hex Talk

1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
"Mind if I have an extra word with you, Star?" You ask the Luxray to make her curiously raise her ears. "Just before we part ways and all." You add before you glance at Bronze and Hex just standing by you. "...privately."

"Oh! Er, right. On my way then. Good luck, Lace." Bronze mutters, giving a bow of his head before heading off with his walking staff.

"You too, old timer." You mention, getting the Marowak leader to scoff as walks off.

Hex scoops an arm around you for a quick tug, croaking, "Mmmh, you two lovebirds don't spend too much time together. I have a Lucario to sneak around with, hm~" Hex pets your head before slipping away towards the mill. "I shall meet you there then I suppose. Ta-ta for now...!"

Seeing the Toxicroak stride off with trotting step into the darkness, you turn to see the Luxray you asked for slowly step up closer to you with her arms crossed some and a curious look to her, "...Yeah? Is something up?"

You look directly to her, "You alright?"

Her ear flicks and her head tilts, "Uhh...yeah? I think so. Maybe just a little cold but...I'm not scared of fighting any dumb bandits."

"But you're scared that I am." You explain, and the expression she makes back at you makes it seem like it was all true.

"...You can handle yourself. Like you said. You've taken things down that are far more threatening than just some horny, hungry punks." She retorts, looking away some with the grip on her crossed arms tightening up from the sudden prodding questions.

"Star..." You prod again, knowing that wasn't a satisfactory answer you had been given.

She huffs and curls her hands into fist, twisting her upper body some with sudden anger, "Don't 'Star' me! Yes, yes I'm worried about you, okay? Are you happy? Am I not allowed to be worried about you when you just decide that you want to go into a random settlement just because there's a chance they might not be bad? Am I not allowed to worry when you just head off to some evil bandit hideout all by yourself? Am I not allowed to worry when you just do the same exact thing, having to deal with ferals, bandits, and this fucked up Damien guy while the mill blows up and burns down? Huh?!"

You expected her to snap, but not by that much so soon. But considering that she's bottled up emotions for the past two days, you can't really blame her. At least it could be a positive she wasn't so quiet and held-back as before now. "...I'm just doing what I can to help people."

"You can help people, Lace, but that doesn't mean you can save everyone. That doesn't mean you can just go out there alone and try to do all of the hard things on your own. I hate to break it to you, but you're as mortal as the rest of us. If you went out somewhere off on your own and never came back, I just...I wouldn't know what to..." She started to mumble and roll her head, fighting back her concerns and feelings.

You reach out to her, but she turns just enough for you to miss. She cups a hand on her mouth, not wanting to make eye contact just yet, remaining reclusive. "You're never going to be alone again, Star." You tell her directly and up front, "I might put myself at risk, but it's because it's the right thing to do. I have all of you right behind me though. This group wouldn't exist if I wanted to do things by myself. I need all of you. We've made it this far, and we're not going to let bandits or ferals stop us from finishing what we started." Reaching out once more, you're able to cup her shoulder and make the Luxray face you again, "I need you. These villagers hardly seem like fighters, and there's no one else I trust that could take care of all of them than you. You're strong, and you fight for what's right, like me."

Star huffs with a shaking voice and has her hands planted against your chest now, lightly pushing at you. She has a smiling, but a tearing eye, "...You know Lace, I really, really hate how you have to be the big hero in everything."

"Yeah, I know." You reply and scoop your arms more around the Luxray, enveloping her into a hug. "And I'm not doing this alone. Hex will be right there helping me get Jackal, and all three of us are getting out. Believe me, this isn't going to be the first time I get Jackal out of a burning building, he can vouch for that."

The Luxray emits a soft sound, like a sneer almost, wrapping her own arms around you. Her head rests against your chest, above your dulled spike to breathe out some. "You'll have to come back to tell me about that then, and all the adventures you had before we met."

"It's a promise~" You say as you stroke a hand at her thick mane. With a leaned down muzzle, you kiss her forehead in comfort which coerces her hands to cling to the yellow fur of your back. "I'll try not to rush ahead to do things myself from now on though."

"Thank you..." She mutters, and the two of you just remain standing there in each other's hold during the dark night in the forest. The wind coldly blows by and the trees rustle in place. It felt as though you were the only two people around on the entire planet in that moment, quietly not saying anything and just enjoying the bare moment for what it was worth.

Suddenly, Star gives a pat to your back and begins to loosen up. "Go get your best friend. He needs you, and I have some people that need me." You smile at her and let her go, allowing the Luxray to take a step back and fix her ruffled mane from how you brushed it about. "The entire attack today doesn't need to go down the drain just cause we wanted a night full of awkward hugging."

"The hugging was awkward? I was enjoying myself." You respond with Star to sigh.

"Yeah, fine, I guess it was nice and all." The Luxray steps back a bit more, holding a single arm and kind of slowly staggers away. "Come back to me after this, alright?"

"You got it." You say with a wide grin, watching the cat walk away some. But in the end, Star appears like she was contemplating on leaving, and instead, approaches right up to you with hands against your chest again and her lips meeting yours. You're not given too much time to kiss back with Star leaning her mouth back out, now just staring up at you some. "A goodbye kiss?"

She huffs, "It's a see-you-later kiss. And I felt as though I would've regretted it if I didn't do so." Her hands remove themselves from you.

"After Damien's camp is over and done with, let's meet up where we can talk more. I'd love to tell you what all I've done so far." You explain to her as both of you were stepping back from one another.

Star was holding her arm still, but behind her back with a bit of a saunter in her step. "Good. I'mmm sure they're quite the listen...~" The grass crunches even under soft steps, along with your own. The way she looked and gave you that one-eyed peek appeared magical in a way. Her head was tilted away with a light grin on it, showing off the eye-patch side of her face mostly. But you can still see her eye of the other side of that short cat nose bridge, looking at you. She was sated with ease about your confidence, yet you can tell there's still that sense of worry in her. It means that she cares though.

You finally turn around and head off where Hex had headed, calling out, "I'll see you later, Star."

"See you later, Lace..." She mutters. You don't know how long it took for her to turn around, but you felt as though Star watched you go the whole way before doing so...


-----|-----

As you come to, you find yourself somewhere dark, your body laid against a hard rough surface, like some kind of stone. You groan and reach up, feeling that a similar surface is mere inches from the tip of your snout. "Could be worse." You mutter to yourself, "With how things were going I might not have woken up at all-" You cut yourself short as your memory of the events leading up to your loss of consciousness returns. "Oh Arceus! I've got to get out of here and find the others!"

You slam your fists upward, feeling the surface give slightly, a waxy powder falling down as if you were breaking through plaster. Before you can strike again however, a voice you recognize, but can't place a name to, calls out. "You're up already? Calm down, I'll get you out."

After a short moment, two pairs of arms suddenly smash through the surface above you, pouring light in as they peel it away, revealing a chamber made of what appears to be beeswax, and one of your Beedrill captors! You push him back and jump to your feet, growling, your rage fueling the aura around your fists as you prepare to-

Your aggressive thoughts are interrupted by the Beedrill suddenly stuffing a Pecha berry he'd apparently kept at the ready in your mouth, the sweet flavor of it's sweet juice spreading over your tongue and down your throat. "I said calm down. You're safe. And alive. Which isn't something I can say for most Pokemon who get ambushed like that. My name is Razz, your uh... captor." He bows politely. "Now why don't you lower those fists before one of us has to kill the other? I didn't hide you here and cover it up by claiming you managed to resist my toxins and break free just to fight you after all."

It might just be the sweet fruit in your mouth making you more agreeable, but you lower your fists while you swallow the rest of the berry down. "I'm Lace," you mutter, your voice unable to hide your suspicion, "Where are we?"

Razz places his lower arms against his hips while gesturing with his upper pair. "This my canine friend, is my little home away from hive. A little hide-away where I occasionally slip promising looking individuals who would have died otherwise, and offer to let them join my-" He stops for a moment. "Ah, I'm getting ahead of myself! You're likely more interested in where you are and where your "friends" my fellow Beedrill and I caught you with are. We are currently in a hidden chamber I found below ground, the entrance is up there." He points at the top of the wall behind you and upon looking in that direction, sure enough, you see a hole in the wall, where sunlight pours in, thankfully the hole is low enough that you can climb up to it when you're ready to leave.

Razz continues. "Your friends however, are well beyond your reach without help, and..." He stops, prompting you to look back to him. Despite his emotionless eyes, you swear you can make out sadness on his face. "And I doubt that even with my help you could save them. I'm sorry."

((Gold and Jackel have left your party))

A mixture of rage and sorrow wells up inside you, the aura returning to your fists as you approach the Beedrill. "Where, exactly, ARE THEY?"

Razz stands firm even as you approach him, his voice flat and without any apparent sign of fear. "They're at the hive, likely having been presented to the queen by now. If she's hungry, at least one of them is probably already dead, both if she was generous enough to grant the spare to whosoever presented the catch. On the off chance she's not, they are likely imprisoned in the storage chamber below her own, awaiting their... execution."

He gently places a hand on your shoulder. "Now then, I can help you, either to avenge them, or if you're lucky, to save them, but in return, I need you to help me. I have a... well let's call it a disagreement... with our queen. See she wants us to stay here and isolate ourselves, surviving off of whatever or whoever we find, but from what I figure, that won't end well. Either this infection will spread to our hive and we'll become a bunch of mindless beasts, or we'll eventually pick off more than we can chew and die out. I want out, but if I was to just leave, the queen would have my brethren bring me back as food. So the way I see it, there's two options for me, either I die, or she does."

The Beedrill suddenly releases your shoulder and turns away, his stinger lowered to avoid accidentally stinging you. "Now, I'm going to stare intently at this wall for a minute, if you're still here by the time I turn back around, then we leave for the hive, if not, I won't go after you, but you're on your own. Think carefully."
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.title: Waking up alone...

choices: Head for the storage chamber, you aren't risking Gold and Jackel's lives
Go with Razz's plan and head straight for the queen to insure her death
1153121111111111111111112122111111111111.content:
You stand there, a thousand thoughts running through your mind. first and foremost the possibility that Jackal and Gold could be dead, quickly followed by the fact that they might not be, and you could save them. Eventually, you come to the conclusion that Razz is your best chance at seeing them alive again, and thus decide to stay.

After a short time Razz turns back around, seeming to be happy to see you're still there. "Well then Lace, it seems we will be working together after all."

You raise a hand for him to stop. "If I'm helping you, I expect one thing in return, if my friends are alive, we're rescuing them, asap."

If Razz had eyelids, he'd probably blink in surprise. "As you wish, though the easiest way to find out if they're alive would be to head to the queen's chambers... well... now. So we'll have to... accelerate things." He picks up a belt off the ground with a pair of stinger like "lances" latched onto it and puts it on. "I'll signal my fellow revolutionaries, and we'll go, wait outside."

You nod and turn, climbing up the ledge to the entrance. The hole you end up climbing out of leads back into the forest you had been wandering through when you were ambushed, though the repetitive scenery of the forest leaves it impossible to tell how near you are to where you were picked up at. Shortly after you step out, a loud sound, like someone blowing into some kind of horn, echoes out from the hole, followed quickly by Razz who grabs you like before and takes off. "Time to go, act unconscious, this flight won't be a very long one."

You nod and close your eyes, and for a minute or two, the only sensations are the odd feeling of Razz flying while carrying you, and the sound of his buzzing wings. But soon you hear an unfamiliar voice. "Hey Razz, is that the Lucario that got away earlier?"

"Yeah I found him nearby, I think he was planning on breaking in to try to save his friends... By the way, why are you guarding the entrance to the hive alone?"

"Eh, something's going on inside, a bunch of the older Beedrill just started attacking everyone, apparently they're causing a lot of trouble, 'cause they've only left a skeleton crew of guards not out trying to stop them."

"Alright, I'll take this guy down to storage and find out where to go to help then."

"Sounds good, head on in."

The sound of Razz's buzzing wings resumes as he apparently flies in, before tapping you gently with one of his hands. "Alright we're in, I'm putting you down now." You open your eyes as he does so, finding yourself in an unusual environment. The interior of this hive is a large series of snaking corridors, some going literally straight up or down, and all lined with the same waxy material from the chamber from earlier. The scent of honey is strong, and you can hear fighting far up above, likely from Razz's cohorts. Razz himself notices you looking around and grins. "Impressive, huh? It's kind of a shame I have to just leave it behind, but hey, I like living." He chuckles a bit. "Alright we're heading for the queen's chambers, we'll kill her and then release anybody trapped in storage."

You growl at him. "We go to storage first, my friends could still be in danger!"

Razz shrugs. "The easiest way to find out if your friends are even alive would be to find out if the queen has eaten, and if she has, then any time we waste means she's had more time to uh... adjust to her new weight. If we waste time heading to storage and she's eaten one already, we've only made things more difficult for ourselves. And if she hasn't eaten them, I'd prefer to not risk us getting injured before we fight her, even if it will be two on one. But I did agree to help you save them, so I'll leave the planning to you."
