I, Mace, will laugh at your failure!" The Pangoro then leaves and Wes chuckled a bit "I think he's nice." You snickered a bit from that "I'm sure he and Patrick will get along well." Both of you then snicker from the thought but you'd figure the bear would make an interesting teammate.
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Mace the Pangoro

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content: You were occupied with getting Wes a bowl of punch when a giant black beach ball knocks you over and you yelp in surprise. You blink a few times noticing that the ball was very squishy and a voice speaks out. "Whoa! Sorry about that. I didn't see you walking by." You look up and see that the black belly belonged to an Arcanine. His eyes were yellow and he stood around nine feet. He didn't look very muscular but upon closer look his frame was that of a sumo wrestler. You quickly get up and chuckle a bit "Ah it's alright dude. This party is very crazy." The canine grinned and nods "I've never had any doubts of you completing that trial. You must have come a long way to gather your friends Zeke." You nod a few times and smile "I have. And I think I still have ways to go to stop the infection from wreaking havoc." "Kasai." You tilt your head to side from the Arcanine's bark. "Um.... Excuse me?" "That's my name. Kasai No Ino is the full name." "Oh....~" You then slap your cheek for not realizing he was introducing himself. "I hope to get to know you more Kasai." The canine nods as he walks off and you go back to getting Wes some punch.
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Kasai the Arcanine

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
You let out a low yawn as you pat your fat belly a few times feeling the golem had digested inside your gut. There was no one else around and you could hear their voices from out side. You get up from the bed and head to the elder's hut. Once you arrive the villagers were split with supporting you with cheers and bows of respect and rejecting you by booing and showing rude gestures. The elder's golden eyes shine through the tend and letting out a hardy laugh. "Ah... I haven't seen the villagers this riled up in ages! But I digress. Now for the final trial..." He pauses for a brief moment as everyone was muttering softly. "Soul Survival! In this trial you will need to utilize everything you know to win a three on one battle with the Legendary Guardians!" Once he finished speaking fire, lighting and water all formed from the center of the ring.

You swallow nervously as the three elements form bodies. First the fire was a male Entei. He stood eight feet tall and had muscles all over his body, he bears a six pack and he flexed his muscles as he growled fiercely. The water formed a female Suicune. She was two feet shorter than the fire legendary and very sleek. She had a d cup but that was hard to see thanks to her long thick purple hair covering up her chest like a bra. The lighting formed a male Raikou and he stood eight feet tall like the Entei however, he was very fat. His arms and legs were like thick logs and cheeks were puffing out of his face and his immense dome of a belly jiggled as he breathed.

You nod and step to the center of the ring. The Entei glared at you which unnerved you a bit but you came this far so there was no way to go back now! The Suicune giggled a bit "My aren't you brave. Normally Edgar's glare would scare or at least make folks jump back quite a bit. But then again you completed two trials. Color me impressed! I'm Sylvia and the blobby dog is Roan." The Raikou chuckled a bit. "Well now all you have to is survive our onslaught for fifteen minutes!" Edgar smirked as he glared at you again. "Let's see what you got!" You nod as you get ready for the fight.
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: The Final Trial

choices: Nothing happens and the attacks connect...
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
The elder gave the signal and Edgar lunges forward with a Flare Blitz. Despite the weight you've gained from Geo you was able to dodge the burning canine before he could touch you. You grit your teeth and looked over to see Sylvia charging up an Aurora Beam while Roan launches a Thunderbolt. You repel the electric attack with Ancient Power and launched a Flamethrower and melted the beam. However while this was happening Edgar strikes you from behind with another Flare Blitz and burning your back. The Entei was very aggressive and released a Fire Blast at you! You growl and didn't let that stop you from using Head Smash to break through the flames and bashing the fire dog on the head and he roars loudly before being blasted back a few feet. "D-Damn you...!" He roar but you couldn't let your guard down as Roan fired a Shadow Ball and Sylvia focuses with Calm Mind.

You were able to avoid the dark sphere and distract the water dog with Ancient Power and you fell a little bit of all of your strength increasing. Edgar was struggling to get up and growled as he then started to channel a white fire while fire and Sylvia giggled a bit "Oh Zeke. I should let you know now. Each one of us has a move that we couldn't learn normally. I'll show you mine~" She then concentrates and a pair of shurikens form her hands and your eyes went wide after seeing that and she giggles "Have a taste of Water Shuriken!" She then hurls them a you with great speed and hits you them. You pant a few times and look over and see Edgar charging Scared Fire and Roan channeling Zap Cannon! They fire the two attacks simultaneously and coming together. Thinking fast you pulled out the gem you found in the Polygon Maze and...
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Start of a Long Brawl

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
You hold the orb high but at first it looked it wasn't doing anything but it then shines red and the attacks disappear from sight! Your eyes went wide after seeing the orb had absorbed the attacks and you decide to throw it and it released all the energy it had back at Roan and Edgar! The two canines were able to avoid getting hit but the blast range catches both of them and the orb comes back to you. You make a small sigh as you were able to buy some time for your self and Sylvia realized what the orb was capable of and didn't want to directly attack you. You stayed on your guard as the other two got back on their feet. Edgar was now furious and lunged at you with another Flare Blitz!

You decided to attack head on with Head Smash and when the two attacks collide they make a gigantic explosion! You pant a few times while Edgar was staring you down! Oh those demon like eyes! But you wouldn't back down! You had overcome the Entei's intimidating glare! Roan and Sylvia were awestruck with your courage and standing up for yourself. You knew it was risky but you had to stand your ground for five more minutes. The fire canine wasn't going to let you survive and he charge at you with his maw open wide! You let out a gasp as...
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Almost there...!

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
Your tail looked it had a mind of its own as it whipped out in front of you and then at the tip of it started to open up and spread out wider than the Entei's whole head! Edgar's eyes went very wide as he dove right into the opening and with the momentum he was going his upper went squeezing in and with a mixture of panic and frustration in his roar as he thrashed about in your tail. You blushed a bit as you started to enjoy the feeling feeling of canine's struggles but then that moment hits you... Why are you enjoying the movements that the fire legendary was doing but now wasn't the time for that. You had to act now before Edgar burns your tail's insides! You take a deep breath and focused everything to you tail as it started to pull Edgar's muscular body and his legs kicked wildly for as long as they were being pulled into your tail. With a final slurp his feet disappeared and you looked back at your tail with a gigantic bulge in it and being pulled into your belly. It felt weird but you shuddered a bit from all of the Entei's struggling form and everyone excluding the Elder had gasped seeing what had happened. Sylvia and Roan looked at each other with worry "I... I don't believe... I don't want to believe Syl... Edgar..." She moved over to the Raikou who had large beady eyes and swelling with tears. "I'm sorry Roan... But there was nothing we can do for him now... His own rage was his undoing..." You look down at your belly which was still thrashing about wildly and you couldn't help but move over but not too close and say "... I'm sorry about that but... I-" The Elder then lets out a loud roar which cuts you off "And that is time! Congratulations!" At first there was nothing but silence but after a moment a mixture of cheering, jeering and booing was going around.

"Yes! He did it!"
"Impossible! He cheated! It's the only way!"
"I knew he could do it!"
"I can't believe it... No way..."
"All hail our savior! He'll bring the light back to the world!"
"He's a lucky bastard! His luck won't last forever!!"

SILENCE!!!
The elder's booming voice quieted the crowd and he slithered out of his hut and showing that he is a Dragonair naga. You make a nervous swallow seeing that you ate one of the guardians. He makes a smile as he stares into your blue eyes with his golden pair and then lets out a hardy laugh "I knew you were special from the first time I've seen you from my hut. You have risen to each of the challenges with determination. As promised I shall give you the support of this village." You pat you gut a few times as you make a sheepish smile "Ah... Thank you very much sir... Sorry about-" "Say no more. You had to do it. It was either you or him and you were able to prevail. It will be sad and we will miss Edgar but you should use his power to help you in your quest. Think of it like that. Don't worry, Edgar does have a younger brother and he'll fill his role better anyway." You nod once before a familiar Arcanine walks over to you "Hello again." "Kasai...? What are...?" "I knew you had something special. Please allow me to accompany you on your journey. Having a fire type around can help in things get a little chilly." You chuckle a bit and nod once "Alright Kasai. Let's go meet up with... Ergh...!" You try to stand but the thrashing Entei was heavier than you thought and the pudgy Arcanine giggles "Need some help?" You nod as the Elder chuckles softly "Kasai. Good luck with assisting Zeke." The fire canine nods a few times and grins "Thanks sir!" With some help of Kasai you reach your party and everyone except for Patrick was cheering for you and a Clefable walks over "Won't you stay for the night for your victory party?" You make a grin and chuckled softly "Sure, I could use a break after that."

+Kasai the Arcaine joined your party!+
+Wes rejoins the party+
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Zeke Learned Tail Nom?!

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content: You couldn't believe it for a moment but you noticed that your chest and upper body started to grow a bit in size thanks to high protein meal that was Edgar but you shake that feeling off and ponder about your tail. Upon closer inspection your tail did develop a maw and it could open and close upon command. It was very weird but if it wasn't for that power awakening you would have been inside the Entei's belly and not the other way around. You chuckle a bit as you watch your team mates and those who had faith in you dance and sing for hope had started to shine. "Um... Excuse me." You blink a few times and turn to see a quite skinny and lanky Entei. He's about the same height as the one trapped and being churned inside your stomach so you reply. "Yes? Can I help you?" Without warning the canine then tightly hugs you "Oh you've helped enough! Thank you for ridding me of that jerk of a brother!" You then realize that this was the brother that the elder had spoke of so you calmly respond as you were being hugged tightly for a skinny fellow. "You're welcome... So What's your name?" The fire legendary then lets go after asked that "Oh... My name's Ernie." You then rub the back of your head a bit "So... Are you nervous about taking your brother's role?" Ernie shakes his head a few times "Nah, he was always mean to everyone and exerted his role to boss everyone around while the elder was out of the village." You nod once and decided to walk over to Wes as you say "Alright then. I wish you the best of luck." "Thanks! You too!"
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Meeting Ernie

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content: Wes seemed to be by himself and taking small sips of a drink as you came over to him and he smiles softly "Hey there." You smile back and giggled a bit "So how are you liking the party?" The Tyranitar lets out a soft sigh "It's alright I guess. I'm not a good dancer to be honest." You then nudged his shoulder as you reply "Aww, it's alright. I have two left feet myself." Wes chuckled a bit as he softly nuzzled you "Thanks." He then takes another sip of the drink he was holding "You know... We've been through a whole lot ever since we've met near the forest." You nod a few times and smile "Yeah... And there will be more to come. I won't stop until I put an end to the madness." Wes nods and smiles "I'll be by your side too! No matter what comes our way we'll take it on full force!" You smile and blush as Flora walks over and giggles "Aww~ Look at you~ That soo cute~" You and Wes both blush at the same but you knew that Flora knew. She is your best friend and knows everything about you so you didn't mind it at all while Wes was a bit embarrassed but you make him feel better by giving him a warm hug or as best as you could with your bloated gurgling belly limiting your reach but Wes chuckles from the gesture and hugs your gut. "Thanks Zeke~" You smile back and let out a soft purr. "You're welcome~" After that the time had passed on to the late evening and it was time to hit the hay.
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Growing a Bond

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
The sunlight's ray hits your face as you let out a soft yawn and stretch out as you notice your body was a bit more muscular than usual. You look down and to your dismay the fatness of your gut still remained but you decided to shake off that feeling and get up. Everyone at the party was out like a light and you tip toe to the outside where the elder was waiting with a grin on his face. "Ah, you seem chipper this morning." You chuckle a bit as you stare into his golden eyes "Ah ha... Thanks sir." "Please, call me Vellon. It's what my parents named me." You pause for a bit as you wonder about his parents but you let that thought drop "Alright Vellon. I think it's time for me and my friends to go." Vellon then places a paw on your shoulder "Take care of Kasai for me." You nod a few times after he said that.

A few hours past and everyone was ready to leave and the Arcanine was the last to come as he pants a few times "Ah... Sorry for the wait... Had to say good-bye to mom. She's overprotective of me but... I don't blame her for not letting me go since I'm that left of our family..." No one said anything for a few moments letting the feeling of families sit in their minds. After that you and your group wave goodbye to everyone as they do the same and head down the path that leads to an abandoned town.
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Leaving Goma Village

choices: "We can't leave him like that!" (No new party members)
"Yes, we have to help! Now shut up and get ready!" (New party members)
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content: It seemed so surreal to travel a few miles from a lively village to a desolate town where there is nothing but an ominous wind that moaned giving both Xio and Kasai shivers down their spines. "Damn... This place... It's horrible..." Odie muttered as he spotted a skull and picks it up. "Oh these poor pokemon... Taken before their time..." Wes grits his teeth and growled lowly "We can't lower our guard guys! If this place is void of life then it means there are spirits roaming this place!" Xio, Kasai and Ion all gasp from that and huddle together. Flora, Mark, Patrick and Bull all got ready to fight some ghosts as you decide to call out to the empty town. "Hello? Is anybody there?" After a few moments a loud scream could be heard and everyone heads to further in the town to see Dusknoir trying to defend a very pale Poliwrath but isn't doing well as several Confagrigus had surrounded them with some Duskclops you could hear them says to the would be defender Traitor! Traitor! We claim all who wonder in this town! You have betrayed us Darcel! You must be punished! You blink a few times and call out to the ghosts "Hey! Leave them alone!" The Dusknoir looks over at you and calls out "Please help him! I can't do this alone!" Patrick then looks at you with a weird look on his face "Are we seriously gonna do this?!" You look and him with a serious look on your face.
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Entering the Ghost Town

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
The Zebstrika groaned after hearing that but he charged forward with the others. Looking at the group of ghosts there were twelve of them and each one of your teammates take on one while Darcel was trying to keep the Poliwrath from running away while a Confagrigus used Scary Face and Glare which completely paralyzed the now white amphibian and you throw Ancient Power at the coffin but it blocks the attack.

With all the of the other fights could go either with Wes taking advantage of his Dark Pulse and weakening his opponent while Odie was struggling with his foe due his weakness of Ghost while Bull was frustrated that none of his attacks were working but neither did his enemy's work on him. You had to keep Darcel in the brawl but suddenly the Confagrigus reached out with its large hands at you and Darcel...
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Assisting Darcel

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
The hand's grip was quite tight as you let out a loud yelp and squirm in it. The Confagrigus stares at you with a dark grin on his face. You continue to struggle about as the jewel you had from Goma Village started to glow that caused the coffin to let out an agonized roar and drops you. You decided that this was a chance to strike and let your tail engulf the coffin. To your surprise it had done it half a minute and now and odd lump in your tail but it didn't stay for long it then pushed the bulge into your fat gut. With the defeat of that ghastly ghost type all of the other ghost went into panic and fled the scene. Darcel makes a huge sigh as he looks over at you. "Thanks... I didn't think I could save him without your help." You nod once and see the Poliwrath was out like a light. "Well that was rough... I think it's safe now to rest." Darcel said as he stretched out. You nod a few times and everyone gathers around at the inn.

A few hours had passed and the Poliwrath comes around and seeing the Dusknoir lets out a loud squeal and tries to run but only to bump into Flora and she giggles a bit "Aw... That's nice. You're wide awake!" The Poliwrath makes a nervous swallow "Y-your not gonna eat me are you?" Flora gasps from the question "Me? Eat you you? Heavens no! I don't eat those who aren't infected!" The amphibian shakes a bit "But... I am already infected! All of us are!" Flora blinks a few times after hearing that "Wait.. Come again?" The water/fighting type shivers a bit "We are already infected! It's only a matter of time before we all go mad!" Odie then steps into room as he overhears what the Poliwrath had been saying "Well now this is interesting. Can you elaborate on what your saying?"
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Gem Reversal

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
The Poliwrath nods a few times as he backs up a bit as everyone gathers around the room to hear what the water/fighting type had to say. "Okay... Well everyone knows how the problems started from Aurora Caverns... That was only half of the story. The second half involves a very twisted Darkrai. He was the one who create that black crystal. It actually contained a Lugia who was very insane and giving out dark thoughts. So when the crystal was broken the Darkrai then spread nightmares with the Lugia's thoughts... Except these nightmares had granted everyone strange abilities..." You blink a few times "You mean being possible to devour someone?" The Poliwrath nods "Exactly. Not everyone could hand this though and with that the Darkrai could easily manipulate the minds leaving the bodies to be voracious, horny beasts!" Odie then speaks out "Interesting... But let's look at Zeke. He has the power to swallow in four different ways." That made the Poliwrath's eyes went wide "W-W-WHAT?!? I thought that only the Darkrai's three closest strongest soldiers were capable of that! T-Then... There is hope for us!" You tilt your head to the side "Huh?" "We need to head to Aurora Caverns to stop the madness once and for all!" You get the picture but then you tilt your head to the other side "How are we gonna get there?" Odie giggles a bit "Leave that to me. I know where it is but it quite a way to go from here." You nod a few times as Dercel hovers to you "Allow me to come with you. I think you need all the help you can get." You grin and then looks at the Poliwrath "What about you?" The amphibian hesitates a bit and sighs "I guess I'll go along too. I'll have a better chance of surviving in a group than going alone. Oh before I forget. I'm Lesley."

+Darcel the Dusknoir joins your party!+
+Lesley the Poliwrath joins your party!+
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: How One Goes Feral

choices: As the road leads something blocks the way
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content: You look at your group and couldn't help but be amazed by the colorful party you have assembled. It simply started off with you and your best friend and now it has grown to a party to stop the madness that a Darkrai has created. Everyone was getting ready in their own way and salvaging anything that was left in the town. There were a bunch of oran berries growing and Kasai was gathering them. Patrick was training with Bull since they didn't want to get soft and get caught by any of the feral pokemon. Wes, Odie, Ion and Clyde were all talking with Darcel gathering and making some plans and tactics to deal with attacks. Flora, Mark and Xio were talking with Lesley and getting the Poliwrath some comfort and reassure him that as long as he's with them nothing would go wrong. You take a moment to gather you since you had a tough time but knew things were gonna get harder from here on out. You then walk to the Odie before stretching your arms out a bit. "So are you ready to take us to Aurora Caverns?" The Grumpig turns to you and smiles as he gets up. "Indeed I am. Let's go. We have a long journey ahead of us!" Everyone comes over and Odie starts to walk out of the village.
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Prepartions

choices: "Let's go, Bull is on his own."
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content: Your party travels about a good ten miles until the road makes a huge split in the middle showing two paths. "Oh dear... This wasn't here before." Odie sighed after seeing this. Bull grunts as he steps forward. "Nonsense! We'll go this way!" Lesley blinks once and gets in front of the Tauros before yelling "Whoa! You're not leader here! Let's leave the decision to Zeke okay?" The Tauros huffed and pushed the Poliwrath out of the way before rushing forward and Patrick coves his face with his palm as he groaned. "Ugh, I didn't think he would be that thick. I suggest we leave him on that path will we go on the other path." Xio shakes his head a few times "I dunno. The path Bull went on seems a lot more dangerous... We should follow him before he gets himself into trouble." Everyone else looks at you while the Grumpig speaks to you "Well Zeke? What do you think we should now?" You rub you head a few times before you go with a choice.
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: The road splits

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
Everyone except for Patrick nod in agreement while the zebra groaned a bit which makes you chuckle "You know, you don't have to go after Bull." The Zebstrika huffed as he walked to the path that the Tauros didn't take. With some discussion you planned to take these party members with you; Flora, Patrick, Odie, Wes, and Kasai. While the others would go and catch up with Bull before he got into any trouble. You had a feeling if you went with this plan everyone would meet up somehow... You didn't doubt it for a second as you wave to the second group before saying to them "Good luck! And stay on path." Darcel replied as he waved back to you. "Alright Zeke. We'll see you later!"

-Bull, Mark, Xio, Ion, Clyde, Darcel and Lesley have left your party-
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Going Separate Paths

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
"I can't believe Bull would storm off like that." Xio said as he walked behind the group. "We should stick together and going off alone would lead to trouble. You'd think he would learn from that after being separated from us before." Clyde nods as he spins his bone a few times "We should hurry and find him before someone else does." Lesley sighs a bit before walking along the path with the Tauros' tracks clear as day. Darcel was a little worried about the bovine while Mark kept his eyes peeled for any sign of him.

They continued on the trail for half an hour and didn't find any trace of him but as they came upon a rain forest some rusting could be heard and Xio jumped back a bit "G-Guys! We've got company...!" Everyone turns to rustling bush and some chattering could be heard. Mark then calls out to the muttering bush "Hey! Come out! We got some questions for you!" After a few moments of chatter its revealed to be...
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Following the Tracks

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
A couple of shadows leaped out and used Smokescreen to cover the area and leaving the group blind and confused as each of them were struck with a sticky substance and Darcel's eyes went wide "C-Crap! They got someone who can use String Shot!" The chattering continued and a strange melody began to play. Within the panic and struggles each one of the party members pass out with the Dusknoir being unaffected by the song he could make a Houndoom but it attacks him with a Sludge Bomb and he blacks out from the blow...

He comes around and sees everyone in a bizarre village and the villagers were all wearing masks and paintings. They were dancing and chanting and his eyes went wide as he could seed his teammates all fully cocooned and placed around a circle. He takes a look at the center and he could clearly see Bull. He was already wrapped up and carried to some of cave. With a low growl a pair of purple eyes appear from the cave and the inhabitants all scatter and hide as the creature appears to be a Gyardos naga and it roared loudly for a moment before seeing the cocooned bovine and licks its before devouring him with. Darcel watched in horror as the wriggling lump traveled down the gullet before retreating into the cave. He wondered how he was able to see this but he notices something... He was unable to move at all and it was hotter than usual. The Dusknoir was trapped inside a Chandelure being used as fuel for its fire... He could only watch as his friends were food for the ferocious hydra before he would become part of chandelier...
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: A Trap!

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content: It didn't look like much but a Dugrito emerge from the bush and everyone back up a bit "We're sorry for alarming you. We thought you were servants to Tyrant Fang." Lesley blinks a few time along with the others before asking "What's Tyrant Fang?" The moles talk to each other before replying "It's a fearsome beast that rise in a cave not to far from here... The villagers are terrified by the creature and they would appease it with food and capture anyone who enters this land... We watched a Tauros come by only to fight them but losing badly. He was struggling all the way even after being wrapped up by String Shot." Clyde looks at the ground type pokemon "How the hell did you see all of that?" They look at the bush and replied "We were lucky that this bush camouflaged us perfectly." Mark grips his fist before looking at the group. "We don't have much time! We've gotta hurry and rescue Bull!" Lesley speaks out after hearing that "Wait! Don't we need a plan first?" The Beartic shakes his head "No, let's storm the village and take them out!" Darcel looks at the Poliwrath and he whispers to him "Don't worry, I have an idea. Let's just follow them for now."
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: Witnesses!

1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
The group rushed toward following the trail of when strange chanting could be heard and they stop against some bushes to check and past them there were various of pokemon with face painting and half of them were bug type and knew String Shot. They were uttering some vague words but there was a large gray-ish white lump in the center of the ring and it was clear that was Bull fully cocooned and ready to be served to the "Tyrant Fang" that the Dugtrio were talking about. The chanting goes on for about a few more minutes before a Primeape walks toward the group wearing a Bronzong mask started to speak. It wasn't clear what language it was but Mark wasn't going to wait for them to carry the Tauros to the beast and he calls out "Change of Plans! We're gonna take you all out and take our friend with us!"

With that said Ion opened up with an Earthquake and with cracks on the ground happening scared all but three villagers and the Primeape growled and spoke out and the three guards, a Blastiose, a Magmortar and a Luxray stepped forward when Xio and Clyde charged in making the fight look uneven for the and the primate had no choice but the join in to even up the odds for them. Darcel and Lesley both stayed hidden and the Dusknoir started to lead the Poliwrath away from the fight and figured if they could deal with "Tyrant Fang" maybe that would stop the madness in this area.
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.title: A Change of Plans

choices: He has a trick up his sleeve...!
1531111121111121111111211111111111111111.content:
They run down a long path as they pant and puff seeing that they wanted to reach this beast as soon as possible. Darcel blinks a few times as he light at the end of the dark path. "Look! I think that's were we'll find Tyrant Fang!" The Poliwrath nods before punching his fists "Well what are we waiting for! Let's take him down!" 15311112.content:
You look around to find the dark hut dimly lit with only a few torches hanging in the bolted holsters of the walls with no windows to let in light. However, you could make out several figures in the hue of torchlight, spotting an anthro Absol, female from its figure and choice of clothing, as it wore a grey top around her chest and a loin cloth of the same color while she leans over a wooden table which was sprawled with a map. Across the circular table sat a large Seviper naga, male with a flat and muscular chest and arms, wearing a black hooded jacket lined with red zippers.

"Uhm...hello." You nervously ask. Flora stays close to your side as the two anthros eye your body, mainly focusing on your large, scaly belly digesting the prey inside.

The Absol spoke first, breaking the silence, "...Oh my, who is this, Grand Elder? These two don't look like they're from around here."

The gruff Stoutland chuckled from behind you, closing the hut door, "No, Elice, they're not. I caught them snooping around town asking about the infection..."

The Seviper's crimson gaze flashes and looks down at you, "They know of it, do they?" The naga slithers his scaled body closer to you, sliding up coyly towards you as you step back from his intimidating form.

"Yes, w-we're looking for information or a cure on the infection. Can I ask who you are?" You kindly ask. The Seviper pauses for a moment, sitting still which terribly made you feel uncomfortable along with Flora as he peered over you with an unreadable expression. The Stoutland walks over to him, whispers something to him and chuckles afterwards. You glance at the Absol, seeing her sit atop the table while crossing her leg over the other, smiling in a witchy way. Suddenly, the serpent grins and strikes out with an open maw! You wince as Flora yelps to see his crimson fangs sink into your shoulder, dripping with venom to seep into the tiny wound. You howl out before collapsing to the ground, struggling through the numbness coursing through your body from the Seviper's poison while your Nidoqueen partner growls at the snake, jumping forward to stop him.

Suddenly, a Night Slash smashes into her side from the Absol and sends her into the stone bricked walls of the hut room. Elice quickly straddles herself atop Flora's stomach, grinning as she held your partner's arms down while calling out, "Hurry up and bite her with your venom, Solace!"

Solace, the Seviper, merely coiled around your body, binding you tightly in its spiral as he hissed with a sly grin, "She's a poison type, so it wouldn't have much effect on her. Besides, she seems weak enough for you to handle."

Flora growled, "What are you freaks doing? We're trying to save people!"

The Absol on top of her clenched Flora's wrists more powerfully, replying, "Yes, but we're not ones to just give up an opportunity like this. Now we can eat as many villagers as we want, and if people get too nosy about it all, the infected ferals can be the ones to blame before we ditch this rut of a town."

The Elder sneered, "Precisely. And besides, the citizens wouldn't know or care if the two of you 'disappeared' suddenly. They probably figured you have left already!" The old dog chuckled as a loud rumble emits from his gut. "Chow down time..."

You writhe within Solace's coils, but he simply tightens his vice grip around you, licking his forked tongue, "My, what a delicious hide you have, especially with all of that chubby meat on you..."

The Elder raises a hand, "Now now my selected pair. I didn't share this little scheme of prey for simple meals. Make sure we can..."

1552.content:
The skies were as red as blood as a lone anthro Charmander ran through an expansive flatland with a panicked visage. His tattered royal blue cape swayed behind him as the source of his panic came into view for you - a Rhydon Guardian that was serving alongside seasoned Rhyperior veterans in the front line for the Royal Army of your castle town within Bulkhead Fort. There were hundreds of thousands of red gleams in the distance - a sure sign of a legion of the Infected. The Charmander that was in your sights looked back every ten seconds to see that the abundant group of assorted Venusaurs, Metagross, Sableyes, Gardevoirs, and Salamences were gaining on him. After a couple glances behind him, he turned around and started running backwards while he faced the oncoming horde and started shooting Ice Beams and Thunderbolts from his hands in an effort to subdue any Sableyes that got within his danger range. The Sableyes were immediately downed with each special attack, but they were still pouring out of the Infected front line in droves.

         By this point, you had adjusted your Protector suit in preparation for the worst and prepared an Earthquake-inducing stomp while your commanding officer, an Aggron, yelled to you and the front line, "Guardians! On my mark!!" It was plainly visible to you that the uninfected Charmander was nowhere close to escaping the range of an Earthquake attack, and if all 100+ Guardians, yourself included, made a synchronized quake now, the earth beneath the Charmander's feet would become naught but dust, and he would have no chance of avoiding a fate that involved being swallowed up by the earth on which he was making his retreat. With that in mind, you were hesitant about following through with the order, especially when you were quite familiar with the flame lizard for whom you were a personal bodyguard before you were drafted back into the Guardians in preparation for this battle. Now you are presented with a choice... Do you follow the imminent order to make a localized continent-obliterating Earthquake to slow the advance of the Infected, or will you break off of the front line and risk your life in order to defend your former client?

Alas - in spite of your eventful and enjoyable history with the Charmander, you knew that his safety could not be guaranteed. With a heavy weight in your heart, you raised your foot and awaited your commanding officer's order to demolish the earth ahead. All you could think while you waited for the command was, Max... I'm sorry...

         Then you heard your commander yell out, "Sink the Infected!!!"

         You and the other front-line Guardians stomped the earth with all of your collective might, and surely enough, the earth ahead of you was crumbling like dust. The Charmander - the one you thought of as Max - realized that he wasn't going to make it with foot speed alone, so he tried to propel himself toward you with his Flamethrower. From your position, you tried to fire off Rock Blasts at the flying dragons, and you managed to some of the airborne group's attention with some hits and near-misses, but at least 15 of them managed to get into Bulkhead from the air, and the Pokemon there had no hope of escaping their untimely fates as meals for draconic maws, asses, and cocks. The bodyguard sighs in relief as he sees that you are intact, and he walks over to your bed with the intent of consoling you after your dream.

1552211.content:
His name is Ramnas Cragborn, one of the few Rhydons that was of the Royal Guardians, and the only Rhydon that ever reached the organization's elite ranks without fully evolving. The rocky bipedal rhino-saur stands at a whopping 7'3" with about 375 lbs. of bulk that he takes advantage of in order to protect his Charmander client. As a Ground Type, Ramnas is rather stoic and noble, but he can be quite aggressive if he wants to - or if something threatens his client. The Rhydon is devoted to his job, just like religious fanatics are devoted to their god(s), and he takes great pride in keeping his client safe. However, Ramnas's devotion doesn't necessarily mean that he's boring and overly reserved; to the contrary, the Rhydon likes to have a drink every now and again at the local tavern, and he loves to partake in a few friendly drinking games and organized bar fights with either his former brethren in arms or anyone who will humor him for such an activity.
         Right now, Ramnas isn't wearing anything as he stands at your bedside, but in the throes of battle, he usually sports a custom-made Protector that was improved from the Royal Guardians' standard-issue gear and designed for greater mobility without sacrificing protection. He also wears his armor in public, but it is the only garment/gear that he wears aside from a huge backpack that is donned when he and his client are out in the field.

         You, the Charmander that Ramnas works so hard to protect, are Max Eclipscia, a wandering mage that has been looking into the particulars of the Infection in hopes of deriving a cure. You stand at about 4'6" tall when you stand up on the floor next to your bed, and you weigh in at a light 87 lbs. that you don't exactly care to thrust into dangerous situations. You tend to take a backseat when it comes to glory and whatnot - all you really care about is being helpful in bringing about a favorable outcome. Much like your bodyguard, Ramnas, you are passionate about what you do, but whereas he devotes himself to your protection, you devote yourself to your studies and your worship of certain Legendary Pokemon - namely, Ho-oh, Dialga, Rayquaza, and Arceus. Unlike your Guardian, you aren't one to drink. You also aren't a fan of needless violence, and you would rather question/negotiate first, but you are quite capable of defending yourself if the need arises.
         Right now, you are wearing nothing but a pair of blue pants as pajamas, but you usually wear a red vest, a pair of dark blue pants with a leather belt that features small pouches for berries and other small necessities, brown leather shoes, and a royal-blue cape in public.

         Ramnas towers over you as you stretch, and after you put your clothes on, he goes on to ask, "How was your sleep, Max?" The Rhydon is always extremely concerned with your well-being - much more so than a Guardian is with a client in most cases, and he comes across as the father that your biological one could never hope to be. With that in mind, you tell him about the dream. Ramnas laughs a little when you tell him that you were seeing the dream through his eyes, but aside from that weird detail, he thinks for a bit(not his strongest suit, but he wasn't an idiot) before he assures you, "It's just a dream - don't let it get to you. I mean, we need to go out and find the cure for this thing today!"

The expansive castle town of Bulkhead wasn't as lively as it was before the infection started its spread, but at least there was still a little life to it, even in these times. However, even with the routine traffic of walking Pokemon that was complimented with the occasional horse-drawn taxi carriage, one couldn't help but sense the uncertainty in the air, for although Bulkhead was famous for its nigh-impenetrable defenses, the Infection was still quite infamous for its onset and virile contagion factor, and for the power that the afflicted possessed. 15533221.content:
You may have noticed several things about the Dusclops. She was female, for a start. At a glance, perhaps 5'8", but up close her true height showed; just tipping over into 6'. She was curvy, possibly a bit more than the average female, heck, a lot more than the average female; her chest was quite endowed, well over a size D. She was draped in long, black robes fashioned from strips of cloth, similar to the kind used to bind Egyptian mummies. Strangely, her eye was a brilliant gold; I suppose most of you know that Dusclops have a red eye. Her limbs were slightly disproportionate; longer and a little less muscled than others, but betrayed her true strength. Grey hair, almost comically anime as it reached her waist, flowed out behind her. And though you couldn't tell unless you asked, her name was Glyph.
Glyph was in a predicament. For a start, she was alone. It wasn't a situation anyone wanted to be in, especially in these troubled times. Everyone knew of the infected: the menacing purple eyes, inability to speak coherently. Glyph knew more than others, though. She knew because she had been infected herself. Not completely; the gash from the bite wound had not been enough to infect her spirit flame, but enough to blur the boundaries between herself and insanity. She held on desperately, not wanting to become what so many before her had succumbed to: a ravenous animal craving whole flesh.

To top it off, it was raining. Heavily. Lightning occasionally split the sky like sparks from the weapons of Gods who tore the heavens apart in a battle for supremacy. Glyph believed in Gods; she believed in anything that could maintain herself. The truth was: she didn't know what was safe to think anymore. One false thought, one corrupted vision, and that would be it. The poison crept though her body, making her feel lethargic. Her vision began to blur. She forced herself to focus again. Faithfully had she followed this dirt track, hoping it would lead her to a safe haven. Perhaps she could even be treated. Perhaps she could be saved...
The lethargy returned, accompanied by a whining noise that made her deaf to all else. She scolded herself. It was this kind of thinking that was going to get her turned. Or worse... Eaten. She was motivated by not only the desire to remain her proud self, but also by fear. Fear that she may just end up as food for another. She had never even dreamt of practicing it herself; she found it abhorrent and sickening. It was cannibalism, to a certain extent. Even though being a ghost did have its advantages, she still had to eat. Therefore, she stuck to herbs she gathered herself in the forest, making special broths thy were nourishing for herself, but useless to other.
Again, the symptoms returned, stronger this time. She cried out in terror and desperation. She was not going to lose it today, not after... Not after... All... This...

She collapsed in the mud. As she lay there, another bolt of light illuminated her sorry form, with a foreboding shape looming over her...

They also make you immune to it when you take enough of them," he says. You perk up, interested and excited.
"Do you have one?" you ask desperately. he nods, then reaches into one of the little niches of the den that lined the walls. Strange you hadn't noticed them before then; they were everywhere, lined with pretty much anything. Berries, stones, even a broken sword...
"Here," the Arcanine held a berry out. You took it and risked a small nibble. It was sweet, but had a bitter tang, yet you ate it anyway. The Arcanine sighed a little and looked at the entrance of the den.
"We should get going," he said. "I don't want any infected to stumble onto you in this weakened state. Can you use anything? As a ghost type I expect you know shadow ball," you think for a second, then nod. You learnt it a few weeks ago after fighting off an infected Serperior that was chasing you.

"My name is Glyph. And yours?" You inquire politely.

Light filters through the leafy canopy above, casting splotches of illumination across the forest floor. You stayed alert and looked for any infected that might lurk in the shadows or in the branches above, but you seem to be alone. You reached the dirt track only a few minutes later, where Scorch turned right. You stop, worried.
"Scorch, that's where I came from," you say. He looks over his shoulder.
"It's also the direction we have to go to get to the Hardrock Mountains," he stated. You bite your lower lip in anxiety.
"But we have to go towards the infected," you say. Scorch turns round and walks back to you, resting a hand on your shoulder.
"Are you that afraid of them?" he asks. You look at the floor, not wanting to admit it.
"Yes," you say. He looks at you sympathetically.
"It's ok. You have me. And the sooner we get those berries, the sooner we can reach, well, wherever you were going. I was sick of staying in that den anyway. It was high time I needed some motivation to do something useful," and with that he turned around and walked on. You set off after him, not wanting to get left behind.

You both walked for a good few hours, before you decided to ask the question.
"How far is it to these mountains of yours anyway? I've never been to them before," Scorch keeps walking, but answers nonetheless.
"I'd say about 120 pokemiles from here," you acknowledge his statement and quicken your pace; he's a lot faster then you. You regret it as you walk straight into his outstretched arm, his ears pricked up and a low growl emitting from his throat.
"Infected?" you ask timidly. He stops growling for a moment to whisper something from the side of his mouth.
"Hide. In the bushes, down the slope," he motions the drop to the left. Before you can move, Scorch is tackled by a slavering Zangoose. You sprinted down the hill out of harm's way and skidded to a halt at the base. This was stupid. You should be up there helping him!
1553322111.title: Salvation!

15533221111.content:
You stop and skid to a halt, conflicted. Leaving your friend there, no matter how powerful he seems, just doesn't seem right to you. You look back up the slope, then back at the bushes, then back up the slope. You finally make a decision and gather what strength and courage you have left, before running back up the hill and focusing on an orb, cradling it in your arms. You rise over the incline just in time to see Scorch unleash one of the hottest Fire Blasts you've ever seen, before following up with your own attack, throwing the orb with every ounce of force you can muster in your aching arms. It had it's intended effect; slamming the Zangoose into a tree, pulping the wood to splinters and knocking the Zangoose unconscious, if not dead. Scorch turns to you, his eyes showing a mixture of anger and gratitude.
"I told you to hide!" he said sternly. You fold your arms over your breasts.
"It's high time I had the motivation to do something useful," you quote. He seems to calm down a bit.
"Well, thanks anyway. He was a fast little bastard," he looked back at the Zangoose. You put the the sweetest smile you can manage in your exhausted state.
"That's more like it," he grunts, but smiles good-naturedly. He begins to walk back to the unconscious Zangoose.
"He's out cold. Leave him," you say. Scorch looks back at you.
"Well, I have to eat now, don't I?" he says. You pale and turn around, a hand clasped to your mouth. You retch slightly as you hear the poor Pokemon disappear down Scorch's throat, glistening with saliva. He turns back to you.
"Glyph? Are you not feeling well?" he asks. You shake your head, not turning around. He sits next down next to you. A tear leaks down the side of your face, and you look away.
"Glyph?" He asks again.
"I... I don't like... Vore..." you stammer. He shuffles uncomfortably.
"I'm sorry... I didn't know... I thought you'd be fine with it, y'know, with all the infected around..." the last statement causes you to sob slightly. He reaches across to you, and to his immense surprise, you hugged him tightly. He pauses for a second, unsure of what to do, but then he returns the hug. The two of you remain that way for a minute or so, and when you finally let go, Scorch's fur is wet and matted from your tears.
"I guess the saying isn't true then," he says. You look up at him, your face still wet. He smiles.
"My mother always told me that ghost types couldn't cry. 'They're hollow', she said. It's not true at all: you've probably got more emotion than any of us," you warm a little on the inside, his kind words soothing you a little. He picks you up and places you on his back, provoking a little yelp from you, before setting off and the both of you continuing on your quest.

* * *


You stopped at nightfall, Scorch tired from carrying you and you still lethargic from your wound. It had been a peaceful trip most of the way, except in the first two minute when the Zangoose had woken up and had begun struggling. It had make you sick slightly, but you resisted the urge to vomit and waited until the struggles subsided. That was almost as sickening as when it was trying to get out.
Scorch had collected some wood, including a nearby tree he had cut down using his claws.
"Isn't that a bit overkill?" you said. Scorch shrugged.
"Maybe," he replied, before beginning to slice it into logs. You had given up at that point, tired and hungry. By now, Scorch had removed a few berries from his pack for you to eat, and you were just finishing the second one off when something in the fire caught your eye. It shone a brilliant cyan, and you instantly called out to Scorch, who was a little way off breaking up a few more branches.
"Scorch, do you think you can get that?" you ask. He looks at the stone.
"They don't call us fire-types for nothing, you know," he plunged his arm in and quickly grabbed it, before pulling it out and leaving it on the log he was using as a chopping block to cool. Though you had the sense not to touch it, you examined it from afar. It was smooth, yet rough, and a light glowed faintly from within.
"A Dawn Stone..." you whisper. No-one hears. No-one but you. They were incredibly rare, so had one ended up in a pile of branches in a fire?

It was some time later, the moon only just visible over the treeline, when Scorch suggested you both bed down. You agreed and took the stone with you, Scorch quickly showing you to a small den he had dug. You hesitate a little when he tells you to get in.
"It's a bit small..." you begin.
"Either in there or out here with the infected,"
"Inside. Definitely inside."
15533221111.title: Guess You're Not That Frail... Or Hollow

155332211111.content:
It was still dark when you woke. In fact, you probably wouldn't have been able to see anything with your spirit vision if it hadn't been for the fluorescent glow of the cyan stone that rested next to your head. The glow was... mesmerizing. A loud snore from Scorch snapped you out of your trance, and you looked away. What king of power did that thing have in it to put even a ghost-type in such a state?
You moved out the way as Scorch rolled over, his massive form threatening to crush you. He actually looked a bit pudgier than yesterday, which you found cute... Until you remembered yesterday. You forced the image out of your mind, and thought about something else.

"Daddy!" a young Duskull ran to her father - a Dusknoir - in the late summer evening, the sun just beginning to set, the sky a pale fern green, and the tall grass waving in the soft summer breeze. A town, it's silhouette the dominant sight on the horizon, lay peacefully on the plains, its inhabitants going about their business like they always did.
"No! Not that! Anything but that!" you whisper frantically.
The Dusknoir picked the young girl up, cuddling her close.
"Daddy, can we play hide and seek?" the Duskull asked eagerly. Her father nodded, smiling.
"Of course we can, sweetheart," he tickled the girl under the chin, making her giggle. "But... You have to find me first!" he put the girl down and dived off into the grass, making a trail for her to follow.
"Daddy! That's not fair!" the girl pouted in mock annoyance, before setting off after him, laughing. The Dusknoir led her on a merry chase around the meadow for a good 10 minutes, before finally letting her catch up.
"Tag! You're it!" she smiled gleefully, before running off. The father stood up and let out a deep laugh.
"Oh, no you don't!" he began to chase after the trail of giggles that drifted through the air, the girl all but invisible in the reeds and wild grass.
"No!" you shake your head furiously, trying to rid yourself of the memory.
The Dusknoir stopped next to a small pile of grass cuttings, from which a suspicious laughter emanated.
"Hmm. I seem to have lost her! Where could she have gone?" another giggle came from under the cuttings.
"Gotcha!" he shouted as he pulled the girl out from under the cuttings.
"Now..." he said. "I think it's time to go home," he hefted the Duskull onto his shoulders. She struggled a little, but he tutted.
"Come on, it's past your bedtime," he said. The Duskull sighed.
"Yes Daddy,"
You clamp your hands over your ears to shut out the voices, but to no avail.
"You must face the past... If you are to move into the future..."
You hardly register the second voice, yet it echoes around your head.
The sun had finally set, and the two ghost types were now resting inside their humble abode; a single-floored house, crafted from nothing but lime, wood, metal and a great deal of heavy-handedness. The Duskull's mother, also a Dusknoir, was in the kitchen preparing supper. The Duskull girl sat in her room, playing with a Banette doll.
"Sweetie?" the girl looked up to see her mother at the door.
"Yes mummy?"
"I need to talk to you about something," she sat down next to the girl. The Duskull shifted a little, hugging her doll close.
"You know you got your gold eye from me, right?" she said. The girl nodded, but said nothing. The mother continued:
"Recently, I had a message from the Spirit World. They told me it was to do with you," she said.
"What did they say, mummy?" she asked quietly. The mother leaned in, as if afraid someone was eavesdropping on them.
"They said you were... special," she said. The girl continued to stare.
"They told me you were going to change the world," the mother said, before sitting back up. "Now you mustn't tell anyone else about this. It's a family matter, ok?" the Duskull nodded.
"I promise I won't tell anyone," she whispered. The mother smiled.
"Ok. Now I'm going to finish off supper..." she was stopped abruptly by the Duskull's father, who burst into the room, a panicked look on his face.
"Angela, you need to go," he said. Angela stood up.
"Janus? What ever is the matter?" Janus shook his head.
"I can't explain it. Pokemon... They've gone nuts! And their eyes... they're not normal. Violet! I can't say any more; you must go. I have to stay behind to fight them off," The Duskull kept holding her doll tight against her chest. A tear fell from Angela's eye.
"I can't go. You know I can't leave you..." she sobbed. Janus shook his head slowly.
"Anglea, dear... You must. They've already killed two townsfolk, and I'm not planning on you two being the next ones on their list," he said. "Now go!" he thrust the door open wide. Angela quickly swept the Duskull up, making her yelp in fright. Janus ushered them outside with haste.
"Now you must run. Run as far as you possibly can. I'll catch up with you," he smiled.
No... Not smiled... Lied... you thought, curled up against the wall, tears running down your face.
The young Duskull began to cry as an explosion caused the earth to shift underneath the trio. A nearby house exploded into shards of flaming stone and burning wood.
"Shush, Glyph. It's ok," Angela cooed to the weeping Duskull. "It's ok..." Another building disintegrated, water-types fighting to extinguish it whilst the other, still-sane townspeople fought off the attackers.
"Angela, please," Janus begged. She looked at him hard, before sobbing. She took off, leapt the fence, into the meadow grass and just like that...
"My father was gone from my life..." you weep quietly, Scorch still gently snoring away on the other side of the den. And there you lay, crying and mourning for your lost father for what seemed like hours...

* * *


Scorch wakes to find you sat, head in hands, silent, except for the occasional sniffle. He stands up and stretches, deciding whether to ask.
"You're awake," you say. He nods.
"You're upset," he replies. You say nothing in response.
"What is it?" he asks.
155332211111.title: Sweet Dreams

choices: Unlike most walls, this one you can move. (Pancakes!)
You act too slow: the Scyther is going to enjoy this.
1553322111111.content:
"It's personal," you say.
"Family?" he says. The question catches you off guard, but you quickly regain your composure. You had to make a decent impression on him after all, and you had to learn to steel yourself against those flashbacks in order to do so. Speaking of flashbacks, they seem to be occurring more commonly lately...
"It's ok. I understand. Lost my uncle a few months ago to an infected. Stuffed down a Leafeon's throa-" he stops himself as you wince and apologises.
"Forgot you didn't like vore," he says, before beginning to collect the remainder of the items hidden in a small crevice dug into the wall. You pick up your newly acquired Dawn Stone and examine it a bit more closely. The second voice in your flashback... It seemed to have come from the stone itself. You doubted your own sanity for a moment; rocks don't just start talking for no apparent reason... Or maybe the reason wasn't exactly apparent...
"Glyph," Scorch snaps his fingers under your nose. You lean back, startled.
"Sorry, I..." how do you explain you heard a talking rock without it sounding incredibly stupid?
"Doesn't matter why. Try and stop yourself from doing it if possible: it makes you vulnerable," he says. You nod, relieved you don't have to elaborate anything for him. Scorch hefts the contents of his pack over his shoulder, before starting to claw at the entrance you both made last night to stop the infected from tracking you. You concentrate for a minute, willing the Dawn Stone to repeat what it said earlier. Nothing happens at first, but then you hear a faint whisper.
"Glyph..." it was definitely not Scorch; the tone was too mellow and soft for him. Perhaps there was something else going on here...
 
* * *

 
Back on the dirt track again. You kicked a stone absent-mindedly, still thinking about this morning. What had that voice said again? Something along the lines of: "You need to face your past, to live your future"? What was that supposed to mean? You shook your head and focused. Scorch had said not to lose it like that. You pushed the thought to one side, resolving to deal with it later. Now was the time to stay alert.
"Pain... Sorrow... Guilt..." you freeze and look around, scanning the surroundings. Nothing. Was it that bloody rock again? You huff and run to catch up with Scorch. It was a little while before either of you spoke.
"So how does a Dusclops learn Psycho Boost?" Scorch asked. The question surprises you.
"How did you know?" you ask, curious as to his reasoning.
"A lot of Pokemon have been trying out any sort of move thy can find lately, what with all the infected, even if it's hopeless. Caught a Wartortle the other day trying to learn something like Bullet Seed. Quite comical to watch actually; he was spitting seeds at a tree for practice..." he muses. The last part makes you laugh. The corner of Scorch's mouth twitches upwards in what you presume was a smile.
"So I'm guessing you saw a psychic-type use it first?" you say. He thinks about it for a second, before shaking his head.
"No. A Tropius, as a matter of fact," he states. You laugh again, and this time he chuckles.
"Anyway, it backfired on him; got blown into a bloody lake a couple of hundred metres away," you wince at the thought; it must've been a damn powerful attack to send him tha far back. "But I got a pretty good idea of what it looked like: pink, glowing, looked a bit like a miniature sun," he says. You nod in agreement.
"Where did you learn it?" he asks. You look back at him.
"I learnt it after experimenting around with Shadow Ball, I guess," you lie. You knew it wasn't true: you'd learnt it a long time before that.
"Ah, ok," Scorch says, obviously losing interest. You shrug and continue walking.

It was about half an hour later when the attack occurred. Scorch pricked his ears up again and assumed a fighting stance, building up a salvo of fire deep within his body. You could feel him get hotter as the temperature rises, and you prepare in turn. Nothing too stressful this time... you think, remembering your lethargy after knocking out the Zangoose.
The forest on the right had slowly dropped away to reveal rolling plains, and the cliff on your right had disappeared as well, mirroring the landscape on your left. You knew the track was a well-known highway (if that was was applicable to such a poor excuse for a path), but couldn't help wondering why you were using it; it wasn't exactly inconspicuous. The thought was cut off by a rustle in the grass. You turn towards the sound and ready yourself, charging up a Shadow Ball that cast an eerie light across the floor. Seemingly realising their stealth approach had failed, your attackers stand up and show their full height. A Lilligant and a Scyther, both of them shorter than you but no less menacing. You knew they could and most definitely would eat you given half a chance.
It was the Scyther who made the first move, springing at you with a speed you could only describe as supernatural, assuming you were the weaker target. That was it's first mistake. Instead of throwing the orb you hel, a futile endeavour as you had hardly any room to throw it by the time you registered the Scyther's attack, you forced it to assume a large, rectangular shape, form an unyielding. Try breaking through a Reflect, bastard, you think as the Scyther collides with your hastily-constructed barrier, earning itself a broken nose for it's troubles. The Scyther scrabbled back up and eyed you curiously, as if deciding whether to eat you or use you as a toy. Meanwhile, Scorch was dealing with an infected of his own as the Lilligant dodged his attacks with supreme agility, teasing him. He growled in frustration and sent another jet of flame it's way. The (decidedly female, you thought to yourself) slid out the way with almost contemptuous ease.
Unfortunately, focusing on your partner's well being left you wide open to attack, which the Scyther promptly takes advantage of, leaping towards you from the right.
1553322111111.title: Respect For Privacy

choices: Are you serious? All of them?
15533221111111.content:
You whip round, pulling the barrier in front of you as the Scyther collides with it in a sickening crunch. Not that it really bothers you. You slammed the barrier into the floor, trapping the Scyther underneath, causing it to writhe and squirm in pain as you begin to increase the pressure. The keratin on one of the blades cracks, then shatters entirely as you continue to exert even more force on the hapless pokemon. Eventually you can see the hard exoskeleton crumple slightly, and the Scyther begins to choke as you suffocate it with the immense pressure on it's lungs. Fortunately, being merciful was one of your traits, and you dispel the shield, leaving a broken, paralysed and near-unconscious Scyther to cough and splutter on the hard earth.
You turn to see Scorch, his foot clamped over the Lilligant's throat to stop it from escaping.
"Bloody quick, this one. I hate it when they're quick," he grumbles, before removing his paw. The Lilligant is in a sorry state; retching slightly as she struggles to get her breath back. Scorch picks her up none too gently, before lifting her into the air above his wide-open maw.
"Scorch..." you warn. He lowers her down again.
"Fine. Turn away and try not to listen," he says, before continuing with his meal. You do as he says and clamp your hands over your ears to block out everything that goes on behind you, staring at the floor. He taps you on the shoulder a few seconds later.
"Finished," he says. You nod and swallow nervously. He sighs.
"You're going to have to get over that phobia, and soon. Fear's not a good thing to show when fighting these infected," he preaches. You hear a gurgle from his stomach, and can't resist looking down. His stomach hangs down beneath him, a good deal larger than it was a minute a go. You can see the faint struggles of the Lilligant inside, and you look away, sickened. Scorch sighs.
"Don't like, don't look," he states bluntly before setting off down the path again. You recover from your ill feeling and run to catch up with him, before matching his pace.
"Glyph..." the voice again. You pull out the Dawn Stone from one of the pockets in your robe and look at it. Still that same fluorescent cyan. Wait. Not just that: there's an outline of something in there. You hold it up to your eye, but the image had disappeared. Perhaps it was just your imagination.

* * *


"She still can't hear us,"
"I know, but we have to keep trying,"
"We may not have enough power to do so..."
"No. If necessary, we can borrow some of hers. We'll need it if we're going to carry out our task,"
"That's going to take a lot of energy. Way more than we can muster, at least,"
"I have my ways,"
"Which are?"
"To put it simply; we're going to meet her face-to-face, very soon indeed..."

* * *


"Glyph. Wake up: it's daytime. By the sun I'd say 8 in the morning, and we can make the mountains by this evening if we're quick," Scorch says. You yawn and stretch, opening your eye. You had had a good sleep that night: no dreams, no nightmares. Just long, blissful darkness. The way it's supposed to be. You heft yourself to your feet and exit the cave Scorch had found last night. He'd used a technique he called 'Nightwatch' to get his sleep, yet be completely aware of his surroundings. When you asked how, he simply smiled and said:
"Practice,"
You shake off the numbness in your injured arm; the berry's effects were beginning to wear off, and Scorch had warned you had little time left before you started to deteriorate again, before setting off after him. He seems unsettled slightly.
"Scorch?" you ask. He looks down at you.
"This isn't right. There should be a lot more infected here. I expected a fight as soon as I crawled outside, but..." he leaves the sentence hanging, and you nod in acknowledgement. You had anticipated an increased presence of infected as well, but this was entirely unexpected. Still, you had to keep your guard up; they might just be planning an ambush. Or they might be oblivious to your presence. Either way, nothing good would come if you lost focus.
15533221111111.title: Scyther Pancakes

15533222.content:
It excites me to have another storyline pop-up! Not like that. Honestly. Seriously. Don't get ideas.

Shadecerule's Story: Darlue the Purrloin isn't your typical hero. He's more likely to rob something in your home then help protect it. Yet this mischievous cat may find himself on a journey of self-discovery and change in his simple efforts to avoid the infected with those that he meets along the way. Assuming he doesn't end up as fat first.

Another option for a storyline to be added.
15533222.title: Storyline Choices VIII

155332221.content:
You've chosen to step into the shoes of Darlue the Purrloin!

This sneaky protagonist is the cream of the crop when it comes to thieves (and surely, meals as well). He gets through life by stealing what he needs from those who don't need it--though you can be sure that this way of life gets him into a fair amount of trouble. As for looks, he may be a run-of-the-mill Pokémon that litter various areas of the world, but he's one of the few "shiny" ones out there. His skin is a very dark blue, almost black. His eyelids are a lighter hue of blue, which rise above a set of green eyes. His underbelly and various other markings are a very light shade of teal.

With the infection spreading further every day, the number of easy and deserving targets is growing slim. Out in the wilderness, where there is no civilization to be seen for miles, he might need to chance an encounter with one of the infected. They tend to have a bounty of useful items ripe for the picking, considering the number of victims it take to satiate the desires of an infected Pokemon. Fortunately for Darlue, Pokemon can't use their equipment anymore once they've become belly fat for a hungry predator...
155332221.title: Darlue, the Devious Purrloin!

choices: Leave your concerns behind and sneak into Fulleaves Forest.
Looks like the intell was mixed up somewhere down the line...
1553322211.content:
You've finally reached the outskirts of town--word is that a horde of infected pokemon were coming from the other direction. Frogs of some sort. Politoad, perhaps? Or maybe Croagunk? Either way, you didn't want to stick around to find out. Vinnavale Village was a lovely place, but you didn't feel like getting caught up in that kind of mess.

You took one last look back at the village, flicking your tail at the wind. It was a shame that most of the villagers were too stubborn to flee. Too caught up in their homes, in their possessions. You almost felt bad for leaving, but it wasn't as though you could save anyone if you stayed. You were too weak. Sure, you were lithe and agile, but there wasn't much you could do with such a measly moveset: thief, trick, fake-out, and charm. Moves for stealing and escaping, not for battling.

Whelp, looks like there will be bellies full of Pidgeys tonight... At least they'll take care of that greedy Honchkrow mayor. You forced yourself to turn around. With a sigh, you stepped out to venture toward your next destination.
1553322211.title: Escaping already!?

choices: Whatever. You can restock in the next town.
The outpost is only twenty minutes away... Sounds like a plan.
15533222111.content:
You wandered into the forest outside of town, trying to push thoughts of Vinnavale Village behind you. It was a town populated by bird type Pokemon, after all; at least some of them should be able to escape, if not most. Really, staying to help would have been more like condemning yourself. That realization gave you a bit of peace as you moved forward.

You tried to keep hidden in the brush, wanting to leave as thin a trail as you could. Infected Pokemon could be anywhere out here in the wild... It was best to stay out of sight. You paused for a moment to check your map; according to its information, you should be able to reach the nearest town in about two hours. So long as no complications arise, that is.

You noticed something else on the map that you didn't see before: an outpost in the middle of the forest. It was a little out of the way, but it was much closer than the next town. Outposts are a great place to restock on supplies, too--sometimes even better than towns. Especially towns entirely populated by birds, who prefer to eat things like seeds and berries poisonous to other Pokemon. So, it suffices to say that you weren't able to stock up on a whole lot of food at Vinnavale Village. In fact, all you had left in your bag was a satchel of seeds, an oran berry, and half a roll of bread.
15533222111.title: Lovely forest, so far.

choices: Get out of here while you still can--no need to get involved!
This Flareon won't make it on its own... Time for two against one!
155332221111.content:
You shrugged and stowed the map away. It would be better to get into town as soon as possible. After all, the outpost may not even be there anymore; with the increase in infected Pokemon, the place could have been overrun and destroyed. Even though the outpost might hold something interesting... No, it was best to move on.

It had been a surprisingly long time without a single thing to worry about--somewhere around an hour. That realization almost made your surroundings feel a little eerie. You thought you suddenly heard a noise, but you brushed it off as paranoia. You couldn't allow yourself to get worked up over a few mind tricks.

However, a few more minutes into your journey and you realized that perhaps it wasn't your imagination. You heard a bit of commotion to your left and decided to investigate... Surely, one day, curiosity will kill me.

Through the brush, you saw a clearing. A battle was apparently going on, but it wasn't a friendly spar. You could tell by the fear in the Flareon's eyes and the drool leaking from the corner of the Slaking's gaping mouth--not only that, but the laziness of Slaking was comparable to Snorlax. They were rarely ever this aggressive... There was only one conclusion that could be made.

The infection.
155332221111.title: Onward!

choices: Bread's gone, time to move on!
1553322211111.content:
You watched as the Slaking sent the Flareon flying against the base of a tree with a single Hammer Arm attack. An intense wave of fear washed over you--that Slaking was powerful! You couldn't help yourself any longer--you had to get out of here!

You turned on the spot and ran. One look over your shoulder showed the Flareon's body being crammed into the maw of the Slaking, and that was all you needed to see. Leaving the scene behind, you fled until you considered yourself at a safe distance. Panting, you hid within a bush and pulled out your bread.

A feeling of unease built in the pit of your stomach. You've encountered a great number of infected before, but you've never had to abandon anyone. You've always been a solo player. Less to worry about, for the most part. Don't worry about it. There was nothing you could do. You'd be sliding down that gullet right now if you'd have stayed. Still, telling yourself that wasn't very comforting as you were just sitting here, safe and sound and nibbling on a piece of bread.
1553322211111.title: Time to pussycat on outta here.

choices: Just a little more... You can sense that you're almost there!
15533222111111.content:
You finished your snack and decided it was time to move on. It's no good to stay in one place for too long when you're out in a wilderness potentially filled with hungry, infected Pokemon. You shuddered as you thought about the Slaking again.

Almost there, now... But I still need to be careful. Your dash for freedom made up for the time you spend on your short break, so you were still right on schedule--you definitely wanted to get there before sundown. Even though you're a dark type Pokemon, the advantage you'd gain would be minimal compared to the hungry Pokemon who actually live in this forest and know the place.

But thankfully, you calculated that you'd be at Claritown in no time at all. It was a good thing that you didn't drastically change directions in your escape. Claritown should be just a few more miles away!
15533222111111.title: Snack time's over... For now.

choices: You want to escape, but your body isn't responding.
Don't let the fear take hold. Retaliate!
15533222111112.content:
A sound to your right suddenly perked your ears to attention, freezing you still and silent. However, inaction may not have been the best choice, as a moment later you were pummeled by broken branches and a sudden heavy weight.
