155332222221112111111111.title: Shared Bath

1553322222211121111111112.content:
It takes about 30 minutes until Kenshi's knot deflates enough to pull it out comfortably, and you give him another peck on the lips before sitting up. "We should get washed up before we move on." He can only nod with a silly grin on his face that you couldn't help but feel you were reflecting as you both slid back into the small lake.

You washed each other's fur, which allowed you a chance to really feel how strong the young boy's muscles were as you rubbed into them with your fingers. He also seemed to linger longer than any other part when he started massaging your small breasts, making it difficult to bite back a moan. After a few minutes of that, you both climbed out, got dressed, and headed back to your camp.

Kenshi must have been getting comfortable with the idea of you being a couple, considering he laid down and gestured for you to join him. There was a moment of hesitation, but it melted away when you set your head on his firm chest, lulled to sleep by exhaustion and the sense of protection.

The night passed peacefully, though besides your internal clocks waking you both, you had no way to tell if it was morning from inside the cave. "Morning Yuki," Kenshi says after you both sit up and stretch, then surprises you with a sudden kiss. You giggled, before getting to your feet.

"Morning, ready to get going?" He gives the thumbs up, and takes your hand before taking the lead. Kenshi sure is seeming more confident lately, not that you minded. You walked for what you believed to be about thirty minutes before you could see the literal light at the end of the tunnel. When you stepped out, you were showered with bright sunlight, an indication that you overslept and it was at least noon. You pointed to a small village, fortified with a high wood wall, "that must be it."

As you approached, an arrow suddenly whizzed past your head, which you responded to by whipping out your scythe. A voice that was too ambiguous to tell if it was male or female called to you from behind the closed gate. "What are your names?! Answer or I'll take you both out as infected!"

They must have seen you from a distance, so they couldn't see your eyes. You set the scythe to a more casual position at your side and placed a hand on Kenshi's tensed up shoulder. "Our names are Kenshi and Koyuki! We came to your village to look for someone!"

A moment of tense silence followed, before the gate suddenly started raising, and you could finally see the source of the voice. It was actually kind of confusing, he was a black fox, that you knew was a Zorua, about your age, but aimed straight at you was a folding bow that emitted a soft glittering emerald light. "Who are you looking for?"

You held up your own relic, "I was sent to find a Zoroark that had a bow described to be a lot like the one you're holding..."

He bit his lip, with a twitch of his tail, the flicked his head, "come inside then. Dad told me you'd probably be coming." Tilting your head, and shooting a sideways glance to Kenshi, you sheathed your scythe, took his hand, and followed the mysterious boy inside.
1553322222211121111111112.title: Reaching the Village

15533222222111211111111121.content:
When he stopped in front of one of the larger houses, which must have been for the chief, he turned to you. The question left your lips before he finished, "what's your name?"

The boy blinks and chuckles, "ah, I guess we forgot the introductions, huh? My name's Natsu, and if you were sent looking for the Godsbow Tanuki, he's my old man. He's actually the mayor here."

Mayor, chief, same difference you told yourself, "ah, then we'd very much like to meet him." He nods and opens the door, crossing the threshold casually, "dad! Visitors!"

Heavy footsteps trudged down from the stairs that faced away from the door, until a figure crossed into your vision. "Visitors? I thought I said not to allow anyone into the village. His face was contorted in a scowl, and his son had his ears folded against his head.

"But they're..."

You decided now was a good time to cut in, quite literally, by whipping your scythe back out. Tanuki's face changed from disappointment to surprise. "Oh, you remembered my stories Natsu. Good. Come inside, I'm going to guess your father told you to find me?"

You frowned and shook your head, walking to the table, "no...it was a Swampert, Milo." When you sat in the chair, he narrows his eyes, nodding.

"I see...what, if I may ask, happened to Alfwin and Sakura then?" A tear threatened to fall from the corner of your eye. It had been a while since you'd heard her name.

"Sorry...mom...she was eaten by a feral...my dad disappeared defending the village, but he-"

He cut you off with a gentle shake of his head, "there’s no way Alfwin fell to these creatures, he's way too strong. I bet he's looking for you."
15533222222111211111111121.title: The Chief

choices: We'll stay here, gotta stay safe.
He might need our help, let's go!
155332222221112111111111212.content:
You aren't given any time to really think about that, when someone, a Patrat, bursts in. He's obviously panicked about something. Tanuki grunts in annoyance, "Mil, I swear, if this is another false alarm-"

"EMERGENCY. EMERGENCY. FERALS INCOMING, CITIZENS FIND SHELTER IMMEDIATELY. THIS IS NOT A DRILL, REPEAT, NOT A DRILL." The loud voice of someone was blaring through the village, and the Zoroark cursed and rubbed at his temples.

"Shit. If you two can fight, you're free to join us. Otherwise, hide here with Natsu." He gives no time to respond before he grabs his composite bow which was hanging from the wall near the front door.

The Zorua boy looks between you, pulling out his relic. "If we're staying, I'll guard the door. Otherwise...I wanna help dad." Kenshi also looked to you expectantly.
155332222221112111111111212.title: Interrupted!

1553322222211121111111112121.content:
As much as it pained you, he was a hero, and risking yourself needlessly seemed stupid. "We'll stay here, gotta stay safe..." Kenshi frowned, but nodded in agreement, and the boy Natsu eventually did as well.

Sounds of fighting continued for a good 15 minutes, and then fell into silence suddenly. Just before that, you swore you could feel a stomp or some such, and then a soft knock at the door. "Who is it?" Natsu called after a moment of hesitation.

"We got the infected, it's safe to come out now." The Zorua frowned, and opened the door slowly.

“I don’t recognize your v-” Was all she was able to say before the door slammed open, staring right into the violet eyes of a Blastoise that grabs him and pulls him out, kicking and screaming.

You grab your scythe and whip it out, running for the door, "let him go!" Just as you cross the threshold though, something is jabbed into your chest and sends a jolt of electricity through your body, making you spasm and fall over, dropping your weapon. Your vision starts fading, until Natsu's scream perks you back up, but by that time, your throat is gripped, and you are shoved up against the wall of the manor, and you find yourself staring into the blue eyes of a Pachirisu. 'Blue?' You question to yourself, wondering if the light was playing tricks on you, but his words quickly dispel any doubts.

"I can see you're confused, so I'll make this simple," he says, snapping his fingers which seems to signal a feral Magcargo to pick up a groaning Kenshi. "I am their master...though, only these. After all, there are a few higher on the pecking order..." The caped man brushes a finger along your cheek, and you snap at him with your fangs. "But maybe get ridding of two of the brats standing between him and victory will net me a promotion."

Natsu's screaming suddenly stopped, but all you could see was the Blastoise's shell, his head hunched over. The wet squelching noises coming from his direction pretty much answered the dreadful question that came to your mind. When it seemed to be echoed, you looked in horror as Kenshi's head disappeared into the snail. The Pachirisu grabbed your chin and forced it back to look at him. "You’re going to be mine either way, but what to do with you afterwards?"
1553322222211121111111112121.title: Waiting Out the Storm

15533222222111211111111121212.content:
"I'll make you my queen!" He suddenly exclaims, and while you're still processing what that could mean, a powerful shock courses through your body, the last thing you see being the Pachirisu’s twisted smile, and your mate dissolving into the body of a lava snail. Then you’re caught before your head smacks against the ground, and you black out.

The next time you awaken reveals you’ve been brought to a room fitting for a king, and looking down reveals you to be wearing a beautiful sky blue dress. You move, only to find your wrist shackled to the bed, but before you’re able to freeze it, your assaulter enters, “I called you a queen...but baroness I guess would make more sense, hm? Oh, but I never introduced myself!” He crosses the room, and you fire an Ice Beam at him to make him back away. Or you would have, if anything had just come out of your mouth. “Feisty! That’s why I gave you a special choker that disables all your moves, and without your little toy, you’re nothing but a little girl~”

The squirrel crawls onto the bed, and you futilely crawl backwards, “no need to be shy, you’re safe so long as you behave. I’m the Baron, and you, my little flower?”

With no other alternative, since you were unarmed and you saw your only two allies turned into food, you just weakly choke out, “Koyuki…”

So began a year that you spent as the baroness, though you finally got to walk around the estate freely after about a month since he was positive you wouldn’t run. Especially with all the feral guards around, and some that weren’t. Emboldened by his success in taking out three of the chosen, he would travel occasionally, with stories of more that he had either eaten, or fed to his minions.

You were in his foyer that was converted to a throne room, pleasuring him with your mouth with his purring and petting the back of your head. “Oh Yuki, you’ve gotten so good at this!” It made you sick anytime he called you that, since it reminded you of your dead mate, but it wasn’t as if you could fight him.

The door suddenly swings open, and you turn in time to see nothing but a white streak before something that sounded like gunfire, and words that you were pretty sure sounded like, “seems like the small fry’s gotten a little big for his britches! You may be a Baron, but I’m a God!”

You thought you were dead, but you find yourself awake, wondering if you were in heaven...but you could feel the Pachirisu was there, and you knew full well that wasn’t where he was going. It was also dark, moist, and something was clenching on you, and something splashed on you, burning. You were in a stomach! But the Baron hadn’t suddenly decided to eat you...he was in here too… Speaking of, seems like he was waking up, “wh-what?! YOU CAN’T DO THIS TO ME!!! I DELIVERED ALL OF THE CHOSEN!!!”

A muffled response reverberated around you, and you were pretty sure it was the same voice you heard earlier. “Yeah, well, not all of them. But hey, I took care of that, so how about a little gratitude? Not that I need it in words, your nutrition will be more than enough! Ahahahahah~!!” And that was the last thing you heard, before your term as the baroness came to a sudden, and ultimate end.
15533222222111211111111121212.title: The Baroness

1553322222211121111111112122.content:
You chewed on your lip, but eventually opted to reach for your scythe, whipping it out with a flourish as Natsu started to push on the door. “He might need our help, let’s go!” The two boys smiled, part of them probably wishing for a fight, and a chance to prove themselves...it’s just how they were, you guessed.


No time to reflect on that though, the setting sun washed the village in a fiery orange light, and the sounds of a horde of heavy footfalls reverberated in from behind the gate, setting everyone on edge. But even more bizarre than that was the silence that followed, until a knock came at the gate. Confused, but cautious, Tanuki takes it upon himself to walk over to the gate and open the small hatch, stumbling back in surprise. “Wh-What is the meaning of this?!”


A haughty voice replies from the other side, sending a chill down your spine from the saccharine venom dripping out of it almost literally. “Greetings, simple villagers, I am the Baron. As it so happens, you are all intruding on my land, and there’s little keeping me from wiping you all out...however, we can come to a little...agreement.” He chuckles, snapping his fingers, and the gate nearly caves in from the impact. “Hear that? It was just two of my precious ferals nearly smashing your little gate in. A couple more and it will probably be splinters.”


There was a pause, probably the Baron letting that sink in before he continued. “So here’s the deal. Hand over the bowman and his offspring, and I’ll bring the lot of you into my personal protection. Refuse, and you this town becomes a buffet.”


You had no say in this choice, and was only able to look to Tanuki to see what he’d say.
1553322222211121111111112122.title: Into the Fire

15533222222111211111111121221.content:
He clenches his fists a few times, until he calls out, “open the gate!” The villagers hesitated, until eventually the gate opened with that heavy creak, made more difficult when the two dents on the other side were shown to all of you.


It was quite a sight, with 10 or so ferals, and at the head, a small Pachirisu man, wearing clothes that reminded you of your old life, complete with the cane he was currently leaning on. And he was unable to keep that smirk off his face as he looked over the villagers. Most of them were using shoddy, repurposed weapons, like pitchforks and hunting bows, with the exception of the two chosen children, you and Natsu, Kenshi, who used his fists, and Tanuki, who, though not wielding a relic, his bow still had exquisite craftsmanship and was obviously designed with combat in mind. “Now, you lot, throw down your weapons...and have the Godsbow and his kid step forward.”


Perhaps Natsu should have gotten rid of the bow earlier, since it identified him as Tanuki’s son too easily. Well, the fact that he was a Zorua was probably a bit of a giveaway. Tanuki looks at him and sighs, nodding slowly, “alright, just leave the village alone.”


They both drop their bows, prompting everyone else to do the same with their own weapons, and with some hesitation, you followed suit. The Baron seemed to give you a look, but it was gone by the time you noticed, and decided it was simply your imagination. “I’m sorry, was that an order? You think ‘cuz you’re the self-proclaimed ‘chief’ of some backwater village that it gives you some power?”


He clicks his tongue with a scowl, “you need to learn your place...but that’s alright, I just thought of a way for you to do so.” His scowl transforms into a haughty smirk as he lifts up his little, almost feminine footpaw. “Lick it, peasant, and make it snappy.”


Tanuki growls, stepping forward and kneeling down to take it into his hands. If it was you, you may have bitten it, but the Zoroark seemed to have more self control as he just licks the pad on the bottom. The look on his face told you it really wasn’t that bad, which made you wonder about this squirrel. Just what kind of old-world conveniences did he have access to anyway? And for that matter, why were the ferals listening to him in the first place?


“Enough.” He says suddenly, before landing a kick right into Tanuki’s nose, and regretting it immediately when he realized the sound of bone breaking wasn’t his nose, holding his foot and hopping around quite comically.


Trying to keep the sneer out of his voice, the fox just says, “sorry. Was always told I had a hard head.” However, the Baron turns on him with the angriest glare his cute, pampered squirrel face could manage, and in a pained, high-pitched voice, screams.


“You think that’s funny?! I see the other relic-wielder back there, and I was going to give you a chance to give her up too, but then you had to say something!” A snap, and the docile ferals sprung into action, “slaughter them all and WIPE THIS PIECE OF SHIT OFF MY LAND!!!”


Everyone tried to lunge forward for their weapons again, but with the foxes out of position, and everyone else not trained for real combat, only you and Kenshi were quick enough to react. It was a flurry around you, villagers getting grabbed and eaten quicker than you thought possible, even for them, and you could only catch bits and pieces as you dove and grabbed your scythe before rolling to your feet.


A large feral Pidgeot swooped in and grabs Tanuki by his shoulders, and pulls him to a nearby roof, never to be seen again, at least without being able to see through the avian. “DAD!! Hold on, I’ll-!” Was all Natsu could say, before a sinkhole opened beneath his feet, and a few seconds later, out jumped an Excadrill with a full, squirming gut. The young and old men gathered to fight all went down even easier, calling for mercy for their wives and babies.


Kenshi was doing his best, punching off a Galvantula as it had lunged for you at the same time, trying to snatch you out of the air. You gave him a quick nod in thanks, before springing over him and slashing through the closest feral, only now realizing this was your first real kill. It was majestic, and beautiful, very different from the image you had in your head.


Your scythe impacts with the beast’s chest, and makes a clean slice, its power activating and freezing the Grovyle solid before he shatters, leaving behind only powdery snow. Not that you had time to think about it, since that was just one down, and turning to press your back against Kenshi’s to face down the small army, only realizing now how hopeless your odds were.


The Baron steps forward, nearly reaching you before an Aura Sphere get shot past his head. “Bravo kids, you’ve done well thus far...but I’m afraid this is where the curtain closes for you.” His fanged smile glints in the dying light of sunset, as he holds out his cane. “How about another deal? If you throw down your weapons and grovel to me here and now, I’ll let that boy go...but not you, my dear. No, you’ve been deemed too dangerous.”


You couldn’t even make the choice before you feel a rush of wind, the Riolu blowing past you with charged fist raised for the squirrel. “I won’t let you hurt her!!” There wasn’t even time to react, to try and help, to do something before the Baron deftly sidesteps him and jams the cane right into his chest.


“Well, I gave you a chance, now you both die.” With a laugh, he sends electricity through the weapon, which you realized must have just been made to resemble wood, since the jolt flowed so easily through it, electrocuting Kenshi and sending him flying back to the feet of a drooling Rhydon.


Finally, your body caught up with your eyes, but rushing at the Pachirisu only seemed to be accelerating your doom, now that you could feel first-hand how wide your gap in experience was. A Thunderbolt crackled through the air, making your fur stand on end, shooting out of the end of his cane and paralyzing you on impact, stopping just inches short of killing him and you just crumpled to the ground in a twitching heap.


Another snap, and the Rhydon must have decided to grab Kenshi, using him as the sound of slapping and screaming you’d grown so accustomed to echoed in your ears. “He’ll make a good soldier once he’s evolved, but our Lord has decreed you die...and your little toy will make a nice proof of kill for me to collect on your bounty~” Claws from ferals you couldn’t see tore away your clothes, pulled away your scythe, and held you up in front of him, you could only barely muster the strength to glare at him. But he just smiles as he walks forward, pulling off his pants to reveal a cock that, while small compared to something like, say, the Rhydon, it was certainly much more than you’ve ever handled before, since it was the soon-to-be infected Riolu that’s been your first and only. “Nothing to say we can’t have a little fun first.”
15533222222111211111111121221.title: Letting in the Boogeymen

155332222221112111111111212211.content:
He grabs your hips, and despite bracing for it, you still cry out in pain and unwanted pleasure when he slams all 9 inches of his meat into your slit. However, that was nothing, compared to the impossibly wide, gaping maw in front of you that your head was quickly crammed into. You’re reminded of how you once saw a squirrel stuff its mouth full of nuts, with its cute, puffy cheeks. This was certainly a hell of a lot less cute as he just abuses you to get off like a toy, more concerned with using his tongue to taste you, and stuff more of your body into his mouth. In the darkness, all you could see was how this must have looked to a bystander as an anthro Glaceon girl disappears into the Baron’s mouth, cheeks bulging out with your form pressing against the thin skin.

Since all he wanted was to get off as quick as possible, you were at least relieved when the cream shot into you, electricity shooting into your body and making you lose control. You could feel him laugh as the stream mixed with his cum to become quite a messy puddle on the ground, before you’re stuffed in completely. This was probably what a stomach felt like without the burning...and it’d almost be relaxing if it wasn’t for the circumstances.


It wasn’t much longer, though felt like an eternity, of him using his tongue to wrap around you, tasting you, rolling you around in the tight space, before a swallow reverberated around your body and drags you into his throat with one motion. You cry and whine weakly in your short trip down, the muscles of his gullet contracting and squeezing your body the entire way, making you wonder if perhaps you’d be crushed to death before you’d even get there. No such luck though, but at least you were close to passing out as you emerged with a loud squelch i to a pool of burning acid.


Soon, even the pain would dull, and you’d fall into a final sleep….your eyes closing, or maybe they were already closed. It was so dark that it made it impossible to tell. Not that you really believed in such things, after the coming of this world, but some part of you still hoped you would get to see your mom and dad in the afterlife. Yes...you could feel yourself drifting as your fur probably dissolved…


Suddenly, a literal jolt fired off from the stomach lining and into you through the hyperconductive acid, forcing you back awake. You were still able to scream, much to the Baron’s delight. “Oh no no no, the sweet release of a quick death is too good for you babe. This will be slow, and I’m going to make sure you feel all of it. That’s just the price of your defiance.”


And he meant that, the electricity kept your heart and mind working even after you were mostly gone, until finally, not even that could keep you alive. Outside, Kenshi's infection was complete, the dazed, violet-eyed Riolu standing up with cum dripping out of his asshole, and all of the ferals worked together to clear out the small village until nothing but splinters and tattered clothes remained. A content squirrel rubbed his fat gut and laughed, “maybe I can finally get that promotion now, getting rid of two of those pests...but better safe than sorry, we march on the next location at dawn!”
155332222221112111111111212211.title: Fun for the Baron

15533222222111211111111121222.content:
“Come and get us then!” The Zoroark shouts defiantly, only to be followed by an uneasy silence that lasted a good few minutes.

The Baron’s laugh then pours in from the hatch in the door, giving you and all the villagers upset stomachs just from hearing it. “You peasants have some balls, I’ll give you that.” Just as it seems he was about to give his command, Tanuki fires an arrow with pin-point accuracy through the slot, and quickly nocks another before the Baron could even react. Then the shriek of a dying creature, but its pitch was too different to be him. “Pidgeot! Grr, she was one of my favorites, you’ll most certainly pay for that one!”

“Get ready everyone!” The chief shouts, though it’s obvious from their postures that only a couple besides you four really knew anything about fighting. Your body tenses when the gate suddenly crashes open, broken down by four ridiculously huge ferals. But, you know the saying, the bigger they are...and both foxes proved it by firing arrows straight through the hearts of both the Excadrill and Rhydon, causing them to stumble and then collapse, dead.

There was no time for a head count, with you only able to make out the other two ferals at the gate. In the corner of your eye, you could see Kenshi was ready to take on whichever you didn’t, but who was better? You had to make this decision fast! This would most likely determine the outcome of the entire battle, so you had to choose wisely.
15533222222111211111111121222.title: Siege Defence

155332222221112111111111212221.content:
You press your back to Kenshi’s, stepping in sync with a maneuver you practiced a few times in the last week to switch your positions and your opponents. Once turned, you could see both Tanuki and Natsu pulling back on their bowstrings, letting their arrows fly into the Zweilous. Judging by its shriek, it must have been a direct hit, but you didn’t have time to look back and see the damage with the Shiftry barreling down at you!

Kenshi kicked off at the same time, fists glowing with aura energy as you whip your scythe out. The Shiftry shot a Razor Leaf at you, but your recent training and experience kicked in, letting you dig your heel in and pivot, spinning around them to dodge. Before he had a chance to retaliate, you twirled once more, utilizing the built momentum to strike him clean in the side. The feral’s eyes widened in...fear? An expression you’d never seen the beasts make before, but before you could contemplate the implications of that, ice began forming in the wound, creeping over his entire wooden body before it shatters in a flurry of snow.

You hardly had time to take it in as a cry from behind caught your attention, turning back to see Kenshi holding one of the dragon’s jaws back with only his paws, but as strong as they were, they’d be no match for the other one closing in! With a deep breath, energy concentrates in your mouth, firing out to strike the head square in the eye before it has a chance to bite the Riolu, and distracted him enough to turn the tables, slamming the jaw shut and then delivering a wicked uppercut!

The Zweilous roars at Kenshi, while you run up on his flank, forcing him to split his attention between the two of you. Kenshi hops from foot to foot, holding up his fists and ready to strike once again. You both exchange a look, tense and waiting for the dragon to make a move. The feral seemed to be unsure of what to do with two opponents, before finally barreling full tilt at Kenshi with mouths open.

However, you created a blind spot for him, and the second he rushed past you, another Ice Beam fired out of your mouth before you had time to think, hitting his legs and making him slip just before he could hit Kenshi. This gave the boy enough time to swiftly maneuver around him, and with a couple of well-placed Force Palms, the dragon crumples. You sigh with relief, eyes trailing over to see the Pachirisu fending off the Zoroark’s bow strikes with his cane, apparently electrified judging by the sparks shooting off with each strike.

He wasn’t prepared for Natsu to sneak around behind him, and deal the finishing blow as an arrow whizzed past and dug right into his arm, making the Pachirisu scream in agony. But it was cut short as Tanuki landed a wicked strike to his skull, making him fall unconscious.

Everyone in the square looks around at each other, before triumphant shouts echoed throughout. The villagers held up their pitchforks, tools, and some even had brooms! You smile and join in the revelry, thrusting your scythe up, while Kenshi just pumped his fist.
155332222221112111111111212221.title: Grass vs. Ice

1553322222211121111111112122211.content:
That night was filled with much revelry, though some couldn’t join in as they were busy fixing the gate. You, Kenshi, and Natsuki were seated at a large table, with Tanuki of course being at the head. What food the village could spare was laid out before you all in a mouth-watering spread. You licked your lips, the smell of wild game filling the air, arrayed out on serving dishes with bright fruits and vegetables.

Part of this reminded you of your old life as the daughter of a noble, though the tastes were more...untamed than you remembered. It helped you keep the tears in check, and bury the memories of your father and mother under the mountain of food. ...It did strike you as odd though, as you scarfed down that Tanuki hadn’t so much as lifted a finger. He just sat there, watching you all...no, his eyes were more distant...like he was looking at something far off in the horizon.

His concentration was broken when a couple of villagers set a large platter in front of him, and you swore a wicked smirk crossed his lips for a moment. The music that some of the villagers were singing and dancing to got noticeably quieter. You could now hear the muffled noises from under the cloche, and the slight clattering, alerting you to the fact there was definitely something alive in there! The chef, you presumed, was an Emolga, wearing a stained white apron, and she pulls off the cloche to reveal a familiar face!

The Baron, now trussed up and naked, surrounded by various berries and vegetables, and as much as you didn’t want to look, you were pretty sure there were some stuffed into his ass as well. It was impossible to ignore the apple forced into his jaws though, since he was trying to say something around it, and you were sure it wouldn’t be very appropriate. Tanuki stood and clapped his hands, bringing the din of chatter to a stop, clearing his throat. “My people, we managed to survive another ordeal this savage world has thrown at us.” The crowd cheers, before he waves to silence them again.

“And now, we embrace the new law of the wild. I will consume this stuck-up prick.” You were taken aback for a second as everyone watched in stunned silence as the Zoroark gripped the now screaming Pachirisu’s head, and pulled him up into his gaping jaws. His tongue splattered drool all over the squirrel’s face, but though his expression was full of anger, you just realized his cheeks sparking! However, his discharge of electricity seemed to do nothing to deter Tanuki from shoving his head into the back of his throat, making you stare in confusion for a moment before you realized he’d transformed himself! Sparks danced off his own body, blue lightning bolts traced along his sides and nullifying any attacks the Pachirisu tried. Hell, you could swear you heard the fox moaning.

The Baron was a small morsel compared to the tall Zoroark, slipping easily into his gullet with rapid gulps, his body restrained cleverly by edible leaves so everything could digest without any trouble. His squirming body disappeared down Tanuki’s gullet in minutes, the last part of him being that thrashing, sparking tail, before he could no longer be seen. Except for that bulge in the Zoroark’s gut, which got noticeably less forceful after he belched from his large meal.

Everyone, including you, slowly returned to their own meals, but it killed a lot of appetites it seemed. After the feast was done, you were pulled aside by Natsu, with Kenshi, while the fox boy spoke in a hushed tone. You only just realized he was carrying a few robes in his arms, “hey, as thanks from the village, and because my dad said so...we’re gonna head up into the mountains to the hot spring for...a bath. We’ll also be making you two some new clothes, yours...um…” He glanced from you, to Kenshi, and back. “One could barely be considered clothing and...yours probably haven’t been washed in a while, huh?”

You blush hotly, looking away and nodding begrudgingly. “Hey, it’s fine! It’s not like there are many good places around for laundry anymore. C’mon, a bath in these is great for the spirit!”

V - V - V

The three of you walked away from the village, up the mountain path, towards where you came from originally, before splitting off to head deeper. It was a bit treacherous in the dark, but you did have to agree that this was safer from any ferals wandering the area, because while you couldn’t see them, they couldn’t you either. And with Kenshi’s aura sight and Natsu’s dark vision, you were able to navigate with them leading, gripping tight onto you boyfriend’s hand.

Eventually, you made it, Natsu supposedly transforming into some kind of a fire type and shooting a nearby torch to help light the area. By the time you looked back though, he was still in Zorua form. You shrugged, and stepped towards the pool, glancing back at the boys, “um...can you both turn around?” They exchanged a look, Kenshi nodding, though the Zorua gave you a puzzled look before complying as well. You sigh, and strip out of you old, musty clothes, only now conscious of the fact that they indeed reeked...especially your panties, as old and torn-up as they were. You discarded everything onto a rock off to the side, and dipped your toes into the water.

The hot temperature took your breath away for a moment, before you eventually plunged your entire body into the spring to let it envelop your body. “Okay...you both can come in now.” From the sounds of clothes shuffling, you could tell they were stripping as well. Or at least, Natsu was, since Kenshi just had his loincloth. He joined you soon after, leaving just the fox. Kenshi glanced back, before gasping and looking away quickly.

“Oh geez, you’re-!” You tilt your head in confusion, looking back before your eyes took in his full, naked, black-furred body. The gentle bump on the chest, and the small hood of a vulva between their legs though...told you that you’ve had QUITE the wrong idea about him! Or rather, her!!
1553322222211121111111112122211.title: Feast of Revelation

15533222222111211111111121222111.content:
Both you and Kenshi couldn’t help but steal looks out of the corners of your eyes as Natsu finally sinks into the water with a long, drawn-out sigh. “Um...so I wasn’t trying to hide this or anything…” She muttered, ears flat against her head. You both turn to her, now submerged in the water, if you didn’t know better now, you’d still think this was a boy. “It’s just how I was raised. And especially after...the infection..or whatever it was. It’s not really much safer though, we’ve watched the ferals. They’re...indiscriminate…”

The three of you sat in silence for a long time, only the sounds of the gently lapping water on the sides to keep you company. But as the hot water seeps through your fur, and into your skin, you could feel more relaxed as the dirt and grime is washed away. “It’s okay Natsu. I mean, I’m a girl, and we’ve seen you fight, so we’d still love to have you on the team.” You finally say, getting an affirmative nod from Kenshi as well.

Natsu smiled and bowed her head gratefully, “thank you, I won’t let you guys down! ...Oh, and in case you were wondering, Natsu is short for Natsuki.” She added as what seemed like an afterthought.

You just giggled and then held your hand out, the others catching on and placing theirs on yours. “From here on out, we’re a team. We’ll watch each other’s backs, and no ferals will ever beat us!” With a splash, you all lift up your arms, and smile to your partners. Your friends.

After drying out and dressing in the robes provided, you carried your clothes back down to town with Natsu and Kenshi following behind, handing it to someone for washing so you could head to Tanuki’s and finally get a good night’s rest.

V - V - V

A few days later, you and Kenshi got up, sharing a bed as the Riolu’s surprisingly strong arms did help you get to sleep easier. There was an attack the day before, but you were able to confidently kill or drive away the pack of ferals with an emboldened crew of villagers, with Tanuki leading the defense. You stretch and roll out of bed, smoothing the wrinkles of your new sleeping gown out, before disrobing.

That was another thing you’d noticed, being even more comfortable than before around Kenshi. The villagers gave you both clothes to sleep in, as well as some new travelling clothes. You pulled on the tanned, colored cloth and leather tunic on, noting that it certainly offered you more protection than before, while still maintaining a light quality. The cloth areas were dyed a brilliant sky blue, with matching pants. Kenshi had something similar, getting up and pulling off his light cloth sleeping pants, and tossing on the dark blue tunic and pants. “It still feels a little weird wearing clothes like this…”

You just giggled and headed downstairs to meet up with Natsu, and eat a quick breakfast while making final checks on your supplies. Eventually, you’re standing at the gates, with what feels like the entire village out there to see the three of you off! A twinge of jealousy plucks at your heart as you watch the Zoroark and Zorua exchange goodbyes with a long, tight hug.

You all turn to face the outside world, setting back off on the path to the next destination, a castle town about a day and a half journey that you were informed about by Tanuki. It was ruled by a family of Delphox and their line, a monarchy that shared the name.

Galdimer.

~ END PART 1 ~
15533222222111211111111121222111.title: Resolve

155332222221112111111111212221111.content:
Part 2 Prologue: The Fall of Galdimer

Galdimer. This was the name of the Kingdom Koyuki and her friends were now heading towards, not realizing the danger, the all-out war that they’d be walking into. But much like any rebellion, uprising, there is a beginning to this story.

As mentioned, Galdimer was ruled by a monarchy, the king and queen both being Delphoxes. They had three children, the oldest a Braixen girl, another Braixen son, and finally Lucy, a precocious young Fennekin. Because her siblings Gina and Julien were the first-born, they were tasked with the more heavy-handed tutoring about how they would one day become the rulers. This left the third-born in an interesting situation, she still received the tutoring, as she was still a princess, but she was also free to pursue other things. And after meeting the court mage, an apparent descendant of a hero, decided she wanted to study under him. This wasn’t for completely unselfish reasons, however. When she was younger, she came across the Captain of the guard and his son, a Raichu and Pikachu respectively. The boy was around her age, and they hit it off almost immediately.

His name was Zach, and he was his father’s squire. Much like Antonidas, his father Gilliad was a descendant of the heroes as well, possessing the sword Caladbolg. For much of their childhood, the pair were inseparable, but when teased about Zach’s possible future as royalty, they would both just blush and wave it away. They were both devoted to their respective studies, young Zach learning the sword from his father, and Lucy the ways of magic from the older Luxray.

This continued pretty much uninterrupted, until a few days after she turned 13…

Six Months Ago from Present Day

It was a day much like any other, or at least, it was supposed to be. But the princess was awoken earlier than normal by a very flustered looking Greninja. One of the oldest and most trusted butlers...she sat up, rubbing her eyes in confusion. “Walter, what-?”

“No time princess,” he interjected rudely, but before she could say anything, he was already rushing back to the door. His grandson was there as well, a Murkrow through breeding later down the line, thanks to the boy’s father. “Hurry and dress, we’ll be just outside.” He takes Kelan and pushes him back out, closing the door behind them.

Still very much puzzled, but sensing the urgency, the Fennekin rolls out of her large bed, slipping out of her silk nightgown and running over to the wardrobe. Inside was some princess robes, as well as mage robes, which she pulled out along with her small birch wand. Thanks to her upbringing, they were of top quality of course, and she runs over to the door. “Okay, what’s going-”

Again she was cut off, this time by a scream from down the hall…before it appeared. A Nidoking rounded the corner, more massive than any she’d seen before...and there were a pair of legs sticking out of its mouth! She only noticed its shining violet eyes when he turns his hungry gaze to them, slurping down what could be assumed to be a maid since she could catch some black cloth near their ankles before it disappeared. “A...A f-feral...here...in the castle…?” She asked in a whimper, stepping back with her ears laying flat against her head.

“Yes princess. We don’t know how, but they’ve infiltrated the castle...they’re running amok in the town...there might not be anything left soon, but I will at least get you out.” The Greninja states, holding out his arms and forming twin water shurikens. “Kelan, you know the way to the cellar.” Kelan’s eyes widen, about to protest, but the Nidoking was now barreling down on them!

“Y-Yes grandfather!” He shouts before turning and grabbing Lucy to pull her out of the way, while Walter leaps over the Nidoking to throw them down, causing the feral to roar as the shuriken smash into his back, throwing him off-balance and plowing into the wall.

“GO!!” The shout electrified the children, who both take off down the hallways! As they run past different rooms, they could see all kinds of scenes in the corners of their eyes. An infected knight raping and eating another of the maids, another knight being swallowed up into a feral’s cock, and unfortunately this causes some hesitation in Lucy.

“W-Wait! What about my family?!” Kelan stops and turns with a frown, shaking his head and grabbing her wrist.

“Princess Lucy...they were in the throne room together, and the invaders stormed in there almost immediately. The only reason you were overlooked is because you slept in and no one could say anything about it before the attack began.” He explained, as calmly as he could, but all of those words were just crushing the poor girl’s heart.

Almost as much as the Feraligatr that just smashed Kelan in the head, sending him crashing into the wall and reeling for a good few moments. In her weakened and frightened state, Lucy turned to the beast, drool dripping from its fangs as the small foxy morsel quivered before him, weakly holding out her wand and shooting out an Ember from it.

The flames did nothing to slow it down, hell, it wasn’t even fazed in the slightest as it smacks the wand out of her handpaw, the force of it knocking her flat on her ass, the young mage staring up in horror as she was sure her life would end in those slavering jaws.

And then it happened.

“Lightning Sword Flash!” There were two voices, and all she could feel was the static that made her fur stand on end, a literal flash of something crossing her eyes before the massive feral fell over backwards. A familiar paw crossed her vision, and a voice that made her heart flutter.

“Lucy! Are you okay?!” Zach! She gripped his hand tight, pulling herself up with his help, and embraces the young boy...though he was slightly older than her, by a couple of months.

“Zach! Oh Mew, I’m so glad to see you!” Lucy was basically crying at this point, before she looks around and notices a couple of faces that gave her hope. “Gilliad! Master Antonidas!” The latter Raichu gave her a terse nod and ran past them, to see if anything was still in the area, or at least, any immediate threats, while Antonidas was assisting Kelan back to his feet.

“Hello Lucy. I wish circumstances were better, but unfortunately, we don’t have that luxury,” he explains quickly. “Let’s get you kids out of here.” The aging Luxray picks up Lucy’s wand, now splintered, frowning at it a bit, before shaking his head and handing it to her. “It won’t do much as a magical focus now, but it’s probably better than nothing.” Now reunited, the five set off on their path to the cellar, dispatching ferals with the combined might of the Captain and the Archmage. Lucy, Zach, then Kelan all descended into the cellar, with the adults following behind. Antonidas was bringing up the rear, and wasn’t ready when something suddenly whipped around his ankle, causing him to fall forward on the stairs, his staff flying out to the rest of the group.

No one could process what was happening before the elder Luxray was dragged out of the doorway! “Gilliad, keep the kids sa-!” And he was gone...leaving only silence...before something could be heard slithering against the floor, a massive shadow clouding the dooway. Gilliad growls and turns to face it, whipping his head around to the teens.

“The wine bottle on the third shelf, fourth from the left. Pull it and run through the secret tunnel.” Zach wasn’t even able to call out for his father, before the Raichu charged forth, obscuring their vision with a shower of lightning. Lucy picked up her master’s staff, feeling a surge of energy through her paws...but...it was only a little more powerful than her old wand. Something was off about this, it was supposed to be one of the legendary weapons! Especially when she watched her master use some truly powerful magic once…

Kelan, following Gilliad’s instruction, hurriedly pulls on the bottle with a resounding click and whir as the hidden mechanism sprang to life. The shelf swung open on a hinge, while the sounds of a fierce battle raged outside. Zach was about to run in with his wooden practice sword, but Lucy grabbed his wrist and shook her head. “Zach...I know how you feel but…” She paused, choking on her words as tears shined in her eyes. “We’d only...get in the way...and I need you.”

He paused and sighs heavily before nodding, running into the tunnel with her just as heavy footsteps clomped about outside! Together, the three pulled it shut, but they would probably need to get moving quickly, before they burst in with pure force! Lucy took a deep breath, grabbing a torch from the wall and lighting it up with a quick puff of flame. Her, Kelan, and Zach all exchanged a look, before taking off down the secret escape route.
155332222221112111111111212221111.title: Part 2 Prologue

1553322222211121111111112122211111.content:
The teens ran down the tunnel for what felt like forever, Zach eventually grabbing Lucy’s paw, and taking up the torch to light the way. With ferals about, it was incredibly dangerous to be sprinting headlong into the darkness like this, but they couldn’t be sure that they hadn’t been spotted on their way in. So they had to risk it...until eventually, they reached the end. The Pikachu looked around and found a sconce mounted to the wall, which had transitioned to wood a few meters back. A ladder reached upward into yet more darkness, but they had little choice. “I’ll head up first. I can see in the dark.”

Zach and Lucy turned to look at Kelan, but before either could protest or say anything about it, the bird was already a few rungs up. The squire sighs, drawing his iron sword, thankful that he’d earned it just a month ago, and pointed towards the direction they came from. The air was tense, before Kelan’s voice called down. “Coast is clear guys!”

Lucy’s ears perked up, and she ran straight over to the ladder, gripping onto it and climbing up a couple of rungs. “Don’t worry, I’ll be right behind you.” The Pikachu said from below her, giving her a smile before turning back to face any oncoming threats.

But none appeared, and soon all three were sitting inside of an abandoned house. All things considered, it was pretty well furnished, and quite spacious. Lucy started to walk around, running a finger along everything to find that they were also kept clean, only a thin layer of dust settled on them.

A scream from outside caught their attention, Lucy running back downstairs while the boys shielded her. But instead of the usual noises, the voice yelled, “oi! Where do you think you’re takin’ me?! Mitts off you ugly fucker!” They were...female? It was hard to tell, since their tone was so harsh, but Kelan opens the door to see a Skuntank feral pushing along a Ponyta towards the town square.

The three exchanged confused looks, “wasn’t that a feral? They eat first and never ask questions, right?” Lucy questions, closing the door behind her. “What’s going on?”

“Only one way to find out,” the young squire replied, taking her paw and walking after the feral and the probably girl, with the Murkrow trailing behind.

As they approached, a grand, but hissing voice could be heard. “My dear sssubjects...well, I guess I should first introduce myself.” It was a bit hard to see over the heads of the giant crowd gathered already, with more streaming in, but one could just make out the one on the stage. It was a Serperior naga, and a ridiculously huge one as well, at least 15 feet long from his head to the tip of his tail. That stage though...it used to be used for executions before Lucy’s father outlawed the practice. It left an ominous pit in her stomach though, as she watched the naga slither back and forth.

“I am Ssarlin, your new king. Or at least, I will be soon enough.” He chuckles darkly, flicking out his tongue, smirking as he tasted their collective fear and confusion. “Alright men. Bring out the prisoners!”

A couple of larger Pokemon, both clad in darkened armor, one a Dragonite, the other a Luxray, led four cloaked figures onto the stage. The heavy iron of manacles could be heard, before Ssarlin laughs, slithering over to one of them, cupping their chin and tilting their head up to meet his eyes. “Still got some fire there...good, that makes it all the more fun to snuff it out.” He grabs the cloak and whips it off, revealing a bruised and battered Delphox, with a crown perched upon his head.

The king. Lucy’s father. She cried out, but so did others in the crowd, so it was masked by them, “I care not what you do to me. But let my family, and my people, go.”

Ssarlin just blinks, before throwing his head back in a raucous laugh. “Oh! That’s rich!” He turns away, before his tail whips around and strikes him right in the gut, leaving him to gag and fall to his knees, drooling in pain from the thick muscle. “You have no idea what’s about to happen, do you? But allow me to demonstrate.” The serpent now goes over to the next in line, pulling the cloak to reveal another Delphox. 155332222221112111111111212221111111.content:
Part 2: Liberation

Your journey took a few weeks, mostly uneventful, save the towns you passed by on the way. There was something curious, ominous about the way that the level of destruction seemed to rise the close you got to the castle town. Surely, that was backwards, but it definitely wasn’t your imagination. An increased frequency in ferals accompanied it, making your journey more perilous than it should have been.

Eventually, your band of three came to the town nearest to the castle, known as Ymir. The signs of the reinforced gate and stone walls being blown open by some kind of a great force. You exchanged a look with them, then brandished your weapon, alone with Natsu, while Kenshi’s fists glowed with aura. Whatever did this could still have been here, even though this doesn’t look recent. But you had to investigate.

The three of you ran to the edges of what remained of the heavy iron gate, the stones on either sides held up only by lucky placement. With you and Kenshi on one side, and Natsu on the other, you swivel your ear towards the town. It twitches from the thrumming of your heartbeat, having to take a couple of deep breaths to calm it before you could fully concentrate. It was...quiet. A deathly silence hung over like a cloud, revealing no signs of life. This meant no ferals...but the chances there were any survivors was...slim at best.

With a heavy sigh, you motion to Natsu that the coast was clear, before, on a silent count, you and Kenshi roll in front of the entrance. What your eyes beheld, your mind almost couldn’t comprehend. Ruins, not a town, stood before you. Carefully, you and your companions pick your way over the rubble into the destroyed village. No. It used to be a city, some of the buildings apparently stood taller than any that you’d seen to this point, some even reminding you of the mansion you used to live in.

A dull throb pinged in your chest, but you quickly shake it off. Now wasn’t the time to think of home, just like this town, it was gone. You all froze when you heard a noise, a low, deep rumble, from behind the wall of one particularly destroyed home. Luckily, the wall that was there had windows, and you all slide over to it, to look at the other side.

It was impossible to tell if this thing was a feral or not, but the size of the Flygon on the other side, slumbering away, was a pretty clear indication. You were faced with a dilemma now. Do you just leave it alone, for it to continue on its probable warpath? No. Your morals wouldn’t allow it, and especially not after meeting the people of the last town. Images of them fleeing, screaming in fear as it swoops over with other ferals to devour and defile the populace.

Your grip tightens as your resolve hardens, but now it was just a matter of what to do. You could probably dispatch it with a single good blow, but if you messed it up it might be too late to get Kenshi and Natsu’s help before something happened…

But you can’t mount a surprise attack with all three of you, but maybe Natsu could lead it into an ambush if it were awake and chasing her.
155332222221112111111111212221111111.title: Part 2

1553322222211121111111112122211111111.content:
You nod to them, whispering in as soft a tone as you could manage while they leaned in close. “We’re gonna take him out while he’s still asleep. Kenshi, you follow-up in case something happens, and Natsu will provide support from the rear.” As you quietly approach the sleeping beast, you whip out your scythe, your ears perked and listening closely for any signs of the Flygon waking up or stirring. When it seemed like the coast was clear, you gripped tight before leaping into the air, the blade swung back behind your head!

The position was a vulnerable one, as you found out, when the Flygon suddenly spun its massive body to smash into your gut with its tail!! All of the air was driven out at once, and you could feel a couple of ribs crack as you were driven into the ground, the dragon now standing to its full height to cast a looming shadow over your broken body. Your ears rang from the intense pain you were in, only barely able to make out the shouting of the Riolu nearby that seemed to grab his attention.

You wheezed, trying to tell him to run, before you saw a sphere of energy collide with the Flygon, who used his wing to block and dissipate the attack with ease, before he opened his mouth to charge up his own blast. Arrows whizzed by, some sticking shallowly into his hide, but otherwise having very little effect on the dragon as he continued to charge up. With an intense pressure, the torrent streamed out, much wider than any of you could have anticipated, turning your head just enough to witness the Riolu and Zorua get blown away. “KENSHI!! NATSU!!”

You got your second wind back, sucking in air desperately, before a claw gripped around your back. He easily lifted you from the ground, dangling as you could hardly move your limbs before you’re tossed up into the air. The world spun around you, but one thing that stuck out was the side, gaping maw, that lunged and snapped up your entire body, enclosing it inside the dark, hot, humid space. It was already hard enough to breathe, but getting tossed around by his tongue, which wormed its way under your clothes to make you blush and whine, was making your efforts nearly impossible.

Suddenly, he must have tilted his head back, to swallow your body, folding it in on itself to nearly break your spine as you slid backwards down his throat. There was some kind of movement outside, as you could see some light peeking through before the throat muscles swallowed up your vision as well as your body, but the voice was unmistakable. “LET ME GO!! I’LL RIP YOU OPEN AND GET KOYUKI BA-Gmmph?!” The voice became more muffled as the archer was probably chomped down upon as well, but you could hardly think about that as you finally landed in the unforgiving draconic stomach.


V - V - V


The small morsel hardly lasted more than a few minutes it seemed, but the Flygon was uncaring as he plucks up the last of the little band. The Riolu certainly had more fight in him left than the other two, but it did him little good as he was whipped into the ground a couple of times, and then swallowed like the rest.

Nearby, a silhouette perched on the wall of one of the destroyed buildings, having caught only the tail end of the conflict. “What a horrible way to go. If only I’d gotten here sooner…” The figure sighs, shaking his head, and flies off while the dragon curls back up to rest off the small feast.
1553322222211121111111112122211111111.title: Stealth and a Kill

1553322222211121111111112122211111112.content:
You do a quick scan of your surroundings, before spotting a building suitable for this plan. “Okay,” a quick glance at the slumbering dragon to make sure it didn’t hear your whispers, before you motioned and continued. “Natsu, we need you to get his attention, and lure him over to that building. As soon as he’s in range, we’ll surround him and take him out.”

She seemed unsure for a moment, before nodding and pulling out her bow. While she positioned herself, you and Kenshi took back off down the empty street towards the chosen ambush site, stopping on either side of the door as you pull off your rod from your belt.

With a quick nod to him, he pushes open the door and dives in first, with you close on his heels, tumbling and extending the scythe, ready for battle if there were still some stray ferals. Much to your relief, it was just as empty as it seemed, so you could both take your time making your way up the stairs. “Do you think this’ll work Yuki?” The voice came from behind you, still hushed as a precaution.

“It has to,” you replied, a bit more bluntly than you originally intended. “That beast will kill so many others if we don’t do something about it...I can’t just leave this be...you’ve seen what it’s done here.”

“Yuki...I unders-” He started, before the horrid sound of a dragon’s roar sounded out, so powerful it shook the very building you were both hiding in! A look was exchanged between you, before you bolted up the stairs. From the sound of it, Kenshi was close on your heels as you both tromped up the rest of the way, before stopping at two different windows.

Down in the street, Natsuki had taken off in a dead sprint, but the only indication of the dragon were the powerful wingbeats and the shadow that felt as if it nearly engulfed the entire town. She stops and does a quick turn on her heel, nocking back a few arrows and screaming at the top of her lungs. “COME AND GET ME DIRTBAG!!” Whether it understood her or not, she let them fly, sheathed in dark energy to the point where the force of it pulsed out at you as it flew by.

It must have made contact, since the next thing you heard was a shriek of anguish, and the massive green dragon swoop down in a blur, nearly knocking you off your feet as it passed!! The Zorua tried to leap back, but it fired out a Dragon Breath that she must not have been expecting, since it grazed her as she tried to change trajectory, causing her to fall back!

The dragon’s intentions were clear, closing in on the girl now with maw open wide! “NATSU!!!” You scream, jumping without thinking, aiming for the dragon’s back with your scythe held over your head!
1553322222211121111111112122211111112.title: Setting the Trap

15533222222111211111111121222111111121.content:
A black shape flitted past the corner of your vision past you and the dragon, grabbing Natsuki and pulling her to safety in the nick of time. Flygon was s only able to scoop up a mouthful of earth, angrily spitting it out and roaring just as your blade connected with his wing! He shrieked in pain, beating them a couple of times to shake you off, sending you flying back.

That same shape flew behind you to catch you, a few black feathers fluttering before you. Kenshi dove down after you had, slamming his flaming aura palm right into the top of the dragon’s head, sending him reeling for a few moments before a few more arrows hit his chest. Eventually, he manages to shake the Riolu off, prompting the mysterious flier to stop his descent, while the Flygon finally takes off into the air, unsteady because of ripped wing.

“No!” You shout, charging energy in your mouth, firing it with the stranger holding you from behind, the recoil making you both slide back a bit.

“What’re you doing?!” They shout, the voice pretty clearly male, but he didn’t let go. The attack connected with his other wing, the creature uttering an otherworldly shriek as he plummeted to the ground. A cloud of dust billowed up upon the impact, the Flygon unable to do anything to slow its descent. A few tense moments passed, but the corpse just laid there, motionless.

The four of you exchanged looks and sighs of relief, allowing you to see that your rescuer was a Murkrow boy, probably around your age. He was dressed in light, black leather clothes, with a pair of daggers strapped to his belt. You bow, the others following suite, and Natsu adds a quick ‘thanks’ in there for good measure. “Thank you for your assistance…um?”

“Kelan, and it was no problem. But what were you all doing trying to take on that massive dragon?!” He exclaims, making you shrink back a bit with ears folded. “You three have a death wish or something?”

You bite your lip, shuffling uncomfortably on your feet. Hearing a growl from your right, you hold up your arm in front of Kenshi, shooting a glare at the avian. “We wanted to make sure that beast wasn’t free to cause anymore havoc. Like he did in this village.”

He raises a brow at that, crossing his arms with a click of his tongue. “So it was justice? Alright...come with me.” As he turns to walk away back to the entrance, you follow uncertainly, making a point of staying between him and Kenshi.

“Where?” You ask after you pass by the fallen gate. He just chuckles, looking back over his shoulder.

“Galdimer.”

V - V - V

The sun was just beginning to sink into the horizon behind you as the great stone walls came into view. However, before you could see what was happening at the gates however, Kelan veered you all off to the side. He came up to what looked like a boarded up sewer entrance, stopping and looking around with a hum. “Coast’s clear,” the Murkrow mumbles under his breath, before pulling aside a couple of the loose boards. “Alright, everyone in.”

You grimace, looking inside the dark, damp tunnel, “are you serious?” He just stares at you, and after exchanging a look with Kenshi and Natsu, you crouch down a bit and crawl inside. You pull the hood over your head to keep your ears from brushing against the roof of it, covered in Arceus knew what. You were thankful for your pretty thick leather boots as they splashed in the shallow…’river’, before you came to a split in the path.

From there, Kelan guided you all from the rear, instructing with quick, sharp “go left. Now right.” And other such instruction as you made your way through the labyrinth, before a sudden, “alright stop.” You hadn’t even noticed that you’d passed under a grate, before the bird reaches up and pushes the loosened cover off and hops up out of the sewer, leaving you all to follow up after him.

When you finally get pulled up thanks to the help of your two friends, he slips it back over, and looks around. You were in a back alley behind a few houses, completely shrouded in darkness and out of sight. This was all really strange...why were you all skulking around anyway?

That train of thought was interrupted when you heard something lumbering at the entrance of the alley. It came into view, and you grab your scythe, ready to whip it out, when you saw the glowing violet eyes of a Croconaw!
15533222222111211111111121222111111121.title: Kelan

155332222221112111111111212221111111211.content:
Kelan didn’t notice the three of you pull out your weapons until you rushed past him, “wait!!” It was too late though, your blade was already singing as it cut through the air, connecting with the Croconaw before it shattered into ice crystals.

“What are ferals doing-?” You start, before the sound of heavy metal sollerets tromping down the streets. Before Kelan could even give the signal to run, the black armored knights surrounded you all, trapping you in the alley. “What’s going on?!”

A more decorated guard, a Poliwrath displaying his higher rank, stepped forward and brandished his sword to you. “Put your weapons down.” At the command, you all had no choice but to throw down your weapons. However, Kelan had different plans it seemed as he threw his daggers at the knights and spread his wings for take-off. The head guard knocked them down easily with two slashes of his sword, pointing the blade at the ascending avian. “Archers!”

Two arrows whizzed over your heads, slamming into his winged arms and pinning him to the building with a cry of pain. “Now. In accordance with the laws passed by King Ssarlin, you have been found guilty of murder and..attempted evasion of the guards. You and your accomplices are sentenced to death.” His smirk became cruel when he glances up at Kelan upon saying ‘attempted’, before he and the other guards close in on your group.

“But, that was a feral! We’re here to save the city!” You protested, but it fell on deaf ears as the captain pressed the tip of his blade to your throat, drawing a bead of blood.

“Save it. Your sentencing has been made and will be carried out.” He replied coldly, before he makes a practised swing, slicing your clothes apart from the front to expose your body, a thin red line forming where metal met flesh. You almost couldn’t process what just happened, even as the searing heat of pain bloomed from your chest, and you tried to cover yourself up before he grabs your arms and slams you into the wall.

“Yuki!!” Kenshi screams, rushing in past a couple of approaching guards to land a solid punch on the Poliwrath, knocking off his helmet in the process. He didn’t need weapons to fight after all! But when he makes the grab for your scythe, reverted back to its compact form, he’s knocked away by a couple of guards using their shields to crush his body between. “Gah-ck!” You could almost hear the bones crunch from the impact before he falls over, wheezing with a trickle of blood leaking from his lips.

1553322222211121111111112122211111112111.content:
This was too easy. That was the only thought running through the Braixen’s mind as the small group of teens made their way through the familiar walls of the castle. Ever since Kelan disappeared a couple of weeks ago, you all had to get a bit more daring, and while you had a couple of close calls, you finally managed to enter Ssarlin’s stronghold!

Easy or not...this was it. You were going to take back your family’s throne! A quick glance at the Pikachu running at your side, exchanging determined nods, when you all stopped at the door to the throne room. You took a deep breath, gripping tight to your master’s staff, before you all worked together to push open the large, heavy doors.

“Ah, there you all are. Right on schedule.” That voice, it was unmistakable, especially the way he hissed his ‘s’es. “I was ready to eat your little friend here just from how bored I was getting.” The naga stood tall, someone wrapped in his vines as he looked over the group. “You all have been such a thorn in my side, but thanks to Kelan, I’ve learned everything I needed to. How shocked I was, to learn the leader of the so-called ‘Resistance’ was actually the sole surviving heiress to the Galdimer line! Lucy, correct?” You just growl at him, your eyes flitting to the trapped avian, showing signs of having been tortured, and toyed with.

“Let him go!” You shout at him, looking back over your shoulder to a hooded Leafeon boy. “Ransel, heal him when we get him down!” He nods, nervously gulping and clutching his wooden staff. “Everyone else, I’ll back you up with magic. CHARGE!!”

Zach, the female Ponyta, and the male Lairon rushed forward at the ‘king’, before they were stopped short by the Dragonite and Luxray from before, when your family was executed. They slashed at the Lairon and Ponyta, while the Pikachu continued to run at the serpent!

“Liz! Seth!” You concentrate flames at the tip of your wand, the red jewel on the top shimmering as flames shot out of it. Liz parried the Luxray’s blade with her small blacksmith hammer, while the dragonited slammed his greatsword into Seth’s shield. The Luxray leapt back to dodge the fire, shooting electricity at the Ponyta, striking and pumping volts through her body that made her scream and fall. The dragon, however, shrugged off the attack easily, forcing the Lairon onto his knee with a grunt of pain.

The Leafeon boy took off, reaching his hand out to the Ponyta, before the hilt of a sword was viciously slammed into the back of his skull as the Luxray rounded on him. In the ensuing chaos, you didn’t even realize that Zach had gotten locked in combat with a fully armored black knight, sparking as he swung his steel blade angrily. “Where did you get that sword?! THAT WAS MY FATHER’S!!!” You needed to calm him down, get this situation under control somehow, summoning flame into the jewel adorning your staff and blasting it at the Luxray! “Liz, we need to take him out quick to help Seth!” She groans, nodding as she unsteadily took a fighting stance, while the lion simply slashes through your magic.

You run up towards her, brandishing her hammer once again as she glares at your enemy, twirling the heavy weapon in her fingers with ease. He loves his little sister deeply and would do anything to protect her, though not too strict on it.

Their parents are a male raichu and a female pachirisu. The father is the captain of the town guards. The forces were greatly respected and admired by everyone in Aurora. The mother works at the hospital as a nurse. Her caring and understanding were well-known in Aurora. When Rai turned 10, he was taught how to fight. (Any pokemon must be at least 10 years old to be taught moves.) While his father taught him how to fight, his mother taught him why should he fight. Defeat the strong and defend the ones who are weak and innocent was your mothers well-known motto.

         With him is his little sister Katherine, though most people call her Kate for short. She'll be turning 7 in less than 2 weeks. Her fur is white with a faint blueish tint and have a light blue stripe which starts from their forehead and goes all the way down to the tip of the tail. A large white tooth grows out of her mouth. Her eyes are bright orange. She has a yellow circle on each cheek. Pachirisus have tails that are almost twice as big as they are, with three spikes at the top of the curl, which it can shoot charges from. Her arms and legs are very short. Still, she can run incredibly fast.

         Kate is a caring and playful pokemon. She likes to share with her friends and very polite. Although, she is very shy and tends to lose herself in her daydreams which can get her in trouble, but she always mean well and would never cause any harm to anyone or anything. She loves flowers, especially white ones. One time she came home with a whole bouquet of different kinds of flowers, of different varieties. Big, small, tall, short, thick stem, thin stem, you name it. She'll bring it.
15533222222221111.title: Introduction and backstory

155332222222211111.content:
You and Kate have been running for a while trying to get home. Luckily nothing happened along the way like the scene with the semipour. When the two of you arrived, you couldn't believe what you are seeing. Aurora, your hometown, is in chaos. Some homes are on fire, pokemon are attacking each other, and you see some of the houses are barricaded. What is this, some kind of riot? you thought as you see what is happening. â€œRai, what's going on?" Kate asked, terrified at the scene. â€œI wish I knew, but I don't, but it can't be good." You quickly look at your house to see it's not too badly damaged, but there are some pokemon around it. Oh please let my parents be OK. You plead in your mind. â€œCome on, we have to find our parents." You say grabbing her hand and preparing to run to the entrance.

         You reached the entrance, but quickly hid in a nearby bush. You don't want to risk a fight with your sister nearby and draw any attention towards you two. As the two of you made your way in cover, you stopped and looked around to make sure the coast is clear. Before you moved, you saw a female Persian fighting a male flareon. The normal type overpowered the fire type, but what she did next shocked you. The cat started swallowing its head. You couldn't believe it despite seeing it with your own eyes, the cat was consuming the fire dog. You caught the cats eyes in time to see their purple as well. Another PokÃ©mon going crazy? This can't be of coincidence â€œWhat is it? What's happening?" A familiar voice snapped you back to reality. You look and see the pachirisu began pushing to see, but you push her back in time. â€œStay down!" you order quietly. You would try and help, but there are other purple eyed PokÃ©mon close by. You just have to keep going. You grab your sisters hand and moved on.

         You were able to get to your home without encountering any problems. You approached the door cautiously.. â€œKate stay close to me." She nods and you open the door. What you saw next horrified the both of you. Your parents are on the ground, covered in bandages, caked with blood. You two ran to them. â€œMom! Dad! Are you alright?" Your mother awaken, her eyes blue like yours thank Arceus. You see the injuries are not serious. â€œRai? Thank goodness you're all right." She says weakly. â€œBut what about-" â€œLittle Katherine." The both of you looked to see your father hugging your sister. â€œWe were so worried about you two. Are you okay? Anything happened?" â€œThanks to my big brother I'm fine. He too He turns to you with pride in his eyes as he says: well now, looks like your training has paid off." He quickly became stern as he adds: â€œRai, this semipour, has his eyes were a different color when you saw him?" You explain everything to him. â€œYes. His eyes were yellow before he lost consciousness, but when he woke back up moments later, they were purple. I also saw some other pokemon acting crazy with purple eyes as well. Do you know what's going on around here?" â€œIt's must be that virus that I read in the paper." he says looking down. â€œA virus?" You repeated what he said. â€œI'll explain everything with you, but first you must close and barricade the door." You done what he said and returned. â€œThis'll take time to explain, so let's head to the basement. I can walk, but you mother needs help." You and Kate headed to the basement with your parents and waited to listen to what he's about to say.
155332222222211111.title: Aurora in turmoil.

1553322222222111111.content:
â€œOne day, I went out to fetch the newspaper from the office. When I picked it up, I noticed an article talking about a town pretty far from here suffering from a strange virus. The residents are becoming aggressive, incidents at hospitals, and attackers all developing purple eyes, even ones who they know don't have em. It mentions that forces are looking into it and they'll come up with a solution to the problem." He shook his head before saying. â€œThat was 2 months ago." Your ears perked up at that last sentence. â€œWait, so this whole mess started 2 months ago?" He just shrugged his shoulders and said: â€œI only know where it occurred. This might've started sooner."

         You turn towards your mother. â€œDid anything happened at the hospital?" She nods and starts to speak. â€œTwo patients, one adult, the other in his early teens, were sent to the hospital. We were sending them to the ER when the youth lost consciousness. While trying to revive him, he soon wakes up and starts to thrash about wildly. We tried to calm him down, but he wasn't listening." She pause for a moment before continuing. â€œWe were forced to use a sleep seed and restrained him and the father when he lost consciousness as well. Afterwards, I went out to get some medicine for them, but when I came back, everyone, including the patients, were gone. The room was a complete mess as well." She finishes with tears forming in her eyes. You two go to hug her for comfort. So it seems the rate the PokÃ©mon turns is based on ones age and size. You thought.

         After they finished explaining, your dad starts to speak again â€œThat's all we know, but there's one place that might have more to offer. The town is called Silverhills. I bought a map of the land that could help you find it. I don't know how this happened, except that this is not normal. You two can rest here for a few minutes, but then you'll have to go." You're a little surprise about the firmness in the last part, but you forced it down and said: â€œNot without you! I have some berries in my bag that could help you recover faster." Your parents looked at both of you with a crestfallen look on their faces as your father says: â€œI'm sorry, but we can't come with you" You and your sister froze up with a shocked expression as you two say: â€œWhat!?" You then ask: â€œWhat do you mean â€œcan't" come?" Your mother answers â€œWe can't come because we're infected as well." That last sentence slams you hard like you're been dealt with a focus punch.

Author's note: ugh! Doing this on a tablet is a pain in the ass. Especially if something stupid happens and you have to start over. But I'll continue to make more as soon as I can.
1553322222222111111.title: The explanation of the virus.

15533222222221111111.content:
You stood there for a moment, shocked from the news you two just heard. What? "T..that can't be." you say in disbelief. Your mother bows her head as she says "I'm sorry, but it's true." You open your mouth to speak but was cut off when your sister screams "NO!" as she started running and then jumped into your father's arms. "You can't turn into one of them. You can't!" Your father hugged her back then said softly "we're sorry, but it's too late." he put her down and looked at you, "There is something you can do about this though, but before that.." he started coughing before he continues.

         "Do you know how others get infected?" You shake your head. Your father takes a minute to look at your sister before continuing: "It's not pretty. The infected beats their victims first then forces them to ingest large amounts of their fluids. it doesn't matter How they do it or Where it enters, if they do it, you're infected." As he finished you pondered why he put so much emphasis on how and where and then you thought of your encounter with the semipour.
